reviews.text: Since there isn&#39;t the regular rush with tourist we decided to dine in at waikiki! Parking of course at the Royal Hawaiian. With validation first 3 hours free. We were immediately seated after our temperatures were checked and we filled the covid sheet out. Hosted and our waiter were awesome ! We got our usuals and seriously missed eating out. Although take out is available the atmosphere in cheese cake is so nice, it has a darker lighting scene so you can enjoy dining without bright lights shining in your eyes! Very clean and food delicious! We order our cakes to go since we were full from our meals. The bakery worker informed us some new cake flavors and her favorites which is always nice to hear. Glad we got to enjoy this place before it gets crazy busy when tourist come back.

The wait wasn&#39;t too bad, staff observing good safety protocols, everyone masked and good social distancing. Our server, Melvin, was very friendly and through. They brought out the drinks right away, the kids loved the hot chocolate with whipped cream and just the right temperature for famished kids! The giant Belgian waffle was giant and a big hit! My husband enjoyed the double bacon burger and my son loved the brûlée French toast.<br>Too full for cheesecake, so we ended up getting cheesecake to go and our server was willing to let us get the cheesecake and keep it in the back so we could check out and grab it on the way home. Great service!

Down in Waikiki and got some food to go. Fast and friendly staff. For me it&#39;s great because they have a lot of gluten free options for me. Today I got the corn tamales and French fries. Of course I had to get cheesecake too. Staff were all wearing masks and hand sanitizer was at the door. Looked like most people were doing outdoor seating. Best part is there isn&#39;t an hour to two hour weight. Ordered my food and only waited about 25 minutes.

Came here for some grubs for dinner, got the naked chicken wings and a side salad, my server was Mathew. Mathew was on point and he totally accommodated my strict diet. Very knowledgeable and knows his stuff. So glad to have Mathew as my waiter.<br><br>Came here another night for Dinner and had a salad, was served by &#34;Spencer&#34; she was very good in taking my order very friendly and with a beautiful smile. It&#39;s people like her that makes this company shine. Thanks girl for a great dinner.

This Cheesecake Factory is 10X better then the ones I&#39;ve eaten at on the mainland. Great flavors, great drinks, great staff, and great for a crowd. Honestly stop here with a big group if you have one

I don&#39;t know why I haven&#39;t reviewed Cheesecake Factory before! Better late than never! <br>I&#39;ve eaten here tons of times. They actually have a huge restaurant... right in the heart of Waikiki. I used to like the bar area. This place gets crazyyyyyyy busy and bar area is open seating, kinda the secret move! Lol. Anyway this is precovid so I&#39;m not sure on that now because of the reinforcement of social distancing. <br><br>Cheesecake&#39;s food is plentiful and generally flavorful and satisfying. Prepare for a huge menu and either sharing or leftovers! I love their pastas, salads and specialties... bread is included and really good. Plus obvious big list of cheesecakes and a few other dessert options. Oreo, snickers, s&#39;mores, tiramisu, strawberry... cheesecake galore!!!!!!<br><br>Unfortunately my last few takeouts during Covid have been incredibly disappointing. Idk what happened to their kitchen but maybe try dining in as possible. I had the worst overcooked bland pasta and crab dip this last trip. The host staff was surprisingly rude, especially for how slow it was and how long I waited for take out I already called in. <br>In all though, generous portions, good prices, and usually good service. Hopefully they&#39;ll get back to their precovid service!

Been here twice this year i.e. covd time and it&#39;s been a treat for us to go out and eat something we havent made, drink a cocktail and talk and relax. The happy hour between 3 and 5 is perfect for us, to have 2 pupus and 2 drinks and a nice walk home on uncrowded streets! Blue Hawaii and other cocktails were all good and the portions are generous. They are known for their bread, which is still soft fresh and ono. I really liked the chicken sliders and avocado spring rolls. The crab dip is huge with lots of crab but almost a bit much to share with 2, better with a bigger crowd, it is so rich.

Came here since we had a mini staycation in Waikiki. Hotel was next to Cheesecake Factory and since we haven&#39;t been here for at least 3 years, we made sure to come here one night. We had a party of 8 and they informed us that they could only seat 4 of us on one table but it would be near each other. It&#39;s basically every other table is filled. We were fortunate enough to be seated outside.<br><br>   We were served bread and the multigrain has got to be one of the best. It also comes with a sourdough bread and butter. My wife ordered a lava flow, and I ordered a castaway ipa on draft. For our main dish, I went with the combination of chicken madeira &amp; steak Diane. My wife got the gumbo, and my daughter got the honey truffle chicken. Everything was good except the chicken Madeira was a little different then I remember and the portion size of all dishes was a little less. My wife really enjoyed the gumbo &amp; my daughter loved the honey truffle chicken. <br><br>  It wasn&#39;t busy like normal and our wait was around 15 minutes, usually it can be over an hour wait. Service was fast and our server was friendly. Will definitely be back again.

Original review below and still stand by it 100%. Fortunately, I have not come down with food poisoning. I am bothered that big management commented on the review to pretend they care... I emailed them immediately after they posted it 6 days ago, but they have not responded at all. Adding a photo to show where I received the auto-generated email saying they would respond.

Only 1 out of 3 cooks was wearing any protection when making the food preparation.  No face masks as well.<br><br>During covid 19 this type of Heath inconsideration is unacceptable.<br><br>Food was mediocre as my steak was not medium rare. Cheap cuts of beef.  Pasta was also under seasoned.<br><br>Cheesecake is the only great thing here and warrant the 1 star bump

Not sure WTH is going on but I&#39;m sorely disappointed. We ordered our desserts to go. Got Tiramisu cheesecake and the original with strawberries.  At $10  a piece,  they should certainly give you a FULL PIECE! Do yourself a favor and head over to OTTO CAKES on 1127 12th Avenue, Honolulu, Hawaii 96816 Just remember that they close at 7pm most nights. Silly me for not having a craving earlier. Now I have to go tomorrow to even out the karma. I came to CKF b/c they are a chain and should be nice and uniform but I&#39;ve never been given such small slices from them. This is the first time I&#39;ve been to this CKF since I moved here 6 months ago and it will be the last. Fool me once, shame on you.

Just had a COVID-19, takeout, Meatloaf from Cheesecake Factory, it was recommended to me years ago, by someone, excellent!  3 generous slices of tender meatloaf, with sliced corn off the cob, and homemade mashed potatoes. Again, EXCELLENT!!!

Covid compliant<br>We went for appetizers and desserts.  Greeted promptly by host and seated after completing needed Covid info.<br>Waitress was great from start to finish we ordered crab artichoke dip buffalo wings and fried calamari. The artichoke dip and the calamari were tasty, but the buffalo wings seemed like they were cooked and sat for a while.  Then we went straight to desserts. Red velvet cheesecake and caramel chocolate turtle cheesecake. Both were delicious.

Finally got a chance to try this place after all these years. First of all, I just can&#39;t see myself in long waiting lines just to have a meal. A friend and I decided to go in at 10:00 at night which made it perfect. No lines and straight to our table. <br><br>But the only down fall coming in this late was, the servers weren&#39;t to attentive because they&#39;re getting ready to clean up by 11:00p. We would have to call them as needed. And they shut down the coffee machine so I couldn&#39;t get refills. However, they were polite and professional. They didn&#39;t make us feel rushed.<br><br>Like the ambience. A nostalgic yet modern look   with dim lighting. We chose to sit on the outside to absorb the cool and breezy air.<br><br>We started with soft drinks and an appetizer. We ordered the fried calamari which was lightly battered and deep fried. The battered wasn&#39;t as crispy as I expected and the taste was just okay. <br><br>For our main dish, we ordered the Fettuccini Alfredo which was amazing. It was creamy with the perfect density and flavor. The chicken was fresh and soft.<br><br>We also had the Smokehouse BBQ Burger. This sandwich was incredible. Homemade thick hamburger patty, thick sliced bacon and many more other ingredients. It stood tall on the plate. First bite said it all with the lettuce, deep fried onion, tomatoes and the side BBQ sauce. A great tasting burger.  It was accompanied with some fresh hot french fries The only thing I wish they had was some jalapenos, I like a little bite to my sandwich.<br><br>Topping off the night, we had Hot Fudge Sundae. It was presented very well. It came in a giant goblet with whipped cream and sprinkled nuts. The hot fudge was on the side. It was fantastic!<br><br>Can&#39;t wait to try other menu items on my next visit.

It was my first time back to Hawaii for the first since the pandemic <br>November 15, 2020<br><br>the food was large portions and I have avocado spring roll which was to die for and also order the Thai chicken and shrimp with brown rice.<br>amazing<br>hang in their Waikiki Hawaii.  <br><br>thank you it was very amazing

A great place in Oahu, you may know the food! YUM!! Big portions, loads of choices (the menu is a big spiral bound book). There is something tasty for everyone... and it&#39;s a great place for celebrating occasions! <br>*Salads- enough to share, very fresh, several different salads each with its own taste, dressing and flavors. 2 sizes large and Giant.<br>*Appetizers- such a variety all are goods, covers the entire gamut of cuisines.<br>*main Courses - great meals, everything is so good<br>*Desserts- Cheesecake &amp; more<br>The bread that accompanies the meals are delish- French bread &amp; whole dark country wheat. Really good. <br>To Go is available and the beach is nearby! <br>Long waits for table service, but when you are prepared for that, the time goes quickly.

Since it&#39;s more quiet than usual in Waikiki, we took advantage of going to the Cheesecake Factory since there&#39;s no line and we had giftcards to use.  We were a party of 6 that had to be split between 2 tables, but we were seated close by with one table separating us.<br><br>Service was awesome.  Christophe was our server and he was excellent - very attentive and friendly!<br><br>As for the food, it&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve last eaten at a Cheesecake Factory.  The menu is still huge with lots of choices.  We ordered the branzino (light, my fave part was dipping the brown bread in the sauce), pasta carbonara (really good! I&#39;d order this again), 3 cheese flatbread pizza (daughter liked the crust and smoky flavor but stated the cheese was strong tasting), meatloaf (moist and flavorful), vegan Cobb salad (meh), and pasta pomodoro (made dairy free for my son and he liked it a lot).  Pretty big servings.  <br><br>Also ordered the pineapple upside down cheesecake to go cuz, c&#39;mon, you&#39;re at the Cheesecake Factory.  The slice was smaller than I remember, and for $8.50 it doesn&#39;t seem quite worth it.  Flavor was fine, but $8.50?!?  Really?!?
Usually this establishment is fairly consistent nationwide. By far the worse location I&#39;ve been to when it comes to quality of food. If you like COLD fries and WARM poke this is the SPOT!
Actually,l am not cheese cake person,but it was good.Yummy!!!!<br>Many kind of cheese cakes were there.<br>l was hard to choosed just two pieces of cakes.<br>I wanted eat every tastes!

The food is pretty good, the desert is much better... but the time that it takes from ordering your food to its arrival either for take out or dine in.....is too dang long! I am not sure why this is an issue with The Cheesecake Factory-- in Waikiki and Kapolei. When visiting the mainland- sorry, don&#39;t like to compare Hawaii to the mainland- the service isn&#39;t this slow. It took about 55 minutes for our take out- and this was just before 10:00p on a Saturday night. I&#39;ve heard the same complaints from friends who come here. The food overall is pretty good.... wish that the turn around time for food delivered to the table or for take out would improve.

A chance of a lifetime!!  To go to Cheese cake factory waikiki without the long wait and crowds...<br>Yes!! <br>Gotta always look at everything with a positive outlook and this was it!!  If you aren&#39;t familiar with this location.....this location is normally packed with crowds of people just waiting to get in...not unusual to have a waiting list of  30 plus on a wait list....No joke!  plus we pretty much had the place to ourselves well maybe 30 parties spread out throughout...the place is huge (easy 400 people plus seating)  so 30 parties in this place is still pretty much empty..<br>The insides is beautiful with detail throughout...decorated walls ceilings with a very cool undescribable theme...half palace half outside patio errr well you can go and describe it with your own words...all i know is it is very inviting and half airconditioned half outside patio  type seating and just beautiful!!<br>The staff was attentive and dilligent in safety protocols...keeping their distance..keeping dining parties 6 ft or more apart...disinfecting tables immediately after diners leave...all good!  They did accidentally charge us for something that wasnt ours but an honest mistake...the one thing is I dont believe there was any sincerity or warmth when the manager was remedying the issue and I seriously cant recall an apology from the manager but the waiter did apologize...<br>Okay on to the food!!  Shucks forgot to take menu pics anyways their menu is huge!!  appetizers...salads...pastas...burgers... entries...even meatless options...there are many menu pics on yelp to look at..(bummed no longer have chicken fried steak ..I went with their meatloaf ( good taste and dense only ate half).it came with mashed potatoes (not bad but a bit luke warm) ..succotash...beans corn and some other stuff (meh)..we also ordered a side of asparagus (buttery goodness) ..I cant talk about the other food because I did not try it...<br>So if you look for the positive in this pandemic you will positively need to visit Cheese cake factory waikiki before the crowds return....

Decent food and something for everyone which makes bringing family easy since everyone likes something different. I do a lot of take out ordering and what bothers me is waiting in the long line to pick up even though I&#39;ve already ordered and pay because of all the people in front of me trying to decide what to order. Please change the operations to have another line for those who&#39;ve already ordered and paid

Arrived at 7:05pm and no wait for my wife and I.  No menus so we used the QR code.  Ordered some drinks, dinner, and desert.  All was delicious.   The server and food runners were pleasant and we hand a great time.  Ok, if there was room for improvement, the lighting was a little dark in the bathroom..... there.... something to improve upon.

The food is good....onc you can settle the 21 page menu.  Our service was impeccable with our hyper attentive waiter Sean.  I dont know if this dude was on something or had too much coffee that day, when he was at our table he moved a hundred miles a minute even while standing still.  We have the parmesan chicken, which was perfectly cooked, and seasoned to the delectable pallet and could not have been better.  Also, we enjoyed the NY strip and garlic shrimp pasta.  Everything we ordered was amazing and the portion size was more then expected.  Totally worth the money.  Our only complaint was the menu was so long and had so many good looking options it made decision time a long process.  This CF was probably in the top five I have visited across the states.

I stopped by the restaurant to have a quick lunch before checking in our hotels. The restaurant has a good menu with lots of delicious dishes that you can get. You can salads, mahi-mahi to the burger, and different kinds of soups. I think the restaurant has a better menu than regular Cheesecake Factory ones in the mainland. <br>I had salad mahi mahi and it&#39;s delicious. The price is average to medium-high $20 for the main course and 17$ for Burger and Salads.

You got our order wrong. You missed a pasta dish. Because it was a door dash order the only recourse was a refund. But let me tell you that does not make us whole. A member of my family didn&#39;t get what they wanted and had to share in the remaining meals. It&#39;s somewhat special when we order from you, so it&#39;s a major disappointment when the food ordered doesn&#39;t arrive. <br>It&#39;s curious that the receipt printed on the bag was correct, but it was obvious that there were only 3 and not 4 containers.<br>Also the taste of the other pasta dishes were not the same (not as spicy) as the previous order. Needless to say it was a very disappointing meal. <br>This inattention to the basics and inconsistency in the food will weigh heavily next time we choose to order dinner.

This place was my son&#39;s favorite restaurant all during high school. Now that he&#39;s 20, we don&#39;t come much anymore, but it&#39;s still a fun place with good food of gigantic portions. <br><br>We came here last Monday and surprisingly, we were seated right away at 6pm. My son&#39;s girlfriend is visiting from Oklahoma and had never been to a Cheesecake Factory before.<br><br>We were seated immediately and were each given one of their giant menus which sort of resemble the Webster&#39;s unabridged dictionary, it is so thick. I always order the same thing, the Thai lettuce wraps, because it is one of the few items that has less than 1,000 calories, it&#39;s very good, and I take half of it home to enjoy for lunch the next day. The kids had a harder time. This place has fish, steaks, burger, sandwiches, salads, pizza.....just about anything you&#39;d ever feel like eating. They finally decided on pasta, the chicken piccata and the chicken marsala. <br><br>We started off with their basket of bread, and this bread is so good. Crisp exterior with warm, soft, chewy insides. This is how bread should be. Appetizers were avocado eggrolls and a giant plate of French Fries. We enjoyed these immensely. The chicken piccata had a nice lemony taste, al dente capellini, and tender chicken. My son&#39;s girlfriend said her chicken marsala was super good. Needless to say, the portions here are so huge that we&#39;ve never had room to order dessert. One day we will come and only order cheesecake! But until that day comes, be sure to drop by and have one of their hundreds of delicious meals, you&#39;ll be glad you did.

Cheesecake Factory has always been a FAVORITE of mine over the years for Birthday Celebrations for parties of 3 or more! <br><br>In fact, I actually celebrated my last 3 Birthdays  with Friends here and recently the Birthday of another dear friend here! It was her first time ever trying Cheesecake Factory and she thought it was Blown-Away AWESOME!!! =D! She can&#39;t wait to bring her husband and kids here! <br><br>I can confidently say that I have never had a bad experience at CF!! I feel it&#39;s the PERFECT VENUE for a GROUP Birthday Celebration or Special Occasion, because of the HUMANGOUS MENU SELECTION (something for everyone including Vegans), PLENTIFUL PORTIONS, and over 50 LUSCIOUS CHEESECAKES &amp; ASSORTED DESSERTS to Light Candles on &amp; CELEBRATE in SWEET &amp; SATISFYING STYLE!!^__^! Also, because friends/family usually treat the Birthday person to their meal, CF has HIGH-Quality Delicious meals without being over-the-top expensive! You can get most of their GIANT ENTREES for around $17-$25. WIN-WIN for the Birthday Girl/Boy &amp; their Celebrants!! =) =)<br><br>Yes this Waikiki location does not take Reservations &amp; they are ALWAYS BUSY, for Brunch, Lunch, &amp; especially Dinner, every day of the week! But totally understandably because their food is super duper Good with a Capital G!! Even on weekdays you may wait 30 min - 1hour during peak times. But let me tell you, it&#39;s TOTALLY WORTH THE WAIT!! Plus, they will give you a buzzer so you can wait with your party just outside under beautiful palm trees enjoying quality time &amp; conversation, working up a ravenous appetite (you&#39;ll need one! ;)) as you enjoy pleasant island breezes!^^<br><br>I&#39;ve tried over 20 menu items over the years and never been disappointed! I will write about my absolute FAVS!!<br><br>#1 FAV -- ORANGE CHICKEN!!! Yes, this ain&#39;t a Chinese restaurant, but seriously, their Orange Chicken is THE BEST I&#39;ve had by far from any establishment anywhere, Chinese or not!! 20X better than Panda Express! LARGE CHUNKS of FRESH ALL WHITE MEAT CHICKEN, CRISPY non-greasy batter, and TOTALLY YUMMY Sticky Orange Sauce with FRAGRANT Orange Zest shavings, Asian veggies &amp; steamed rice. A CF MUST-TRY!!! =D! <br><br>PASTA DA VINCI -- al dente penne pasta with tender morsels of fresh chicken thighs, in CF&#39;S Famous INCREDIBLY DELICIOUS RED WINE MADEIRA SAUCE with mushrooms &amp; onions -- trust me just try it!! =)! <br><br>STEAK DIANE -- SCRUMPTIOUS BLACK PEPPERCORN sauce on medallions of steak (cooked to your preference), my friend got hers Med-Rare &amp; it was JUICY RED meat, she LOVED the sauce &amp; asked for extra!! Comes with mashed potatoes (rustic w/ red skins &amp; potato chunks mixed in -- yes!!) She got it with linguine which was fresh made! Absolutely FABULOUS --  I Love watching people clean their whole plate &amp; dig what they eat!! Lol =)! <br><br>Also Noteworthy -- Bryan W. very often orders their IMPOSSIBLE BURGER and says it&#39;s one of his FAV places to get it at!<br><br>Oh! Did I mention their BREAD??! One of my FAV places EVER for table bread!! They give you 2 -- Fresh Chewy Warm Sourdough (so so Good!!!) &amp; Deeelicious Dark Molasses Oat -- Bread, Bread, Bread, more Bread please!!! :D :D <br><br>MANGO KEY LIME CHEESECAKE W/ COCONUT MACAROON CRUST -- nuff said!! :D :D<br><br>Seasonal PUMPKIN Cheesecake &amp; they have a Pumpkin/Pecan Pie Combo Cheesecake -- OMG!! Better than CPK IMHO! :)<br><br>Cheesecake Factory has over 250 Menu Items and the Spectacular thing is that every one of those items is FRESH, QUALITY, DELICIOUS, &amp; MADE FROM SCRATCH!! AMAZING!!!<br><br>Service has always been OUTSTANDING and even memorable!! =)<br><br>Ambiance is Clean &amp; CLASSY! ^__^<br><br>Full Bar of course!! A must-have at any Celebration! Cheers to Sharing Quality Time &amp; Quality Food amongst Quailty Friends &amp; Family!! ^__^!<br><br>BRAVO CHEESECAKE FACTORY!!! Mahalo Nui Loa for all that You are &amp; See You at our next Birthday Celebration! Yay! ^__^!!

Waitress was all over the bulls ass .....but no where to be found! After sitting for 25 minutes WITHOUT a menu, her light bulb went on when  i told her, we had no menu! We ordered a drink, ordered food ( after 1 hour )  ordered a drink @ 9:39 pm and waitress informed us , we could not have another cocktail after 9:00pm....per Liquor Dept rules , nothing served past 9pm! Why would they not inform us at the beginning  of this long ass dinner journey ???? There service sucks and ditto on the food and cocktails

#latepost <br>Definitely a hit and miss kind of place --- like what time of the season it is. If it&#39;s peak season, avoid at all costs since the tourists seems to flock like crazy to this place. For example: spring break, summer break, etc. The wait time can anywhere from 20 min to 2 hours so take heed. As far as the food, it&#39;s ok. It&#39;s unfortunate to know that most of the food is pre-prepped and frozen but with that said.. it&#39;s still good lol!

Food is so delicious but the service there is horrible.<br>I ate in restaurant and was appalled when patrons weee sitting with feet on seats. <br>Gross <br><br>During covid and all!<br>I politely asked the hostess if this was acceptable and she said yes. Disgusting to know that I&#39;m sitting on a seat that  other people have put their feet up on<br><br>Food is always predictably delicious. On another occasion shortly after that visit, I ordered takeout and the people were again rude and unfriendly . I don&#39;t understand if they don&#39;t want to deal with the public they should find a different job.<br> Terrible service!!!

Beware that if you place a take out order they may tell you to wait outside BUT you still go inside. I arrived to pick up food &amp; was told to wait outside (6:50). I checked in w the attendant after 10 minutes of waiting outside (7:00) &amp; the attendant went inside to look for my order only to come out w a manager after several minutes. The manager asked how I placed my order, when I responded &#34;online&#34; I was told to go inside where I had to WAIT another 5 minutes in line to get our order. Finally got our food at 7:10, after 20 minutes of waiting, Meal is cold, no one even seemed to care that they had us waiting for no reason as the food was ready when I arrived.

If you order a &#34;wellness salad&#34; with dressing on the side, the salad greens will arrive dripping in oil.<br><br>This was unfortunate and disappointing, as the salad was ordered for an individual who does not like dressing on their salad.<br><br>This was not a mistake made by The Cheesecake Factory-- rather, they massage the kale with a lemon vinaigrette (presumably to make the kale more tender). However, there is so much oil that the entire salad arrives limp.

Love the salads here and the servers are so nice. Go see ashlie she&#39;s the best. The Caesar dressing is great and the chicken is fresh of the grill. My husband had the jambalaya and we also tried the bacon burger. If you are looking for a big salad after eating a bunch of poke or Japanese, come here.

We&#39;ve been to the Waikiki location 3-4 times; the latest being last night. I had the Pan Seared Branzino w/Lemon Butter &amp; my husband had the Shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo. Both were perfect! <br>Our server Michael M S was very attentive, funny &amp; went above &amp; beyond to take not just 1 photo for us, but 3! <br>The food has always been excellent there. I really feel you can&#39;t go wrong w/anything you order; they always do an excellent job, which is no easy feat w/a menu as extensive as theirs! <br>Our wait was only 40 minutes, probably the shortest ever for us. <br>Excellent food, excellent service . . we had a great time.

If you other choice try to stay way from this place. Their sanitation level is a little below average. They don&#39;t wipe the tables and chairs after each use, and their silverware need some heavy Clorox and detergent cleaning. If you find yourself eating here, ask for wood chopsticks instead.

One of my favorite places to go! I personally don&#39;t like large crowds of people, but my experience here was amazing, my boyfriend and I went on a double date with a few friends and we were seated with in about 30 minutes of us walking in and placing our name down, as we waited me and my boyfriend were able to walk around in the F21 right across until we were seated. <br><br>the hostess was friendly, as well as our server, sadly I can&#39;t remember his name since our visit was a while ago, but he often checked up on us to see how everything was going, and even had a full conversation with the guys. <br><br>Our dinner was absolutely amazing. It was served within another 20-30 minutes (the girls ordered prime rib, while the guys ordered burgers LOL!) my boyfriend was a little jealous I ordered prime rib so of course he had to get a bite or 2 in.<br><br>Then we moved on to dessert. I just had to try the s&#39;mores cheesecake (I can&#39;t resist sweet) that was a good way to end my dinner. My boyfriend doesn&#39;t really take well to chocolate, so he had a plain vanilla bean (his favorite) though he was able to finish it, our waiter kindly packaged it up for him and then we paid. <br><br>A well deserved 5 stars! I always recommend to friend whenever they have a date night or just want a sweet treat. Will definitely be coming back.

Poke Bowls, Poi, Korean BBQ, udon and Musubis not your thing? Then Cheesecake Factory will hit the spot. <br><br>In Waikiki, Japanese and Korean food are way overrepresented. And, some people straight-up hate Hawaiian local foods. So, it&#39;s fortunate that a Cheesecake Factory is smack dab in the middle of Luxury Row in Waikiki. <br><br>Here, you can get all your tried and true American favorites from steaks, pasta and burgers. And, you can wash it all down with sodas, beers and alcoholic beverages. Enjoy a huge assortment of desserts including their amazing cheesecakes. <br><br>Expect a long wait during peak times at lunch and dinner. Once seated, you will get service quickly and regularly as it seems that staff outnumber the guests. The food arrives quickly as they have a large and efficient kitchen staff. And, there are no surprises here. No raw fish and ground up root vegetables. Prices are decent too. <br><br>If you can&#39;t stand the local dining scene in Waikiki, Cheesecake Factory has you covered.

Give me a sit-down, median-priced restaurant that has longer waiting times than Cheesecake Factory Waikiki; I&#39;ll wait.<br><br>Can&#39;t name one? Thought so.<br><br>Even so, you can&#39;t go wrong with a meal here. There are choices for everyone in your party... vegan, gluten-free, peanut-free, Thai, American, etc. Everything I&#39;ve had here is decent. Though busy, the service is great. I&#39;m not a fan of the dim lighting at all, but I can survive. And of course, the cheesecake is DIVINE. A bit steep at ~$9 a slice but you can&#39;t go wrong with the New York-style cheesecakes from here. Cheesecake Factory also validates parking at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, so that&#39;s a plus.

By far one of my TOP 5 restaurants ever! Yes it&#39;s a chain restaurant (I&#39;ve been to CF&#39;s in CA and TX and just as good), and it never disappoints! I love everything here, except the waiting time to get a table as it gets super busy. Their level of service is awesome all around! Food is always delicious. Ambiance is comfortable and inviting. I don&#39;t want to jinx it but I have never had a bad experience here and I have eaten here at least a dozen times. Kudos and can&#39;t wait to dine here again when COVID-19 has ran its course!

One of my favorite places to go. I usually always get the miso salmon! If you haven&#39;t tried it you should. Today though service was a little slow. We watched others get seated after us get their food before us. <br>But our waitress was amazing. I think her name was Ebony, she kept us updated and apologized for our food. who knew it would be busy on a Thursday night?<br>Tonight we decided to try the crab artichoke dip, and let me tell you it was amazing. You should try it!<br>Will definitely come back again

We came here at least 3 times while we were on vacation just for their cheesecake. Can&#39;t really find good dessert around, but we had a fridge in our room and had a craving for cheesecake. It was actually 3 blocks from where we&#39;re staying so we walked. This place gets jam packed with people and unlike me, I just wanted cheesecakes and a lot of people have the same idea as well! We couldn&#39;t pick all of them because everything looked so delicious! Will definitely be back for more! The lady working at the cash register, she was so sweet and patient. Those people working behind the display case was hustling and kudos for your hard work as well! <br><br>Tip: know what you want to order first before you step in line. It&#39;ll make the line and service go faster which makes it much more organized.

Service was nice , they offered bread and utensils. I originally ordered the chicken Marsala but they didn&#39;t have it since they are do a smaller menu at the moment. So I was recommended the chicken Madeira, said it&#39;s about the same with the sauce and mushrooms and they switched my mash potatoes for pasta to match the Marsala dish. Perfect! <br>I finally get my food, take it home to get ready to eat and I open the box to this. Plain chicken breasts with NO sauce or MAYBE just a drizzle of the sauce that makes the entire dish, and a huge stack of melted cheese on top of the chicken. So I basically received chicken with melted cheese and dry noodles with some veggies. I really tried to enjoy it but it was just not good at all. I&#39;m very disappointed because I&#39;ve seen pictures of what the dish is supposed to look like and this is not it.

It was not even busy, but service and food were not good. we had to wait for a long time to even get<br>our drinks, but food was pretty fast, but they were not even warm, especially the pasta. even smelled funny and strange taste. <br>It was not a server, but waitress brought our food was rude, she didn&#39;t even checking who ordered which, she just put them on the table, didn&#39;t even said anything.<br>I used to like this place, but won&#39;t go back!

We used to come here to celebrate every anniversary and birthday because the portions were huge for the prices, which were super affordable compared to other American cuisine chain restaurants like CPK and Chili&#39;s. Parking is convenient and validated at Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. Prices have been steadily climbing, though, like everything else. Fortunately, the quality and taste hasn&#39;t deteriorated. Service is a hit or miss. We&#39;ve had kindly servers and also impatient ones. <br><br>These days we tend to go for early dinners so that we can order from the lunch menu. We came here for an early birthday celebration (mine!) a couple of days ago. We ordered calamari (lightly battered and so crispy), two miso salmons (so good!), a California guacamole salad (yum!), and a tiramisu dessert (not as good as I remember). Total was about $80. <br><br>It&#39;s still a good stand-by for when we&#39;re in the mood for something that&#39;s sort of fancy.

10/13/20 Happy Birthday to me! My Ohana took me there to celebrate my ?? birthday!! Sorry, can&#39;t tell u what number! Ha ha !!! I CAN tell you that our experience was unforgettable! First of all, as we walked up to the podium, two friendly hostess&#39;s greeted us with aloha. We were instructed to scan the square sticker using your camera on the podium as they use a menu that will pop up on your cellphone.(Very ingenious as to not use a tactial menu which everyone touches) J. Dolan&#39;s uses this smart menu too ! (QRCode)<br>     The hostess takes us through quite a maze to <br>our table. Shucks! All tables outside were taken!<br>We sat near the patio. Because we are in Covid,6ft distance is in effect. IT IS DARK!!!!!! Waitress comes &amp; she&#39;s so friendly. We ordered Calamari &amp;<br>Iced Teas. We drove from Kaneohe so,no alcoholic drinks! Bread is here! U know that dark soft bread with oatmeal sprinkled on top ? I sunk my teeth into it&#39;s pillowyness. Safeway &amp; Times sells it. Calamari came on a big plate with cocktail sauce &amp; tartar sauce. There was a napkin underneath as to soak up the residual oil. Maybe some salt or a little fresh herbs could&#39;ve helped the flavor. Don&#39;t fill up on the bread &amp; pupu&#39;s !<br>Our food is here! It came pretty quick! <br>     Big daddy had the meatloaf &amp; gravy ,mashed potatoes &amp; succotash. I&#39;ve made succotash before <br>&amp; this tasted more like fiesta corn which was really nice! Teen boy had a humongous crispy,<br>falling outside the bun buffalo chicken sandwich.<br>(Check out da pic) I had one of the most flavorful,<br>well seasoned,lemony,buttery &amp; moist Chicken Picatta! Accompanied by al dente spaghettini tossed in butter &amp; Italian parsley. I&#39;m a sucker for u ,Chicken Picatta ! I even eat that @ California Pizza Kitchen! I made this as another main dish for this past Christmas dinner as not every member of our family eats Prime rib. Eldest son went on a staycation with his ohana and ate here as well.! Guess what he ate??? Yuuup !!! I had leftovers for a few days but was happy as a Picatta! I mean happy as a clam! He he ! <br>Okayyyy, after boxing up our food, we ate so much that we should really share a dessert.<br>What ? Share? You get a free mini ice cream sundae for your birthday. How nice! Husband and I are slightly lactose intolerant so we gotta take care of our opu !<br>We can&#39;t have any cheese cake () I did take some Pepcid mid meal as insurance. We decided on Tiramisu! It was a pretty big slice. But... a little freezer burn. I would suppose no one orders that @ The Cheesecake Factory! Duh ?!? <br>Our waitress was very attentive filling up our drinks &amp; letting us know the food would be out soon. Husband noticed that she was from another state.He asked her where she was from.<br>Very friendly &amp; husband tipped her well. <br>     Heads up Yelpers: The menu is VAST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<br>Twenty something pages vast!!!! Make sure u bring your cellphone,bifocals &amp; your appetite!<br>Last time we were there they had just opened.<br>Food was awesome then &amp; I&#39;m glad to say it still is. We went when Oahu was in &#34;Tier 1&#34; . We went <br>walking around Waikiki to walk off the food in our <br>very full bellies. Let me tell you,it was pretty eerie <br>seeing it so ghost town-like. They don&#39;t take reservations so being in Covid helped us to get a table right away. Normally,there&#39;s a bunch of people waiting all the time so we avoid the restaurant. I&#39;m glad we had a chance to visit <br>(&amp; on my birthday too). Like Arnold says....<br>&#34;I&#39;ll be back!&#34;
Love the service and Hawaiian food and drinks in the whole pineapple !!! So fun and high quality!

Ordered online and our order was hot and ready at the time we specified.  Our chicken Madeira was perfect and included a small container of sauce, just enough for the two chicken patties.  The chocolate truffle cake slice was the largest we&#39;ve ever eaten! <br>Pickup by car is located in an alley next to Cheesecake Factory.  There is a friendly security guard who&#39;ll tell you to go down the alley, turn around, and park facing Kalakaua for easy exit.<br>My only minor complaint is I miss those large black utensils and large napkins I received with my takeout before the pandemic.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory gave me feedback on why they are using prepackaged cutlery kits.  It&#39;s an extra precautionary step during these times.  I agree, can&#39;t be too safe during this pandemic.  Good job Cheesecake Factory!
Food is always good. Pineapple upside-down cheesecake is my new favorite. Always love the ahi tuna roll, order it all the time. Service is a hit or miss and that&#39;s the reason I give 4 stars.

The service for the to go order was great. Carly was very nice and very friendly and accommodating for my order. My only gripe, with whoever is responsible, is that my shrimp angel hair pasta came with NO SHRIMP. Not a single shrimp...so yeah. But the taco salad was great.

What a disappointment- every location is different it seems, but I was very disappointed by this location. I placed an order 1 pasta dish and 2 cakes. I arrived 35 minutes after I placed the order to my order not being ready (no big deal) and was told to wait outside and she would let me know. I waited around 10 minutes before I walked back in to ask about my order. The lady had completely disregarded that my order was just sitting there... for 10 minutes...  brought it back and it was not very good at all. The pasta lacked flavor so I added a good bit of salt. The celebration cheesecake wss also very mediocre. Maybe it was just an off day.

Typical chain restaurant, but this place is run like a well oiled machine.<br><br>After browsing through the menu which is like a book,  we selected three dished. Orange chicken, some burger, and a chines salad thingy. I can&#39;t exactly remember their names, but they were all good and very filling. They gave is bread to start with and refilled it cause we were really hungry.<br><br>It looked like it was going to take forever to be seated, but it only took 5 minutes or so. This place is very popular. Service was very good and the food came out fast. The quality of the food was decent. Nothing really special or original, but consistent. The prices are very decent for what you get, especially in Waikiki. <br><br>When we go back to Honolulu, we will return.

This review is only for the takeout cheesecake portion:<br><br>This was my first time at the Cheesecake Factory, and we got the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake to go, at the register. The cheesecake was SUPER rich - like I was basically eating a chocolate mousse + truffle. I loved the different textures of the three layers, as all three were different both texture-wise and sweetness-wise. <br><br>The cheesecake itself is a 4, but what brought my review to a 5 is our cashier, Tony, who was absolutely amazing. My friend used a $10 credit for the $8.90 cheesecake and Tony insisted on giving us back the $1.10 by sticking his hand in his own tips and handing it to us. We told him no need but he insisted, saying that he was also a credit card fanatic and that he wanted us to get our money&#39;s worth. Amazing customer service and delicious (and fattening) cheesecake!

It&#39;s always a treat to get to go to the Cheesecake Factory. My boyfriend were walking around Waikiki and joked about going to see how long the wait was since there&#39;s always massive amounts of people outside. Went in on a Saturday evening and their wait was only half hour for two! Don&#39;t let looks deceive you. We actually got a seat at the bar instead though. <br><br>My go to and absolute fave is always the Pasta Di Vinci. Boyfriend got the burrito. Everything was delicious and the service was attentive. Love that the portions are large enough for a second meal!

Seth, our waiter was fantastic and made our evening that much more special as we celebrated our new home purchase. He was one of the best waiters we&#39;ve had. He was very attentive and on point. If its possible try to get him if he is available. The burgers were excellent, also one of the best in the area. Mahalo

I love this Cheesecake Factory. We have gone a couple of times for just cake and another for dinner. The waiters we have had have been so great, it&#39;s actually hard to believe. We have had to go out to eat every day since we are living in a hotel and I would expect this kind of treatment from a family owned business. The food was really good too. But we honestly keep going back because the staff is fantastic!

Did a mobile take out order during covid.  Put in mobile order and paid online and pickup time.  Since Royal Hawaiian is closed, just drive to the front of the store on Kalakaua and there is a access road right after the store and just parked there.  Went in side and my order was ready.  In and out in less than a minute.  The employees were all wearing masks, very sfe.<br><br>It was well packaged, came with bread, butter.  Had burger and sandwich, both came fries in a colorful cup.   And the cheesecake with whip cream.<br><br>It was all very tasty and easy.   I tend to do pickup rather than delivery since its easy enough and most of the stores are doing very safe practices.

We came in today to place a to go order and there were only two parties in line ahead of us: a party of two almost done placing their order and a party of one who was there to pick up a mobile order. There was a worker who instead of taking our order like the first party, refused to and told us to place the order online outside. This happened despite her not directly doing anything, with three other people behind the counter. It was just plain lazy and bad customer service as the other party ahead of us were not subjected to the same treatment. I unfortunately didn&#39;t catch her name as she was so quick to be dismissive. It made me and my partner very upset, but we raised no fuss. We wore masks and followed distancing rules and as such should&#39;ve been treated just as any other customers. <br><br>Food tasted okay, cold by the time we got back home (we went directly home a short walk away),  and they forgot our utensils. <br><br>I am not likely to come back anytime soon.

Tried 2 new dishes here Today :<br>MEDITERRANEAN GRILLED CHICKEN  18.95 $<br>Tender Pieces of Chicken Breast Charbroiled with Olive Oil, Garlic and Herbs. with Quinoa-Almond Pilaf and Fresh Vegetables.<br>BRICK CHICKEN 20.95 $<br>Deboned Half Chicken Pan Seared Under a Brick .Served with Crispy Potatoes, Sauteed Onions and Peppers.<br>Both Chicken dishes were tender and nicely seasoned.<br>Line was surprisingly not long today .

I was disappointed that the cheesecake sizes shrunk.  They used to give really big pieces.  Their cheesecakes need a size stimulus.  Don&#39;t make them smaller.  Just charge more!  Don&#39;t shrink quality.  I ate the Cheesecake and something hard was inside.  It was a tag

as with everything under the sun there&#39;s GOOD and BAD.<br><br>BAD:  interior decor/design is ugly.  music was awful, with no Hawaiian music tho&#39; you&#39;re steps away from Waikiki beach.  portion sizes were too large for lunch -- on huge, heavy platters.  better to have smaller portions &amp; lower prices, for lunch.  my brown rice needed more steaming (no anal kitchen boss telling wait staff no brown rice till a good-enough pot is cooked).  both my waitress &amp; receptionist failed to offer to validate my parking ticket even tho&#39; we certainly look &#34;local&#34; amid the very few customers during Honolulu&#39;s 2nd lockdown.  their chit shows suggested tip amounts starting at 18% !  chit total of course, is inflated by 4.5% Hawaii tax, so less than 15% is plenty, for unskilled labor.  not enough veggies in my Bang Bang shrimp &amp; chicken dish, &amp; too few shrimp in my platter. <br><br>GOOD:  i asked my cheery waitress if i could get Bang Bang dish &#34;mild&#34; instead of &#34;spicy&#34; as described in the menu.  she asked the cook who said it&#39;s not spicy &amp; there&#39;s no ingredient he can omit to make it not spicy.  goofy, huh? all that&#39;s needed is to black out the word &#34;spicy&#34; on menus.  but this dish tastes very good.  22 page menu! has page #s which is rare among eateries, &amp; de rigeur if diners like to co-ordinate their dish selections.  there&#39;s Steak Diane which is not common.  my waitress was very cordial, but i doubt if she or most wait help could describe this dish adequately &amp; make it sound very ono!  i&#39;ll bet the dining room boss doesn&#39;t test his/her staff&#39;s skill at orally describing menu offerings with flair &amp; good info.<br><br>examine a menu online before going &#39;cuz 22 pages of menu is daunting &amp; can turn off your appetite.

Well it&#39;s CCF so it&#39;s got a good variety, healthy portions and interesting local twists  to a few dishes not offered outside of the Islands.  It&#39;s gets busy though so tough to hang out for too long after a meal as there is a pretty good line building up and a bit of a subtle suggestion to move on once done eating. The service is better than the one in Palm Desert, CA so we were pleased

The food is amazing, always has been, always will be. The reason I gave it one star is because I want to report an issue that will get people&#39;s attention. I am a student here and am only 18. I was wearing a cropped shirt and a woman employee at the front told me to &#34;cover up&#34; because it is a family restaurant. I was so embarrassed that once I got to my table I started crying and couldn&#39;t stop. I was celebrating an anniversary and did not want my dinner to start off feeling completely insulted. This policy needs to change ESPECIALLY because my outfit was appropriate. This should not be the standard at places like this, we live in HAWAII. So disgusted.

Had an amazing (during covid) experience here! Wait time was literally 5 mins &amp; that was just to get our table set up. Usually this place requires a whole day set aside to just get a seat for 2 so straight off the bat it was great! Our server was super helpful &amp; accommodating &amp; even helped us make selections off of the menu. Food was delicious &amp; portion size is your typical massive Cheesecake Factory plating  If you don&#39;t like waiting forever for a table, I would highly recommend going while their are capacity restrictions at your favorite restaurant

Saturday August 15th.<br>During the 4-5pm evening timeframe, I dined in at the Cheesecake Factory and was overwhelmed by the professional, charming, efficient, and outstanding performance of the Staff. In particular the General Manager Kelly! She surely set the standard of excellence. Additionally, Anthony our server, Matthew, and several other employees that I did not record their names, were awesome! With today&#39;s challenges, it is very reassuring that business does not suffer nor do the team spirit. The Cheesecake Factory on in Waikiki is the best example of the &#34;can-do&#34; attitude. Mahalo, Efrem Williams.

Gonna start this off with a PSA: *PLEASE DO NOT order the &#39;fettuccine alfredo&#39; of &#39;hot spinach and cheese dip&#39; here if you want either to taste flavorful...* because boy, oh boy, you&#39;re gonna be disappointed. <br><br>Both dishes although freshly prepared with quality ingredients lacked flavor. The fettuccine alfredo looked gorgeous and the pasta was cooked perfectly, but the sauce tasted like unsalted butter and cream... There was no rich cheesiness or garlic-ki-ness to it. Just blah. It didn&#39;t satisfy my craving for alfredo at all. The pasta I ordered as a take-out lunch so I just chalked it up to &#34;not ordering this again, oh well&#34;. <br><br>And the hot spinach and cheese dip... oh my goodness. The dip was hot, the chips fresh and crispy but again, no flavor. It just looked like steamed spinach with a sprinkle of cheese. There wasn&#39;t even enough cheese or other ingredients to form a proper dipping sauce if I was being honest. I had brought this up to the waiter and he asked me what I wanted him to do about it. Then later he forgot about my drink order and I reminded him. Ended up getting my drink towards the end of the meal. He sincerely apologized at the end of dinner. It looked like he was new and still perfecting his workflow.<br><br>I&#39;ve dined here many times in that past. I like the decor and ambiance of the restaurant. Lighting is slightly dimmed so it feels relaxing and intimate with whoever you&#39;re dining with at the table, despite the constant noise and motion going around in the restaurant. I like to look up at the art on the ceilings, there&#39;s koi and flowers in some panels. The menu option is vast ranging from lunch potions, dinner, salads, sandwiches, seafood, pastas, pizzas, appetizers, local favorites, asian fusion, traditional american, etc. <br><br>I always spend forever looking through the menu but usually always order the &#34;Crusted Chicken Romano&#34;. It&#39;s this big baked piece of cheese coated chicken with spaghetti in this kinda like tomato bisque sauce. I think it tastes better with extra sauce. This usually never disappoints me.

We&#39;ve tried their take out service twice and its not worth it. Remove away the ambiance of dining inside this restaurant and your left with nothing more than extremely over-priced fast food. There&#39;s not even a drive up window and your order is never ready in time, but they do always forget important things like forks. This location doesn&#39;t even have the same menu items as a regular Cheesecake Factory. Do yourself a favor, spend a quarter of the price and go anywhere else.

Check of all trades but not best of none. Don&#39;t even think about getting the spinach dip because....you thought it! BLAND. We got the nachos, chicken sandwich, and the flatbread as well. The spinach and mushroom flatbread was worth it, and the chicken sandwich was a 7.5/10, but I had better. Nacho was terrible.

Went here for a birthday dinner for two and our server definitely made the night. Had to wait about 20 minutes but my partner and I spent the time walking and seeing some stores. <br><br>After sitting down and ordering, our food came out quickly and portions were definitely enough for 3-4 people.<br><br>I ordered the avocado fried rolls and impossible Bolognese and they were delicious. The avocado fried rolls were crispy and the pasta was flavorful. Definitely recommend! <br><br>The only downside is how dark and dim the whole place is, definitely needs more brightness, also it is a bit pricey so expect to spend a little more.

If you can withstand the hour wait at Cheesecake factory, it&#39;s definitely worth the it. No matter where you get seated, it&#39;s loud. We love to be seated at the outside patio to people watch. The food is good and are large portions, but we all know we go here for what? The Cheesecake!! So if you only want that there is a separate counter. Now the line is long but goes quickly. DON&#39;T LET THAT FOOL YOU! The actual wait for your order after you&#39;ve paid could be 30 minutes! I don&#39;t understand the long wait but yes, again it&#39;s worth it. My favorites are Red Velvet cheesecake, Godiva chocolate &amp; Banana cream pie. I wasn&#39;t impressed with their Mango one though. The price range is from $8-9  for a deliciously rich piece and they top it off with a big glob of home made whip cream on the side. A tip is after you order, go to the back bar and order a    $12 dirty martini to cut the edge off the wait. You might get lucky and if some people leave the bar, scoot in, order food, get your cheesecake order and plant yourself for awhile, the bartenders are always great back there!

Food is good but it&#39;s so crowded and dark inside. Also, I gave my server/waiter my parking ticket to get validated and he did not validate it. I specifically asked him to validate it and when I got my bill, my parking ticket was right there. I assumed it was validated and walked all the way back to the royal hawaiian parking lot only to find that it cost $14, which I was not going to pay. I walked all the way back to the restaurant to get it validated. Normally, it wouldn&#39;t be a big deal, but I had my child with me and he was kind of fussy. Also, when I asked to host if I could get my parking ticket validated he barely even looked at me or said anything like &#34;I&#39;m sorry about that.&#34; He was too busy talking to the other hosts/hostesses behind the counter.

Where the hostess seated us was extremely cold. When I mentioned that it was too cold to be comfortable she replied &#34;what would you like me to do about it?&#34; I asked if the thermostat could be adjusted or if we could be seated somewhere else, none of that happened. We suffered through our meal and it took a very long time to get the check. Should have gone to Dukes instead. The food was ok.

I am all about customer service, been there done that, went to all the classes.....The night before Valentines, after a more stressful and pushed back day I decided to go out with a friend to Cheesecake Factory.  I have the copy of my recent with respect to this guy not getting in trouble.  When an adjacent table asked for another basket of bread with a waitress that passed on the message to this &#34;mystery waiter&#34;.  His response to her is jaw dropping and ear burning.  He says....&#34;THERE&#39;RE (the table) ON THEIR THIRD BASKET.!!!!!The table next to us also heard.  This is not his first time, why keep him. He works on the front line. Integrity of people for humankind just loss value.<br><br>Sadly, a COMP meal wouldn&#39;t make things better.... INTEGRITY HAS NO PRICE!!!!!!

We don&#39;t typically east in TCF but we (family of 4 with 2 teenagers.... 1 being a picky eater) ate here twice during our vacation and had 2 great meals with great service each time.  Also, wait times were short due to it being a big location.  We were pleasantly surprised.
Zen is the most amazing waiter. He is absolutely wonderful. Every need was met. He anticipated our choices. Not say good things.

Hello Cheesecake Factory Team,<br>I completed the survey and contact form to let you know what happened with our experience. I should have mentioned I found them while we were eating them. Yes we still ate them because it&#39;s been a while since we had food from the business. I just wanted to treat them to something we know is normally good. Flavors were still awesome (minus the strips of papers). Just not the small surprises please. I included pics of my sales receipts and I blurred out the cashier&#39;s name out of respect for his privacy. I didn&#39;t realize your business includes their names on it.

I love the Cheesecake Factory. I want to make that known. However, the service at this location make it pathetic. <br>I ordered a cheeseburger for my child &amp; a slice of Cheesecake for myself. I placed the order by phone &amp; was told it would be 20-25 mins. I arrive at the restaurant about 20 mins later &amp; paid at the take out counter. I was told my order would be about 5 more mins &amp; was told to wait outside-someone would call my order by my phone number. <br>So I went outside and waited along with a bunch of other people for another 20 mins. A girl kept coming out, asking people their names &amp; returning with big orders. She asked my name 3 times before finally asking for my order number. I told her I didn&#39;t have an order number-that I ordered by phone &amp; showed her my call log. She finally came out &amp; said I was waiting in the wrong area. I told her that I was waiting where I was directed to by the counter girl &amp; was then greeted by the manager who told me again that I was I was in the wrong area. <br>I&#39;m sorry. But I was waiting where I was directed. Then to be told that it was basically my fault for not getting my order is completely unacceptable. My child&#39;s food was cold-he wouldnt eat it &amp; I called to speak to the manager again. She then told me that I was making the problem &#34;personal &#34; because I told her I don&#39;t let my kids eat at 9pm!<br>The customer service is ridiculous. Especially when they&#39;re hurting for business. They have the time since they are unable to max out their seating so you&#39;d think they&#39;d be a little more aware of their service level. <br><br>I wouldn&#39;t recommend this location to anyone!

We were quite surprised to find that Cheesecake was opened on Christmas Day! Since they were, we happily<br>Got seated and were told we could even order from their brunch menu! After looking, I decided to order their monte Christo sandwich. Thick sweet bread, cheese, ham and eggs served with breakfast potatoes. The husband had the French toast with a side order of ham. Needless to say, we really enjoyed our brunch and were happy that we were able to  is it that day.

Hello! This review is for Shawn/sean/ Shaun (I&#39;m not sure how to spell his name but he had rainbow hair and he was working at around 6:45pm today). He was super friendly and he was one of my favorite waiters that I&#39;ve ever had at a restaurant! Just wanted to say thank you to Sean for making the dining experience memorable and for being so friendly ^.^

Matt our server was awesome! Wasn&#39;t to happy that my steak Diane was cold. I was hungry and was not going to wait for a new one. So I just let my server know so that next time the kitchen staff can be more aware. Matt then offered to take care of the steak Diane, but manager said no. To just give a cheesecake only. Manager asked why I didn&#39;t tell the server that it was cold. I&#39;m not going to wait 15 to 20 for the server. Bathroom was so messy!!

I went to Royal Hawaiian Center to visit the shops. While there, we stopped by Cheesecake factory. Got a togo order and asked them to validate. We spent about 3 hours at the center. Which should have been only $2 for parking with validation. The person who validated gave us a faulty validation. So we ended up paying $18 for parking. We went to ask the parking attendant for help but she basically said we were screwed because of the way the shop validated the ticket. Very unhappy about this.

Nothing. Because there&#39;s no servers helping. 20 mins to get my order in. 15 mins to get bread. Didn&#39;t have pog didn&#39;t offer just juice kept trying to get just pine apple juice and orange juice... ended up getting strawberry lemonade. Been 28 mins since we ordered. Just ordered poke and sushi? 28 mins for server to check in on us.  Had to call down a server to ask for bread, he brought the bread not our server. <br><br>Used to love this place when Larry worked the back bar.<br><br>UPDATE:<br>Food came 40 mins later. And was soggy. <br>Didn&#39;t even ask how the food was when we left.

Five stars! I would recommend this Cheesecake Factory over the one in kapolei because their service is much better. They are really prompt with serving your dishes to you. Also the waiters and waitresses to the hosts are much more friendlier. The ambiance is nice and even when it&#39;s busy you still feel private at your table or booth. The food here never disappoints! I always have their avocado egg rolls and I&#39;m telling you it&#39;s mind blowing. They are not greedy with the avocados. The sauce that they serve it with compliments it so well. My go to dish would be the steak Diane and the shrimp scampi combo! And it is a winner everytime. If you want to try something new with a burst of flavor in your mouth! I recommend the ahi carpaccio! It&#39;s light and refreshing with a burst of flavors. I also recommend the warm crab dip with artichokes! Those are my three favorite starters. Keep it up guys!!!

Totally love their menu! We always get the strawberry cheesecake. Their burgers are so big and delicious! Lasagna verde is tasty as well. Currently, you can dine-in, delivery and pick-up. There&#39;s parking beside the restaurant for pickup.
They always try their best. Some dishes are good and others not so, almost like they&#39;re days old and have been reheated. But otherwise friendly place. I hope that they will reopen soon.

I LOVE THIS PLACE!  If you have never gone to a Cheesecake Factory before, GO!  You will not be disappointed.<br><br>If you regularly visit Cheesecake Factory, you will LOVE this one located in the heart of Waikiki.<br><br>Just steps from the beach or the famous Kalakaua Avenue shopping, you will find something to satisfy whatever you are craving.<br><br>From great drinks, to a menu that is PAGES long to their amazing cheesecakes... you can&#39;t go wrong.<br><br>Now, keep in mind this place GETS BUSY!  If you go on a weekend during peak times, you could wait up to 1 hour.  Just go a little off the peak times and you will be fine!  We went New Years Day at 11:45am and got seated in 5 minutes.  The night before (New Years Eve) at 10pm, there was a 2 hour wait.<br><br>It is SOOOO worth it though.  My go to meal is:<br>* Prosecco<br>* Buffalo Blasts<br>* Burger and Fries<br>*Vanilla Bean or Red Velvet Cheesecake with Vanilla Ice cream.<br><br>ULTIMATE cheat meal for me! lol!<br><br>I only wish parking was a little closer.  They have free parking with validation at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, about 1/2 mile away.<br><br>I go at least once every other month.. love love the variety of food!

Came here for a birthday office get together.  Parking at the Royal Hawaiian is  convenient and cheap for Waikiki so don&#39;t worry about it.  It&#39;s a Thursday lunch hour and there was no line so we got seated right away.<br><br>Ordered appetizer Cobb salad, Veggie salad, pork sliders, kalua pig pizza , avocado rolls.  And 1 regular size dish the Sausage and shrimp penne pasta.  Ate family style for 4. And of course ordered for dessert key lime (sublime) and their anniversary cheesecake.<br><br>Glad we ordered appetizer salads because there would be no way for us to finish a regular  size.  <br><br>Service:  we had an awesome server! She was thoughtful and attentive. Added a star for her awesome service.<br><br>Tips:  <br>1.  don&#39;t order the Kapua pig pizza<br>2. Order the dressing on the side for the salads<br>3. Order the avocado toast instead of the deep fried avocado rolls, it&#39;s cheaper and probably taste better when cold.  The Avo rolls when cold is heavy on the palate. <br>4. Do order the key lime cheesecake. It was tart and sweet!

We came at around 930 pm. Not too bad of a wait. We waited about 10-15 minutes for our table compared to waiting 1-1.5 hours during the busy rush times around 6-7 pm. Overall experience was okay. Food was pretty good with okay service. Waiter was nice but that&#39;s pretty much about it. Nothing special that stood out. Just another normal dinner with pretty good food and okay service.

Timing is everything here. We came for a late lunch on Sunday and we were lucky that there was no line and no waiting.  <br><br>Since we are trying to eat more veggies, this is a good place to go. There are a lot of salads here and some vegan choices as well. Our order arrived very quickly. <br><br>They were very tasty and the huge portions makes for a very satisfying lunch. Our waitress Beth was excellent. <br><br>The only problem is that their complimentary bread is so delicious!  We couldn&#39;t resist when it was offered.<br><br>Definitely a place to go for great salad<br><br>Today we tried the Impossible Burger which is plant-based.  Everyone should try it!  I&#39;ve tried many veggie burgers and meatless burgers in the past and none comes close to this one. I&#39;m certain that if someone didn&#39;t know it was meatless, they wouldn&#39;t know the difference. It was soooo delicious. The side Caesar salad was also big and delicious. <br>In addition, our server Denise was great. Very friendly and efficient!<br>We will be back!
Not consistent with their recipes. Shepards&#39; pie has been made three different ways.<br>It&#39;s corporate so why don&#39;t you stick with the recipe.

Cheesecake factory<br>We have now been to a couple of cheesecake factory&#39;s throughout American but for some reason the Waikiki CheeseCake Factory is our favourite.<br><br>It&#39;s always busy and they don&#39;t take reservations, so I would recommend getting there a little bit earlier than you actually want to eat.<br><br>We arrived about 5:15pm and waited a short time before we were seated. We sat in one of the booths and were very comfortable.<br><br>Staff were busy, but still very attentive and managed their allocated tables really well.<br><br>Food was, as always, sensational..... Tasty, fresh, well presented and large portions<br><br>Only because we loved it so much, all all managed to squeeze in the highlight CHEESECAKE!<br><br>The selection of Cheesecake is huge!<br><br>And the taste of the cheesecake is second to none! I could talk all day about how good the cheesecake is but all I am going to say is..... &#39;go in, try it, you won&#39;t be disappointed&#39;<br><br>Cost for a wine, 2 beers, 3 soft drinks, 5 main meals, 5 cheesecakes was about $150 (US)

Two years later and the service is still top notch. <br><br>They gave us a pager when we checked in and told us 20 minutes. 21 minutes later the pager went off, these guys are good!<br><br>The complimentary white baguette, dark sweet bread, and butter were delicious as usual.  <br><br>I had the crispy chicken sandwich and it was huge!  <br><br>Our server from Minnesota was very friendly and very attentive to our needs. <br><br>The live band starting at 7:00pm was a nice touch. They play towards the street in the front.

I love the Cheesecake Factory. We all went as a family for dinner even for Christmas last year. <br><br>However, Covid seemed to change things a lot which is disappointing. The server was awesome, and was attentive and courteous. However, here was our experience. Fast seating and ordering process. They must be understaffed since I found out maybe 10+ minutes later that they didn&#39;t have part of my order so I ordered an alternative to that one part. During the dinner, the table next to us (which was less than 6 ft...) was bickering about the bread portions so loudly we couldn&#39;t hear ourselves. Ridiculous argument for 5 min much? After that things were fine but the bill was $100+ with tip included for 2 people, when it was all said and done. I wasnt told there was a difference in pricing until I saw the receipt, due to the changed order. <br><br>To top it off, I got food poisoning or something from the meal as I threw up a few hours later. This morning I woke up nauseous and with a headache, and so did my boyfriend. He didn&#39;t throw up, but we sure are going to take our temp with how close everyone was in that room. <br><br>Here&#39;s the thing- this is probably one of my first dine ins since quarantine. This place looked like a virus hotspot, with people with no masks on and tables way too close. Tables may be sectioned off, but they are barely even apart! On the way to the bathroom I was walking 1 feet away from people with no masks at their table. It just seemed like they were doing JUST enough to be &#34;cautious&#34; but really it&#39;s all for show. Tables cleaned quickly possibly to low staff, taking photo of the menu (which is great, but doesn&#39;t help more than doing a bet yet cleaning job and separating people) and not much sanitizing going on. I had to suspect it was the shrimp that gave me the food poisoning since my boyfriend didn&#39;t eat that. And we are unsure if we are now infected. The idea is chilling as there were a lot of people, and that could be the hotspot for so many cases.<br><br>Between sitting through an argument by the loud table next to us, sitting way too close to be able to hear them and being a bit uncomfortable at how close people were, the changed order, the high bill for two people (which would be fine as we had takeout, but now we are throwing it all away because we are unsure which one was the bad food... or if they told us there would be a little difference in pricing for the changed order $8 difference for an entree) and the food poisoning, I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be visiting cheesecake factory for many more months.<br><br>Update: we didn&#39;t get a temp even a few days later.

Note to The Cheesecake Factory: Please be sure to recognize the outstanding service Eddie provided for us tonight! He&#39;s just great! Give this guy a raise! <br><br>This is the second time my girlfriend&#39;s and I have gone to The Cheesecake Factory afterwork on a Friday. So far, so good. We haven&#39;t had an hours wait or so, like we&#39;ve previously experienced. After about a 10 minutes wait, our little pager device went off and our hostess was already waiting for us when we approached the service desk. <br><br>Eddie our server was just awesome. He was attentive, very gracious and anticipated our every need. His who demeanor was welcoming and very personable. It&#39;s service like this that keeps us coming back.

Been in Oahu for a week now and have gone here twice.  Both visits were wonderful. Always looks busy, but both times we were told about a 10 minute wait and it was.  Kudos to the cooks and the servers.  Christy Ford was our waitress the first night.  Great personality and very attentive to not only us, but from what I could tell, ALL of her tables.  I own a restaurant in California and wish ALL my servers were like her.  Max the manager was always on top of any customer needs and was connecting with the diners as well.  On Saturday, Feb 1&#39;st, there were two gentlemen entertaining and they were GREAT.  I hope the new Cheesecake Factory near us in Temecula, Ca will be just as good.  Oh yeah,  the filet mignon and brick chicken are now my favorite dishes.<br>Tom Powers/Owner of Giovanni&#39;s Menifee

Normally I enjoy cheesecake factory from Doordash, but today I decided to dine in. Everything was fine up until our server forgot to put in our order, which we had already guessed with our drinks taking a very long time, while we were sitting waiting for anything even a couple water glasses she was LITERALLY sitting down on a chair talking to another guest. After talking to another server about our drinks our actual server realized that she did not put in our order, and that was 40 minutes of just waiting at the table already, I can understand if it was busy, but if you have time to lounge around and sit at another guests table its unacceptable. Everyone else great job tho.

I go to cheesecake quite regularly however it&#39;s a crapshoot every time we go. <br><br>Always go before 6:30PM or you will be waiting over an hour for a table!! They do not take reservations, so you have to walk there to put your name in &amp; get a buzzer. <br><br>This particular time we got an amazing server named Marisa M.! She was so genuine and such a pleasure to have as a server. She made helpful recommendations, was attentive but not intrusive. She also listened to our requests for no sauce &amp; type of bread preferred! If you ever have a chance to request her, do it!! It&#39;ll make your experience so much better. <br><br>We ordered a bacon bacon burger &amp; miso salmon for entrees. The bacon bacon burger without the special sauce was great! With the sauce on it, I could see how it would be too filling/fatty. The miso salmon was fantastic, quite large too. The only downfall was the surrounding sauce (white) not so pleasing to me. <br><br>For dessert we got the pumpkin cheesecake, I highly recommend this flavor if you are a fan of fall flavors or pumpkin in general. It&#39;s filling, so ordering 1 slice for 2 people will do just fine. I can&#39;t imagine eating it all on my own. <br><br>Parking: no parking aside from the Royal Hawaiian and surrounding parking centers. It&#39;s best to Uber or walk it here. We chose to walk.<br><br>Ambiance: it&#39;s noisy here, like REALLY noisy so I wouldn&#39;t recommend a first time date here! If you sit in the back, it&#39;s also very cold- not sure why... I always request to sit closer to the front of the restaurant so my food doesn&#39;t get cold in 15 m and I&#39;m not shivering.. <br><br>Really the servers make the experience great and thanks to Marisa, we had such a great night out!

Our food hasn&#39;t even come but I had to write my review! Been here many times before but I can honestly say this is the best experience! The person who made it so though is Travis. He is absolutely amazing and pure!!  He is extremely thorough, gave us the perfect amount of time to look over the menu, and brought the bread out super quickly. I am just so impressed and happy with his service. Can he be my waiter every time? Please?  <br><br>His personality is just so perfect for this type of industry. I know all these waiters are slammed and for the volume, he is doing it all with a smile. Sometimes when people get busy, we have a tendency to let it show. Travis makes sure to we feel he is available for us for however long we need and I truly appreciate it.

Was so looking forward to eating here tonight. Food has always been good. We had to walk out when we unraveled our napkins only to find two of our forks weren&#39;t washed and still had food on them. That was digesting and we couldn&#39;t stay. Managemet asked if they could do anything to change our minds to stay fir sinner but during these times and any other time if wrapping dirty forks back into your napkins that&#39;s just laziness. Those dirty forks had to go through an employee to get there. Sorry but we didn&#39;t have any confidence in staying fir our food to arrive.

The Cheesecake Factory has delicious selection of cheesecakes in every city and 5 stars is not enough to mark the taste of &#34;Classic Cheesecake&#34;.  First time I visited Cheesecake Factory in Los Angeles and I don&#39;t even remember my experience. Later when I moved to San Francisco i visited them again at Union Square location, where my experience was more colorful with view to Square, pigeons and light breeze of Bay, where I enjoyed &#34;orange chicken&#34;, which is way better I tried in different places. Long story in short. Honolulu location it was  amazing, because around the corner you can find  walkway to the Waikiki Beach after orgasmic desert therapy!  Cheesecake Factory you are the best Cheesecake Factory!

Server at bar is sweetheart. She resucued me from Tourist with bad manners. Asked woman next to me to please move her hat off the bar as.its right next to my food. Who does this ? Manager was tactful and moved me to a table.

This is such an awesome location. The hostesses are a little oblivious though, husband and I checked in and was told to stand and wait. Then we started noticing everyone who came in after us were being seated before us, so I went to the hostess that checked us in and she asked if I checked in with her, uhh duh because you took my name supposedly. She then said we would be seated next- which we were. Hence why I&#39;m only giving 4 stars. <br><br>Our server Joesph B- I&#39;d give him 5 stars for his outstanding service. He told us since we had never been here before to order one thing and then order another since the servings were huge and he most certainly was right!! Husband and I ordered the nachos for an appetizer and between the two of us we just finished it. The chips were fresh and none of the stale stuff you get from most restaurants, the toppings were flavorful and on point. No brown guacamole, pico was fresh and well seasoned. We also ordered the strawberry cheesecake and per my husband &#34;it doesnt taste like the stuff you get from the store, it had just the right amount of sugar to satisfy you and not be overly sweet.&#34; The sodas are huge too, not like a beer sized soda full of ice, you get your money&#39;s worth. <br><br>I would definitely go back to this location and recommend you ask for joesph b as your server, he was very knowledgeable about the menu and a cheerful server who seemed to really enjoy his job.

This Cheesecake Factory is the busiest and I never understood why. I usually don&#39;t care to eat here but my friend has never been here before and the food was always pretty good. The wait for two was suppose to be 40 minutes and while I was waiting all exhaustedly and dying of hunger. Out of the blue, Aleea came up and told me that there&#39;s a table leaving at the bar if I wanted it it&#39;s up for grabs when it&#39;s ready. So my 40 minute wait turned to a 10 minute wait and she was on point with service! The food was good as well. She even warned us that we ordered a lot but we didn&#39;t care because we were starving. My tip is to sit at the bar area or come here on a decent stomach because the wait will be long for dinner! Also their brown house bread it&#39;s to die for.
