Aleea ask if we wanted house bread and my friend who hasn&#39;t been here said no thanks. I had to say we will take the house bread it&#39;s her first time. As she ate it she was pretty amazed by their brown bread and said wow I can&#39;t believe I turned that down.
Ate Chicken Romano pasta. Was pretty good. Service was alright but not all that. Ordered the Oreo Cheesecake and it was to die for! Shared half of it and still felt so full and satisfied.

The biggest Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. I&#39;m not sure if they always have a live bland plying music but when we went there was a live band with great music!! I never see that in the mainlands. Our waiter did a great job in serving our huge party and was very patient with our Japanese family who didn&#39;t speak English. <br><br>Just like most restaurants in Waikiki the menu comes in Japanese. The lighting was VERY bad thought. Very hard to read the menu. <br><br>Food is great, I always get the meatloaf whenever I go to a Cheesecake Factory.

My mom and I went to this Cheesecake Factory location in June after the Boyz II Men concert and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves overall. It was her first time at TCF and my second time (my first experience being at a mainland location). Even an hour before closing the line was out the door. However, we were seated pretty promptly at an outdoor table. Our server, Nina, was super helpful and on it with everything. <br><br>We ordered the fried calamari and appetizer caesar salad to start. Both were really delicious and generously portioned. I would order them again. You also get big water glasses (very convenient) and a yummy complimentary bread basket for your wait, which we enjoyed. <br><br>For the main course, I ordered the Chicken Madeira - currently my favorite dish here. My mom ordered the Chargrilled NY steak which, unfortunately, was pretty dry and tough for $22.95. Additonally, the veggies on both our plates were a little woody and undercooked. However, as they were rapidly approaching closing time, we did not want to make a fuss about it. I&#39;m sure she would not order that steak again though, as there are many more options to choose from. <br><br>For dessert, I ordered the Dulce de Leche cheesecake, which was a little overly sweet for my personal taste. My mom got the low carb cheesecake with strawberries, which was as good as you can expect being a low carb option. She seemed to really like it, so that&#39;s all the matters. (I think my favorite cheesecake of theirs is still the cookie dough one). <br><br>Overall, this is a great location, the staff are very helpful and accommodating even near closing, and I definitely plan on returning for a third CF experience hopefully in the near future.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my all time favorite chain restaurants. Good prices a wide range of dishes and excellent portions. And not to mention GREAT butter and sweet bread!. I like the Waikiki location; great atmosphere. My go dishes The chicken Piccata has to be one of my favorite ways to enjoy this classic dish, Unlike other chicken piccata dishes, this one contains mushrooms and has a creamy sauce that is hard to beat.,   also very good Cajun Jimbalaya and the Bistro shrimp pasta. Favorite dessert is the Tiramisu cheesecake.

One of my favourite places I ate at while my time in Hawaii. I ate their twice where I ordered a hot black pepper prawn and rice dish and then a sweet and spicy chicken and prawn with rice dish. Both were so yummy. The only thing I would say is that their portion sizes are way to big.
15m wait for one slice of cheesecake to go. I think they lost track or forgot about me because the people behind me were given their food much sooner. Cheesecake is still pretty cherreh tho

The environment, food and service was amazing. I haven&#39;t been in here in almost 2 years but when I went last night it was well worth the wait and to top it off our waiter was amazing. Joseph handled everything very professional but still made us feel so comfortable. He remembered all 7 of our orders. He was very friendly and had an amazing attitude the whole time. He even suggested drinks that we wouldn&#39;t have thought of ordering. He knew the menu like the back of his hand. And the food never disappoints me. It was so delicious! Thank you for being open during this crazy pandemic and still giving your guys all.

Oh my gosh how do I eve start.. great drinks the BIG ISLAND mixed drink is a winna! Waits can be up to 30 min to an hour when high volumes occur, but they are very prompt getting everyone in. It is SO worth the wait. Staff are friendly, food is AMAZING. Be careful with appetizers, portions are big, it could spoil your dinner meal. The nachos appetizer is to die for, could feed 4 easily. I HIGHLY recommend the steak Diane options, I ordered it almost 3 nights in a row. You will not leave disappointed.

So me and my fiancé stood in Waikiki during this call Covid virus I decided to have dinner at the at cheesecake factory on the first night so we did and they fulfilled all of our expectations.We&#39;ve been here for about two weeks and I believe we eat their lunch and dinner for at least 10 days straight.We&#39;ve done takeout we dined in and the food was always Excellent. No matter what we order it&#39;s always good the portions are big And worth the price and plus we always have leftovers that taste awesome even the next day.My fiancé and I would recommend stop by there and try getting a Caesar salad to start off with and finish with the chicken piccata. That&#39;s that&#39;s our starter kit For the Cheesecake Factory. And by the way they have the best ranch in the world that goes great with Fries,pizza,&amp; burgers. Thank you to the staff thank you cheesecake factory. Aloha

I literally downloaded the app just to leave this review. <br><br>I would just like to take a moment to thank the manager on duty who was working 10/6/19 at 8pm with the blazer and long blonde curly-ish hair. With the restaurant industry you can always guarantee that somehow something will always go wrong...orders get given away to the wrong person, food gets burned, modifications come out wrong, etc etc. But of course at the end of the day the reflection of the restaurant depends on how the issues are handled. <br><br>I had an issue with my takeout order being delayed and the takeout employee as well as the MOD couldn&#39;t have handled it better. They let me know what happened, assured me that they were taking care of the issue and refiring my order so it would be up to par and then comped my order to make up for the inconvenience and extended wait time.<br><br>Grace and outstanding customer service are not always easy to maintain during the peak hour of the dinner rush but the manager on duty seemed to have it in spades. Thank you so much for handling my situation so well and I really can&#39;t even begin to express how much I appreciated you and your team going above and beyond. <br><br>And my avocado egg rolls and chocolate mousse cheesecake were fantastic as well btw :)

So this spot is smack dab in the middle of Waikiki. Wait time is a given I guess just be prepared of a really long wait time. Be prepared for a lot of people. It&#39;s a huge restaurant but even still it&#39;s extremely crowded. I&#39;ve been here years ago and it&#39;s only gotten worse. Our waiter was swamped he had so many tables. We did have to wait for our food but we kinda anticipated it. Highly disappointed to find that they&#39;ve taken some really good items from the appetizer menu. No more firecracker salmon and no more spicy shrimp. <br><br>We did enjoy our meals no complaint there. Most people who&#39;ve been to his part of downtown understand its touristy and wait times are a given. If you don&#39;t like to wait or crowds stay away.

Seating: Wait time was 1 hour on a Wednesday night for a party of 4 but I already expected it, since I live here. So, make sure to wear comfy shoes for the stand, or find a seat nearby if you can. They are always busy. I did get to observer their seating operation and they are very organized and fast. They have a great system but there&#39;s just so much people that they may need a bigger place. They give you a buzzer, then they get it from you after to &#34;check in&#34;. After that, they have you wait on the side &amp; then someone calls your party name. When they called it out, my kids were in the bathroom so I mentioned it and she just said to let them know when they get out and one of them will seat us. They did. We were sat on the outside part which in my opinion was perfect. We got to see the entertainment but at the same time, the people passing by as well.  <br><br>Food: We actually didn&#39;t come to eat but more so for the entertainment and to just have a day out. Of course I ended up ordering. Appetizers and Desserts with some tea, and then 2 take out dishes. The avocado rolls were delicious. My daughter normally can&#39;t stand cilantro but she loved the dipping sauce that it came with. I did too. We ordered Godiva cheesecake, Mac and Cheese and a sundae. Portions were HUGE! (I only attached some photos, I forgot to take photos of the other ones)<br><br>Service: Anyway, our server James bka Kimo was super awesome. Very patient with us as my 9 year old son was trying to find his words to order his Mac and Cheese. My daughter and I are allergic to pineapple as we were ordering her drink,  we told Kimo, he said, &#34;No problem, I can leave a note to let them know.&#34; We pretty much know what to order an not to order, but it was a great precaution. I&#39;m pretty observant when it comes to service and he&#39;s very attentive, to all of his guests. He&#39;s a natural.<br><br>This is my second or third time here and to me, it was the best. Mahalo Piha!

Stopped by The Cheesecake Factory last night as it was one of the last places in Waikiki allowing dine-in due to COVID-19. The place was jam-packed. We ordered the avocado egg rolls, the veggie burger (not Impossible burger) with Fries, Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta, and the Impossible Taco Salad. We enjoyed all of the items. The bread that comes out as the appetizer wasn&#39;t as warm/fresh as I&#39;d like/have had in previous visits to Cheesecake factory. The veggie burger is house-made but a bit on the mushy side. However, it&#39;s tasty if you get a bite of all of the crunchy toppings (cucumbers and pickles) and the aioli in one bite. The impossible taco meat adds a good flavor to the taco salad but the salad is not served in a typical taco salad shell as one may expect. There are crispy tortilla strips to add the crunch element. My favorite dish was the Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta. The dish is very simple in the fact that it&#39;s either an olive oil or butter sauce and mainly sauteed veggies, but the super crispy bread crumbs and parmesan bring the dish together nicely and it&#39;s unique from many pasta dishes served in Italian restaurants. <br><br>*Review from a life-long vegetarian*

This was a very very busy place. I myself probably wouldn&#39;t bring my children here to eat at all. It&#39;s just too much going on here. <br><br>We were seated within the first 5 minutes of checking in. We sat in the back area on the upper level I guess you could call it. <br><br>Our waiter was very laid back &amp; relaxed. Maybe a little too much. But... I like when they&#39;re that way. SOMETIMES. Because then I feel that I too could be a little more laid back myself. <br><br>Well we had a GC of $25 &amp; a couple Comp cards for Free cheesecake. Maybe I should t have said anything to him BEFORE we were served. <br><br>Idk. I only say that because we were really well dressed because we just came from the symphony. So obviously we looked as if we were there to spend some scripts. But I feel that because we DID mention the GC &amp; COMP CARDS TO HIM PRIOR TO ORDERING, it made him feel as if we didn&#39;t have money to spend and that we were probably gonna tip him terribly. THATS JUST OUR OPINION. He didn&#39;t have his name tag on, so we couldn&#39;t get his name. But the reason why I said that is because we weren&#39;t ready to order just yet. And he was ok with that. Finally we were ready to order, we set out menus at the end of the table &amp; waited about 10 minutes before he actually looked st us again. And what I mean when I say... &#34;he finally looked at us&#34; was because he passed or was right across our table at least 5 times before he glanced at us. I then waved him down gesturing we were ready to order. We put in our order and it came within a reasonable time. But my husband was missing his fries, and he forgot to get me Parmesan cheese on the side. So, he came back with my cheese. Apparently the cooks forgot to make my husband&#39;s fries, so that took a while. But when it finally arrived  it was very Ono. My pasta, however, wasn&#39;t as great as it was @ the Kapolei Cheesecake Factory. That one there was Oh oh ONO! But this one... it tasted MORE SALTY than creamy. Now maybe it was because I had added in some extra parm cheese, but... still, it shouldn&#39;t have changed the taste of the cream. If anything... the cheese should&#39;ve enhanced the flavors to blend together and NOT taste so over powering. My husband on the other hand said his mushroom burger was AWESOME!!! I knew I should&#39;ve gotten that instead. LOL!! But I took my pasta home. I think I only took 3 bites from it too. I didn&#39;t want to make t into a BIG DEAL &amp; so I just ate the molasses bread. <br><br>As we waited for our waiter to finish cleaning the table across of us, another waiter approached us and asked if we were ok, removed my husband&#39;s dishes &amp; asked if we wanted refills &amp; a container for my pasta. So THAT waiter took my plate and packed it for us, came back with a refill &amp; asked if we needed anything else. HE WAS A GOOD WAITER!!<br><br>Our actual waiter was like... &#34;OH! I DIDNT REALIZE THEY WERE DONE. THANKS MAN!&#34; (Hence why I said... &#34;Maybe our waiter was too laid back &amp; I shouldn&#39;t have said anything about the GC &amp; CC&#34; prior to ordering)  After the other waiter left, our waiter asked if we&#39;re ready to order  our cheesecakes. We took 2 oreos. Gave us the bill. Made out cheesecakes &amp; cashed us out. We then was done, thanked our waiter, left him a tip in the folder and went on our way. <br><br>Like I said... HE WASNT A BAD WAITER @ ALL. Maybe he was just tired and it was near the end of his shift. And it&#39;s probably just ME being nit picky about how things went. sorry... I&#39;m just being thorough, that&#39;s all. <br><br>NOT SAYING WE DESERVE TO BE TREATED LIKE VIPS or like a KING &amp; QUEEN. HELL NO!! I&#39;m just saying he probably was comfortable with us that&#39;s all. And I&#39;m ok with that too. Which is why we DID tip him 25% instead of 15% or 20%. Maybe he had a long night and by time we came in... he was ready to go home and sleep. They were super busy!! I mean am the waithelp we&#39;re jamming. Even the managers too. <br><br>So did I enjoy myself here?! Yeah... sure! Would I come back? Uhhh... only if we really had to. For someone else&#39;s birthday or an event then yeah. Would I bring kids to THIS LOCATION?! Uh-uh! It&#39;s too too much going on. Too too loud for me to take my kids to. Because then they&#39;ll think it&#39;s ok to yell or speak up loudly &amp; they just might misbehave really badly and that&#39;ll be it. So no! I wouldn&#39;t bring kids here. <br><br>Restrooms were small kine messy. Counter tops were full with left over water puddles from peoples drippings. Lighting is very very dim. I wouldn&#39;t recommend those with bad eyes to go there to eat. Because even the restaurant itself is dimmed. Not as much as the restrooms, but it is dimmed lighting. I think the bathrooms ONLY LOOK a lot dimmer than the restaurant itself because of its BLACK MARBLE COUNTERTOPS AND BATHROOM STALL WALLS AND DOORS. They&#39;re ALL BLACK. So it makes the bathrooms seem darker than it should be. Although I likIt&#39;s can be very dangerous for someone who doesn&#39;t have good sight. They should make their restrooms whiter or brighter. Either way... just enhance the lighting it a bit more.

There was always a huge lineup at dinner time so we decided to give it a try out of curiosity and we are glad that we did.  We went at 5pm and waited for 5m mins. They are very efficient and quick with their food service. <br><br>The portions were huge and food was great. We ordered the angel hair pasta with shrimp, Cobb salad and tiramisu cheesecake.  It was delicious! There is a reason why this place is always busy. And the prices are one of the most reasonable places you&#39;ll ever eat for a dine in experience.  Highly recommended!

Okay so this is a review about this past Saturday March 21. I needed time to calm down since I was so upset at another guest. Seriously 100 stars to cheesecake employees. <br><br>I work upstairs at Noi Thai Cuisine. Wasn&#39;t given the memo that we changed our covid hours of closing at 9pm to 8pm at noi. So I had to improvise when I walked in at 8:07 and the kitchen was almost done cleaning. Stopped by cheesecake because yum I love the food. There were 2 employees behind the counter trying to take orders and get all the food orders correct and out to everyone. Idk how many in the kitchen but imagine not very many since they have windows and I couldn&#39;t see anyone in the small view I had of the kitchen. Take out was packed. So in light of practicing social distancing my roommate and I decided to call in and wait somewhere that didn&#39;t involve being in a crowd. <br><br>Btw They have a selective menu. That can be found on their website but to make things easier<br><br><a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fthecheesecakefactory.olo.express%2Fmenu%2Fhonolulu-hi&amp;s=dbfd80922e0a7c835a916b7631eea0b2dfaacf1386dbae64df868eaac8a21eb0" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">thecheesecakefactory.olo…</a><br><br>So roomie and I show up to pick up the food. And there was this woman  She was a guest. But awful, heartless human is probably the nicest thing to accurately describe her. I&#39;ve been in this industry a long time. I&#39;ve seen some things. And while this isn&#39;t the worst I just have to applaud the cheesecake employees for how they handled this obnoxious, rude woman. She walks up to counter causing a gigantic scene that her fried calamari is taking longer than 3 minutes..... 3 minutes.... literally reaching over the counter yelling that this is her second order today.... Lady do you not see this gang of other people also waiting for their food they just ordered?! Do you not see that there&#39;s only 2 respectable human beings behind the counter working their butts off during this pandemic?! Do you want undercooked fried calamari?! Like whooooooo does she think she is?! Oh this is your second order today? Okay then you&#39;ve had food already so sit down woman!! <br><br>And to the employees behind the counter... sis I didn&#39;t get your name... but bless your heart. You deserve a freaking medal. You didn&#39;t get crazy. You suppressed your anger. A feeling I am well familiar with in this industry. But given the state of emergency this country is enduring. Like I&#39;m not 100% sure I could&#39;ve kept it together as well as you. And I know how people try to take advantage of corporate places to get free food, refunds etc. especially with platforms like yelp. Not enough people come on here to say nice things. Lots of negativity. So I applaud you. And because I don&#39;t work there... I&#39;m not clocked in. I was one of the people that verbally put her her in her place. Legit the entire place had your back. It was beautiful. She kept yelling that you were being mean and you were like nope not today. When you said &#34;listen there&#39;s 2 of us and we have been here over 7 hours I will call security if you do not calm down&#34;  MY  SOUL  SANG  and your coworker he also continued to work hard. The both of you literally did not stop bagging and checking food while this woman was having a conniption. Really wish I stayed until the end but we got our food and were like bye! I swear the food tasted better after witnessing that. I hope security came and made her feel real small. She was so out of this world psycho.  what a dummy!<br><br>So Thank you! Many mahalos for continuing to work hard and deal with monsters like that woman during this time. You are so much more appreciated than you even know

So we ate early and the wait wasn&#39;t too long but beware of this location......it gets crowded beyond belief. His is your typical Cheesecake Factory with a huge assortment of various foods. It covers almost any appetite. Service was great, food came quick and delicious. Had the Shrimp scampi and my daughter had the salmon. So full we couldn&#39;t even think of dessert but it did look amazing. Big establishment so you can eat in or out.

Went on a Sunday afternoon with my kids and husband. We only had about a 5- 10 minute wait . Hostess staff weren&#39;t the friendliness but weren&#39;t bad either. Waiter was attentive. Food was good . We had avocado egg rolls as an appetizer and they were really good ! Came with a sauce that added a bit of sweetness, perfect touch! I recommend that if you like avocado.  We took our desserts to go , of course you can&#39;t go to the Cheesecake Factory and not get dessert . We had a strawberry cheesecake and a Reese&#39;s cheesecake. If I were to go again I would just for the desserts.
Hi there, I did actually let my waiter know. He came back with a fresh batch of mashed potato but I was still hesitant to eat it since it originally has chunks of potatoes in it

Come early and come hungry! This place gets super crowded, you have to stand in line to put your name down for a table because they don&#39;t take reservations. Their portions are BIG. I never have to take home food but I had to here. Definitely order the calamari for sure, next time I could eat just that and their complimentary bread it was so good. <br>Shawn our server was excellent. He made the crowded and loud experience really enjoyable and was on top of everything. He goes above and beyond the call of duty with a smile. <br>The only reason I&#39;m giving 4 stars is because of the Fish and Chips I ordered. Unfortunately, it was average at best. I was hoping for the same type of breading as the calamari but it wasn&#39;t quite there.  The fish was thick and moist but not too flavorful. The cole slaw also had no taste or tang. I&#39;m sure if I ordered something else, I&#39;d rate the experience as 5 stars. Nonetheless, the outstanding service we received made the drive into Waikiki worth it.

Celebrated our daughter&#39;s birthday with her friends.<br><br>Wait was 1.5 hours, good thing there are shops near by to pass the wait time.  Host was very rushed and felt like they could not be bothered to be friendly.<br><br>Waitress made the long wait so worth it, she was upbeat, pleasant, smiley and had the right recommendations for our large party.<br><br>Portions are perfect for family style dining and kids loved the food.
Everything was fresh and delicious. Paige our server was perfect. The mushroom soup was excellent and the pizza was delicious.

PROS:  Large portions, so good value for your money; huge selection of food options (something for everyone); good service<br><br>CONS:  No reservations; long wait times at peak hours; parking at Royal Hawaiian (validated) is about a block away from the restaurant<br><br>FOOD:<br>-Avocado egg rolls. If you like avocado and sun dried tomatoes, get these.<br>-Thai Coconut-Lime Curry. Not authentic, but absolutely delicious and inspired by Thai flavors.<br>-Other recommendations. Lemon herb chicken, huevos rancheros, meatloaf, chicken pot pie, white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake.

So let&#39;s get the skeletons out of the closet: the wait to be seated anywhere near dinner time...sucks. However, I&#39;m sure the wait is because people are enjoying themselves so much, they aren&#39;t quick to leave. The Blue Hawaiian drink I ordered once seated was the best drink I&#39;ve had on the island. The spinach and cheese dip as an app, delightful. My fish + chips, exactly as expected (which sometimes getting what you expect is exactly what you need when you&#39;re away from home). We had a great meal here + will come back before we leave just for some cheesecake and another Blue Hawaiian. Cheers!

The Cheesecake Factory has a huge menu, which at some point you have to wonder how they can prepare so many different things and keep all the required food or ingredients fresh.<br>However, their cheesecake is very yummy.
Delicious and fresh, great flavors. I had the Smokehouse B.B.Q. Burger - Smoked Bacon and Melted Cheddar with Crispy Onion Strings and B.B.Q. Ranch Sauce. <br>Really good smoky and tasty.

We were hesitant to come here because one reviewer below stated they overheard two waiters talking about customers that kept requesting bread. I went against my judgement and gave it a try despite being highly turned off by that. During both sittings on back to back days we really enjoyed our food. We&#39;ve never had a bad experience with this restaurant back in NYC as well. I&#39;m happy we came here. Both nights did have cold bread that was hard and may require a dentist if not eaten with caution. On the first night, all bread wasn&#39;t included on the table. Thankfully, we didn&#39;t come for the bread. The Ribeye during the first sitting was one of the best I&#39;ve had. The second sitting on the second night it did have overly too much fat that occupied most of the meat. While our server on the first night seemed to lack a little personality, both waiters were attentive to our needs and requests that were made. The amount of food was massive. You do get your money&#39;s worth in the amount of food and amount of variety you do get.

***UPDATE***<br>So I for some reason thought it would be great to eat here for my birthday.  Something nice but nothing super fancy.  I know that the waits are long and didn&#39;t think it would be that much worse since it was a Wednesday night....boy was I wrong.<br><br>We get there at 7pm, and I wait about 15-20 mins to check in and get our name on the list (the line was out the door - normal thing) once I get up to the counter, I put in a table for 10.<br>Hostess: &#34;parties for 10+ you&#39;ll have to speak with a manager, but I can put your name in while you wait for our manager, and give you a buzzer&#34;<br>ME: &#34;Sure thank you&#34; (move to the side)<br><br>I waited for another 20 minuets for the manager to come to inform me that they are able to take my party of 10, but the wait will be 90 minuets from the time I had checked in.  I agreed and walked outside.  We killed some time and walked around in F21, came back out and waited till out buzzer would buzz. 90 minutes passed by, my sister checks with the hostess to see how ling more it would be, and was told another 20 minutes, they were waiting for a party to leave so they could set up our table.  over 20 minuets pass and no buzz, so the other half went in to check on whats taking so long, they tell him that our table is just about ready and that we can wait on the side of the hostess stand to be seated. Another 10 minuet wait, and then we were finally seated.  <br><br>We weren&#39;t seated till about almost 9.  So once we sat down, we were just about ready to order.

I rarely go in Waikiki because of parking and the crowds, but usually when I&#39;m here I love to go to The Cheescake Factory. I came here on a Sunday night on a date.<br><br>Surprisingly the wait wasn&#39;t too bad since we arrived around 630PM. We waited for about 10 minutes (usually it&#39;s 30 mins or longer). It was a cold night and we were placed to sit outside, which I didn&#39;t mind, but really wanted to sit inside because of the ambiance. <br><br>The service changed since the last time I been here. The complimentary bread especially the brown bread is the best. But this time they didn&#39;t ask if we wanted more bread which was a bummer because I can get full off the free bread. I had the Chicken Madeira and my date had the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp. The food was amazing as always and for dessert of course we got a cheesecake. The Nutella one to be exact. Our waitress saved us from ordering a cheesecake that looked good in the picture but according to her &#34;it&#39;s not that great&#34;.<br><br>If you ever are in Waikiki and thinking where to eat for dinner, always have this place in mind.

Menu has a lot of choices, and most of them are tasty. The portion sizes are large and can be shared. Even the lunch specials, which are smaller size portion, are enough for a person. I even see some people pack the rest of their lunch portions . It is that large and worth the price.

Management has zero control over this restaurant. I have been to several of your restaurant locations and by far this is the worst one when it comes to simple patron flow control. Your flagship is way busier and flows much better. Door way is jammed up, can barely get in and out. Desk needs to be moved forward and out of building during busier evening. Hopefully, the food and service better than the management running the place.

We always love the Cheesecake factory even though we don&#39;t go often. It&#39;s always consistently delicious and generous with portions. Plus, cheesecake, am I right? This latest visit we went with a party of 5. Service was very good. I had a lava flow, Cajun jambalaya pasta and celebration cheesecake. Didn&#39;t love the celebration as much as the red velvet, but others really enjoyed it. I got a mango key lime to go too. Our server gladly packed up our leftovers and they were great for lunch the next day.<br><br>I wish they had proper 5 people seating though.  With 5, you basically get a booth with a chair pulled up. Also, I think mainland shops still give you two things of whipped cream with your cake. Only got one here. Yes, it matters.

Came on a Saturday night around 7, probably 100 people waiting outside! Despite that we only waited around 40 mins, there&#39;s a reason why it&#39;s called Factory. <br><br>Our 5 or 6th visit here over the years and it&#39;s consistently good.<br><br>We got the Steak Diane in a wine reduction, Bistro shrimp pasta and a French country salad with two kinds of beets, goat cheese, candies walnuts.<br><br>Enjoyed every dish, a good amount for a family of three not including the bread that comes before the meal.<br><br>In Waikiki it&#39;s hard to find consistent quality and decent prices, other places granted with nice views will charge you 10-20% for the same dishes.

As I said before I am not a chain restaurant person, but the Cheesecake Factory has a few entrees I look forward to once in a while.<br><br>We arrived early enough in order to get seated reasonably quick, this restaurant does form quite a line so you can expect to wait for a table during the dinner rush, unfortunately the Cheesecake Factory still does not take reservations.  <br><br>We were provided a booth with a view of the tree line within the mall, it is a quiet section of the restaurant and gives you the feel of sitting outdoors.  Our server was very friendly and even had a sense of humor, he took our drink menu right away.  <br><br>Every time I think of the cheesecake factory I think of chicken for some odd reason, could be because of the large chicken breasts they typically serve.   I ordered a Caesar salad to start, substituing ranch dressing of course.  I then ordered the Teriyaki Chicken which comes with steamed rice and being on the island I expected the rice to come out a bit sticky.<br><br>The Caesar salad come out quickly, it was made with all fresh ingredients and the perfect size for a starter salad.  The entrees took a little longer to arrive than expected, based on the number of people waiting to be seated I expected a delay, although I shouldn&#39;t have to.<br><br>The teriyaki chicken was cooked very well, I always favored teriyaki sauce on chicken over many others and with the rice it was a great combination.  <br>Of course you cannot leave here without a slice of cheesecake and they practically have an entire menu for that alone.  <br>With cheesecake I tend to go in two directions, simple and complicated, this time I went for complicated and ordered the &#34;Chocolate Tuxedo Cream&#34; cheesecake over the original.  As always that dessert almost put me into a coma, it was perfect with an espresso and required a walk up and down the beach afterwards.  <br><br>Very good dinner, very good service, the price point I think for the cheesecake factory is always a bit high.<br>Cheers!
This place never fails to impress me! The food, the service , and the environment all top notch! 100% one of my favorite places to go in any state.
Great place for mid-afternoon coffee and dessert. It gives me a sense of being at home while I am spending several months on the island.
It&#39;s The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Always the Best.<br><br>Always the same.<br><br>Not matter if your in Hawaii or NYC.<br><br>Delicious Everytime!

Don&#39;t go here if you value your health!!! Not safe!!! Today, two customers that were eating here had just gotten off a plane from LAX. They straight up told their server. They weren&#39;t quarantining. Management said there is nothing they could do. Management is just chill about allowing people to come in and perform illegal activities in their restaurant. Management is ok with helping people spread this virus to our community. Shame!

One of my favorite restaurants. I love Cheesecake Factory. This location is always crazy packed so I&#39;m lucky if i get to eat here without a long wait time. We came today when they first opened so it wasn&#39;t so bad. Our waitress Reyanne was very attentive and sweet. Our food was delicious but my pasta carbonara was a little salty for my liking but I still ate it. One star knocked off for the saltiness but other than that we had a pleasant time and Reyanne was a great waitress!
Excellent Asian fusion food,and the best cakes.  <br>Good service before the &#34;shelter-in-place&#34;. <br>A little pricey though.

This place is always busy, but if you have a small party of 2 or 3 the wait isn&#39;t too long. We went on a Sunday afternoon and walked around Forever 21 (right next door) for less than 10 minutes. They gave us a convenient little buzzer that notified us that our table was ready.<br><br>Everyone was very friendly including the hostess and our waiter. He frequently checked in on us to ensure that we were okay. We tried the spinach cheese dip appetizer, which was pretty good--it came with tortilla chips. My son ate all the complimentary bread lol. I ordered the honey truffle chicken. I never order chicken because I&#39;m not a big fan, but this chicken was amazing. It had a crunchy outside, that was a bit sweet and salty. It came with mashed potatoes and asparagus--I was stoked!<br><br>My sister ordered the fettuccine Alfredo, which she enjoyed. She said the sauce was nice and creamy and the noodles were cooked to perfection. My son enjoyed a bit of both. We ended our meal with cheesecake of course! I had the fresh strawberry cheesecake with vanilla ice cream. It was heaven! My sis had a chocolate cheesecake ala mode, which she loved as well. <br><br>The menu was very American with a mixture of dishes, if you are indecisive like me you may have a hard time choosing since their menu is so extensive. The prices are okay, my lunch was a $20 meal (not including pupus or dessert) so if you&#39;re on a budget be prepared to spend a bit more. The only gripe I had was with the bathroom. I had to take my son in to change is diaper and you can barely see because the lighting is so dim. Other than that, everything was pretty nice. Side note: if you&#39;re not into crowds this probably isn&#39;t the best place for you, this place is packed 24/7.

This is a review purely for their vegan options which include a total of 2 items in their entire menu. Small progress is good progress so I do appreciate the effort in providing an entirely vegan Cobb salad and the impossible burger. Although I try to support entirely vegan establishments, this is a great option for vegans in Waikiki looking to eat a very satisfying meal for an excellent price point. The Cobb salad was gorgeous, hard to say for a ordinary salad, but they made a rainbow display of beets, avocado, cucumber, grape tomatoes, quinoa over a giant bed of spring mix. Vinaigrette was served on the side and the salad is giant enough to easily feed 2 hungry vegans. The only other place I know serving the impossible burger is the counter, so I was delighted to see this on Cheesecake Factorys&#39; menu. Even though it&#39;s considered processed, i can&#39;t deny I enjoy the impossible burger and how closely it mimics r a real burger is insane. Plus no animals harmed so win for me. To top it all off, service was excellent. Our waiter was so attentive without being intrusive and very friendly and hospitable. I will for sure return to encourage them to continue to provide vegan options and hopefully increase the variety. Hopeful a vegan cheesecake will come next.

I&#39;ve been coming here with my dad for many years now when we come to Waikiki for vacation. We usually don&#39;t go to chains and seek out more local grinds, but in Waikiki, everything can become outrageously expensive and sometimes its nice to go somewhere familiar and reliable.<br><br>I am always amazed by how this location handles the massive volume of people who dine here every day. I don&#39;t think they get enough credit for the impressively extensive menu that they execute exceptionally well. This time, we ate on a Sunday night and was given a wait time of 50 minutes. Remarkably, the buzzer went off right on time! <br><br>I got the grilled fish tacos (MP/$15- a steal in Waikiki!) which were beyond my expectations. The fish was deliciously flaky and moist and it came as 4 mini tacos. My dad got one of the steaks and enjoyed his meal as well. <br><br>Our server, Christian, was very nice and made sure our iced teas were kept filled. Despite the restaurant being crazy busy, he had great timing and we never felt forgotten.<br><br>An improvement that could happen is an upgrade to a text messaging system to alert when your table is ready. That would solve the congestion problem in the front. But I&#39;d imagine that&#39;s a corporate decision..

Everyone in Waikiki wants to eat here, the wait is long, and it&#39;s hot Hawaii weather... so I always get take out from Cheesecake Factory. I order my food online, walk over about 30 minutes after placing my order, and walk straight to the front of the dessert line to pickup my order. It&#39;s way faster then waiting 2+ hours to get seated. I don&#39;t want to be hangry by the time I get in so takeout is just as good for me. The takeout workers area ALWAYS quick and always have my order ready. I always forget to take photos of my food but I dine in here quite often so I&#39;ll be sure to take a photo or two next time.

Delicious food at a decent price, great service but a 1hr plus wait, lively ambience and validated parking in the heart of Waikiki is what you can expect at The Cheescake Factory.<br><br>I don&#39;t know why they refuse to take reservations but that is the only thing keeping them from a five star review in my opinion. <br><br>Whenever my family has a special occasion The Cheescake Factory in Waikiki is one of our top go to places because the prices are reasonable for the quality and quantity of food you receive, plus it has to be a special occasion for me to agree on a 1hr plus wait time to eat anywhere!<br><br>Every time I&#39;ve come the service and food has been consistently good. Unfortunately the long wait has been consistent as well.<br><br>Looking forward to the wait time shortening since a new location recently opened in Kapolei. I heard the wait over there has reached 5hrs! I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be visiting them anytime soon. <br><br>Meanwhile I&#39;ll stick with The Cheescake Factory in Waikiki for my consistently delicious food, good service and 1hr plus wait, lol.

It is usually busy on the weekend, but surprisingly this past Saturday night, a few friends and I only had to wait for about an hour and 15 minutes! Pleasant surprise.<br><br>After we were sat, our waitress was very prompt with out drinks. She gave us bread as well and then took our order. I ordered pasta without meat, when all of our food came out, as my husband had his flash on for Snapchat to record the well presented food that just arrived at our table waiting for fresh stinky cheese to me grated on top of it. As the flash of light went over my food I noticed little pieces of meat in my pasta. I told the man who dropped the food off that was grading the cheese and he said, Where??,&#34; as if I was lying or was mistaken. I know to check my food now because there has been countless times when there is meat in my food when I had already requested from the wait staff for there not to be meat in my food. <br><br>Anyhow, he took the food back, our waitress walked by and probably noticed that I did not have my food and failed to ask why. Then when they brought me a new meatless pasta, she came to our table asking why it took so long... Hm... She said very offensively that she is &#34;VEGAN! And it is not her fault!&#34; I was not blaming her. I simply stated that it had meat in my pasta. <br><br>As a result they took my food off the bill, thank you, and the food was good. No big deal. I wasn&#39;t expecting my food to be taken off. I was a little sad we didn&#39;t get a second serving of bread, but we probably didn&#39;t need it anyways. <br><br>I&#39;d give this place 3ish stars closer to 4 so I just rounded up. Will probably be back, but won&#39;t order that pasta again.

I have seen the Cheesecake Factory here in California, but my first dining experience was in Waikiki.<br>The ambience was superb! We came when there was live music, which only added to the pleasurable experience. I recommend seating across from the Hawaiian Hotel courtyard for the beautiful banyan tree, tiki torches, and exotic looking flowers! <br>The service was incredible. My son often measures the service based on if his drink gets empty. It never did, as the servers visited our table regularly to see if we were satisfied or in need of anything.<br>Unfortunately, we chose to go to the local restaurant called ALOHA Table the next night for our major spending (wanting to support the locals more directly.)<br>Sadly, we were treated like unwelcome tourists, even though I was in Oahu to visit 2 generations of kupuna (grandfather, grandparents, and great uncle) at Kawaiahao Church cemetery.<br>$150 later, we returned to Cheesecake Factory. They can easily replicate a great experience! Kudos to them!

Did you know that if you shop &amp; dine (sit down restaurant only, sorry food court) at the Royal Hawaiian Center and then take receipts to the information center to show them to get a ticket so that parking is only $8 for 5 hours. This is a great deal for parades and events going on in Waikīkī. That being said.<br><br>FOOD: The Fresh Grilled Salmon was cooked to perfection, nicely grilled while still moist on the inside. The Factory Burger had a nice char to it on the outside while also being moist and juicy on the inside, the Sourdough French really went will with burger holding up to the juices from it.<br><br>SERVICE: Great service!! Even though the waiter originally thought lunch ended at 4:30pm when I pointed out the menu said 5:00pm he still was able to put it in with 5minutes to spare. Our beverages were always topped off (free refills on the soda). He also checked on us several times during our meal to make sure everything was great.

The Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. This location is very busy so we waited until almost 930/10 PM to eat and we only had to wait about 10 minutes. We were seated right by the live band so it was a little loud but nothing too bothersome. <br><br>Food was amazing as always...once you could decide what you wanted. I had the four cheese pasta. It took a little long to get out of the kitchen but worth the wait. The manager even came by to apologize. <br><br>We finished off the meal with taking our cheesecake Togo. It makes for an amazing breakfast the next day!
Decided to take home the rest of my food because I couldn&#39;t finish it. But when I went to eat my leftovers I found a curly hair in my food

We go here atleast twice a month. I been to many cheesecake factories in the states. By far this cheesecake factory in Waikiki has the best customer service and better quality food!!! I tried almost everything on the menu. And every dish I tried is good.  Only con is the wait time for dinner is way too long and this is every night.

First time eating within the restaurant and ordering food. <br>Let&#39;s start off,<br>We arrived unexpected to eat here, wait was only 20 minutes which was great.<br> We got seated maybe with in 25 minutes.<br>Our server I wish I remember his name, he was awesome. He was on his A game. He was a pasta lover so he helped me decide what I should go for in the pasta menu. <br>He was honest on how certain foods would taste.<br>He was always checking on us, seeing if we needed more water if our food was good etc. <br>Always we came just when the seasonal pumpkin pecan cheese cake cake out.<br>We had a great time with great food.
Nice service, great bread, good portions, and delicious cheesecake! I had the Thai Curry Chicken and Tiramisu Cheesecake.
Slow service and my food had obviously been sitting before it was delivered to my table. While I typically enjoy Cheesecake Factory, this experience fell short.

Because there were 100 people waiting out front, I thought the wait would be an hour. But, the quote was only 10 minutes and delivery to our table (4 ppl) was 15 minutes. <br>The service was mediocre with Long wait time to order, food delivery, and little follow up. But, the food quality was really good and the portion sizes impressive. Plenty left over for another meal. Good for families. Very loud atmosphere.

Oh Cheesecake Factory, how I love thee. <br><br>I don&#39;t care much for dining in here, especially cause the wait... so I always call in and order takeout. It&#39;s always the vegan cobb salad, and pasta choice varies between the chicken bellagio or the bistro shrimp - no breading on the shrimp. Food is always good and the cashiers are always super friendly.<br><br>The reason I took off a star was one of the last times I ordered takeout my order was put in wrong. Like I said, I always get the vegan cobb salad, but this time when I sat down to eat it was a regular Cobb salad. I tried to eat it because I didn&#39;t want to go back, but I did not like the blue cheese and the bacon and egg bits. <br>Yes, the cashier repeated the order back to me but I didn&#39;t realize she said &#39;cobb salad&#39; instead of &#39;vegan cobb salad&#39; because that had never been a problem before. I called and spoke to a manager about it and he handled everything very professionally and was very nice about the whole thing. <br>My problem was the girl that took my order. Her whole demeanor while I was down there was super unprofessional and quite childish. I tried to apologize to her for the misunderstanding but the only acknowledgement I got from her was this facial expression where she was trying to hide her look of contempt through a half smile. The cashier that was helping me with the exchange was obviously new and didn&#39;t know how to handle the transaction and tried to ask the girl for help. She straight up told him she would not help him and that he needs to learn for himself... ok... that&#39;s super unprofessional. <br><br>This experience stopped me from going to cheesecake factory for a while, but I still love it there. The service I used to get was so great that this last experience doesn&#39;t take much away from it. <br>I&#39;m posting this review now because I ordered takeout through Grubhub and remembered the days of what used to be (before this whole ordeal) haha

Cheesecake Factory is well known. The Jamaican black pepper shrimp was fenomenal! As well as the shepherds pie! However, the wait to get a table is quite long and without reservations it can seem like a long time. If you walk to the bar area and there are no parties going on, you can definitely sit and get alcoholic drinks and full<br>Menu service! Greatest discovery yet, definitely recommend this place because of location and menu.

I was pleasantly surprised as I expected our table to be in the main area and we didn&#39;t want to wait for a table on the front patio.  The hostess told us it would be a 20 minute wait and it was!   Pleasant surprise number 2 was going to the sunset bar and being next to the garden and fairly quiet.  Caleb served us the most amazing dinner.  Den had the rib eye and I had a very good seared Ahi Tuna.  We will be back again.

The Cheesecake Factory is a favorite stopping off place for a fun  atmosphere! Your right downtown Waikiki near everything. It is housed in the Royal Hawaiian shopping Center. The outdoor seating is a favorite with everyone. The food is the same yummy menu you would expect. The service is really fantastic. Once you go it will be on your to do list!

It&#39;s my first time eating at a Cheesecake Factory. I had the shrimp and chicken gumbo with brown rice. It was good and I&#39;d order it again. We tried the spinach dip and it was good but I had better. The fried mcncheese was not as great. I was expecting it to be cheesier inside but it&#39;s more like floury. So I can&#39;t have that again. Their strawberry cheesecake and the macadamia crusted cheesecake (not sure what it&#39;s called) was really delicious. We went in for dinner and It&#39;s so busy here and the wait is long. It gets crowded by the entrance area and noisy too. Service is fast and friendly.

We went to Cheesecake Factory today to celebrate my birthday. I&#39;m not sure if this place is made for locals since it&#39;s in the heart of Waikiki. Most of the patrons are tourists, so locals like myself don&#39;t blend in.  We arrived at noon with amazing very little wait. Our server, was little disappointing. His name was Joe. He just took our order, refilled our drinks once, checked on us once maybe and handed us our check. I&#39;ve seen other waitresses offering better service to the other tables. <br>Oh well, at least I got to eat my fave, the crispy won ton crab. We also ordered the everything pizza with salad and surprising the pizza was great! No room for cheesecake, but took one home. The original cheesecake, awesome! Will be back for more! <br>For the waiter, maybe a little more customer service skills. <br><br>Updated review:  service on Dec 16, 2017<br>I seem to find that the earlier you go to Cheesecake Factory, the better it is. There is no wait to be seated., but we did get seated all the way in the back and the tables are stacked so close together that it makes it feel<br>Pretty darn uncomfortable like you are joining the table next to you!  Once again, our server as the greatest, but do-able.  And I&#39;m not sure why, why in the world they took off my crispy crab won ton off the menu!!!! Oh gee! <br>I&#39;m not sure if cheesecake is still a 3-Star!

This 5 star review is for our waiter Bianca who made us feel like family and her service was prompt and very attentive considering we were there during a rush on a Friday night and boy was she busy. Her attitude was everything and she made us feel important and also recommended to me the Pasta Napoletan which by far the best meal I&#39;ve had at Cheesecake Factory, and she could tell because I wiped out my entire plate! (No take out for me!) My fiancé however had the chicken Marsala which is always her go to when at the factory of cheesecakes. The live two man band were playing local island music I grew up on and they nailed every song and had me serenading my lady til the end of our dinner date. Thank you for having them play and please continue to book them because we will definitely be returning with many more guests for you folks to entertain. Wooh!!<br><br>MESSAGE TO MANAGEMENT: Please recognize this young lady for her dedication and work ethic, my fiancé and I have a business of our own and know all to well how difficult it is to find people like her that represent our brand as their own. We just had an awesome night!

During my time in Hawaii this is easily the worse dining experience I have had.  McDonalds would have been a better choice.<br><br>The food took about 30 mins to show up. That&#39;s not a big deal if he food was hot and delicious but it was not<br><br>Ordered the mushroom burger with fries, cooked medium rare. Pretty good burger but then again I can go to Denny&#39;s and get a similar burger for $5 cheaper. The fries were ok.<br><br>My wife ordered the chicken bacon sandwich protein style. The chicken was very hard and chewy. It was disgusting. She re ordered a burger and we waited another 20mins for that and I had already finished my burger. <br><br>By this time our baby girl has already lost her patience and she is going ballistic.<br><br>As soon as the food showed up my wife took 3 bites and we asked for the check to leave.<br><br>Horrible experience I don&#39;t plan on going to another cheese cake factory in my life.<br><br>2 stars because the burger was pretty good

So, I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory before but I have to say that this one in Waikiki is by far the best. I want to give a shout out to our server tonight Kristie F. I&#39;d say she went above and beyond. She was very helpful with the menu, answered any questions with  thorough answers, very attentive to our needs even before she was asked. And to the gentleman that helped clear the table with her , they worked as a team , clearly making a statement for the company.  The food was very tasty and  reasonably priced with large portions. Kristie packed up our cheesecake to go with a smile. <br>Thank you Kristie F. you&#39;re great at what you do !!

Decent food and great service. It was very clean and comfortable. The wait staff were very pleasant and attentive. I think it was a little too dark, they need to crank up the lighting in some areas. Prices were reasonable.

Because this location is in Waikiki, expect large crowds during the day and a not so quiet atmosphere. The wife and I visited while on a lunch date on a Monday and it was packed. Our waiter was friendly and very attentive even though he had alot of tables. Our food was as expected and came out quickly. They will validate your parking so do not forget to ask. Will be returning as we saw some things on the menu we MUST try. The calamari was fresh, not chewy and seasoned perfectly. The Mrs ordered a Cuban sandwich and it was delicious and massive. I grew up eating Cuban sandwiches and this is the closest you&#39;ll get on Island. The Luau salad (lunch portion) was also very good adb way bigger than expected for a lunch portion.

As long as you are aware this is one of the busiest--if not the busiest-- Cheesecake Factories, you will enjoy this place. The first night we were here, which was on a Saturday, we had to wait an hour and a half for a table because we got there at 6pm. We went on New Year&#39;s Eve again but at 4:30pm and had only a half hour wait. So try to time it right to avoid a bad wait. Their menu is also a tad smaller because they are so busy (this is what they explained to us). I think because they are so busy we had a problem twice with not having something available, like a dressing or liquor.... We were in a party of 5 and one night we were placed at a large table and another night we were at a clear table of 4 with a chair stuck at the end. Waiters did bump into that person sitting on the end.... probably should rethink the table placements but I think they are just trying to fit as many people in as possible. Food always came out quickly and was great!

There are two Cheesecake Factories on the island, this is a visit to the Waikiki location.<br><br>We went on a week day thinking the crowd wouldn&#39;t be as bad.  This might be true... but if the line is longer on the weekend than what we waited in then I can&#39;t imagine...<br><br>Still, the host that took our name down was pleasant and assured us we would be seated within 45 minutes.  He also suggested we take the two seats at the bar while we waited.  Great idea!  It definitely helped with the wait!  Just remember that the bar is also taking orders from the restaurant floor so don&#39;t expect that attentive of service.  The house wine is decent and the crafted drinks are exceptional.  The pineapple mai tai is a must try.<br><br>We ordered the Grilled salmon and the cobb salad. Both were flavorful and a delight.  <br><br>The salmon was a standout for me as it was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  It is one of my favorite salmon dishes on the island so far.  <br><br>I would comment on the cheesecake menu but seriously, I&#39;ve tried at least half of the menu the many times I have come here and was never disappointed.  Go ahead and try everything!<br><br>If you don&#39;t mind the long wait and the gigantic crowds this Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki is a great choice.  The hosts, bartenders, and waiters are friendly and efficient.

Rough start! Waited for 2 hours to get in....they put a party of ten on a table that seats 6! Then no one comes to the table to greet us, give us menus or anything for over 15 minutes!!  Very disappointing!  I had to call someone over. Half of our party walked out....they were over it! Don&#39;t know what the big hype is with this place.....the foods isn&#39;t even that good! Definitely not worth the wait or time!!! Work on your customer service people!!!
Great food food portions the staff was freundly and on top of the service,  great overall experience

Food is good but I didn&#39;t find it &#39;great&#39;. Menu is huge and the service is very good, once you get in. Waiting out the front does cause you to dwell on the factory side of the name rather than &#39;cheesecake&#39; and the the frenzy around seating did leave me feeling more like a caged hen rather than a welcomed guest. Still, there is nothing like it in Australia so I would recommend it to fellow Aussies, for the experience at least.

It breaks my heart to have had such a disgusting and dishonorable experience at such a so-called well established restaurant.  <br><br>I&#39;ve been a loyal customer/ 30% + tipper for many years so of course as I celebrated my sons graduation tonight I took him and all my family that flew in from around the world to what I thought was a guarantee satisfaction restaurant. Not only did we wait an 1 hour and 45 mins patiently. My 8 months pregnant sister offered to tip the waiters 100$ to sit as soon as possible because there was no where to sit in the waiting area and she was experiencing leg cramps.  They later sat us on 2 separate tables that weren&#39;t even adjacent to each other which is later explained to me that the 2 tables were for one waiter and if they had used 2 of  the almost vacant table adjacent to one of ours was in the area of another waiters section and that they &#34;wouldn&#39;t know how to split the tips&#34; this remark leaves me appalled at the fact that their &#34;tips&#34; meant more to the waiters and apparently management than allowing a family to enjoy this once in a lifetime celebration...! <br><br>I later waited almost 20 mins for a manager on duty to see me, who starts off with &#34;well my manager Courtney says you tried to bribe her so you guys are lucky we sat you period&#34; !!!! I almost fell over at this remark because it was not intended as a bribe because frankly the food industry is a &#34;TIPPING INDUSTRY&#34; and attacking a pregnant woman&#39;s way of trying to &#34;accommodate to be accommodated&#34; way of things ... how are these 2 managers even allowed to hold this position? <br><br>And to top it all off, my son receives his steak plate happily was about to take a bite and he notices a curly pubic like hair in his food. Now his hair is straight and mines is blonde. He was so disbarred by this he walked out and went to McDonald&#39;s. <br><br>I can&#39;t begin to describe how much of a disaster was this place. The quality of food and SERVICE needs to be revamped and fast ... <br><br>As a local woman &amp; family, it&#39;s a shame to have been treated as if we are minority in our home land. I understand that this is a strong tourist environment but this is also Hawai&#39;i and where is the aloha, let alone customer service ?!

We came here on a Wednesday to celebrate a birthday. <br><br>Food: After drooling all day over their exhaustive menu, we decided to order the avocado egg rolls (always a winner!) and I ordered the chicken and biscuits. Touted as comfort food, with the &#34;best&#34; buttermilk biscuits on the side, this dish was what I was craving. The portions of chicken, vegetables and mashed potatoes were generous, and the pan gravy was savory but not over-salted. Hints of sage and white pepper flavored the gravy nicely. But the buttermilk biscuits...?<br><br>Maybe I haven&#39;t visited a lot of places in the South to know how true buttermilk biscuits should look and taste. However, I&#39;ve made and had enough biscuits (just look at me) to know what I like in a good one: a crispy exterior, some layered flakiness, and some &#34;elevation&#34;or height to show the baking powder and soda are doing their thing. Unfortunately, these were not the &#34;best.&#34; While the exterior of these was crisp, their lack of height and rather doughy insides told me that they had wilted like a bouffant hairdo in today&#39;s high heat and humidity. <br><br>Dessert was a shock for me. Never before had I considered ordering the low carb cheesecake, but since I was full from the appetizer and entree I decided to try it. Mind you, it weighs in at around half the calories of the other cheesecakes so I was feeling quite sanctimonious... It was nice and light, almost mousse-like, with a thin walnut graham crust sweetened with Splenda. Nice!<br><br>Service: Our server Brandi was awesome. She embodied friendly attentiveness. She was even sensitive to our birthday girl and asked if she wanted them to sing or not. B.G. opted for no song, but Brandi lit the candle on the cheesecake and said she&#39;d wait to make sure B.G. made a wish. Thanks Brandi!

It is the cheesecake factory.  Same as anywhere. Nothing original or different for Hawaii that we were aware of.  We had a gift card so off we went.  Huge portions as always, and so we took our leftovers and our cheesecake piece to go as always.  Location is lively and conveniently on the shopping district.  You could plan to walk around a little before eating or after.  They could&#39;ve gotten an extra half star for that.

Pleasantly surprised to have a good value experience at a busy chain restaurant smack in the middle of Waikiki. We waited 15 minutes for a table at peak lunch hour on a Thursday. The service was extremely friendly, if not lightening-quick, but we didn&#39;t expect it to be a fast experience given the size of the queues. <br><br>The menu here is extensive and the portions quite generous. We all enjoyed our food, nothing was particularly stand out but the variety on the kids menu was refreshing; my 3 year old loved the salmon, mashed potatoes and carrots and I was happy for him to have a more nutritious variation on the standard chicken nugget / pizza fare. <br><br>My iced tea was delicious and refreshing on a hot summer day. An unexpectedly welcome respite for our hot, tired feet in busy Waikiki beach.

The Cheesecake Factory has a menu that could be a novel. There are so many choices that everyone should be happy, to include vegans. Still waiting on a vegan cheesecake though...Their service is usually pretty good, although there is almost a guaranteed line, even with the large seating area. Their brown bread is also amazing!

Omg! Why is the wait here so ridiculous all the time! It&#39;s always an hour or more wait for a table even on a weekday! Your stomach will eat itself before you even get your meal. I guess if you eat at some abnormal time then you&#39;d be lucky with no wait. <br><br>I tend to do take out more often now. They have a garage with validated parking, but the garage is so far! It&#39;s like a hike to get there and back! If you have a buddy it&#39;ll be better cause you can park on the side. I usually call it in as I&#39;m doing my hike. Sometimes there&#39;s a wait at the cashier to pay anyway for a take out order. <br><br>Want anything extra? Like brown bread? Just ask! They&#39;ll gladly pack it up for you!! Today I was on hold for a bit but the cashier was friendly once I was able to place an order in, despite how busy they are! <br><br>You can also order a jar of dressing to go! But beware!! They&#39;re made fresh on the daily so they go bad within two days.. I mean really bad! And sour! So make sure you&#39;re willing to eat a lot of salad! Or have some kind of party! Their Caesar dressing is so good! But I can never eat that much salad in two days!
It was very satisfying, the food was great and server very attentive. I very much recommend this place.

The cheesecake in Honolulu deserves 5 stars. There really isn&#39;t a lot of good food on the island and Cheesecake Factory makes it easy to try new delicious meals for any occasion. Must eat during your vacation!!
A great place to go if everyone is craving something <br>Different due to their large menu which even includes breakfast items.  There&#39;s always leftovers too.

I don&#39;t know if I would&#39;ve eaten here yet everything else was closing.I had the gumbo and it was decent and the bread was real good. Unfortunately the meal took a long time and i filled up on bread. The wait stuff was nice but it did feel like I was eating institutional food like something you would get at a college dorm<br>Cafeteria

This is always our first spot to hit for dinner when we first arrive to Hawaii. The line is insane but worth it. I know it&#39;s a cookie cutter type of restaurant across North America, but I find the one in Waikiki is the most consistent and delicious. I never get disappointed and the food is always spot on.

Hadn&#39;t been back to Cheesecake Factory after an unpleasant experience awhile back but decided to give it another try.  This experience was much better.  <br><br>I don&#39;t really understand why the lighting is so dim in the restaurant and even in the bathrooms.  <br><br>The sweet corn tamales were delicious and so were the Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane.

Had great service from our server. She was attentive and always making sure the drinks are filled. We had the Chicken Katsu and the Pasta Carbonara. The Chicken Katsu was a good dish but had a little too much spice in spots for the member of our party who got it. Most of the dish though was well balanced with heat and flavor though. The Pasta Carbonara was excellent. Good mix of bacon, peas, and chicken. We had a good time here and was nice to get a familiar meal in paradise.

I&#39;m going to be very frank and tell you right away that 3 stars were taken away for inappropriate behavior. My server began speaking to me in a slow manner (immediately) and I know it was only due to my appearance (I&#39;m Asian). I make this assumption, because I witnessed my server doing this to every Asian man and woman who walked in. What&#39;s even worse is that I ordered pasta as my entree and was asked if I needed chopsticks- what? <br><br>Anyways, let me start from the beginning. My bf and I came to Cheesecake Factory because the ones in California (specifically San Mateo) have been disappointing and we wanted this to be a redemption moment of some sort. We were seated immediately as it was past the lunch rush.<br><br>Then comes our server being kind and racist at the same time. She slowly asked me if I wanted bread and water. At first I thought it was just her way of speaking, but it definitely wasn&#39;t. I ordered the pasta and my bf ordered the hawaiian pizza with a caesar salad. Again, at this point our server asked if I needed chopsticks. I&#39;m eating pasta... so no. <br><br>Strangely enough, after our meal, while she waves goodbye to my boyfriend, she BOWS to me. What is that? I understand that there are a lot of Asian tourists (and even locals) running around Oahu, but that is just too much. While the food was great, the service was just inappropriate on all levels. <br><br>To the managers of this location- please teach your employees to behave appropriately to customers. I don&#39;t care how nice they may be, my server flat out made me feel super uncomfortable. It&#39;s 2017- please stop thinking in reverse.

Excellent service and delicious food! That says it all! But...to say a bit more, the servers were very accommodating and surprised my granddaughter with a birthday dessert and a pleasant song. All in all a very nice experience. But...after all, the Cheesecake Factory is one of my all-time favorites, no matter what city or state!

My wife and I met up with some friends who wanted to go out.  They showed up early and got on the wait list so our time was minimal.  It was crazy-busy compounded by some sort of block party going on which we walked upon finishing dinner.  Our server was good, timely, kept things flowing, although we were with our friends so time passed quickly.  I ordered a pizza hoping I&#39;d have enough room left to eat cheesecake but was stuffed so took the cheesecake home to partake throughout the week.  We sat outside on the edge of the building which I&#39;d caution anyone who sits there given the pigeons.  We were good the whole meal but the Gods from above rained down and narrowly missed a massive head shot that would have ruined a nice evening.  I don&#39;t know why this restaurant hasn&#39;t placed spike strips along the building&#39;s edge to prevent birds as this was ridiculous and couldn&#39;t have been the first time.

Overrated if you ask me! They don&#39;t take reservations, it&#39;s first come first serve, our wait time was an hour. We finally get in there and it&#39;s ridiculously hot in the dining area, idk why the doors were open instead of closed so the A/C could work properly smh. The waiting area was more comfortable than the dining area. Our waitress was a passive aggressive b***h who did not validate our parking passes (we found out the hard way when the parking garage tried to charge us $16 each for parking, there was 2 vehicles so that&#39;s $32) and she placed the wrong to-go plates in the wrong bags so when our party split up to go home, no one had the correct plates. I went home to Ewa Beach and my steak Diane went to Kaneohe smh I regret giving her the $30 tip I gave, the downfalls of being too nice.

This place is always busy so make sure you plan ahead. This place is very big therefore it&#39;s always loud because of the amount of people. Can&#39;t really have a quite conversation because you feel like your always screaming. <br><br>Service was a little slow. Food was average. I always get the bistro shrimp pasta. The shrimp has too much batter, pasta is drowning in sauce which I wasn&#39;t a fan off but the flavor was there. My boyfriend ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta which according to him was good but nothing special. <br><br>But cheesecake is always BOMB!!

A chain restaurant in a tourist destination. As always good is bland and mediocre. Line is always long with an extreme wait time. Not very organized. Over priced for sure. There is no reason a bland chain restaurants should be charging 30 dollars or more for a dinner plate. Prices marked up severely due to location. My advice is find a nice family owned location along the strip. You will get a delicious meal you want for half the price.
Consistent. Good portion. Good service. Good price. Food comes out expeditiously and did I mention they are consistent?
Worst poke ever! Not good at all. I thought it may be good due to lots of customers. Service was sub-standard.

We went on a busy Sunday night. It seems like every night is busy, though. Our estimated wait time was 30 minutes but it was probably closer to 20. Our server was Eric, who was super capable and very polite. He let us know up front that the bar was pretty busy and the kitchen was slammed, so we were able to plan our dinner accordingly. <br><br>My husband and I split the fried Mac and cheese (amazing), the warm spinach and crab dip (would be amazing if it had Old Bay). We ordered the pasta carbonara and filet mignon. The carbonara was great, despite the fact that there isn&#39;t an egg yolk in sight of that dish. Carbonara may be a bit of a misnomer. We didn&#39;t even touch our filet, we were so stuffed, but it looked beautiful. I&#39;m sure it&#39;ll be delicious for tomorrow&#39;s lunch. The mashed potatoes were delicious.<br><br>Our cocktails were great. I don&#39;t normally like really fruity things, but the pineapple ginger martini was perfect. It definitely had a kick and was not a wussy drink. My husbands maitai was also great.<br><br>Our appetizers and mains came out at the same time, but Eric gave us a heads up that it may happen due to the kitchen being slammed, so we were fine with it. He was super helpful and on it despite being in a very busy section. We only visited because my parents gave us a gift card, but I might actually come back of my own accord.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chain restaurants. Delicious food, generous portions, and cheesecake for days--what&#39;s not to love, right? As if that weren&#39;t enough, it gets better! They usually do a deal around Thanksgiving/Christmas time where for every $25 in electronic gift cards you purchase from their website, you receive two complimentary slices of cheesecake--to gift or to keep! Seeing how a slice of cheesecake costs between $7.50 and $8.95, this is a super sweet deal!<br><br>I came here for lunch twice within the past month so I could redeem my complimentary slices (they expire by March 31). I ordered the regular portion of Pasta Da Vinci both times because it&#39;s just that good! It&#39;s simple--sautéed chicken, mushrooms, and onions in a delicious Madeira wine sauce tossed with penne pasta and Parmesan--but so undeniably unforgettable. I will totally order this again and again even though there are SO many tempting menu items!<br><br>I don&#39;t think you can go wrong with any of their cheesecakes. I recently tried their fresh strawberry, mango key lime, and lemoncello cream torte, and all of them were divine. If you find yourself having a hard time deciding, your waiter/waitress probably has excellent recommendations. If you want a refreshing drink--the cucumber lemonade is fantastic!

Consistently good service and good quality food. They validate parking if you park in the Royal Hawaiian Center about a block away. They always look really busy but don&#39;t let that deter you. I&#39;ve been going here for years and have never waited more than 15 minutes to get seated (even on holidays).

Food was delicious, I recommend trying the Hawaii specials while in town. Such as the sesame crusted Hawaiian fish, it is what ever the fish is of the day. I had two choices of fish: ono or ahi, I chose ahi. Heads up though it was $35 just for my plate due to the fish &#34;market price&#34;. The wait was about 40 minutes for two and it was a Friday night so not bad. Be aware that this location is always swarming with people our server said they do about 30 million in revenue a year. <br><br>Tip #1: if you want a romantic evening for just you and your honey this is not likely the place it is very crowded with people, dark and hard to hear at times. <br><br>Tip #2: sit inside Nd not on the outside pain where all the public is walking Waikiki beach if you don&#39;t want swarms of people passing by or just want privacy

How can you go wrong with a steady chain? After all, one of the benefits of chain eating is consistent quality and a known menu of options. This Cheesecake Factory is like the others, as beautiful as can be. The staff was exceptionally nice (the only reason I gave them two stars was for the attentive waitstaff) but the quality of the food was subpar at best. I ordered the burger that comes with bbq sauce and onion straws, I don&#39;t remember the name of it. I ordered it medium well done. As you can see in the pictures I&#39;ve posted, it was super rare in the middle! I didn&#39;t send it back (I never send food back) and choked it down but regretted it about 30 minutes later (if you know what I mean). My daughter ordered the bistro shrimp pasta. It&#39;s normally really delicious: lightly breaded shrimp in a delightful buttery, garlic sauce with chopped tomatoes, arugula, and mushrooms. Her dish was tasty but the batter on those shrimp was so thick and clumpy it had to be peeled off to get to the shrimp. It was really quite gross. Dear Cheesecake Factory, I love you but you could do much better than this.

This cheesecake factory is always busy so make sure you plan an hour in advance. There is no reservations. The service could be better.  There is always live music which is nice.  The lighting is dim which makes for a relax feel. It&#39;s loud inside however because of the music and amount of people. <br><br>I ordered the Diane steak which is my favorite. The sauce is brown and sweet. The steak is sliced already. It comes with mash potatoes and asparagus.  I got the avocado egg roll for apps. The egg roll is crispy and taste good dipped in their homemade sauce.<br><br>I always get the Oreo cheesecake for dessert to finish off the night.  Tell them it&#39;s your bday for a free icecream lol.

In the heart of waiks. Packed always with tourists. Good spot to order take out. If you live in the area it&#39;s an easy walkable location and they take orders on the phone. And well we all know the cheesecake rocks. It&#39;s nice to have a few things from the mainland on the island. So super stoked it&#39;s here

The cheesecake tho.... to die for. I had a piece of the salted caramel cheesecake and was dreaming about it to much i had to go back a week later for more cheesecake. I wish they participated in bite squad or uber eats because going to waikiki is out of control. But it was totally worth it. Warning, portions are huge and u might spend like $70 lol SO WORTH IT! my wife ordered chicken &amp; biscuit which she LOVED and i got the bacon bacon burger which was lifechanging. I dont know how the servers survive that crowded mess but i really hope they get paid well &amp; tipped well at all times.
I love this place. They have great black non-flavored iced tea with lemon. And I just tried their turkey burger with sweet potato fries.  Best price I&#39;ve ever had. Good burger too. Services tops.

Went here this afternoon for my birthday and I only had to wait about 20 minutes! We got a nice spot outside but the waiter didn&#39;t really seem to care about us. It definetally seemed that he was trying to get my family out of there as quickly as possible.  We look at the LARGE menu for about 3 minutes and the waiter kept coming back.
