I&#39;m not sure if it was our small bill or what but very disappointed:/ don&#39;t get me wrong he was nice but not very personable and didn&#39;t seem to care. The food was VERY good but my boyfriend felt very sick to his stomach right afterwards.

The Cheesecake Factory located on Kalakaua Avenue in Waikiki near one entrance of the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center.<br><br>Of all the years that the restaurant has been around I have only dined there three times.  First time was lunch with my cousin from South Carolina and her friend from California along with their young daughters.  Second time was dinner after the Breakout Waikiki outing with friends.  My last visit was to have early Christmas dinner with friends.<br><br>On my most recent visit I was with seven other individuals and we sat in the back end of the restaurant closer to the Royal Hawaiian.  Complimentary bread and water was delivered to the tables.  Menus were already placed on the tables.<br><br>I had to study the menu since I was undecided of what to order.  Should I order pasta, burger, sandwich, steak, or seafood dishes.  I opted to order the Shrimp Scampi with Steak Diane.  The dish comes with mashed potatoes.  I didn&#39;t know that I ordered the same dish as one of my dinner companions.<br><br>My dinner was delicious.  My dinner companions noticed since I cleaned the entire plate minus the gravy.  Did I have room for dessert...nope.  I was stuffed from my meal and the complimentary bread.  Plus I drank two full cups of water.<br><br>I should have stood in line near the front of the restaurant to order a slice of cheesecake to go.  Too many flavors to choose from...one day I&#39;ll go back for the cheesecake dessert.<br><br>194/200<br>Review #400

Love their grilled chicken avocado sandwich! The cheesecakes are a must of course and I also love the side of bread it comes with! <br><br>The only downside is even though we order to go every time to avoid the long wait but we still end up waiting an extra 10-15 min from the time we are told. Other than that, service is good and the sandwich is the best!
Always eat here when on Oahu. Denise D is a great waitress. Very friendly! Food was great &amp; drinks on point. We will be back!

I have been coming to the Cheesecake Factory and tonight&#39;s experience was one of the best I ever had at Cheesecake Factory. First of all, I ordered onlime which was the first time I ever ordered like that to avoid the wait time. It said that my order would be ready in 20 min. Timing was great and the woman at the counter told me to go to the register on the right. <br><br>Cheyenne was at the register and she is the best! She was so friendly and patient with my mother who wanted to use up all her gift cards (usually we would have someone at the register who would roll their eyes at us or hesistate to ring up the order using gift cards) but Cheyenne took all the gift cards without hesitation and swipped them or entered the numbers on the computer. She was so nice about it and she checked our order before giving it to us. The customer service that she gave us was excellent and she should be acknowledged. It made my first experience ordering online pleasant and for that I am really thankful, because I intend to order online again because of the excellent service. Online ordering is so convenient!<br><br>Next, the food. The firecracker salmon rolls, the bistro shrimp pasta, hibachi steak and avocado n chicken salad was just amazing. To top it off, the carrot cake at cheesecake factory is excellent. Everything we ordered was flavorful and filling. Yes prices are moderate but the quality of food is always up to par and never disappoints.  <br><br>Just a heads up, usually during Thanksgiving time, if you order $25 worth of gift cards, you get two free cheesecake which is a great deal!

30 minute wait to get a seat. 18 minutes just to get water. Who knows how long to get our drinks and food. Place is super busy but service is still too slow. Not worth the time.<br>Drink was a whiskey smash, tasted like sunny delight. Pretty much no whiskey taste <br>4 cheese pasta was bland as khaki pants. Half the pasta was room temp the rest was about the correct temperature. How&#39;s that happen?<br>Pretty disappointing.
This review is for great customer service: Lisette (from Bakery) she was super friendly when we  went to pick up our order ! <br><br>Great food, great service !

Cheesecake factory to me is a classic. Their food quality is as great here as it is in every other franchise of theirs I&#39;ve visited in different states. The lunch menu has a lot of items from the dinner menu, however they are a bit cheaper and smaller portions. Which may not be a bad thing because their dinner portions are HUGE! My mom and I shared the Louisiana Chicken pasta and had avocado egg rolls for starter. And of course we indulged in the complimentary and well-loved fresh Brown and Sourdough bread. <br><br>The food was all fresh and hot. The pasta comes al dente (a bit chewy) unless you tell them otherwise. I prefer mine fully cooked but forgot to mention this time. The pasta dish was also nice and spicy with the chicken well seasoned and cooked. The servers also ask if you would like fresh Parmesan cheese on your food (love it)! The avocado egg rolls were so good! Fried but not greasy at all, and nice and hot. The dipping sauce for them is very unique - kind of sweet/herbal but a great compliment to the taste of the rolls. We didn&#39;t leave room for dessert that day, but I know from several previous visits that their desserts are magnificent!<br><br>They don&#39;t have their own parking garage nor valet, but they do validate for the Royal Hawaiian parking garage. The restaurant also gets RIDICULOUSLY busy right around 5pm with wait times sometimes upwards of an hour and a half, so come early if you can. Bar seating is open, so that&#39;s a good bet if it&#39;s only a couple people and someone is standing vigil.

Location: the best location in Waikiki Main Street!!!<br>Service: friendly service!!<br>Price: good range $$ for two <br>Foods: great presentation!! Tasty as always<br>Cleanliness: Yes!!<br>So 5 Star it is!!!<br>Busy establishment so come early !!
One of my coworkers husband works there. And we celebrated my birthday dinner! It was so good ! All around great service and great food! Willing to come back here another day!

I love cheesecake. Needless to say, I was ecstatic when the Cheesecake Factory came to Waikiki. I&#39;ve eaten here a couple of times and the wait is always horrendous. It&#39;s always been at least an hour. This latest time, I was quoted half an hour and was seated within the half hour. Yay!<br><br>I prefer coming for lunch. Their dinner portions are huge. I like to come for their lunch specials. It&#39;s pretty much what they serve for dinner, but at smaller portions and cheaper prices. I love their Chinese Chicken Salad. I always, always get the Miso Salmon on mashed potatoes. It&#39;s the best Miso Salmon I&#39;ve ever had in my life. The miso is slightly sweetened and contains mirin. Even though it&#39;s the lunch portion, I still can&#39;t finish it. I take the leftovers for my dinner. <br><br>My favorite cheesecake is White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut. This time I decided to try the Fresh Strawberry. Both are good, but go with the White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut. It sounds sweet, but it really isn&#39;t. It&#39;s more rich than anything else.

It&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory! And I wanna say I probably haven&#39;t been back here for over 10 years or so........<br>I remembered a time when The Cheesecake Factory had first opened in Waikiki back in 2003, and I went with my ohana to dine here several times. <br><br>All I remembered about The Cheesecake Factory was that they served pretty simple food, they gave huge portions, &amp; the cheesecake was legit!<br><br>It&#39;s now 2016, so I decided to come back here for lunch with a friend, as I figured if I go here during the weekday, it wouldn&#39;t be too crowded.<br><br>Sure enough this place is still popular as when we arrived just before the opening time of 11:00 AM, there was a long line of customers waiting by the entrance door. <br><br>Lucky for us, since the restaurant is huge, we did not have to wait at all, and was seated right away. Shortly after, our server stopped by to drop off menus, &amp; take our drink order. <br><br>After checking out the menu, I decided to get the - Super Antioxidant Salad which was a delicious blend of salad greens, spinach, kale, avocado, broccoli, grapes, roasted pear, blueberries, onion, sunflower seeds &amp; almonds, with a lemon-blueberry vinaigrette dressing. I also added some grilled chicken to my salad to boost my protein intake. <br>With my salad, I ordered an ice tea to wash all of this down.<br><br>My friend ended up ordering the - The Classic Burger, which was a gigantic chop house hamburger. Served with a slice of grilled onion, lettuce, tomato and you can either get french fries, or green salad. Which my friend ended up with the green salad.<br><br>Of course when you go to The Cheesecake Factory, you have to order some of their delicious cheesecakes! They have such a large selection of cheesecakes, I have to admit, it&#39;s pretty hard to decide on which cheesecake to order. <br>At the end, I ordered the Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake - which was a Banana Cream Cheesecake topped with bavarian cream, and it came with fresh sliced banana. <br><br>My friend got the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake - which was layers of creamy vanilla bean cheesecake, vanilla mousse &amp; it was topped with whipped cream.<br><br>What can I say about the grub?<br><br>I really loved my Super Antioxidant Salad! It was the perfect meal which didn&#39;t leave me bloated, or too full..........having that salad saved me some space in my tummy for dessert! (See, you gotta plan your eating!). <br>The salad was not only pleasant to look at, but also the mixture of greens with the dressing was the perfect match! The grilled chicken was kinda bland, but I just ordered it to boost my protein intake, so I was okay with it!<br><br>My friend enjoy the burger.........and the side salad was good too!<br><br>As for the cheesecake desserts.............there is nothing bad tasting on their cheesecake menu. Whatever you order here, you cannot go wrong! <br><br>Overall, the prices for the food here at The Cheesecake Factory is kinda pricey for lunch, as I paid $58.00 for lunch (with tip), but the service here was great! Our server was very attentive, refilled our drinks, &amp; checked on us often. A great dining experience!
As expected, excellent food and libations. Service by Tyler T, flawless! The Cinnabon Cheesecake was Dee-Licious! In fact, Sinful!

Everything is what you would expect. Good food, service, staff is friendly. However, you will run into much longer wait times than the stated &#34;10 minutes&#34; that they tell you it&#39;s going to take to be seated. Over all, on par with everyother Cheesecake Factory we&#39;ve been to.

Went to The Cheesecake Factory with friends on Christmas afternoon.  It was crowded and the wait was about an hour as we had expected.<br>I decided on the Green Chicaquilles with pork.  They were good and the sauce flavorful.<br><br>The plate was huge and was more than i could finish after having bread and butter while we waited for our orders.<br>Everyone enjoyed their meal, however, there is some strange system of how they service a table by using multiple waiters.  We did have a large table, but we were never sure who was going to do what at the table.<br><br>There were several order mistakes and some new person would show up and find that there was a problem, just to be followed by another person bring out the same mistaken dish again.<br><br>Once our meal was finished, one got their checks right away, others had to wait 30 plus minutes before they could get someone to bring their check.<br><br>I&#39;m sure there is a method to the madness but we couldn&#39;t figure it out and neither could the waitstaff.

Unfortunately The Cheesecake Factory puts canola oil in all of their food including the soup, salad dressings and Cheesecake.<br><br>Canola oil is a GMO and in my opinion it is also a carcinogen.<br>Canola oil destroyed all the good bacteria in my gut and made me very sick. It makes me feel sick every time I eat something that contains it.<br>I feel nausea, bloated, sick!<br><br>Why they are putting it in every single dish is outrageous. I guess if I ever go there again, I will eat the dry the Vegan Cobb and bring my own salad dressing!<br><br>Read this article and get educated please!  In the long term, people are waking up and becoming more educated about their health so no matter what healthy options you appear to have on your menu, the fact that you put  canola poison in all your foods, takes away from anything healthy on your menu.<br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmedicalveritas.org%2Fwhy-canola-oil-is-not-the-healthy-oil-youve-been-led-to-believe%2F&amp;s=a721e22c8233d00bf25e166d763066c44de6f195b9e71b71b58cb9c0c571af3d" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">medicalveritas.org/why-c…</a><br><br><a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmedicalxpress.com%2Fnews%2F2017-12-canola-oil-linked-worsened-memory.html&amp;s=be08c6259f4c35d46641ee2c1c73606aef5aa10205bf8912adce4c3db5d60238" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">medicalxpress.com/news/2…</a>

I have had multiple negative experiences with this location. The only reason i haven&#39;t given it one star is because the manager tried to make it right for us but that only can go so far. I worked for a restaurant for two years. And this one always flounders when even remotely busy. Which normally isnt a big deal but this is Waikiki. They are busy often. It&#39;s the kitchen staff. Last time I went they put sauce on my online explicitly no sauce order after waiting 20 minutes in line then had to wait another 20-30 so they could remake it. <br><br>This time however, I ordered three items. The most complex specialization was no sauce. We were quoted 30 minutes for our food to be ready. Once we got there at the specified time we waited another hour and 15 minutes for our food to be &#34;ready&#34; while at least 10 other people got their takeout orders. Okay. Well manager steps in to make sure the food is done and smooth things over. So we get our food finally and theres butter but no bread in our bag. Nothing we had needs butter. I understand if they were out of bread but it would&#39;ve been nice if they could have let us know they were out of bread. And the food is all lukewarm. If it took so long to &#34;make&#34; why isnt at least one item hot? All in all very dissatisfied. Definitely prefer the kapolei location, even when they&#39;re busy they have my order ready when they say they will.

We went at around 5:00, hoping it would be early enough since there&#39;s always a long wait when we pass by. We haven&#39;t been here in years. There was a line and some people waiting outside with beepers. They got through the line quickly and were able to seat us immediately. We only had 2 people and they have many tables for parties of 2.<br><br>The waitress was friendly, attentive, and efficient. The staff also cleared tables that left next to us within literally 30 seconds of the people leaving. They also brought new parties to those tables quickly. Super efficient.<br><br>The food sizes and quality were pretty good, and the prices are similar to those in Waikiki. I think they do validate parking, but we just park at the zoo parking lot and walk around. We got the spinach artichoke dip, a burger, the chicken tacos, and two lemonades. We over ordered, because my boyfriend thought the portions would be smaller, even though I told him that they were decent sized portions. We missed out on the cheesecake this time but will return for it!

What can I say about a national chain.  It was packed with a 20 minute wait on Tuesday night.  Their estimate of wait was accurate.  It was close, easy, no guesswork and food was fine and more fairly priced than I would gave thought.  Mammoth venue, noisy, touristy, I could have been in Providence but we were tired, unadventurous and it was just what we needed.    Even had live music somewhere but we never saw him the place was so big.

Food here is great, and customer service is great. Only thing that sucks is waiting behind tourists that traveled thousands of miles to eat food they have at home, rather than hawaiian/local establishments

Our large group of ten came in for dinner at 4:30p and got seated promptly on a Thursday.  It was crowded since Waikiki is always bustling with visitors who want to experience The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>This was my first time to The Cheesecake Factory and I was amazed at the abundance of dinner rolls such as Pumpernickel and Sour Dough that was served copiously with cold butter that made the rolls so savory.<br><br>Next, Blayne our excellent waiter took our orders.  He was so friendly and had excellent customer service.  He constantly checked up on us.  He explained the menu.  He was always filling up our waters.  Actually, he was the best server that I&#39;ve encountered in a while, considering, our large group and our orders as well as our group asking for separate checks.<br><br>As for my entree, I liked it.  The ahi taco was cute.  The flavor was interesting for a taco.  It was more on the sweet side.  I would have preferred it to have been more flavorful and spicier.<br><br>Overall, we had a wonderful dinner experience.  The service that Blayne gave us was outstanding.  Many of us left with desserts.  We had a fabulous time in Waikiki!

I would have given this place a 5 star rating if only the hostess was not rude. It was my birthday and I was with my husband and mother-in-law. The lady assigned us to a table next to the open back door which is not a good place to be because the heat was uncomfortable. So since it wasn&#39;t busy around that time (4pm with so many seats available), we kindly asked our hostess if she can transfer us to a cooler area. I will never forget her face when she rolled her eyes on us after rudely saying &#34;I&#39;ll be right back&#34; and just stormed off. My mother-in-law saw it too that&#39;s why my husband decided to inform the manager about her attitude. So we were transferred to a better table and this is where the fun begins.<br><br>The guy who served us was really accommodating and you can tell that he loves his job.<br><br>We had a blast with the food portions and how delicious they were. We tried 3 different chocolate cakes afterwards. <br><br>Awesome food, kind servers, terrible hostess. So 4 out of 5. <br><br>Hopefully we&#39;ll have a better experience when we go back.
We had a good time and the food was amazing the service was great and the price on the food wasn&#39;t bad at all! Get the cheesecake!

We rarely get over to Waikiki from Kaneohe, but my mom was visiting and wanted to treat us for our anniversary. We chose Cheesecake Factory and tried to get there early so we could avoid a tremendous wait - which I HIGHLY recommend as they do not take reservations and get quite busy as the night progresses. We got there at 5pm on a thursday and were sat right away. Our waiter Sean was incredible right from the get-go, very personable without seeming fake, knowledgable about the menu, gave us some great recommendations, and assured us we could personalize our dishes however we wanted.  We started by ordering drinks - a Maui pineapple beer that was incredibly tasty (I recommend it if you like beer but not &#34;beer&#34;, yknow?), a pineapple mojito (super tasty), and my son got overwhelmed by choices and asked if they just had orange juice which they did - fresh squeezed!  We also ordered the Avocado spring rolls as an appetizer. They. Were. AMAZING. Omg, avocado, sun dried tomatoes, cashew tamarind sauce.... even my semi-picky son tried it and loved it!  The bread basket too - if you&#39;ve never tried their brown bread, even my carb-avoiding mom insisted that those carbs were worth it!  <br><br>For entrees my son was thrilled that he could special order kids bowtie pasta with 1/2 and 1/2 marinara and alfredo mixed together. He loved it so much he was literally happy dancing at the table!  My mom ordered the Vegan Cobb salad with dressing on the side and was totally able to bring half of it home. My husband and I split the Chicken/Steak combo plate with mashed potatoes, intentionally making sure to leave room for dessert. <br><br>Dessert. Well, you can&#39;t go to a place called Cheesecake Factory and not get cheesecake, right?  We tried the original with strawberries on top, the one with carrot cake swirled in, the mango key lime, and the lemon raspberry one. We were surprised when they brought out our two with lit candles and HAPPY ANNIVERSARY written beautifully in chocolate on each plate!  Also, massive extra dollops of whipped cream with each slice and sprinkles! Lol!  They were all delicious, but our favorites were definitely the carrot cake one and the mango key lime with coconut macaron crust!  <br><br>A little pricey, so save it for special occasions, but in all an amazingly delicious meal, with a fun attentive waiter - we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!

Deplorable service. Food was average but half the time it was nearly thrown onto our table (our bread and our packaged cheesecake). The couple next to us who arrived AFTER us were offered and received the bread basket far before we did -- our bread only arrived after we asked another woman, not our male server who seemed to be MIA half the night, for bread. She seemed pretty upset that she had to fetch our bread, and most of the other servers avoided eye contact with us despite us having our hand raised for several minutes. We shouldn&#39;t have expected much based on the other reviews, but this was the worst dining experience of our entire trip.

I have been a fan of Cheesecake Factory for a while.  The food is always consistently yummy and the customer service is great! They have a lot of room for big parties. And honestly, the cheesecake flavors are unbelievable! Because I do not feel like you want to hear the same good things, I&#39;ll skip to the good stuff of the review......if you feel you know enough..STOP! don&#39;t read anymore ^_^*<br><br>Cheesecake Factory has been here for YEARS, but the lines have never died down!<br><br>These are one of those places that is worth the wait!! I&#39;m sure many will agree with me there.<br><br>Or is it???  What if there was a way to get here with no line??????<br><br>Ok, I&#39;m going to let you in on a little secret(ok it&#39;s not that secret, but it has worked for me). The best time to go to Cheesecake Factory is on Sunday morning for their Sunday Brunch! <br><br>I love the sunday specials and you still get to order the regular menu items! (say what!) The best part is there is no long lines. We are usually seated right when we get there or after 15 minutes. That&#39;s fantab! Don&#39;t you think!<br> <br>That&#39;s all I got, I have a feeling I&#39;m going to regret telling my secret. BUT I feel obliged to let people know and enjoy their food as much as I do. If I could, I&#39;d make this review self destruct.

The last time that I&#39;ve eaten here was about a few years ago. First off, this restaurant is known to be crazy busy and provides no reservations.. laaaame. Their menu is huge and sometimes overwhelming which is why I didn&#39;t wanna take pictures of the menu because there was like at least 6 pages (back and front). We waited in line for about 1.5 hours. Luckily, we got seated before it started raining hard. Anyways, I ordered the grilled ribeye steak with a side order of fries which were somewhat soggy. I didn&#39;t even get a steak knife to eat for almost 8 minutes since my steak was delivered to my table. My steak started getting warmish-cold so I had to actually walk into the restaurant to look for a worker because either no one was coming outside or when they did, I couldn&#39;t catch their attention. On top of that, the steak was super thin and looked like a hamburger patty and it was really bland that I had to rely a lot on the A-1 steak sauce. I know steak is not what they&#39;re known here for, but even Zippys crappy steak tasted better than what I had. My wife had the Jumbalaya pasta and a Blue Hawaiian alcoholic beverage, my oldest had the chicken Carbonara pasta, and my youngest got the grilled cheese sandwich. My friends had the steak Diane, some kinda baked lemon chicken, pepperoni pizza, and some kinda cheesesteak sandwich. They all thought it was ok or pretty good. For dessert, we had different sorts of cheesecake flavors. I had the Oreo flavored one which was huge, but super rich and yummy. The others had the strawberry, tiramisu, and snickers flavored cheesecakes. My friend really wanted the &#34;celebration&#34; cheesecake, but apparently they ran out...laaaame..lol <br><br>Honestly, this will probably be the last time I ever eat here again only because I hate that they don&#39;t take reservations so the wait is forever, the seating setup outside is horrible and super tight, the steak sucks, the pasta was mediocre, and this crab dip that we ordered for appetizer was ok. On top of that, it isn&#39;t cheap either. I don&#39;t like complaining about my food in-person because it was already pretty late and I&#39;m not tryna wait any longer. Plus, not that I&#39;m saying this restaurant does this, but I&#39;ve seen the movie, Waiting, and I&#39;m not tryna get a &#34;special&#34; from complaining about my food...lol<br><br>The parking is located in the Royal Hawaiian parking structure. When you validate your parking ticket at the restaurant, the first hour is for free and so after, it&#39;s like a $1 more every hour or so. You have to pay for your ticket before you leave the structure. There are machines right in front of the elevators so you won&#39;t forget. Our waitress, Melissa was friendly and helpful, but sometimes we had to wait a while on getting our drinks refilled. It was pretty busy so I guess it&#39;s somewhat understandable.

Went here while we were visiting Waikiki. The food was good until my husband found a long hair in our nachos. We didn&#39;t make a scene and just let the server know.<br>The manager came out and apologized which we appreciated. The thing that was upsetting was the server had an attitude after that as if we put the hair in there.<br>I didn&#39;t spend thousands of dollars to come to Hawaii to rip off the Cheesecake Factory for $16. I get that people can be shady but seriously no need for the attitude. I still gave him his 20% tip so I obviously wasn&#39;t trying to get free food.

I love cheesecake factory.<br><br>My friends and I come at least once a month. Today however, I came with my family to celebrate my brothers birthday. <br><br>Located right in Waikiki at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, this place isn&#39;t hard to find. Parking is in the Royal Hawaiian parking structure and the restaurant validates for you. The first 2 hours with validation is free. <br><br>We went around 3:30 so we were able to get<br> seated right away. I think anytime before 5pm is a good time to go. Anytime after that, the wait jumps to over an hour long.<br><br>We ordered the crab &amp; artichoke dip as our appetizer. It was so good that it disappeared way too fast. They give a pretty good portion size of the dip as well. For our entrees we ordered the farfalle chicken pasta, chipotle chicken sandwich, a burger, and a soup &amp; salad lunch combo. Everything tasted great! <br><br>The minus 1 star is for the priceyness of this place. It&#39;s a little on the pricier side. Nonetheless, I enjoy the food here. Definitely one of my go-to places to eat.

I don&#39;t know about you guys... but The Cheesecake Factory NEVER fails... they&#39;ve got a GREAT HUGE BIG selection of food! And alcohol. Haha. And endless amounts of bread! My go to menu is the farfalle roasted garlic chicken. Amazing... and my boyfriend gets the bacon bacon burger. I never finish my food. No matter how hungry I am. I always have left overs. I think it&#39;s the bread that does it. Amazing! I added menu pictures too for cheesecake. YUMMMMM!

I can&#39;t believe that I&#39;ve never written a review for this place. Well I&#39;m definitely a creature of habit and I always get the Thai Lettuce Wraps! They are delicious and the serving is great for sharing or for taking the rest home for dinner.<br>The staff is always friendly even though you can tell that they are always busy. <br>I really need to save room for dessert or just go there for cheesecake sometime!<br>Maybe next time I&#39;ll try their new location.

Longggggg wait to get in. But worth it. We went twice during our stay in Waikiki. Food was always great and so were the drinks. Service was awesome as well. Super busy + packed, but yet still an enjoyable atmosphere.

Did take out for just the cheesecake this time!! It was awesome. Long line, but when has this location ever slow down.  If you have time to look over all cheesecake options and to wait. It&#39;s worth it. We ordered an Oreo cheese cake. And let me tell you. It was amazing. The size of one serving was able to feed both me and a friend. Each piece of cheese cake ranges from about 8-12 dollars. Definitely worth. When I&#39;m craving for cheesecake. I know where I&#39;m going! <br><br>Side note, I really thought it would&#39;ve slowed down since the new location opened in Kapolei.

Very crowded but there are always seats for you if you&#39;re a party of two (which was always my case). <br>Get the spicy chicken chipotle pasta, hands down the best menu here. <br>Loved this place and would like to visit again.

This year, National Cheesecake Day was celebrated on July 30, 2016.  We heard about The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s special as they generously offered 50% discount off any of their cheesecakes for both Friday, July 29 and Saturday, July 30.  The special was limited to DINE-IN, ONLY.<br><br>We always see lines and crowds waiting to get into The Cheesecake Factory in Waikīkī.  This location must truly be their flagship restaurant for its immense seating capacity and customer turnover.  Fortunately, this restaurant is located in the Royal Hawaiian Center where they offer free 2 hour parking validation.<br><br>After we attending to some errands on Saturday morning, we drove into Waikīkī and arrived just before The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s 11:00AM opening.  There was a line of about 10 people that had formed in front of the restaurant. But, as soon as the doors opened, the friendly and cheerful hostesses quickly escorted the people to their seats, including us.  <br><br>TCF&#39;s menu is filled with so many menu items that it is like reading a book and we took our time to &#34;study&#34; the menu.   Our server was so patient, cheerful and attentive. He checked with us often to refill our beverages and even tempted us by passing by with other customers&#39; orders while we waited for our lunch buddy.  By the time Lora C arrived, we had made our menu decisions.  She quickly perused the menu as we steered her to consider the lunch specials because we kept in mind our plans to order cheesecake for dessert.<br><br>THE FOOD:<br><br>-Louisiana Chicken Pasta:   Parmesan crusted chicken served over bow-tie pasta with mushrooms, peppers, onions in a spicy New Orleans sauce. The Parmesan crusted chicken, according to Lora, was chicken breast meat that was crisp on the outside and juicy, tender inside.  The bow tie pasta was cooked al dente and the creamy &#34;spicy&#34; New Orleans sauce provided a nice complement to the crispy-crusted chicken.  As for spiciness, it wasn&#39;t spicy at all and barely had a chile kick but, the flavor was good.  The lunch special was priced at $14.95 whereas the dinner portion usually runs as $18.95.<br><br>-Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta:  Rigatoni topped with broccoli, oven-dried tomatoes, roasted eggplant, mushrooms, onions, artichokes, Kalamata olives, garlic and pine nuts.  I always seem to order this pasta because of its flavorful Mediterranean flavors.  But, I really wish they hadn&#39;t removed their Indian Fry-Bread sandwich. I ordered the dinner portion as it was priced at $15.95, just a dollar more than the lunch special and got a larger portion that I could doggie bag for later snacking.<br><br>-Renee&#39;s Special:  Half of a turkey sandwich came with today&#39;s special soup (Stuffed Baked Potato) and tossed green salad for only $12.95.  My husband enjoyed his turkey sandwich which was stuffed with fresh lettuce, tomatoes and lots of fresh baked turkey.  The stuffed baked potato soup was thick and tasted like a fully-loaded potato yet in a soup form. He must&#39;ve enjoyed it as he cleaned his plate.  <br><br>DESSERT:<br> <br>-Mango Key Lime Cheesecake: this fluffy key-lime flavored cheesecake was topped with mango mousse and its crust was made from vanilla coconut macaroons.   We liked the mango flavor and subtle lime flavor.  The coconut macaroon crust was good but we felt it should have been more chewy rather than crisp but, to each his own....<br><br>-Lemon Meringue Cheesecake:  I am smitten by lemon and meringue desserts as its bright lemony flavor brings out Summer so this was my choice.  The lemon curd that was swirled into the fluffy, yet dense cream cheesecake gave it just the right amount of sweet and tart.  Plus, there was a layer of lemony mousse that brought this dessert together with the  meringue.  Yes, folks, I DID share this with my husband who isn&#39;t much of a dessert eater but somehow, it disappeared in front of him faster than me!<br><br>Yay for National Cheesecake Day and I can&#39;t wait for it to come around next year.  We enjoy going to TCF and shouldn&#39;t just wait for this promotion to return and neither should YOU!

The experience started off really bad. The hostess seemed a little overwhelmed as the crowds were coming in. I gave her my name to be placed on the waitlist but she didn&#39;t give me a wait time and just asked me to wait on the side and await for my name to be called.  Good twenty minutes went by and as people that came in after us were getting seated over us, I went up to check with the hostess where we were on the waiting list. I guess after trying to look for my name on her screen, I presume she couldn&#39;t find me. At that moment, I will commend her for not sending me to the back of the line, instead she sat us right away.<br><br>The service at the table was excellent. It was a night and day difference from the hostess experience. The waitress immediately brought out some bread and even brought out some bananas and sliced bread for our toddler. Even though there was shift change in progress, our orders came through relatively fast.<br><br>Now for the food itself, well... the presentation of the main dish was nice but nothing to write home about. We got the spinach and artichoke dip for an appetizer and it was bland at best. The chips were not salted and tasted &#34;old&#34; and the dip itself was unremarkable. As for the main meal, well I got the Chicken Picata which looked nice but the taste was way off. The angel hair pasta came out more than al dente and the 2 of 3 chicken pieces were dry.<br><br>The service definitely saved the day. Maybe it was an &#34;off-day&#34; or things just didn&#39;t click right but it definitely was a scattered experience at best.

June 30th is National cheesecake day! They were having a promotion for 2 days July 29 and July 30 for 50% off slices of any slice of cheesecake DINE IN ONLY.. I love New York cheesecake, the creamy rich texture, so delicious! Calories that are so worth it all. I&#39;ve had the authentic rich NY cheesecake while I was on a trip in New York and man I want those... <br><br>This is the only location on island and being that it is in Waikiki, the line is usually very long! Crowded, sometimes long wait. I was lucky because Lyla and Ed arrived when they opened, got a table. I truly appreciated them for waiting for me... while I took a good 30mins to get there. I got lost, missed the turn to the parking structure at Royal Hawaiian. Then made a wrong turn into a one way street YIKES! Being a local, Waikiki isn&#39;t just confusing for tourist hahah. But with all these one way streets, it makes you mad... you gotta start all over if you miss that one turn.. <br><br>Finally, I made it. Cheesecake was on my mind for days!!! Since it was lunch time I got the Louisana Chicken which was $4 cheaper than the regular dinner price. the Louisiana chicken comes with bow tie pasta and chicken Parmesan. The sauce has a creamy spicy taste with some vegetables like onion and tomato. The chicken was juicy. Not overly cooked.<br><br>Lyla got her usual.. Evelyn&#39;s Favorite. The pasta was light but good. I could see why she always order that.  Ed got the lunch special, Rene special (sandwich that comes with salad and a potato soup) wow what a deal. Portion was generous! The soup was yummy! <br><br>THE BEST PART: THE CHEESECAKE!!!<br>Lyla ordered the lemon meringue cheesecake. I got the Mango keylime cheesecake. Now now we both wanted the sweet and sour yet savory of the cheesecake.<br><br>I liked mine, although they should have asked if I wanted whip cream... I personally don&#39;t like whip cream in mostly anything. It&#39;s unwanted calories I could use towards other things. Let me tell you, first time trying this slice, my mango keylime cheesecake was mango-y with a kick of lime and that coconut macaroon crust went well together! It had lots of shredded coconut in every bite. <br>The lemon meringue was bold! I like that too!<br><br>Thank you two for being so patient with me today!  You guys are always great company :)  <br><br>Until we meet again amazing cheesecake.....

It&#39;s a chain so if you&#39;ve been here you know what you&#39;re getting. Our server was Bo and he was amazing! Very on top on everything and friendly. <br>If you have only been stateside then you&#39;ll find the menu here has things the others don&#39;t. These items are more catered to Hawaii and the local cuisine. We we&#39;re lucky to only wait 15 minutes, but during that time the wait jumped to an hour! It gets very busy. When we left the line was out the door to even put your name down on the wait list. The bar and high tops are open seating if you can find a spot.

They do not offer ANY healthy selections or lite options.  PLEASE add the Skinny Menu and lite options.   It&#39;s not enjoyable to sit with your friends and have nothing healthy to eat.<br><br>As per the owner&#39;s response, they give so many delicious options but  sadly none are healthy
very nice and great food i would def reccomned to friends and go again overall. This was my first time.

I really didn&#39;t want to write a bad review for Cheesecake, as we have been coming here for years and usually enjoy every aspect of it except the wait, but unfortunately between our last visit and this one, it seems that in time they have lost their ability to care about those they serve.   <br><br>Went here last night for dinner, party of 7, 3 adults, 3 preteens and a toddler.  Waited an hour and 15 minutes (this is normal, expect to wait a while, this store happens to be one of their busiest in the nation).  Took a while to be greeted, when Genifer greeted us, she was upbeat and offered to take drink orders, we asked to order appetizers as well at the time, she obliged.  We also informed her that we would like an extra chair as one of us was getting poured on by the leaky AC overhead, no apology, just acknowledgment that she would bring one by... we waited and waited... finally over 20 minutes later and a damp shirt, a chair was brought.  Water was not refilled unless asked, and even then it was a while before the refill would arrive.  All of this would have been mere hiccups, the kicker was when everyone except one preteens order arrived for dinner (a bacon bacon cheeseburger) they said it would be out...  it did not come until someone asked where the food was and at this point everyone was done with dinner and asking for boxes and the dessert menu, when it did come, it did not come with the fries, server informed us they were waiting for &#34;hot fries&#34; (mind you we watched the table next to us immediately receive a sandwich with fries after that).   We waited while he ate his delicious burger, the fries still didn&#39;t come, we stopped the server after about 15 minutes to inquire where the fries were, her response : a laugh and a &#34;sorry I thought someone else would bring them&#34;.   When she returned with them I informed her that it was unfortunate that his meal was not served with the others, and when it was served a long while later, not in completion, and that it was a huge let down.   She giggled and said &#34;yeah.   Sorry about that&#34;.   A manager never stopped by, we never received a sincere apology, it was as if our $170 meal was no big deal.   <br><br>Mistakes happen, Service is not always perfect, but when it is not sincere, when a very blatant mistake that ruins a special night out happens and is not addressed and is worse, shrugged off, it really speaks mounds about an establishment.    <br><br>We still left a 20% tip with a note that service was horrible and to please do better, which I&#39;m sure she laughed at and could care less about, but maybe management will start to care when locals no longer patronize their establishment due to the lack of care.   <br><br>The 2 stars are because other than the long wait, way too dark table due to a light being out, leaky AC,  not getting to eat together as a group, lack of very basic service, and insincere service, the food was good.   The food is almost always good, has so many selections and is consistent.

Would give a 3 1/2. It&#39;s extremely busy. 50 minutes wait, then another 10 to get seated. The check-in process can be improved. As the entrance is blocked with people waiting to get a pager; then the other side of the desk is crowded with people waiting to be seated. <br><br>Due to the great weather, outdoor seating is wonderful, especially when it&#39;s cool out with a light breeze. <br><br>It was Friday night, so live music was a bonus.

This location usually has really great service! But I was severely disappointed with the sarcastic answers I received from Bianca. I went there just for the cheesecake and had some questions about some of the new options. I was interested in ordering the 30th anniversary cake and I asked what was in it and when it they started serving. I wanted to get a feel if I could come back on a later date and try it because I was really craving the fresh strawberry that night. But the response I got was, &#34;uh chocolate and vanilla cheesecake with frosting&#34; and &#34;we started serving it when we had our anniversary.&#34; I&#39;ve had many servers at this location go out of their way to really sell the dish and discuss with me what I should get based on what I like. And so her response really took me by surprise. <br><br>Don&#39;t work in Waikiki of all places or in the service industry, if you&#39;re going to be rude and sarcastic. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going back to Cheesecake Factory for a long time, even though my boyfriend loves this place.

Upon being seated by the host, my boyfriend asked if they served pancakes and the young lady told us yes they serve pancakes for breakfast. Our little girl really wanted pancakes and bacon and was happy to hear about pancakes! We looked at the menu and only saw waffles and french toast. No pancakes!! And thus the reason for the three stars. We ended up ordering the shrimp platter for our precious girl and I shared it with her.  My boyfriend had the shrimp and chicken gumbo and our eleven year old son ordered the factory burger. The food tasted good and my family was stuffed. Would we come again, probably!!!

Busiest Cheesecake Factory in the WORLD!!!<br><br>Took friends from Germany here because they don&#39;t have it there. They sort of make it a tradition to eat at Cheesecake factories every time they visit the U.S. <br><br>The line was a bit long but it was okay tho, I went in ahead so my friends wouldn&#39;t have to wait. They called my number but I told them the whole party wasn&#39;t here and that they were about 5 minutes away. They were super cool about it and put me in this other line and told me to just let them know when they got there. When they arrived we were seated right away.<br><br>So I guess if you plan you&#39;ll be okay. Failure to plan is planning to fail.<br><br>A/C was leaking  on our chair or something near the booth towards the back on the left. Right before the hallway into the kitchen or something. But I guess thats what happens when you are the busiest Cheesecake factory in the WORLD!!! Please fix.<br><br>Other than that we had fun. Nothing cheesy about it. Okay... maybe a little cheesy. =P

Let me tell you about my story, I was vacationing in Hawaii this week and got back home today. Checking all my receipts against my credit card, all checked out correct except my receipt from Cheesecake Factory. So my bill my about $85 and I left a tip for $5 for a total of $90. Well, it was obvious that our waiter didn&#39;t care for the $5 tip and decided to add a 1 to the left making it a $15 tip as my credit card was charged $100 instead of $90. So I called the restaurant today and talked to the manager (Courtney). She looked into the issue and stated that it was a mistake made by the waiter and she will adjust receipt. She didn&#39;t even apologize for the mistake. Then she calls me back and tells me, &#34;sir, the tip is for $15, looks like you Mis-calculated the total&#34; in other words &#34; your an idiot and can&#39;t add 80+5. I was insulated. I explained to her that no, your waiter decided to give himself another $10 tip. <br><br>This is what I call unethical and stealing. I go to cheesecake a lot and it lana reputable restaurant, but the fact that the waiter added a tip and manager didn&#39;t apologize and tried to tell me &#34;the customer&#34; I&#39;m wrong is unheard of. <br><br>I&#39;m soo upset, I will be calling the corporate office tomorrow as I view this as theft. So for those of you who decided to dine here, make sure to check your credit card bill so your not being ripped off by a server who in my opinion. Should be warned if not fired for such intentional act. <br><br>Will call corporate tomorrow to address this issue.

Thats your response?<br>So I pay 22 with tip for a way overpriced<br>So called Monster sized burrito and you say sorry<br>Your so corporate <br>So I get ripped off by perhaps a hung over cook or thoughtless individual and you cover for them<br>Pathetic<br>Do me right<br>I have 5000 friends on Facebook <br>13000 friends on linked in<br>You figure it out<br>U got my cell<br>Call me<br>How would I feel if I were in my shoes and not kissing corporate booty as u are<br>Whatever happened to the customer is always right?<br>You should be fired your petty and unprofessional

Reason why I rate 2 stars even in this crisis time with the covid-19 going on. Food is always good here. But service have to be on point too. Ordered 2 cheesecake one suppose to be strawberry. I should&#39;ve check it also on my behalf, but since I know this place already been here for a while. I did not. Got home I got 2 chocolate cheesecake. Disappoint it cause I know that the cheesecake here is good, but just didn&#39;t get the one I ordered!!!

This is the busiest Cheesecake Factory I have ever been to. Before they even open, there is a long line. However, once the doors open, they have a system down for placing guests to tables immediately. The service was spot on both times we went during our vacation. The food is great and the drinks are quality. I would recommend this Cheesecake Factory, just be prepared for a possible wait to be seated.

Ate there today with the family and I order a Fried Macaroni and Cheese burger and love it. For my drink I ordered Raspberry lemonade. Went there on a Monday at 3 or 4 PM. Wasn&#39;t a long wait time at all right when we walked in there was seats available for a party of 3.

Second time I came here and was only willing to come because it was early around 4pm. Last time, I came for dinner, I was greeted with a long line and 1hr plus wait to eat dinner. This time, I walked in it was so slow the 5 hostesses were too busy talking to notice us before being surprised we came in and got us seated.  <br>Once we were seated, we got the relatively large menu and the kids menu. My daughter wanted Mac and cheese and son was convinced by my daughter that he wanted cheese quesadillas. I noticed we could still ordered from the lunch menu because it was before 5pm. So my wife chose the lunch salmon. I chose the steak Diane which was steak medallions with mushrooms and onions with mashed potatoes.  We were all ready then we waited. Maybe 10 minutes before the waitress came by. Was funny to wait so long because the restaurant was not very busy at the time. Waitress took drink order and food orders and not surprisingly the food came out quicker then the waitress initially did.  After that, waitress was pretty much spot on with the service. She helped me with the take out cheesecake, the request for Parmesan cheese by my daughter was fulfilled with a block of real Parmesan which I put on my steak, my wife&#39;s mashed potatoes and both my kid&#39;s mac and cheese. The food was good, my steak was perfectly done, kid&#39;s cheese quesadilla was delicious as I stole a piece. My wife enjoyed some of my daughter&#39;s mac and cheese after my daughter was full and she liked it. Son loved everyone&#39;s food. Everyone enjoyed cheesecake at home. Overall a good dining experience. Pricey but it&#39;s in Waikiki so it&#39;s expected. Free validated parking. Minus 1 star was for the initial greeting and long wait before waitress showed up. Also although the bathrooms were high tech and pretty, there was piss all on the floor near urinals and water all over the sink. They gotta do more frequent bathroom checks.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve visited. I&#39;m here in Waikiki from California &amp; was surprised when I came back to my hotel to see that I paid $7 for a few pieces of lettuce, which they claim is a &#34;house salad&#34;. Very disappointed in this chain I can usually rely on for bigger portions.

I have only eaten here a couple times due to the wait times and the food being  mediocre, but our visit last weekend flipped my opinion so that I&#39;m a fan now!<br><br>We came at lunchtime on a Saturday and only waited 10 min! We were seated in a large circular booth, perfect for my emerging walker to practice on. Our waitress Gabrielly was great, she even brought us sliced bananas for the baby.<br><br>We opted for a lunch portion of the da Vinci pasta and the Monte Cristo sandwich off the brunch menu. Both were outstanding! The rich wine sauce on the pasta was so decadent and the sweet/salty sandwich hit the spot. <br><br>We took two cheesecakes to go: lemon meringue and tiramisu. I was disappointed in the lemon...it was too sweet and not tart enough like it&#39;s namesake dessert. The tiramisu cheesecake was better.<br><br>We had validation and only paid 2 dollars parking. Can&#39;t beat that in Waikiki!

We are huge fans of Cheesecake factory Honolulu and frequent the establishment several times per month. On this visit, we were seated in a booth along the kitchen area. I already know from previous visits that there is a problem of water condensation building up on the Air conditioning vents in the ceiling and especially over this section of seats. As we just received our food to the table, there were two Cheesecake employees who were starting to wipe the condense from the vents. As they made their way past our table, the adhock mop stick they were using had a rag which appeared to be very dirty. When they made their way to our table, they waved the stick along with the dirty rag over our table and food. To my surprise, they did not provide us with any warning and the thought of having the dirty rag flinging over our prepared food on the table really ruined our whole meal. We did inform our server who agreed with us that the staff should at least have warned us before they came through and did this. Having dust or dirt particles mixed over our food or even the thought of it makes us cringe!! Very bad experience and not up to typical Cheesecake factory standards!!! I am hugely disappointed after this visit!

So this was my go to spot for cheesecake and a date night before the Kapolei location opened. We would parked at the Royal Hawaiian shopping center or stay next door at the Sheraton and would check in and wait to be called. They refused to take reservations so that was just so humbug to wait an hour or two outside. We had a buzzer and couldn&#39;t take it that far so hubby and I would just take turns shopping around. Lots of tourists of course and always packed for dinner. But all for the famous cheesecake! During my first pregnancy I craved a cheesecake, and so they have a bakery inside that you can just order from instead of dining in.

This place is insanely busy. We ordered take out consisting of buffalo wings, calamari (both being appetizers), Wellness salad with grilled chicken &amp; 3 cheesecakes (chocolate x 2 and Reese&#39;s pieces)<br><br>Waited 25 min which was not bad and average wait time. Food was good and hot still by the time I got home which was 10 min walk. I was surprised of the portion size for take out that it was HUGE. This is my first time eating from Cheesecake Factory and can imagine what the portions are like in dining in.<br><br>Cheesecake was moist and to die for. Though almost $9 a slice is on the steep side though in my opinion

Alfredo with large scampi - OMG ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!! 10/10! Make sure to get it with fresh parmesian, even if you don&#39;t like it like me. If you and another split this and a salad it would make for the perfect combo! <br><br>Super antioxidant salad - solid. The pear and blueberry add a freshness. But get the dressing on the side. Honestly, it detracts from the salad itself.

The food here was excellent. For a chain restaurant, I was thoroughly impressed. The food was so fresh and had a lot of flavor. Service was also great. They have an outdoor patio as well which was so nice. I highly recommend this place.

Food was service was amazing. Wait time after ordering was good, and our waitress was friendly. Even though it was a packed Friday night we were able to be seated in about 40 minutes. Only complaint was the process of being seated was quite chaotic and it was very loud in the restaurant. All in all, some of the best food we&#39;ve had in Waikiki was right here!

Its been a while since I&#39;ve been here.  Got there early to try and beat the rush, since they don&#39;t take reservations.  Even though we arrived before 5pm, we were still quoted a 25 minute wait.<br><br>I went to the bar to have a drink.  The kids walked over to the newly opened International marketplace, which was directly across the street.<br><br>We were seated slightly over the 25 minute time we were quoted.  Restaurant was extremely busy, but our server was very timely and remembered all the special requests that we made.<br><br>We ordered our usual Kalua Pig Nachos, which is always fabulous!  There&#39;s some liquidy, gooey white cheese at the bottom of the plate....oh so yummy!<br><br>For the first time, we ordered the deep fried mac and Cheese Balls.  Yum!<br><br>My only complaint at this restaurant is just the fact that I have too many choices.  I always go through at least five selections and in the end, I always get the same thing.... Pasta Da Vinci.  I love it!  I just want to drink that sauce, sooooo good!<br><br>Portions are so huge so we never have any cheesecake (although we stopped at Uncle Tetsu&#39;s at the nearby food court and picked up a cheesecake to go)<br><br>You are pretty much guaranteed to have leftovers for lunch the next day.  So when you consider the portions, it&#39;s a pretty great deal and great for families.<br><br>Consistent service and consistent product, you ALWAYS know what you&#39;re getting!

The best cheesecake factory i have ever been into!! The hospitality is amazing they keep checking on you to see how the food is and how the drinks are... i never had to tell them i needed a refill on my drink they just kept coming back to check! <br><br>The bartender was even better he really took the tine to get to know what we were craving even as he was busy! This whole experience from start to finish was unbelievable !

I love the Cheesecake Factory because of their food; especially different cheesecake flavors! <br><br>The restaurant is located in the heart of Waikiki. Park at the Royal Hawaiian where the first hr is free w/ validation while the rest is $2/hr!  <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is pretty spacious and can hold a lot of guests, although, not big enough for the non-stop traffic (both tourists and locals) in Waikiki. This is right next to forever 21 and across from Macy&#39;s, therefore, shopping while waiting is an option. <br><br>They do not take reservations and the lines are always long! But for someone surrounded by Asian and local restaurants and loves (everything else but that) American food, the wait is bearable for me.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to this restaurant a handful of times and never failed to receive good service. Ambiance is up to par and can be intimate in the evenings while food on the other hand is always good. They have great food varieties, although, my favorite appetizer personally is the avocado roll while salted caramel for the cheesecake, but of course those are both personal preference since everything, I think, is good. Lastly, you will also get your money&#39;s worth out of their alcohol beverages because it&#39;s strong! You can really taste the alcohol in it specifically in the margaritas.<br><br>All in all, I recommend Cheesecake Factory with or without long wait times.

if you can&#39;t get street parking, your best bet is at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center.  The first hour, if validated, is free.  After that it&#39;s $2 an hour.  If you don&#39;t like that and can&#39;t figure out the math, you could park at the Waikiki Shopping Plaza where it&#39;s a flat fee of $5.00 total.<br><br>So glad Judy recruited Frankie to get there early to put in our reservation.  So, the plan was the table would be ready to receive us by 7:00pm.  We arrive then, sit, order and enjoy.  You know how the best laid plans are easily laid to waste?  Guilty as charged.  I was the last to arrive close to 8pm.  Embarassing yes?  I needed a drink.<br><br>Lemon Drop Martini $12.25<br>This was sweeter than normal, I think.  How&#39;d they do that?  Well, it was good for me.  Pricey though.<br><br>Everyone ordered immediately but I wasn&#39;t hungry.  I was trying to get something light besides salad but couldn&#39;t find anything.  Not even in the appetizer section either.<br><br>Baja Chicken Tacos $14.95<br>These came in a group of 4.  I know I cannot expect these to be as good as the Tijuana street tacos I got for 80 cents but one could hope. Maybe I was hoping too much.  Although many of the flavors were there I found the tacos dry.  Note to self: bring my own salsa.  Maybe.<br><br>This seems to be the problem many times when I visit Cheesecake Factory no matter where I go. Everything looks good, tastes good but is missing something missing the mark.   However, the cheescakes are devine.  They are pricey too so I only come if I want to treat myself and if it&#39;s convenient to get to.  This location is not convenient.  Back to making my own.<br><br>Our server seemed okay.  She did check up on us enough to make sure we were doing okay.  And we got to celebrate Frankie&#39;s birthday which he received  a free ice cream cake sundae provided by CF.  It was nice and enjoyable.<br><br>Looking for the next gathering!
This place is wack! How the hell you run out of chicken wings?! Then I asked to refund my order And the manager wants to be a beezy about it too?!

Opted to have an dinner here due to unused gift cards. We decided to head over around 4:30pm on Saturday afternoon. The restaurant is known to get extremely busy between 5:30 and 6:00 pm. The wait can be excruciating, especially on an empty stomach.  <br><br>We parked in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center garage, which, connects to the Sheraton&#39;s parking garage via stairs. (The validations are different for each lot, so mind the signs.) All parking fees in the RHSC garage must be pre-paid at the kisosk near the elevators in the garage. There is no parking attendant on duty down the ramp that you can pay, if you forget. Be prepared to walk a bit to the restaurant as the garage is at the other end of the shopping center.<br><br>Upon our arrival to the restaurant at 4:45 pm, we were quickly seated. If you have a seating preference, state it to the hostess right away.<br><br>The restrooms are located down a corridor before the kitchen. <br>The noise level is pretty loud.<br><br>The menu. Extensive to say the least. Eggs and omelettes are served all day. There is a Sunday Brunch menu within the main menu, and also a lunch menu. <br><br>We began with house bread (sourdough and a dark oat bread) and butter, and an order of fried calamari. A bit on the salty side, but worked well with the garlic aioli and cocktail sauce. The morsels were lightly breaded and fried. Not at all chewy and tough. Very soft and pleasant to the palate. A+<br><br>Do not take the lunch menu lightly by expecting a tiny portion. You will be more wrong! <br><br>I chose the Chicken Piccata, lunch portion, because I wanted dessert, of course!  Three nice size pieces of the most flavorful, tender &amp; juicy chicken in a lemon butter and caper sauce and a very generous portion of angel hair pasta.  A+<br><br>Limoncello Cream Torte traveled very nicely home. The whipped cream held up quite well and was very creamy. The cake was dense and sweet and the cream between the layers was tart. The frosting on the outside of the torte had some crunchies in it, which gave it a nice contrasting texture. A+<br><br>Just over an hour and we were out the door. So many people in the lobby and outside waiting for  a table. Yikes! Good idea to go early!

This place is always a guarantee amazing meal with tons of food!! This evening our server was Mateo, wanted to give him a shout out on such great experience with exceptional service! Much appreciated.

Totally horrible customer service!!! The guy at the register was counting his tips and changing out the change for dollars instead of helping the line! No one was really servicing the line. Ignored for 5 minutes!! Thanks done  for a while with this place! Hopefully service will get better! It wasn&#39;t busy, came at a off time to avoid the crowd but the experience was worst then coming when it&#39;s busy! If I could give no stars for this visit I would!! Thanks for a horrible time!

This is one of those chain restaurants that I feel ashamed for liking. As I am a strong proponent of supporting small and local businesses, I don&#39;t often make it to the giant restaurant chains. They definitely have their place and time though! And that place and time for me was Friday after Thanksgiving on my day of drinking across Waikiki! A single meal of chicken littles and their complimentary bread basket was a solid base for day drinking. We sat at the bar and enjoyed some wine. It was dark and cool inside and we had no wait for two bar seats around 3:30pm. I didn&#39;t understand why the chicken tenders were $20 until I saw the plate piled high with about 12 tenders! The sides of succotash and mashed potatoes were fresh and tasty, as were the tenders. We couldn&#39;t even finish this one meal and took our leftover littles to share with someone looking for food along our walk. Oh, and the honey mustard dipping sauce was banging.

I have been to cheese cake factory many times for lunch or dinner.  Today was the first time I went for breakfast.  Like the dinner and lunch the breakfast was delicious!  Besides the food, the service was amazing.  Our server Jake E. was so friendly and on it!   I give the customer service here an A+. I highly recommend coming here!

This is my 2nd visit. My first visit was during dinner time. There was a line just to get my name in and then another 1 hour of wait. Today&#39;s visit was totally different. I went for lunch shortly after they open. This time no wait. Lunch time is the right time to come here. I think. <br><br>Our server was excellent and professional. We ordered 2 burgers, chicken madeira, crab dip. They were all good. I was impressed with chicken madeira. It was juicy and served with real mashed potatoes. I recommend getting sweet potato fries with your burger. Burger is good for 2 people. I was ready for a nap after my meal. <br><br>Folks, this place quite dark so it took me awhile to adjust to the lighting.

I love this location compared to any other Cheesecake Factory location i have been to in SF or East Bay. I would say i like this location better due to the tropical side, quality and quantity with their food. The garnishments are so cute as well, with cute orchid flowers.<br>I always love asking for outside seating.<br>Waiting time is crazy long at night, during lunch hour, expect 35 mins latest to wait.

We had gift card so we went to there first time. Only walk ins. When we get there on Thursday at around 2:00 pm we got seated like in15min.<br>Every server are nice, I was inside seat,I thought a little bit too dark and I asked switch outside,They are so welcome to move table!<br>Foods is amazing even the breads!<br>Cheese cake are so many choices, one I picked the cake was 1500 cal.

The worst service ever. I got paged so I gave my pager to the hostess and waited in line to be seated but they never called me.they forgot about me somehow then seated me in the bar area and no server came for over 10 minutes.  I was pissed and asked to see a manager which never came .

Food is awesome! I got the Thai coconut chicken, my kids got pasta and grilled cheese. We also got the fried Mac and cheese which is our favorite (it came late though, but it&#39;s ok) usually we would have to wait at least 45 minutes to get seated but when we came in the bar was empty so we decided to just help ourselves and sit there and they have full service and menu there as well. All in all it was a good experience

The only bad thing I have to say about this place is the wait time. Literally can reach up to a couple hours wait. Which i find ridiculous but welcome to Waikiki. <br><br>If you&#39;re a local or just wanna grab some food and go back to your hotel, call and order. You can go right to the pick up line and everything is wayyyyy quicker. <br><br>Whenever you get seated right away ask for a basket of bread!! Their bread is amazing!! I prefer the white one, it&#39;s a small touch of sour dough, but many people I&#39;ve gone with have favored the brown bread. Which is also good. <br><br>I&#39;ve had multiple dishes from here, but my all time go to is the Pasta Di Vinci. It&#39;s absolutely amazing especially with some Parmesan cheese to top it off.  I&#39;ve never had bad service here, in the 7 years I&#39;ve been coming to this location. I try to make it here at least once a year lol.
Worst experience. Broke a crown .  On a nut that shouldn&#39;t have been in our dish. Cost me $1000 plus mouth  pain, time, and grief. <br>Meal stone cold as if that even mattered.

We decided to have a late night snack and wandered into The Cheesecake Factory. That was good and bad... The good - seated quickly, friendly waiters, tasty treats.  The bad - gained a few more extra lbs... Lol

This place is insanely busy, and HUGE! I can&#39;t imagine what it&#39;s like to work here. If you love the Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ll be able to leave this location satisfied. My experience wasn&#39;t the greatest as the server input the wrong order for me, so I got my meal after my spouse was done his. Our bill was not compensated in any way, which I would expect after such a delay with my meal. <br><br>My mai tai was strong, so they aren&#39;t cheap on the booze.<br><br>Overall, it&#39;s like any other Cheesecake Factory with perhaps a little hiccups in service, likely to sheer size of the place.<br><br>Wow, just had to drop it down a star thanks to the lame generic response.

There&#39;s a reason why this place is so popular... Cheesecake Factory is the bomb! I wish we had them in Canada. We were here 4 times during our 10 day trip in Honolulu. And came by once just for cheesecake, lol. <br><br>Their menu is so huge, it takes a while to decide what you&#39;re going to get. Would be a great place for picky eaters since they&#39;re bound to find something here they&#39;d enjoy. And the prices are very fair, considering the area. <br><br>I had the Cajun chicken &#34;littles&#34; twice, they were that good. I think they put quotations beside the word &#34;little&#34; on the menu because it&#39;s anything but. You get like, 10 pieces of chicken, it&#39;s ridiculous. They are basically chicken fingers served with mashed potatoes and corn succotash. I appreciate how they serve the chicken with vegetables as opposed to French fries cause the chicken is already fried (although I&#39;m sure I could have substituted for fries if I wanted to). <br><br>I also had the best burger I&#39;ve ever had in my LIFE here for our last meal in Honolulu-- the Americana Burger. I think it&#39;s their version of a Big Mac cause it&#39;s got that thousand islands &#34;secret sauce&#34; on it. I don&#39;t know if I&#39;ll ever be able to have a McDonald&#39;s Big Mac again.... Holy cow. <br> <br>I also got the chicken parm sandwich, which was good, but the least favourite thing I ordered there. I didn&#39;t like the roasted peppers that came with it. <br><br>My dad got the Cuban sandwich, which was the least favourite thing he ordered (maybe sandwiches aren&#39;t their strongest suit?), the steak Diane, chicken Madeina, and the chicken parm with pasta. His favourite was the chicken Madeina. I had a taste of it and it was really good. They sure don&#39;t skimp on the cheese! <br><br>I tried the Oreo and turtles cheesecake too, and Oreo is definitely the way to go. It&#39;s one of the most popular cheesecakes. It was funny cause I was all like &#34;what a chincy size slice for $9&#34; but I couldn&#39;t even finish it. Soooo good. <br><br>Apparently this is the highest grossing Cheesecake Factory in the world. It was packed at all hours of the day we were there/passed by. The staff here know what they&#39;re doing though. It&#39;s very efficiently run. Other than waiting for a table, we didn&#39;t have to wait long for drinks/food/bill to get to the table.

Cheesecake Factory is Cheesecake Factory, if you love it, you LOVE it. My best friend wanted to go here for her birthday, so we had a group that went. We always love it but this time was exceptionally great because of our server. Our server was Sean and he was OUTSTANDING. He made sure we all had a fantastic evening and kept checking on us. He had such a great personality that we kept talking about how he made our night that much better after we left. We are all servers ourselves so we are always intently watching how other servers work, he was phenomenal. Thank you, Sean for making sure my best friend had the best birthday!

The wait was a typical hour, even for the labor day weekend. The food was delicious as always but since it was towards the end of service, I don&#39;t feel like the server was too engaged or attentive.<br><br>Me and the lady ordered the Farfalle with chicken and garlic and the Pasta Da Vinci, respectively. The Farfalle pasta was on point, the sauce was creamy and savory, and seasoned just right. The Pasta Da Vinci was alright, I feel that the sauce was to heavy on the wine side.<br><br>The service was lacking. My friend Marie, is a vegetarian, but her order came with meat. The waitress was nice enough though to comp her meal. Water was refilled once, and we didn&#39;t even get a refill on bread. <br><br>Overall service put a damper on an otherwise delicious meal, put up with it if you are willing to wait.<br><br>Food 5/5<br>Service 3/5<br>Overall 4/5

Everyone who&#39;s complaining about the wait should just sit at the bar because IT IS THE BEST! Full menu and amazing service! Kristie was attentive, and even at the risk of being redundant, the best. The bar may have been a bit short staffed, but for 3 people to be serving hundreds, they did amazing. You won&#39;t find better food at a cheaper price, and the service is top notch!

The service here at this location is usually great even through the craziness. Last night I dined in with a group of friends and we were taken care of by Eric. His service was good but unfortunately I had a horrible experience with the food service, more specifically the bakery hence why my rating is so low.<br>Two nights ago I dined in and ordered the Godiva Brownie Sundae. What the bakers didn&#39;t know was that I work in the bakery for the Cheesecake Factory as well so of course I know exactly how it&#39;s supposed to look like and what&#39;s supposed to be in the sundae. I kept quiet when the sundae came out wrong but later regretted it when I went back into work and told my managers of the experience. My managers recommended I complain to the manager and have them fix it the next time.<br>Last night became the &#34;next time&#34; and of course, I ordered the sundae again! I took an extra step and after ordering walked over to the bakery where I wanted to watch them make it correctly. IM SO GLAD I DID SO BECAUSE THE BAKER MAKING MY SUNDAE HAD NO GLOVES ON! I get that it was getting late and they were probably starting to shut things down but orders are still orders and people&#39;s health isn&#39;t something to be played around with! <br>After watching the baker get half way through with the sundae, I simply ask her &#34;Are there no gloves?&#34; And to my surprise SHE GOT SO UPSET!! In an angry tone she asks &#34;DO YOU WANT IT OR NOT?&#34; I was honestly caught off guard by her reaction that I simply replied &#34;I just want you to put on gloves...&#34; At that point she was slamming plates obviously pissed off that she was caught doing the wrong thing...I just stood there watching and AGAIN she started to make ANOTHER Godiva Brownie Sundae for me with NO GLOVES ON. I ask her once more to put on gloves and SHE YELLS AT ME and tells me to stop watching her and she&#39;s swearing that her hands are clean... I can&#39;t believe how rude she was so I asked her for her name and with no hesitation she screams &#34;ISABELLE KING!&#34; <br>I find a manager standing by the host stand not paying attention to anything that just happened and ask &#34;Aren&#39;t the bakers supposed to wear gloves?&#34; Confused he replied, &#34;well they&#39;re supposed to be?&#34; I couldn&#39;t believe what just happened so I just went back to my table and told my friends about it. <br>After about 10 minutes Stephanie, the manager of the Bakery comes to the table and asks me what happened. After telling her everything, she basically tells me and I quote &#34;You shouldn&#39;t be micromanaging my workers!&#34; She says that because I&#39;m a guest it&#39;s not respectful to watch the bakers and I shouldn&#39;t have asked her to put on gloves and if I had a problem, I should&#39;ve just asked for a manager. Apparently as a guest you shouldn&#39;t watch the bakers because it&#39;s not respectful... Right?<br>Wrong! I&#39;m pretty sure if the Cheesecake Factory thought it was disrespectful for guests to watch the bakers make their desserts they wouldn&#39;t have the bakery up front where it&#39;s the first thing you see when you walk in!!! After her speech of how I was disrespectful, I never got an apology for her disrespectful worker.<br>Food for thought- Be very cautious about dining in here because obviously health codes and guest services aren&#39;t top priority at this location! Never dining in here again!

Food is very good.  Portions are large and the Cheesecake options are unreal.  Get there early, before peak time otherwise there will be a long wait.  They finally have a Happy Hour..... been waiting a long time for this.  Eat there 3 days a week and have never had a bad meal, menu options cover all the bases.

The day after Thanksgiving is crowded here, inside the Cheesecake Factory. There was a line out of the door. However, we sat ourselves immediately at the bar area, instead of waiting for an hour.<br><br>The Hot wings were too salty, the chopped salad were tasty, but too expensive for its size. The bartenders were fast and efficient, but very nervous and overworked, they want to get you I and out as soon as they can.

It has been long time I come here. This place reminds me of my best friend Leanne who loved Avocado Egg Rolls so much!! I remember one time we ordered them one each!! <br>Today I enjoyed memorable Avocado Egg rolls!!

Visited for lunch with my friend who had a gift card. We were greeted and seated with little wait time. Servers were very attentive and kept our drink glasses full. Warm bread assortment was brought out and was delish. We decided to share the Spicy Ahi Tempura Roll and the Bistro Shrimp. The tempura roll was very yummy. Perfectly fried, not oily, and generously filled. The pasta was also amazing. Loved how the shrimp were prepared. We finished off our meal with a slice of the 30th anniversary chocolate cake cheesecake. I have always been a fan of their cheesecake and this visit  was no different. Amazing cheesecake! Amazing food! Amazing service! This visit was the best so far. Dined a handful of times and have never been this wow&#39;d.

I haven&#39;t been here since 2013 because the parking and the WAITING. But tonight I was actually surprise that the wait was only 40 minutes. Before it would be more than an hour till you&#39;re seated. <br>I do love that it&#39;s located right next to Forever 21 because that&#39;s an easy way to kill time. It definitely did because after I payed for my items our buzzer was telling us that our table was ready. <br><br>I am not a fan about the waiting to be seated part. After we turned in our buzzer we have to stand on the side and listen for our name to be called. In that corner where we&#39;re waiting  can get crowded and it&#39;s also very loud. <br><br>Our waiter&#39;s name was Austin and he was AWESOME. He&#39;s great at his job. My boyfriend and I ordered  crusted chicken Romano and I got the steak Diane with shrimp scampi combo. I was impressed how quickly our food came. <br><br>I knew ordering the cheese cake was going to be hardest part because there&#39;s so much choices! Austin recommended the white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake and it was delicious. It&#39;s everything in one; chocolate, fruit, and cheesecake. <br><br>Can&#39;t wait to try the other flavors of cheese lake next time!

Absolutely love it here and will be back soon. We visited the Kapolei location today around 2 and it was fast to get a booth for 2. Drinks came right away from the bar.
