The appetizer cam out the kitchen really fast after ordering Warm Crab and artichokes with grilled bread was soo good but must be eaten when warm. After it cools you really taste the cream cheese. BF got the spicy chicken gumbo he likes it but it was really spicy but good. I got the lunch size four cheese pasta it was still big enough to eat and have them pack the rest. Dessert was the celebration cheese cake for my first time trying their cheese cake it was pretty good. Not to sweet with a cup of cold milk.
Excellent fast service. We only waited for 15 mins on a busy evening. The waiter was friendly. We got our food in a timely manner. We had an outdoor covered seating area which was so pretty.

Be ready to wait at least two hours. They are so busy so don&#39;t expect full attention. Consider yourself lucky if you get some bread. We had a party of 12 and all of us ate at different times because our food was brought out that way. My daughter was the last one and she got her plate until everyone else was done eating. Some serious bs. She ended up taking her food back to the hotel and at the end just ended up in the trash. It was also so da$&amp; cold in there you could not even enjoy your meal. So NOT worth the $250 bill. Never again at this location!

I had the macadamia crusted ono fish with vegetables. The fish had good flavor but it was very dry. The server was extremely attentive despite how crowed it was. Immediately after my first bite he appeared out of thin air to ask how we liked it. I informed him of the lack of moisture and he immediately offered a sauce to remedy the dish.<br>I suggested honey mustard, which sounds like an unusual combo with ginger fish but it turned out that it complimented the ginger perfectly.<br>My lovely date had shrimp pasta which also had very good flavor. But, the highlight of the night was the red velvet cheesecake. It was well worth the wait.

It&#39;s seems there has been a change in kitchen leadership in the recent weeks. As a loyal customer to this location, I was uncertain why the drastic change in food quality and display. Not sure if the awesome executive chef is on vacation.

Cheesecake Factory makes all their food from scratch everyday day. That&#39;s so cool. I had a strawberry martini. It was beyond delicious and I was buzzing fast. The vegan Cobb salad is awesome. Yum yum.

The Honolulu Cheesecake Factory is without a doubt the best of the Cheesecake Factory franchise, although the wait may be long it is definitely worth it. Our server was extremely attentive and kind, along with the overall kindness of the other employees was a great experience compared to any other Cheesecake Factory I have been to, definitely recommend. There was even a band playing live music, with a great song selection.

One of my favorite places to eat Miso Salmon and of course their delicious desserts. The price is reasonable and when you have a free slice of dessert it&#39;s even better. Love this place and will definitely be back again with my friends. They also raved about the food and free slices. Oh the servers was excellent and the waitress was very great with a friendly sm

The fork and knife are super dirty.  The server is super impolite, I feels like he want to kick me out of the restaurant. We was sitting there 20min without water. I come with my family with all Chinese and we using the Chinese manus. I thing their servers don&#39;t like Chinese. Every time I went there with Chinese family members the server is not good, but when I come with my English speaking friends, the server is awesome. <br>Anyway, the food is good. I like the food only. I still pay tips for the food.<br>The server&#39;s name is Marc C

Located at Royal Hawaiian Center. Busy restaurant! <br><br>Nice outdoor patio seating area, perfect for people watching. <br><br>Food quality is as good as I remember. Huge portion, great for sharing!
Excellent service, ppl very friendly.<br>Waiting line 5-10 minutes which was great for a busy place.<br>Food is amazing

I LOVE THIS PLACE AND THE ENVIRONMENT IS SO WARM AND INVITING. If I could eat here everyday, I would, and I would also have many things to choose from the large variety that the menu holds. It&#39;s a great place to eat for family occasions, dates, or to just chill. They also let my family bring in my mom&#39;s birthday cake and the waitress was more than inviting. Great experience with great food.

I was in Waikiki on vacation and went out for dinner here. Service was wonderful and employees very friendly. There was this employee that was clearing tables by the name Joshua who went above and beyond. I would recommend this place.

This was a surprise for us as s was our first visit. We did not expect much from this chain with its oversized menu but it REALLY delivered.<br>Our waiter, Blaine, was a delight...efficient, upbeat, knowledgeable and charming.<br>I&#39;m a keto eater so ordered some meatballs and my husband had meatloaf. There was some moaning going on...it was THAT good!<br>I followed it up with a low-carb cheesecake and was in Keto Heaven.<br>I&#39;m only sorry we stumbled in on our second to last day...we would have returned.<br>So thanks Blaine and thanks Cheesecake Factory - you made a hard-to-please middle aged couple very happy.
We had spaghetti and steak tacos and the food were good. This place is huge and very busy but the wait is not long at all. The staff are great and so the food.

I&#39;ve only been to this one twice but I&#39;ve been to the other ones around the island and they all are the same. Slow service, flavorless food, but this location tops them because not only did they let us sit in an outside table while the wind blew rain all over us and our bread it took 1 hour and 10 minutes just to get our food after ordering it 40 minutes prior but the waitress couldn&#39;t even remember our drinks and had to wait until our food arrived for us to order our drinks from a different waiter.
So yummy food! I had combination plate with chicken and steak. Their bread is so Ono.

It&#39;s been a couple years since I last dined in at Cheesecake and that was in Sherman Oaks, CA for lunch. On that particular visit, the complimentary bread and Chicken Marsala were very delicious. It was so good, it made my Instagram feed (104 weeks ago! Lol). So, I wanted to recreate the experience in Waikiki.<br><br>At 6:45pm on a Wednesday, the quoted wait time was 30 mins. It was VERY CROWDED inside and out. But, there are plenty of great stores in the vicinity to check out. Or, you can stand in line at the Cheesecake/Take-Out counter to order dessert in advance! Three words: Lemoncello Creme Torte.<br><br>Our pager buzzed within 30 mins, as quoted, but that was really deceiving. We still had to wait another 15 mins once we turned in our pager. There were at least 20 other customers waiting, too. For a moment we thought they forgot about us, so we inquired with one of the hostesses. She explained, once we turn in the pager, it means that our table is being prepared [not ready!]. They will call us by name when our table is ready.<br><br>So, this tall, handsome young man finally calls our party of 2. He was probably the most calm, sincere, and friendly host as we walked from the front to the back of the restaurant. As we approached our table, he asked that we stand to the side to wait a few more moments as they prepare our table. Ha! I don&#39;t know if the restaurant always operates like this, but here&#39;s an idea: page/buzz customers when the table is actually ready!<br><br>Our server tended to us quickly, but at times was talking way too fast I could barely comprehend what he was saying. I felt like the restaurant suckered us in falsely advertising a &#34;short&#34; wait time and now we&#39;re being rushed to order. Well, it took another 45 mins to receive our entrees - maybe that&#39;s why he was talking fast. So in the meantime, we snacked on the complimentary bread, which was not as fresh as I remember. <br><br>Chicken Marsala. The dinner serving was large enough to share between 2-3 people!! So, I ended up packing 3/4 of the plate for home. The bow tie pasta was cooked al dente (which I like). The chicken was tender. The combination of the Marsala sauce and mushrooms was divine. However, after eating a few bites, I was already full (darn you, bread!).<br><br>We also had Fried Calamari. That was actually excellent. Definitely at the top of my list for best calamari in town! Highly recommend it!!<br><br>If you&#39;re willing to wait, the entrees are as great as I can remember.<br><br>No military or kamaaina discounts available.

I love cheesecake factory.  Not only are the cheesecakes the bomb.  Their food is great also.<br><br>For cheesecake, banana cream pie is a must have.  You will thank me later.<br><br>Last night a girlfriend and I had the lettuce wraps and kalua pork nachos.  The servings were huge and tasty.<br><br>You really can&#39;t go wrong with anything in their menu.

We had the spaghetti and also a barbecue chicken salad. Oreo and a sprinkle cheesecake to finish it off. The spaghetti had an Awesome hot flavor that made it exceptional. The bar b que salad had all sorts of great fresh ingredients. The waitress Evangelina was exceptional and very helpful. This place is a go to in Waikiki!

Nick at the bar is hands down amazing. No explanation needed, go see for your self! He truly loves his job and knows how to treat his customers. Had a good time - ended up hanging out there for 2.5 hours. Will 100% visit again.

There are very few places where you can get there at just after 5pm and already have a 50 minute wait, there are fewer places where I would say &#34;yes&#34; to a 50 minute wait and where the reaction to a 50 minute wait is &#34;Oh, that&#39;s not bad.&#34; and there is only one place that I know of on the island where the hostess will tell a party leader that the wait is now 3 hours and they&#39;ll still happily accept it. That place is &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has been a destination for my family for years now, I used to have them take me here on my birthday. Now days though we seldom get the chance to go because of distance and parking and the nighttime craziness that is Waikiki in general, anywho lets break this down into categories again. <br><br>Hostess/Front desk <br><br>I&#39;m giving this its own category in this review simply because of how much time you are likely to spend here. The wait times I&#39;ve witnessed have been anywhere from 45 minutes to 3 hours depending on the time and day. If you really want to try and avoid the wait you need to come in the 3-5pm hours and even then you&#39;ll likely be handed a 20-50 minute wait anyway. <br><br>The people at the front desk do their best to accommodate everyone but please, please keep in mind that these people get swamped all at once by people who speak a variety of languages, there are only 3 to 5 people at that desk for hundreds of people trying to check in, check out, validate parking ect. They will be sluggish occasionally but yelling at them about it will only make their day worse and the wait longer for everyone else so PLEASE SHOW UNDERSTANDING AND RESPECT while you are waiting so everyone can run through as quickly as possible. <br><br>If you get to the Cheesecake Factory too late you might be faced with a line, this line will exit the restaurant and nearly hit the street, in my experience at this point your wait will likely be over an hour. <br><br>They will occasionally run out of pagers too. <br><br>One final thing is that due to how many people there are you can help the line a lot by only sending up one person from your party to wait in line, seriously, like you have no idea how much of a difference that will make with people trying to exit the restaurant with strollers and such. <br><br>Interior and Cleanliness<br><br>I tend to trust restaurants that allow you to see inside their kitchen, they aren&#39;t afraid of showing you what they are doing because they know they have nothing to hide. <br><br>On the inside you have a very sophisticated feeling space, it&#39;s dimly lit with &#34;marble&#34; table tops and rich woods, very well maintained especially considering the amount of people through the space in any given hour. <br><br>Service<br><br>The service here is great, we only had one issue where our server very clearly and specifically asked if my father wanted his soup before or with the main courses and my father very clearly and specifically said he wanted it before hand. The server then said he would get it right away and left. <br><br>We didn&#39;t get it until the main courses came at which point my father sent it back because it was too much food at once, which was a shame, that soup smelled really good. <br><br>Food<br><br>With the amount of food delivered to our table I only tried 3 items personally and I only remember the names of 2 of them. <br><br>The Bacon-bacon Burger (Pictured) : Well cooked with a very nice toasted bun, crossed with bacon and served with the lettuce and such on the side so you can choose if you want it or not. It was spot on, solid 5 star dish <br><br>The everything Pizza (Not Pictured): The dough on their Pizzas is really flavorful and the fresh ingredients pop. The meats had a smokey flavoring to it that was just amazing, complemented nicely by the cheese. <br><br>Crab. . .something. . .crispy Won-tons (Pictured): Yeah, this is the one that I forgot the name for, but these are great. The crab is so creamy and the sauce works well to complete the taste. <br><br>All in all due to the experiences we&#39;ve had over the years I will give The Cheesecake Factory 5 stars despite the issue with the soup, my reason for this is because since we&#39;ve been coming here that has been the only issue we&#39;ve had.

We went tHere last week for my birthday and the food was okay  but the service was horrible. They were changing shifts so our server was  changed he never acknowledged us and never acknowledged us when he finally did he said we look like we&#39;re were blisessful.. huh! It took 45 minutes get our dinner! As a former waitress and hostess I was disgusted.. he acknowledged the other tables but not us!.. I will never go back to this location they need to learn that when you seat a customer you are responsible for them from start to finish!

When you sign up with Yelp to leave a review, you know it&#39;s either REALLY outstanding or REALLY atrocious. It was definitely the latter (much respect to the manager who ended up handling our situation, he was really trying to make things right but our vibe was shot by then). We were so excited to come here after my friends gave the food rave reviews. That quickly dwindled. <br><br>We were given the beeper and a wait time of 50 minutes. No biggie. It beeped 1 hour and 10 minutes later. Hey, at least it beeped, right?! Well from there, we were told to wait around the corner to be seated.  We waited another 50 minutes. If the 6 people at the hostess stand would have been upfront with us, we could have managed. After standing for 10 minutes after our beeper went off, I went to check. I was told &#34;1 minute&#34; 5 different times. It was clear that there was a crowd of at least 10 other parties around us feeling the same way we were. It was super chaotic, extremely loud, and we were not getting a welcoming, aloha spirit. Quite the opposite actually. <br>We were seated over 2 hours later. Server felt our negative energy and kind of fed off of that until we told her what was going on. She was super friendly and helpful after that. They were out of bread, and half of the forks on our table were filthy. Gross! <br>I worked in the restraunt industry for years, which is why we felt the need to tell the server we were leaving and kindly asked for a manager so that we could explain why...because if that was MY restraunt, you bet your a** I would want to know what my hostess staff was up to. Unfriendly, not accommodating, and frustrating guests from the moment they step foot in that place. The manager was super cool, very apologetic and gave us free cheesecake. We truly appreciated that, but not why we told him what we experienced. After a 3 hour fiasco, my family and I left hungry and went to Burger King since everything else was closed. It was our first time ever attempting to eat at this chain and we will never be going back. Save your money and your sanity. And for the love, I hope that manager gets a new job because he is SO much better than The Cheesecake Factory.

Great! Great food and drinks. The desert is awesome! Great little find for Honolulu! The staff is so friendly and accommodating! <br>Well done to all the staff. Although, the wait to get a seat can sometimes be long its worth it. Food choice is in good variety in my opinion and the portions are very generous! Well worth a visit and few more to enjoy the wide selection of delicious foods and desserts on offer. From the moment we got to our table and till the end it was perfection: I felt like our table was a VIP. Highly recommend!

Yesterday my friend and I went there for dinner. I got the meatloaf and my friend got the Shepard&#39;s pie. We got seat really fast but for our server to come and even bring some water was ridiculous. No water for the first 20 mins that we sat down. On top of that the bread didn&#39;t even come before our food. It came with our food... overall the food was really good I&#39;d rate it a 4/5 but service was a 2/5 stars
This was the first time I have been to the cheesecake factory. It was really good they treated us really well. Will definitely go there again I recommend it.  The cheesecake it self is really good.

BLUF:  5 stars for the food, service (thanks to Gloria!) and parking (fairly rare in Waikiki).<br><br>Overall, attentive service, fresh breads, smooth coffee, awesome cheesecake and lots of menu choices.  Sunday brunches only available till 2:00pm<br><br>Bring a jacket though as it is pretty chilly in here.<br><br>(I wrote this a couple of weeks ago....I guess I missed clicking &#34;post&#34;).
Screw this place! Please get WORKING pagers, or take down a mobile number to send a text. <br><br>HORRIBLE wait.

Is there a way to give less than one star?<br><br>This was the worst restaurant experience I have ever had.<br><br>Our bread was so hard, we had to cut the middle out to be able to eat it. And when we asked for more bread, they said they&#39;d bring us back more and never did.<br><br>Our server was named Brandi B and she was terrible. She did not seem happy or have a good attitude at all. <br><br>My friend had asked how an appetizer tasted and Brandi responded, &#34;really good.&#34; <br>My friend then asked which one is her favorite, Brandi responded, &#34;I&#39;m vegan so I can&#39;t eat anything on the menu.&#34; She was of no help when it came to questions about the menu because like she said, &#34;she&#39;s a vegan and can&#39;t eat anything on the menu.&#34; <br><br>I went to Cheesecake Factory all the time on the mainland and ordered the same dish each time. It was my favorite, but when I ordered the pasta carbonara this time, it was extremely salty. It took me forever to finally get Brandi to stop and let her know my food was too salty. I asked her if I could possibly get more peas to add to the dish to try to balance out the salty flavor. She responded, &#34;all our dishes are salty. I don&#39;t know how peas are going to help that.&#34; I responded back, &#34;it will because the peas are bland and will help cancel out the salt.&#34; She responded, &#34;well they&#39;re going to charge you for a side of peas. So I can get you more sauce.&#34; I responded back, &#34;well isn&#39;t it the sauce that is salty?&#34; She replied, &#34;yes.&#34; I said back, &#34;so how is that going to help? I think it&#39;s too salty. But fine, I&#39;ll try it.&#34; <br><br>She went away and I saw her talk to her manager and she came back and said, &#34; I talked to my manager and he&#39;s going to bring you out some peas.&#34; <br><br>I can&#39;t believe how difficult Brandi was when I, the customer, clearly was not satisfied with my meal.<br><br>When the manager came over, he told me, &#34;sorry and  that they get a lot of Koreans coming in saying this dish is too salty. But the dish is supposed to be salty because of the cheese they use. &#34; I don&#39;t know how this statement was supposed to make me feel better. I ordered this dish all the time at other Cheesecake Factory locations and it was never this salty. <br><br>We even ordered cheesecake and I should have packed them up myself because when Brandi packed them up, it looked like she just dumped them into the containers.<br><br>My friend and I contemplated not even giving a tip to Brandi, but decided on both giving a ~12%. I&#39;ve never felt so strongly about giving such a low tip before. After she saw this, she gave my friend and me looks. <br><br>I was also standing up and Brandi walked by and pushed me as she passed!! Someone even told me she deliberately put her arms to her sides as she passed me to push me, instead of saying excuse me and squeezing by. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory used to be my favorite restaurant (people used to buy me gift cards for the restaurant for my birthday)-- but I do not want to go back to this specific restaurant.

After two weeks of enjoying some of the greatest food in Hawaii, my wife and I decided to have a late dinner at The Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki.  We have enjoyed the food and service at this chain restaurant many times.  <br><br>Perhaps it was the hour of 10:30 pm, and I could visibly see that the service team was tired, and after the look warm reception I should have known to look for another option.  Management/ employees-The greeters are is important as the service and the food.  It&#39;s ok to look a person in the eyes and say welcome or Aloha.  And politely ask the new guest to wait for a moment.  I typically find a different restaurant if they can&#39;t properly greet a guest. <br><br>So, management - get more help for the evening rush, because the employees can only do so much.<br><br>But employee issues:<br><br>A customer should not be placed in a corner when there are other tables.  We were seated next to a large person with boundary issues, and a stem wall.  I enjoy eating, so I am also a bigger person. <br><br>A customer should not wait 10 minutes to get water served...thankfully we had bottled water with us.  Considering that when we were served the water had no ice and was room temperature we were actually better off with our Aqua Fina. Oh, and when serving the water it is customary not to blindly hand the water to a person and engage someone else.  Innocent perhaps-but could be considered rude.<br><br>A customer should not be buried under the dishes...it is ok to ask a person (me in this case), can I take your EMPTY plate?<br><br>A customer should get food properly prepared as ordered.<br><br>My plate was Island Poke, and it was good.  No complaints on that entree.<br><br>My wife ordered a pasta plate with no red peppers.  She recurved undercooked pasta and a lot of red peppers.<br><br>But the good news is having a bad dining experience makes the other dinning experiences much more memorable, and helps the dining decision process in the future.  <br><br>Choose wisely!!!!<br><br>Regards

Awesome place for family dinner. Great staff and big portions! Yummy food and dessert!! Added live music definitely added enjoyment and the island sound take on the music was awesome!!! Crazy busy but still well taken cared of!!! :)

I have a gluten, soy, and dairy allergy. 3 people came out to confirm my order that I had to change 2 times.. understandable. But when I get my food and eat my rice. Half way thru there is a layer of soy sauce that I realized I was eating when unnoticed a different taste. The waiter acknowledged it and asked if I  wanted a new serving. I said no thank you. The damage was done and I&#39;ll be in pain probably by the time I get home. Nothing was done about the bill or any other follow up. Sad. I usually pick this chain when I&#39;m traveling as a safe bet. Guess not.<br><br>Update from 4 hours later: the pain is finally going down and def was exposed to gluten and soy from that sauce. Never eating at cheesecake again
Consistent, great tasting food. 9,000 item menu and I&#39;ve still never ordered something I didn&#39;t love.
Always a good bet.  I enjoyed the angel hair pasta with shrimp at the bar.  Friendly bartender and delicious fare.

Being my first time at a Cheesecake Factory where i actually sat down to eat, it was the perfect experience.<br>After waiting for hours at Duke&#39;s just to be disappointed by the menu, we decided to head to the Cheesecake Factory and get on the waiting list. Every time I&#39;ve walked by this restaurant it was packed, and there was a line to wait. So to my surprise when we walk up to get a pager, they actually had a table right then for us. <br>Once we get to the table we are instantly greeted. She tells us what&#39;s good on the drink menu, and then gives us time to decide what we want.<br>She comes back with our drink and recommends an appetizer and then takes the rest of our order down.<br>My friend got the factory burrito, and a manager actually came to the table to let her know it may be a few extra minutes because there had been 9 burritos ordered at once.<br>The plates came out and they were huge portions. everything was definitely worth the money.<br>And of course we ended the night with cheesecake. Everything tasted amazing and they had wonderful service.

This is my favourite chain restaurant to go to...ever and anywhere! Despite the atrocious wait times ranging from 1-2h during peak meal times, I would still recommend their food because whatever you order here is good! I recently came here and ordered the orange chicken for lunch which did not disappoint. The orange chicken was delicious paired with stir fried vegetables and rice. I&#39;ve also had their miso salmon which is also delicious AND cheaper at lunch time! Don&#39;t forget to try their cheesecake! They have 2h validation at the royal hawaiian as well :) great place to come for everyone looking for good food and a good time

For as busy as this area is, especially on a Wednesday night, The Cheesecake Factory was on top of the crowd.  Was able to get seated in the bar area fairly quickly at a high top without having to wait for the dining area.   We ordered a few tasty beverages.  Explore their Hawaiian inspired drinks! You won&#39;t regret it.   The Lava Flow was very good. Tasted like every time you take a sip, you get a different type of fruity flavor! Yum.

The wait was bad... the process is giving you a buzzer, then going to the desk and waiting another 10 minutes while people are leaving and coming in to get a buzzer was super annoying. Wait staff was nice and the food was on par with many other cheesecake factories. I guess it&#39;s our own fault since we knew Waikiki was going to be crazy, it just annoying when you are bumped with your kid in your arms every 10 seconds.
Food was delicious. Service was poor. Wait time was decent. Loved the strawberry lemonade!

Played tourist in Waikiki yesterday and walked past Cheesecake Factory right before lunch hour. No line! We got in with only a five minute wait.<br><br>Service professional and friendly. Obvious that they do a good job hiring. Kale be and Quinoa salad was super fresh and tasty. My son had spaghetti and meatballs. He said it was the best one ever!<br><br>Cheesecake was to die for! Yes, it&#39;s been a while since I&#39;ve eaten here and I forgot just how good their cheesecake is. That&#39;s why they&#39;re called Cheesecake Factory, right? We had the oreo cheesecake and the chocolate truffle ball on the top and the huge oreo cookie was delish. Next time, though, I&#39;m getting the classic. The cheesecake part was so ono!<br><br>Hope to be back sooner than later.

What a great place to have a good meal in Waikiki! Didn&#39;t know the size of this place until my recent visit; it actually stretched to the Royal Hawaiian Hotel because we were able to observe activities there while seated. The food portion was pretty good size and very tasty. I was surprised to tasted their delicious Steak Diane cooked in medium rare. It definitely rival that of a steakhouse. Too bad that we inadvertently ordered too much, and were unable to check out their dessert that looked so appealing. Will definitely give this place another try.

Go for the yummy Cakes, service is poor and food is terrible. Ordered the nachos and got a pile of chips sitting in a pool of melted cheese that looked like craft dinner :/ the Mgr was great took off the bill but that&#39;s not the point the &#34;fresh bread&#34;&#34; brought out was so hard I knew it was sitting out long
I was very impressed with their mushroom burger, it was big, juicy and delicious. Very yummy

Cheesecake Factory was wonderful. I had the chipolte chicken pasta . My hubby had the Diana steak . Excellent choice. Wonderful customer service. Everybody polite bringing that warm delicious bread.  Danger Danger.  I can kill a whole basket with butter.  <br>Two thumbs up.

As always very good food and friendly service staff. Unfortunately the line to be seated is always long as hell. <br>We had a salad and a burger and definitely no space for desert afterwards. <br><br>Bring a jacket, they cool this place down way too much!
Excellent food always and prices are not bad at all for Waikiki! There is a wait here at times but worth it!
Great place to eat! Wide variety of selections and the Orange Chicken was large enough to split into two meals. Cheesecake was great of course!

Had fresh vegetable salad with asparagus, green beans, tomato, cucumber, roasted beets, apple, edamame, radicchio, romaine, white cheddar, with brown bread and vinaigrette dressing. The salad was the appetizer size which was plenty big . It was very tasty. Ate at the bar and the bartender was very friendly and efficient. The brown bread was also delicious

The busiest Cheesecake factory in the U.S. to avoid the lines you have to be there before 5pm. Otherwise you could be waiting over an hour. Service is always good and a large selection of meals. Although they are all chicken or veggie based

Big portions! Great cheesecake! Long wait? <br>Our family loves going here for dinner! We always go early so we don&#39;t have to endure the 30-45 minute typical wait for dinner. When I say early, I mean around 4:30-5pm. <br><br>We love the buffalo blasts!!! Crunchy crispy spicy chicken goodness!! We love the Romano crusted parmesan chicken,  shrimp with angel hair (love it!!!), chicken piccata- such a classic, chicken marsala, Caesar salad (small portion is huge!) and let&#39;s not forget the oh so perfect salmon salad! <br><br>The cheesecake is Devine!!! We have had the key lime, Godiva, strawberry, Oreo, and these do not disappoint!<br><br>The food is always spot on delicious. Always has been and that&#39;s one of the reasons why we keep coming back. That and the customer service is normally great.

Matthew is an awesome server. He managed to memorize all our orders (for a party of 6) and brought it out to the right person. I was surprised that he didn&#39;t have to write anything down. He was also knowledgeable about the menu. He gave good recommendations and went into great detail about what the different dishes taste like.<br><br>I am happy that I had a server like him because he made the dining experience enjoyable. Unfortunately there were a few mishaps during our meal. First off, the AC is just too strong. It&#39;s great compared to the sweltering heat outside but the AC is so strong your hot meal will turn cold in 5 minutes or less. That&#39;s what happened to my plate of crispy chicken Romano. <br><br>Another thing was the cheesecake I ordered was still frozen inside. I still ate it because I love cheesecake, but that might be something I&#39;ll be more cautious of in the future. We told our server Matthew, and he was very apologetic about the situation. He even brought out his manager. The manager did offer a replacement -- which made the dining experience pretty satisfactory. Although my meal had its hiccups, I&#39;m glad the staff actually follow up with you.

Located by Royal Hawaiian shopping center in Waikiki. You already know because of the location, this place is supah packed! Tourists pack this place as well as locals. <br><br>If you don&#39;t mind waiting for 1 hour and a half and have patience  like a saint then do come and join the chaos. The decor is like an old nostalgic museum and oh soooo dark. We had to look at our menu with our cell phone.  Staff is nice as can be, given their working condition.  Atmosphere is oh so hectic and crazy. Not at all relaxing. Not at all surprised, it&#39;s Waikiki. <br><br>After waiting for soooo long for a table, we finally got buzzed and was so famished, we couldn&#39;t wait to eat. Our tables was near vents and it was soooo cold, brrrrr. It was so cold it was miserable. Dare not to ask for another table because didn&#39;t want to wait another 2 hours. <br><br>We were served bread that was soo hard and stale but ate it anyway because we were so hungry. We did let the server know it was hard and stale and she did bring us out another set of bread. The second one was very soft and not at all stale, but we were already full from the first set of bread. <br><br>Soup of the day was potato soup and boy it was good. I don&#39;t know if it was we were famished or not but it looked and tasted very good. 5 stars. <br><br>Shrimp thai rolls was very tasy and good, there was 2 sauces, peanut and a sweeter sauce and they both complimented shrimp roll very well. <br><br>Teriyaki steak was a bit to sweet, not your authentic teriyaki, it was just ok. It was so busy I didn&#39;t realize they forgot the asparagus tempura that comes wiith the teriyaki dish. It was chaos and I just wanted to get out of there. <br><br>Combination steak diane and salmon was average and nothing out of the ordinary. <br><br>Combination steak diane and shrimp was tasy and generic. <br><br>Salad was just ok. <br><br>The best part was the chocolate cheescake. 5 stars. <br><br>The wait here was crazy insane but what to expect in Waikiki. The the food is just ok and not worth going through the chaos and long lines. Probably will return but not anytime soon, I need to get my energy together before i go again.

Where to start. Got there and the place was packed, not sure how we eventually got seated. Anyways they told me wait or 15-20 mins, ended up being close to 50 mins. After that we were seated, a party of 7. The service was pretty good, refilled water and such timely. Food came out pretty fast. I had the macaroni and cheese burger which was pretty good. My wife wife had the pineapple shrimp which she nor I liked very much, you could tell the shrimp wasn&#39;t fresh, and aside from freshness, the sauce and everything wasn&#39;t good. Also one other small thing was the waitress didn&#39;t ask if we wanted split checks, which looking at the party you could kind of tell that we would have wanted split checks. And it took her 15 mins to realize that. Not too disappointed, we were there to socialize anyways so the slow service wasn&#39;t too impactful on my night. I&#39;d suggest going somewhere else, the food and ambiance will be much better. The highlight though was probably the strawberry cheesecake which was actually really good, so probably the only reason to go there is if you want a $10 slice of cheesecake to go.

Been coming to this Cheesecake factory for over 2 years now and in this short time, service is going to shit. Hire the proper staff, train them, and ensure they arent getting high during their day.... stop slacking...<br><br>FYI: Your night time staff is still Amazing!!!
Love The Cheesecake Factory, especially this location!  From the second you walk in to when you are seated ... everyone is so friendly and attentive.   <br><br>Thank you for serving us, Jarvi!

The Cheesecake Factory is an American icon/classic that doesn&#39;t really need much explaining.  Expect mountains of food, be ready to take a doggy bag to take home and reasonable prices.  They have an expansive menu that someone can find something they would like.  Few tips:<br><br>- If you plan to go for dinner, expect a wait for 30 minutes plus if you come past 5:00PM.<br>- A better idea is for brunch/lunch, you can walk right in.<br>- Parking is validated<br>- A good idea to take your out of town guests, if they are picky and don&#39;t want to venture out or not ready for local food.

This place is buzzing all the time and be prepares to wait. They are very efficient though. Once in this place is huge...quite deceiving on the outside. The whole service is excellent and bot rushed. Food was absolutely delicious. Portions are big. The menu has a wide variety of choice for everyone&#39;s taste.

If you can get pass the wait, you will not be disappointed.  That is my mantra when it comes to the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>They continue to provide excellent customer service and have added some awesome healthy options.<br><br>Today I ordered the Super Antioxidant Salad- &#34;A Delicious Blend of Salad Greens, Spinach, Kale, Avocado, Broccoli, Grapes, Roasted Pear, Blueberries, Onion, Sunflower Seeds and Almonds with Lemon-Blueberry Vinaigrette.&#34;  It was amazing.  The Lemon Blueberry Vinaigrette being light, but flavorful.  It was a great combination of salty and sweet which you got in every bite.<br><br>Now, besides my mouth watering salad, I need to do a shout out to our man and best Waiter ever Mathew S.  He was quick, attentive, and even went beyond the call to ensure our needs were meant.  He not only got us fed, he somehow bonded with us as he wrapped with our sons about surfing and enjoying the simple things in life.  That boy needs a raise!  But till he gets that we have him a bit extra on top of the usual 20% because he deserved it.<br><br>I&#39;m again a full and happy girl.  Yay me.<br>-------------------------------------------<br>The best customer service I have ever had here!  Havi gave us exactly what we wanted and more. <br><br>Since I&#39;m always too full for dessert I did cheesecake first.  Went with the classic strawberry cheesecake.  Perfect as always.  <br><br>For dinner we had Shrimp Scampi with extra garlic and cream.  Also with extra sauce on the side.  OUR FAVORITE!  A must for garlic and cream pasta lovers.  The shrimp was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.  Large shrimp- about 6.  <br><br>I also did a falafel salad.  It was HUGE.  Very light and chopped well- very uniformly chopped.  The falafel a we&#39;re not tradition.  The chickpeas were finely ground and rolled into balls.  Not what I&#39;m used to, but taste great.  Would do again.  BUT, so huge that if it isn&#39;t your main course you should share.<br><br>PS- Arrived at about 5pm.  No wait and food came out pretty fast considering this is the busiest Cheesecake Factory in the nation.

Visiting from Japan and have visited this CF location 3 times. None in Japan. Always a good dinner experience. Have never had a bad meal here. Family with me this week and they enjoy this place as much as I do. Tonight tried curry lime chicken. Maybe not back again this trip but will return in the future.

This restaurant is loud . Hard to have a conversation . Wait time more than an hour and a half so be prepared unless there is an empty seat at the bar . Food is on the expensive side . Wide variety of beers available. Cheesecake menu is extensive . Can&#39;t go wrong with any choice they are all delicious .

Food is always great... and service wasn&#39;t that bad either could have been better if the waiter was more attentive. It&#39;s always loud in there so be sure to speak up when your with your partner or whoever your dining with

So I love the Cheesecake Factory - but take out should be infinitely easier here.  Their staff don&#39;t know the process - I waited in the bakery line for 20 minutes when I didn&#39;t need to.  The place was a sea of chaos and not being managed well at all.

I&#39;m gonna miss this place. We don&#39;t have anything like this in Australia. 10/10. Even if one waiter on one of our visits was a little slow. <br><br>My chips were cold on yesterday&#39;s feast but I&#39;m sure if I brought it up they would have fixed it. I didn&#39;t bother because I was pretty full already from the fish. <br><br>Anyway. I&#39;m going again right now. Think I might have the pork chop which would be my favourite this past few visits.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! There are plenty of options for everyone. I enjoy the vegan Cobb salad, miso salmon, chicken club &amp; their sangrias ! I also recommend asking for their brown bread, it&#39;s more tastier and softer than the white. <br><br>Service with Kijung is always amazing, he shares his honest opinions &amp; options. My food always comes out enjoyable, considering that I&#39;m a picky eater. <br><br>If I lived by Waikiki, I would go way too often!

Great service and food was as good as I expect from them. The wait for a party of 6 on a Wednesday night was less than 30 minutes. Live music was a great bonus. The musician was great and played some really great island versions of 90&#39;s and 2000&#39;s classics. <br><br>We sat under an AC vent that had terrible condensation so we had drops of water all over us throughout the dinner. Other than that it was a great experience. <br><br>We try to avoid the spots that are available state-side but this was a good treat and a different experience being in Waikiki beach area. Close to great shopping and walkable sights. Parking was free at the Royal Hawaiian Center with validation so that was a plus. <br><br>Would recommend if you just want a really good American menu and of course the infamous cheesecake for dessert.

Their food never disappoints!  This time tried the Miso Salmon Lunch Special.  I was pleasantly surprised at the richness of the Miso flavor without it being too sweet or over powering.  And so very happy that they were able to replace the rice with a toss salad!<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is always busy and service was good considering how busy they can be.  We had to wait a while for our food and to have our drinks refilled but thankful for our friendly server.

I&#39;ve been here several times, whether I needed a fall back for a large meal, or was having dessert cravings. The staff is very friendly, they rarely run out of menu items, and the timing they serve food is good. It isn&#39;t too noisy despite it being crowded either. You can&#39;t go wrong in terms of finding something you&#39;d like. Their menu is so big it has something for everyone. Their cheesecake and cakes are in the same boat. They have dozens of desserts  to choose from. The only bad thing about this place is the line to get in is usually very long. If you go on an off hour, you should be OK. You could also get takeout to bring back to your hotel room if you are staying in the area. Other than that, I would recommend it, especially if you haven&#39;t been here.

Even though Cheesecake Factory is a &#34;chain&#34; restaurant, the experience doesn&#39;t feel like that at all.  The menu is a novel, but that basically means there&#39;s something for everyone.  My personal favorites are the following (all 9/10 or 10/10 dishes in my opinion):<br><br>Fried Calamari: The breading is light and flaky, comes with a garlic aioli sauce and marinara sauce.  Sometimes it can be a bit too salty, but 9 times out of 10 it&#39;s a good dish.<br><br>Caesar Salad: The &#34;appetizer&#34; size feeds about 3-4 people; when my parents and I get the calamari and Caesar salads, we&#39;re full by the time our entrees come.<br><br>Factory Nachos: The tortilla chips are really tasty and unique, the cheese sauce has hints of American cheese if that&#39;s your thing, but there are also Mexican cheeses as well.  Comes with guac, sour cream, and a lot of other fixings.  <br><br>Fish Tacos (tempura style): Four fish tacos that comes with Spanish rice and beans.<br><br>Cuban Sandwich: Ham, Swiss cheese, kalua pig, mustard, and pickles.<br><br>California Cheese-Steak Sandwich: Basically steak, cheese, and peppers; simplicity is sometimes a good thing.<br><br>Pasta Da Vinci: I get this with linguine (originally comes with penne, which I don&#39;t think absorbs the sauce as well); comes with chicken and mushrooms in a wine sauce.<br><br>Now...for the CHEESECAKES:<br><br>S&#39;Mores Cheesecake and Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake.  I love the graham cracker crust on the S&#39;Mores Cheesecake.  Get both and have your stomach thank me later.<br><br>Go early for lunch (~11AM/12PM) if you want to beat the lines , or early dinner time (~5PM/6PM) as this place gets packed.  Otherwise, call ahead for takeout is your best bet.<br><br>One last note on customer service: I feel like Cheesecake Factory definitely puts an emphasis on this when they train their employees (sometimes you can just tell).  Over the several years I&#39;ve been going to this location, I have never had a bad customer service experience - I also want to give a thank you to one cashier (I believe her name was Nicole), who comped us a cheesecake after my girlfriend and I noticed we were missing salad dressing in our takeout order.
As always, Cheesecake Factory delivers a delicious meal. Our wait was 50min on a Sunday night for the patio which was alright. The service was good and we had a great time, what more can I say? Haha

As basic as it is to visit while traveling, I&#39;m so happy that I did! This was probably the highlight of my trip, I recommend sitting on the outdoor patio that faces forever 21 because they have cool tiki torches that really give you the Hawaiian feel<br><br>Location: It is located right on the main strip where many of the stores are as well as the mall. It&#39;s right next door to the huge Forever 21  which will be my next review (make sure to go here next).<br><br>Wait time: Make sure you come either really late at night or early before lunch because I remember my tour guide driver mentioning that this is the busiest and most visited Cheesecake Factory around the world (not sure how true that is, but the wait line definitely felt that way)! Still worth it, you can even put your name down and then go to forever 21 next door that&#39;s what I did lol<br><br>Service: I had the best server she was so nice and down to earth! I&#39;ve never had bad experience waiter/waitress wise at Cheesecake Factory<br><br>Food/drink: For food I highly recommend both the factory grande burrito and the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. You can&#39;t go wrong with either they&#39;re both so tasty and filling! For drinks I suggest getting the pineapple or blueberry mojitos, they&#39;re strong and refreshing!

My friends and I came here for their new Happy Hour. We are residents of Waikiki and were hoping to find a new happy hour restaurant we could enjoy on a regular basis.<br><br>Our young man server was very nice. However, we had to flag him to order drinks and food after waiting 20 minutes. I don&#39;t think we were in his section. So we thought that was nice of him to attend to us. The drinks arrived 10 min later and the small happy hour dishes arrived 10 minutes after that. Unfortunately my order was incorrect (chicken instead of beef). 20 minutes later, my friends had finished eating and my food had not yet arrived. We called over the manager. He told us he just came on shift and didn&#39;t know anything about our order. He kept asking, &#34;What did you order?&#34;, without letting me explain the situation. He just didn&#39;t want to hear and seemed irritated. He never returned to inform me of any resolution. 20 minutes later, my food (now to go) arrived by another server. When I took it home, I discovered the onions had not been included. It&#39;s the sauteed onions that make the burgers better than McDonalds. The mojito tasted sweet and minty, but I could not taste the rum. It was very weak. I called the restaurant and was refunded the $7.50 for the burgers. The woman with whom I spoke was nice and attentive. If I was the manager, I would have comped the drink as well, considering the very poor overall experience.<br><br>My friends noted the spinach dip and the avocado egg rolls were quite good. The hamburgers were disappointing.<br><br>In summary: nice wait staff, some food good, weak drinks, poor management, and apparently a chaotic kitchen. This restaurant is always busy and often has lines, so there must be redeeming qualities. My friends and I, however, will keep looking for a new happy hour hang out.

Good variety selection of varies types of food. The wait can be VERY long..so plan some hours ahead..wait staff is friendly and personable and I&#39;m sure everyone in your party can find something they like that fit their taste buds.

Pros - food, ambience and customer service js typical like any other cheesecake.<br>Cons - Very unbearable chilled A/C. It was hot outside at Waikiki and so we were wearing shorts. Inside this location, we were freezing.

Ronnie was the BEST server. So attentive and so very kind! Thank you for our pleasant visit to Cheesecake. We always come here on our visits to Hawaii. We appreciate you for your hard work on Christmas Eve Ronnie! Merry Christmas Ronnie

I came here the other day and had Joe B. as my server. He was super energetic and gave amazing service. He was very helpful and gave everything that I needed really quickly. I got the orange chicken and can I say, that was the best orange chicken I&#39;ve ever had. I asked what he would recommend to eat for dessert and it was amazing! Thanks Joe B for such an amazing experience! Definitely will be heading back soon!

My first time to make a take-out order &amp; it worked perfectly. I pre-ordered &amp; everything was ready when I got there, nice &amp; hot,  in the time I was told it&#39;d be ready. <br><br>It was less crowded at this time so I didn&#39;t have to wait; just paid after making sure I had everything. The cashier was very attentive &amp; thorough, even volunteering the info about National Cheesecake Day. On July 30 &amp; 31, any slice of cheesecakes will be half price!
Kind of heavy food. Very good quesadillas, they say that they&#39;re appetizers but they honestly also work as a whole meal. The burgers are also pretty good.

Terrible food, rude staff, definitely not worth the wait. <br>Our waitress, Julie, obviously hates her job. She then takes it out on her customers. Her attitude is condescending along with her behavior that everything is an inconvenience. <br>I ordered the macadamia nut crusted Hawaiian sea food. It was over cooked and dry. I sent it back. The manager never came over to apologize and offer something complimentary. <br>I rarely not leave a tip. This was one of those times.

Friendly staff. No reservations allowed. I always get the Spicy Ahi roll for appetizers! Everything on the menu is delish! <br><br>However, lines are always an hour long wait (the least) during evening weekends

I am so satisfied with this Cheesecake factory...Ian and Nina(bartenders)...were AWESOME!!...It took me time to order because I&#39;m on the Keto diet...I studied nutritional chart before coming, but still had questions...those two answered all my questions and was very patient.  If they didnt know the answer, they asked.  I ended up ordering  buffalo chicken wings and only eating 4 and 5 stalks of celery...so I only had 8 carbs...I&#39;m still keto&#39;n..and I&#39;m very pleased!

Great place to take the family. Food is fantastic, well cooked. Chef&#39;s know what they&#39;re doing here. Portion sizes seem just right for majority of meals. The steaks melt in your mouth and I was even surprised at how much flavour they got out of the vegetables.<br><br>The drinks are made very well, possibly best Lava Flow in Hawaii. <br><br>The lighting is dim and sets a great mood. The only downside is expect a long wait time during usual peak meal hours (1+ hour) <br><br>And of course experiences are different with different servers. <br><br>Our first visit we had a great server that continued to top up drinks and check if we needed anything. The second visit we had to flag someone down for anything. Overall 4/5

Sigh.  Here comes the truth.  After years of eating at TCF, I&#39;m beginning to realize that while they make A LOT of food, and give enormous amounts, it&#39;s also not the best tasting, though a few dishes still rock my boat. <br><br>ATMOSPHERE:<br>Busy and noisy.  This is the highest-grossing CF in the USA.  Seating capacity is big.  There&#39;s 2 outdoor lanais, big bar, and bakery counter. <br><br>FOOD:<br>Caesar Salad - The appetizer portion was huge and big enough for two, comfortably for three to share.  Pretty to look at, but the dressing was too tangy for me.  CPK does a better job. <br><br>Fried Mac &amp; Cheese - Anything deep fried is awesome right?  Big breaded balls of mac &amp; cheese over a marinara sauce.  This is an app but is huge!  Make sure you can share or devour a lot.<br><br>Ahi Carpaccio - Super thin ahi with a wasabi pesto drizzle (couldn&#39;t taste the wasabi which is awesome to me,) sliced avocado and a togarashi aioli for dipping.  Taste was great but the thin slices results in a plate looking like a fish autopsy after trying to pick out your portion.<br><br>Shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo - This is my ultimate favorite dish here.  I absolutely LOVE gumbo, and I love rice.  It&#39;s like a chunky soup, full of flavor with a kick.  <br><br>Chicken Marsala - The chicken was tender and the mushrooms plentiful, but the sauce is way too sweet for me.  It comes with bow tie pasta.  I once substituted the bow ties for linguine - boy was that a big mistake.  They put nearly 1/2 pound of pasta on the plate with the same minuscule amount of sauce on the normal dish.  <br><br>Chicken Madeira - This dish is better than the marsala IMO because it has more depth than the overly sweet marsala.  Comes with mashed potatoes. <br><br>Pasta Carbonara - The ratio of spaghettini pasta to sauce was 70% pasta, 30% sauce which resulted in a very bland dish.  <br><br>Cajun Jambalaya Pasta - The linguine was al dente and the chicken and shrimp plentiful, but overall very underwhelming.  CPK does a way better version. <br><br>Salisbury Steak - Great flavor with a nice crunchy exterior.  Mashed potatoes were okay but could&#39;ve used some flavor (or a more generous amount of gravy.)  To my local peeps, it&#39;s a hamburger steak but formed into the shape of a steak instead of round patties.<br><br>Bistro Shrimp Pasta - I had high hopes for this 1,900 calorie dish.  What a disappointment!  The breading of the shrimp had the consistency of breakfast potatoes, and fell off the shrimp in chunks.  The shrimp had no flavor.  Not being not a fan of arugula, I couldn&#39;t taste them, thankfully.  The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, and that was the only highlight.<br><br>Shrimp Scampi &amp; Steak Diane Combo - After seeing pics of this, I had to try it.  I thought the scampi came with pasta underneath but didn&#39;t.  The 3 shrimp were deep fried and nicely seasoned in a tomato-onion drizzle.  The steak was tender and tasty, in a slightly sweet brown sauce and topped with a few mushrooms.  A wall of mashed potatoes separated the two down the middle.  Highly recommended. <br><br>DESSERT:<br>Red Velvet Cheesecake - It looks awesome in the pic, but I didn&#39;t care for the taste of cheesecake together with red velvet cake.  I prefer them separate. <br><br>Strawberry Shortcake - Not too sweet which is great.<br><br>Banana Cream Cheesecake - Bananas + cheesecake = OMG.<br><br>Strawberry Cheesecake - Same as the banana verdict.<br><br>Original Cheesecake - My boring favorite!  Super light and creamy.  Unbelievable!<br><br>SERVICE:<br>They do not take reservations.  Be prepared to wait up to 2 hours on weekend nights.  The staff are friendly, even in the most hectic of environments.  We recently had Darren F as a server.  What a super friendly, smiley, and professional guy!  Good deal!<br><br>TIP:<br>Avoid the crowds by coming for lunch or late night since they&#39;re open till midnight. <br><br>OVERALL:<br>Generous portions, some subpar selections, weak pasta dishes, but they do have the best cheesecakes around.

I was in Hawaii for 2 weeks my day and trip was ruined by big nose Bianca at the cash register by the take way section. I was miss treated by Bianca she told me to take my food and eat at the beach when I requested to be seated at the bar for drinks. We ordered food and deserts for $100 she was very negative and made it feel like I was not welcome there at all. The manager helped us and sat us down to eat right away and apologized for her rude behavior towards us. Bianca should be fired since she doesn&#39;t know how to treat customers at all. Very disrespectful Man

I&#39;ve dine here once, and have picked up Cheesecakes WAY more than I should (I do work next door). Anyways, I always thought they ONLY did pasta dishes because my friends always told me their pastas are good, but NOPE! <br><br>Cheesecake Factory (according to our server) makes everything using fresh ingredients. Their menu is ginormous. They have so many options, and the pages in the menu seem endless. I ended up going with pasta, my sister had a burger, one friend had the chicken parm, and the other one had a soup+salad combo. Everyone enjoyed. The service was good, and fast. <br><br>Price was pretty high end, but I expect that being in Waikiki. I usually do not order pasta because it&#39;s so cheap and the mark-up. I probably won&#39;t order a pasta next time, because my wallet can&#39;t handle that lol. But I&#39;d try some of the other items. <br><br>Their cheesecake, you can order at the table or by the front where their displays are. They have a lot of variety you can pick from. I am also assuming all cheesecakes are also made from fresh ingredients every day. I like their texture because they&#39;re so light and airy, not the grocery store brand where it&#39;s heavy and thick. Sometimes they have seasonal flavors, like peppermint bark for Christmas season. Their Pumpkin spice sticks around from Oct-Dec. <br><br>Parking: Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center validates for them. <br><br>If you go for dinner, get there early. They can get packed and the wait can be for 2+ hours. I would avoid during long weekends or holidays. <br><br>ALSO if you have issues with tables being so closed to yours, you probably don&#39;t want to come here, as someone can be RIGHT behind you. CF makes use of their space.

These guys do food and cheeesecake well! Massive portions, delicious and reasonably priced for Hawaii. If you don&#39;t finish the monster meals they do takeaways nicely packed too. Food presentation is sometimes sloppy but hey you can&#39;t have everything...recommend any cheesecake but the cookie dough is probably my favourite. They also do a great Sunday brunch served till 2pm and if you&#39;re staying across the road at the holiday inn it&#39;s probably the closest brekky option. Try the  grilled chicken and waffle eggs benedict(?!) it&#39;s surprisingly good! <br>Kids brekky is fruit, French toast and bacon...French toast is def an adult portion every portion is soooo large geez<br>Coffee is acceptable here too which is rare in Hawaii (possibly the biggest downer for coffee addicts like me in Hawaii, is the disappointing coffee)
Love the Red Velvet Cheesecake, going step out of comfort zone and try something different

The wait here is usually long but this review is based on the recent occasion that I experienced.<br><br>We went about 1 p.m. and was seated within 10 minutes and since it was only 2 of us, I figured that&#39;s why we got seated fast.  We were seated all the way in the back by open windows which was pretty neat since I haven&#39;t sat there before. It was such a nice breeze from outside.<br><br>Instead of ordering main dishes, we decided to just order from the appetizers. We got french fries, firecracker salmon and spicy ahi rolls. They were all pretty filling and good. Although it was pretty busy that day, the service was good.<br><br>They have one of the best cheesecakes are definitely known for them hence the name of their restaurant. One of my favorites is the strawberry cheesecake.

Claudia was fantastic! We&#39;ve gone to MANY Cheesecake Factory locations in California, and because of Claudia&#39;s service, this one was top-notch. She made sure our water glasses were never empty, and that we enjoyed everything we ordered. Yara, the manager is great too! If we lived in Hawaii (which we wish we did ), we&#39;d be regulars! Keep up the great work!

So, this is one of my favorite cheesecake place!!! If you haven&#39;t gone here yet well here&#39;s your chance.<br><br>It&#39;s really busy when it hits evening time. So you have to come here before the sun goes down! I usually come here during lunch time cuz that&#39;s when not much people go eat in. I come here because their pasta is delicious and there Oreo cheesecake is the bomb!!! <br><br>I always get some cheesecake before I leave cuz I know that I&#39;m not coming back for a while and I love there cheesecake!! They have all kinds of cheesecake not just strawberry. They have regular cheesecake, strawberry cheesecake, lime cheesecake, Oreo cheesecake, chocolate cheesecake, etc. <br><br>They have a lot on the menu so take your time and pick wisely because it&#39;s a lot of food to choose from:) <br><br>If your a cheesecake lover come here to eat!

This is right in the heart of Waikiki so prepare to WAIT! We waited 2 hours last time, absolutely nuts. <br><br>Service is always good, food is just OK. My husband absolutely hated his orange chicken, and he isn&#39;t a picky eater. Cheesecake isn&#39;t my fave but everyone else is Gaga for it.

Not my pick but went to celebrate a birthday with the fam. The birthday girl who chose the place was very happy to be there. The menu is extensive the food just mediocre in my opinion. I had the gumbo someone else had the steak Diane some shrimp pasta was ordered and a Cobb salad. The crab and artichoke appetizer was good, and the kids love their sliders and bowtie pasta. Everyone comes here for dessert really, let&#39;s just be honest. We had shared a Smore&#39;s cheesecake, a red velvet cheesecake, and the kids had an ice cream sundae. Of course no one finished their dinner or their dessert and we all went home with doggy bags. It&#39;s always nice to go out into Waikiki. Even if it&#39;s crowded and full of tourists it&#39;s nice to just do something different once in a while instead of the normal neighborhood restaurants we always tend to go to.

Who doesn&#39;t love Cheesecake Factory? People come from near and far(we drive an hour plus) to enjoy their delicious food. Whether you like Asian fusion, Island Rim, American or Italian they pretty much offer it all. Not everyone that comes here come for the cheesecake(I&#39;m partial to that) but the food and service is so good we don&#39;t really care that you even have cheesecake most of the time. The cheesecake selection is the cherry on top of your great experience your bound to have. <br>My BIGGEST recommendation is to go early for dinner, I don&#39;t care what day of the week it is. I&#39;d say on average what time is 30-45min on a good day. It&#39;s not unusual to wait almost 2hrs for dinners on the weekends  and it normally doesn&#39;t turn anyone away and that in itself speaks for this place. If you haven&#39;t been here yet, you should be asking yourself why you haven&#39;t. <br><br>Here are a few of my favs for several years:<br>Apps:Spicy Ahi Tempura Roll, Fried Macaroni &amp; Cheese<br>Entree: Miso Salmon, Hibachi Steak, Chicken Madeira, garlic noodles <br>Cheesecake: Dulce de Leche, Oreo, Salted Caramel, Snickers <br>  <br>It&#39;s always a treat to come back, so I&#39;m happy to be here tonight ordering my favs w/my favs.

Hi Yelpers,<br><br>    This a late post from Halloween 2017, decided to grab a drink and some food after walking the Waikiki strip and taking so many photos. So we decided to stop at Cheesecake Factory as the line was short for once. We sat at a table and moved to a bar table no boggy but if they we closing why it matter who knows lol.<br>     And that&#39;s where it went downhill.... I won&#39;t say name just cause it was that bad but damn, she came by after a few minutes took our drink order and food order and I was first to order. She seemed nice enough or so I thought. <br>     Let&#39;s just say in short she didn&#39;t put my order in and showed no remorse blaming me saying o asked her a quest not a statement.. question was can I get the salmon appetizer? She then told my friend that they were out of the crab artichoke dip so just get the artichoke dip as it&#39;s still a dip, and just be glad you have something! (Rude) <br>    Then she ignored our table the rest of the night to the point where she literally walked around the section looking away from it and we had to ask silverware and water from other people as she was clearly ignore us and the other table, all they wanted to do was pay! <br>     Needless to say I was upset at not getting any food or refill on drinks  or even water. I can understand making a mistake on an order but to be rude and ignore us was just in called for. Lastly to add insult to injury the bathrooms was disgusting! <br>    I will never return to this location again which is a shame as I like their food and live close.

Yeahhhh people are crazy to wait in the consistently long lines at Cheesecake Factory. I don&#39;t understand why it&#39;s so popular. You&#39;re literally feet away from one of the world&#39;s most famous beaches, yet Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t even have an ocean view. They offer mediocre American food at high prices. If you want to pay this much for food, you should at least go somewhere with a view. Maybe the kitchen fire a couple years ago made this some kind of weird special attraction. No, that can&#39;t be it. Obviously these people don&#39;t use yelp to find better restaurants in waikiki (I know, it can be hard). <br><br>Ok, I get that their cheesecake is good. That&#39;s pretty much where I draw the line though. I wouldn&#39;t come back for anything but the cheesecake. And even when I do come back to pick up cheesecake, there&#39;s always a line at the counter and the cashiers are rude. <br><br>This place will always be busy (unless they try to burn down the building again) because they&#39;re so centrally located in waikiki and people passing by just can&#39;t help themselves. When you&#39;ve flown thousands of miles to paradise, why don&#39;t wouldn&#39;t you want to try local food?

Absolutely the last time I will eat at the Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki! the service is just terrible! I had a problem with one of the dishes we ordered, I asked before I made the ordered for something specific. When the food came to The table I told our waitress(Autumn)that it&#39;s not what we asked for. She told us that we are right and she will call the manager(Bryan packer) so he could help us out.<br>When Bryan came to the table(after 15 min)and he was the one that &#34;sepose&#34;to help us out, but unfortunately he was super rude and  extremely not nice

They seated us super quick which was great at 8pm on a Friday.  We unfortunately did not get our appetizer until 30 minutes later and it was the wrong app, we ordered nachos and because the waiter didn&#39;t write down our order he mixed it up with quesadillas.  Then we ate the entire plate and had no room for dinner which took forever to come.  Had to ask management to take the appetizer off our bill because we felt we waited way too long and it ruined our happy go lucky dinner because we were starving.

Very busy, Nice &amp; clean place. Food was decent but not great &amp; although it was displayed nicely. My steak was over cooked with a few parts burnt. Service was slow. We asked for extra bread from our server &amp; he came back 5 times without it. It&#39;s very dark throughout the restaurant including the restrooms. The lighting could be a notch higher &amp; still be at a good setting. It was a strain on our eyes to try to look at the menu. We needed to turn on our flashlights on our phones to help.

Although I don&#39;t seek out chain restaurants the rest of the family wanted to eat here. It was quite busy but they seated us when they said they would. There was live music and great service.  The food was fresh and hot albeit being chain food.  A solid choice with a huge menu if you&#39;re trying to find something for everyone.

Great food. My family enjoys going here. Aside from the long wait, the staff are always friendly, and accommodating. the food is always delicious. The cheesecakes are to die for. The price for each slice is pricey, especially when you buy 2 or 3 slices like me. lol But this is a great family restaurant. just be prepared to wait in line for 20 plus mins, 30 plus after 530pm. longer on weekends.

The lines here are insane.  Insane.  <br><br>Lots of tourists because it&#39;s a safe choice in Waikiki.  My friend and her son really wanted to eat here so we endured the wait.  <br><br>Once we were seated, bread and water were immediately brought out.  Service was excellent and our entrees came out super fast.  <br> <br>The best part of my meal were the generous wine pours!  Love!!!<br><br>Save room for dessert and TIP your servers!!!
Great food and wonderful service. Our waiter Jacob was very friendly and helpful. Thanks and we will be back!!

I picked up just one cheesecake here. Of course cheesecake was so great. But I was very disappointed that cashier was so rude. Two cashier didn&#39;t stop chat when I standing in front of the counter. They continued chat like I&#39;m invisible person. Plus, what made me upset is she demanded me to leave the tip on the receipt. Seriously? I think waiter deserve it but i don&#39;t think they deserve it with that rudeness

Came here after a movie. Had the Avocado egg rolls, lettuce wraps, and ended it with a Mango Key Lime Cheesecake. The food is always good here, but the wait is long. We waited approximately 40 minutes. This was on a Saturday night. Typical weekend for Waikiki. Service was great and we didn&#39;t have to wait long for our food. <br><br>Am I the only one who likes the wheat bread more than the sourdough? haha. Will come back just for the bread!

Busy place with a phone book of a menu, this restaurant has something for everyone. From salads to fish and pasta, there&#39;s always good food for any meal. This restaurant is one of the better &#34;corporate ones&#34; with staff willing to please. Service on the food is as fast as possible, which can be a little slow sometimes.<br><br>The decor of the restaurant is consistent with others in the chain, which is dark, cold, but nice. If you want to still feel like you&#39;re in Hawaii, sit outside. The tables there overlook busy Kalakaua Avenue, which is a bustling tourist street at any hour.<br><br>Great for dinner, my favorite meal here is the special Sunday brunch. I love the various eggs benefict dishes, especially the salmon and tomato. The bottomless drinks are amazing, one of my favorite ice teas around. If you&#39;re used to bread service, this is one of the only restaurants in the state that offers it- white and hearty wheat.  Great place for families, dates, or a dinner alone.

This was our first stop when we flew in and it was late and we were hungry. Knowing they typically have vegan options. The vegan cob salad they sold out of, which was very disappointing. Obviously vegans are in high demand in this area and there aren&#39;t many options. The waiter was so nice, I don&#39;t remember her name but she was very helpful with us trying to decide. We ended up getting the vegan burger, after some confusion but it was very good! As well as the avocado toast! The manager even came out to make sure everything was good! Hopefully they can stock up in vegan options! They might be the only good option in the area!

I went in around 4pm hoping to just grab a drink and happy hour bites. But to my surprise they don&#39;t have happy hour at this location. Luckily I could still order off the lunch menu and had some delicious miso salmon.

Went here the past weekend to grab some lunch with my friends. It was a Sunday so I was expecting a long wait, since we had a limo stroller for twins as well. When I told them that I had a stroller they were very very accommodating! The wait was supposed to be 45 mins long but we had a pleasant surprise when they called us after fifteen minutes! <br><br>The service is always very good at this cheesecake factory. <br><br>The food was delish! Friend got the macaroni and cheese burger which was very filling but very good! Then I ordered their gumbo. The gumbo was ok, I&#39;ve had better. I think it lacked spices. The presentation was very pretty but like I said I&#39;ve had better. Their menu is so massive!!! I would personally cut it down to half and just pick their best sellers because some items on their menu are not worth ordering.<br><br>When it comes to alcohol I think they do it right! I&#39;ve never had a bad drink here! We ordered a margarita which was nice and strong. <br><br>Last but not least their cheese cake!!!!! It doesn&#39;t matter which on one you order, they are all so so so good! My favorite it the white chocalates rasberry! Oreo would be my second favorite, but like I said you can&#39;t order a bad one at cheesecake factory!<br><br>P.s They have brunch on Sundays

This is a sensational location for dinner.<br><br>Meals are HUGE and the desserts are awesome - best cheesecake on the planet<br><br>You have to wait to get a table almost all of the time but it is worth it.

Going to Cheesecake Factory on a Saturday night is something I wouldn&#39;t recommend to anyone. It was so crowded and so many people were just waiting for a table. People were being told that the wait was two hours long! Luckily we outsmarted them and called ahead to make reservations. We just had to wait 15 minutes for our table. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory has a very long extensive menu and it was difficult to decide what to eat. I have so many food restrictions in my diet and many of their items are on my do not eat list. I decided on Fettucine Alfredo. My husband and our friend got the Hibachi Steak. He was originally going to get a burger but changed his mind because of our waiter. <br><br>Our waiter was a very charismatic guy. He made us feel very welcomed when he greeted us at the table and he shared the staff favorites. One of them was the Hibachi Steak. He raved about the sauce and the meat and that sold my husband. So no burger and instead he got the steak. <br><br>My husband really enjoyed his steak. I didn&#39;t really care for my Alfredo. It seemed like it was lacking something, like pepper or something. It tasted so plain. <br><br>So I guess I give three stars to my dinner, four stars to the waiter, and of course five stars for the delicious cheesecake.

If you get tired of the food in the downtown Waikiki area or just want a good meal, go here. We went on a Saturday night and it was not too much of wait but very busy. Again, it&#39;s very busy and very crowded in the lobby so sit outside while you wait and wish for the buzzer to vibrate or sit at the bar. <br><br>We actually got seated outside which was kind of nice whereas you can people watch as your view is of the main street. Also it was quieter so you could actually hear each other talk. <br><br>Our waitress was very attentive even with all the people there and tables that she was attending to. You could tell that she had been doing this for a while. We placed our drink order and our meal order and the procession of things was very smooth and fluid. There wasn&#39;t really a huge amount of down time or awkward sitting and waiting for a waiter to come back out to check on things. <br><br>I got a five cheese pasta that was very rich but very good. I decided to save room for some cheesecake because let&#39;s be real...why come to Cheesecake Factory and not get some great cheesecakes. There really is a lot of overall selection on the cheesecake menu. There weren&#39;t a huge amount of options for vegetarians but they were happy to add or remove items from most of the entrees to accommodate. <br><br>It was my sister&#39;s birthday so it really was just a nice way to still relax on vacation, have a good solid meal/service and just enjoy each other&#39;s company. <br><br>Total $80 +tip for us two but we got appetizers, drinks, entrees, and cheese cake, so I think money well spent.

First off obviously the wait here is out of control. But if you do just want a cheesecake you can go in and on the right side they have a smaller line for those; the cheesecake tastes great, the prices are high but it is occasionally worth it as a splurge.<br>As for the food it is very good but considering the prices and the average 1 hour wait at least, I will not be going here very often at all... really like never basically...<br><br>The service was okay, everyone was generally polite and nice but we did have to wait a little while for things like water. It seems as though the servers are good but perhaps have too many tables. It stays super busy. <br>Also they do validate parking I believe we park at the Sheraton and they validate it. Of course that is a decent walk away. <br>Overall I&#39;ve been to many cheesecake factories and they generally are good. This one is no exception but the prices and wait make it not worth it. Those are my only gripes though.

AMAZING SERVICE FROM TYLER T!!!<br><br>Sometimes, it&#39;s nice to just slow down and visit a classic favorite, and tonight was one of those nights. Tyler was attentive, engaging, and not at al absent or overbearing, which is a difficult balance for many servers to find. <br><br>Kids meals came out quickly, Appetizer cake at an appropriate rate, and dinner came almost immediately after the appetizer plate was cleared away and the drinks were refreshed. <br><br>The food was as delicious as always, although the jalapeños on the factory nachos had absolutely zero bite: my 1st grader was eating them without blinking. The seared ahi was delicious, and the toddler devoured the kid&#39;s salmon! The spicy cashew chicken here was better than at other locations on the mainland, so whatever your staff is doing to it, keep it up! <br><br>It was fun to come back to an old favorite tonight, and we look forward to returning to the Honolulu CF again soon! <br><br>*PS: Ask for Tyler&#39;s Section! He was OUTSTANDING!<br>*PSS: Unless you&#39;re a lousy tipper, then just don&#39;t go.

Timing your meals is crucial with coming here. If you end up here during dinner time, there is always a lengthy wait. I ordered the meatloaf and it was pleasant (for a meatloaf). The cheesecakes here are delicious and are a must if you don&#39;t frequent this place. This place gets 5 stars for portion size but it does outshine the quality. The menu is large and there is something for everyone. The vegan Cobb salad is probably my favourite salad of all time.
