Nicole our hostess was fetchin amazing! She was super nice and made us feel welcomed. (She needs a raise or something... at least an enthusiast high five). Ashley was our server and killled it! She really helped my birthday feel amazing and she was super friendly and super down to earth. 10/10 would recommend just because of these two. :)

BUG ALERT! DO NOT EAT HERE! NOT SAFE!<br><br>I&#39;m posting this review literally 15 min after I ran from this place in Waikiki. When I sat down I noticed the back of my thighs were a little itchy. I attributed this to the wicker seats but to make sure I went to the bathroom to check it out. There I discovered more than ten bite marks!<br><br>I&#39;m talking BIG, half dollar sized welts that were inflamed and incredibly itchy. Normally I&#39;m very shy about my body, but I&#39;m posting pictures to prove it. I took them in Cheesecake&#39;s bathroom. <br><br>Please do not eat here. No food is worth the pain I&#39;m in.

You can always count on Cheesecake Factory to be packed every night of the week here in Waikiki. Wait time was about 20minutes so it wasn&#39;t that bad. Our waitress was very quick on service and friendly. Got us our drinks really fast. <br>I ordered this cocktail with ice cream in it. It was really good. You couldn&#39;t even taste the alcohol with the ice cream in it. The drink itself was pretty thick so it took a while to finish. <br>I ordered the miso salmon and it was perfect. The presentation was gorgeous! The salmon was perfectly cooked. It had a nice sweet and savory flavor and a nice flakiness to it. It was surrounded by this white sauce and some peas. The sauce was light and had a nice flavor. I couldn&#39;t tell what it was but it was good. I wish I had more peas though. <br>Of course, when you come here, you need to get dessert! I got the tiramisu cheesecake. It was awesome! Tasted like tiramisu and had the richness of a cheese. <br>The only hiccup was that they brought out the wrong pasta for my friend. A Cajun pasta instead of the Louisiana pasta. They were really nice though and came to apologize and offered a free soup or salad. They handled it well and brought it out in a reasonable time. <br>Definitely the best Cheesecake Factory experience I&#39;ve had. Everything was spot on and efficient!

I love this place. They always have good consistent food and service is always great. I&#39;ve only been here maybe like 5 times? I would love to come back more times but the dinner wait for this place is always 2 hours long. If you don&#39;t want to wait that long I recommend coming before dinner time for an early dinner around 5 pm. You get seated right away. And of course if you come to Cheesecake Factory you need to order their cheesecake for dessert! I&#39;m not a Cheesecake fan but I would get the Oreo one it&#39;s so yummy. I always get the chocolate cake every time. It&#39;s really big and really chocolatey and it takes me three days to finish it but that&#39;s just me.

I had family visiting for the week and we came here for lunch the other day. Joe B was our server and he was amazing! Very friendly, gave great recommendations, and overall such a wonderful experience. We came back three days in a row! Joe B was so great and made our experience there amazing.

The place was busy, but it was worth the wait. Nice food and choices for every tastes : huge menu!! Nice building too. Try not to come between the rush our 7-9pm. Huge choices of cheesecakes. We went back there also for the Sunday brunch: I took the Monte Cristo sandwich, this was a very good one and I was very full. <br>If you have some time to spend in Waikiki, go there and enjoy!

My second time here and holy snap, no wonder I don&#39;t come here that much. The wait is ridiculous. When you come during those peak hours, you wait longer than expected. My friend came around 6:30PM on a Saturday night and put down her name for a table of 10. It was a hella long 3 hours wait. It&#39;s insane. Was it worth it? To me, not really. The hostess said 2 and a half hours and it ended up to 3 hours. So we basically ate dinner at 9:15 PM. We were all starving like cows! <br><br>We were all excited after the beeper vibrated. We walked inside and was seated all the way in the back of the restaurant. As soon as we sat down we already know what we wanted to order. When we saw the waitress, my friend instantly requested for water and tons of bread for all of us...literally. 10 minutes later our bread came and there was only one basket of it. That&#39;s it?! The kitchen was backed up so it was slow. We asked for more bread (white and brown). It came with butter. I loved the brown bread. It was soft and yummy. 10 minutes later our appetizer came. We shared a avocado spring roll. It came with about 6 rolls with sweet and sour dipping sauce. It tasted pretty good. Spring rolls stuffed with avocado. Need the sauce with it or it&#39;ll be bland and dry. 15-20 minutes later our main entree came. I ordered Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta (rigatoni, with veggies). So, I shall complain now. The rigatoni was not even fully cooked. It wasn&#39;t soft. The pasta tasted like oil and seasoning mixed together. It wasn&#39;t even special. I&#39;m so disappointed. I wasn&#39;t able to finish it so I took it home. It&#39;s true, maybe they are known for the cheesecake and not the food. I was full from bread so I wasn&#39;t able to order the cheesecake. <br><br>Next time if I come to cheesecake factory, I&#39;m doing take out. Cheesecake take out is available too on the side. It&#39;s much more faster! I&#39;m done with the experience. Service was slow, but I understand it&#39;s busy. Maybe they should hire more servers? Sometimes I don&#39;t get why tourist from the mainland wants cheesecake factory here when they get a lot of it on the mainland. Weird...

This review is based solely on the cheesecake!!  I have actually never had a meal at this Cheesecake Factory location but have stopped by for a slice occasionally.  My daughter also loves their cheesecake and requested we go here after dinner at a nearby restaurant.  Today was also 1/2 off a slice for national cheesecake day, so how could I refuse. I decided to try something new and opted for the carrot cake cheesecake.  This was the best decision of the day!  The carrot cake was delicious and moist and paired awesomely with the creamy cheesecake.  This one just went to the top of my cheesecake faves list!

We came here for lunch due to this place not taking reservations. I&#39;ve been here before so I know how long the line can get - and well, I have no patience when I&#39;m hungry. The wait for lunch was short, only 10 minutes to get a seat.<br><br>When seated, our waitress took our drink orders then came back for the appetizer and entree orders. It took a while for our drinks to come out, and later on, the appetizer and entree took a while too. So much so, that I already got full off the free bread. I ordered a fresh squeezed lemonade. It was pretty good and came with a sugar rimmed glass.<br><br>What I found weird was they gave you no butter knives for the bread. Our waitress was barely to be found so we used a spoon to put butter on the bread. Lame.<br><br>We ordered kalua pork nachos for our appetizer. This was the best part of the meal. I loved the pico de gallo and guacamole on it. The chips were crispy, had lots of cheese and loved the jalapeno toppings.<br><br>I ordered the lunch special Pizza with Everything and a salad with ranch dressing. The salad was so-so. Not much taste to the dressing at all. The greens were a spring mix and it was fresh. I just had to add a little salt to the greens for more taste, which I rarely ever do.<br><br>The pizza was meh. The pepperoni tasted like nasty processed Hormel pepperoni you can get from the grocery store. In fact, I&#39;d rather eat that stuff. The cheese was minimal on the crust and there were small portions of onions, sausage, mushrooms and peppers. The mushrooms on the pizza looked like canned mushrooms. The crust tasted like those microwavable mini pizzas. I ate one slice and boxed the rest to go. I may feed it to my dog, eat it as a desperation lunch or just toss it in the trash. Not sure what decision I&#39;ll make yet.<br><br>Our waitress sucked. Once our order was in, she tended to the other Japanese tourists, and left us without saying a word. She also did something weird, which was stuff her body between our small tables (they are very close in the back side) facing her butt towards our plates and food. Gross.<br><br>Of course if you come here you got to have the cheesecake. I ordered strawberry cheesecake to go. It was alright. I&#39;ve had better elsewhere. <br><br>Parking was only a dollar if you park in the &#34;non-hotel guest lot&#34; at the Sheraton Hotel garage. Don&#39;t forget to get your ticket validated, then pay at the prepay machine downstairs or on the 3rd floor.

If I could give more than 5 stars, I would. Brian and his team were so kind and so, so generous. I ordered take out but when I got to work I saw that they had forgotten the soup with my order. I called the restaurant and got transferred to Brian, the manager. I told him I couldn&#39;t come back until after I got off of work and he said that that was fine even though they would be closed. He promised me my soup and a slice of cheesecake of my choice. When I go there they gave me TWO soups and an ENTIRE LOAF of EACH bread, PLUS a slice of the cheesecake I wanted! The ladies at the cheesecake counter were so sweet both times I went. I am amazed with the customer service I received at The Cheesecake Factory! Thank you for making my night!!

Sorry CCF, but I have to downgrade you a star because I think you&#39;re letting things slip.<br><br>Here&#39;s my feedback-<br>Try adding some new menu items. With all the stuff CCF&#39;s offer, it would be nice to see a few more changes.<br><br>We sat at the bar area so I realize customer service might be lacking compared to the dining room (though it shouldn&#39;t), we didn&#39;t feel the guy working the bar was the CCF standard of friendly. He seemed bothered by us ordering food and drinks from him.  The woman behind the bar took over after we pointed out our cheeseburger was missing... Cheese! And the fries were cold and limp. She fixed our order asap and was a lot friendlier. <br><br>The bathrooms were a mess. They usually are a lot cleaner, so minus some points there. The sink area was covered in water, there was toilet paper scraps all over the floor and wet rags laying on the ground. Yuck. <br><br>The white chocolate macadamia Caramel cheesecake was good but it was such a tiny slice for $8. See picture. It really was reduced to a sliver when normally the slices are huge. <br><br>Anyway, we love the food so we&#39;ll be back and hope for better results next time.

&#34;Let them eat cheesecake! &#34; That&#39;s what Marie Antoinette would have said if she ate here.  This place serves much more than cheesecake. They serve burgers, pastas, salads, brunch items, girth expanding desserts and more.  The menu is huge.  Even the pickiest or healthiest eater can find something to eat.  I love the crab hash.  The kids brunch with French toast, bacon and fresh fruit is another good choice. <br><br>I always have my doubts about whether Mainland chain restaurants make their dishes to order, but the food here certainly tastes fresh and delicious.  The portions are generous.  I&#39;m mostly a low carb eater, but I throw that out the window because this place is carb heaven. Before I forget I want to commend the excellent server we had today.  Blaine K. not only provided prompt service, but he even laughed sincerely at my husband&#39;s jokes which is much appreciated since today is Fathers Day and we wanted him to feel special. <br><br>The decor reminds me of some rustic Italian villa.  The lighting is good for those of us of a certain age who want flattering lighting, but it might be too dim for some.<br><br>The only criticism I have of this particular Cheesecake Factory is the traffic flow.  It&#39;s very crowded and hectic. You get a pager until you&#39;re called which can range from 5 minutes to 1 hour.  You need to avoid peak hours or you&#39;ll have a long wait.  We only waited 10 minutes today, so it wasn&#39;t bad.  When the pager goes off, you get asked to stand near the hostess counter which is also near the stroller parking area while they find a server to seat you.  It&#39;s a narrow area not meant for a lot of people to be standing around. Meanwhile, there are many people entering and leaving the restaurant.<br><br>Parking can be done at the Royal Hawaiian and the Cheesecake Factory validates the parking.

I can&#39;t believe that it was so reasonably priced!  And Nina was our bartender! She was da bomb digity!  We had three drinks, an appetizer, and dinner for two for less than 85 dollars!  Couldn&#39;t manage dessert, but I must say the atmosphere was amazing, clean, friendly, and worth the walk to eat there!  Go try it!  Ask for Nina! She will hook you up!
We went in but the line was long and the place is soooooo dark, it was an instant turnoff.  Walked out without trying to get a table.

I&#39;ve been coming here for a little over a year and generally speaking, I love this place. <br><br>Pros:<br>Delicious food. I&#39;ve tried many menu items here and loved them all. My favorite is the Chicken Madeira.<br>Decent service. I can&#39;t recall any bad service incidents here.<br>Nice non-alcoholic beverage menu (not just soft drinks, all sorts of fresh lemonades) as well as a solid alcohol selection.<br>CHEESECAKE GALORE! <br>They&#39;ll validate your parking. <br>Outdoor seating available. <br><br>Cons:<br>This place is packed around dinner time and we&#39;ve experienced 90 minute waits. The upside is that if you snatch a seat at the bar or bar hightop tables, you can order dinner there and skip the wait. <br>Loud. Not the place for a super romantic dinner. This is the place to go if you already know the person you are with and don&#39;t really care to learn new things about them tonight.<br>Crowds. If you aren&#39;t big on crowds, this isn&#39;t going to be the place for you. <br><br>Whether you decide to sit down for a meal here or not, do yourself a favor and pick up their Tuxedo Cheesecake to-go.

As my family and I were enjoying our delicious meals, we&#39;ve concluded that the one thing about The Cheesecake Factory is that they&#39;re always consistent in taste and never disappoints. However, We lucked out and had the most AMAZING server in Marisa. So much so that I was compelled to stay back and to tell Jenna, the manager, how incredible Marisa was. She was super attentive and went above and beyond in her friendly hospitality. I ordered everything she recommended and was extremely satisfied and grateful. Thank you TCF and Marisa for a memorable experience:)

Been here numerous times for lunch and dinner over the years. Be prepared to wait a hr or two if going for dinner. Lunch is easier wait times in the past was only 0-20 mins. Food is always great no matter what we order. Parking is a pain in Waikiki but we jus find the nearest garage which is on Royal Hawaiian and walk it. Ambiance is nice but kind of on the dark side for me.

Fridate Night - appetizer: baked mac &amp; cheese, entree for her: fried shrimp sandwich (new item), entree for him: fried chicken sandwich.. Cheesecakes to go: white chocolate Carmel macadamia nut and strawberry to go. Total $65 (no tip included).. <br><br>Came here at 9pm - parked at Sheraton for $12... Wait time was 35 minutes, we waited and watched people at the bar to leave so we can get there seats right away!! Yay for bar service!! <br><br>Place is always busy... But wait is worth it! Like many said, they don&#39;t take phone reservations - so prepare for the wait! Enjoy!

Cheesecake Factory was well worth the visit and wait! We went at about 8pm on a Saturday night. You have to line up to get a ticket, then come back after about 20 minutes for a buzzer, then it&#39;s about another half an hour after that before you&#39;re seated. There&#39;s plenty of interesting things around to view while you&#39;re waiting though as it&#39;s located on the main strip. Our waiter Josh was an absolute legend! Attentive, friendly, and amazingly quick service- thanks so much Josh! <br>Ordered the chicken and biscuits and the meatloaf for our mains- we were both super impressed with the large sizes and home style taste. Nothing tastes like it&#39;s come from a giant chain! <br>For dessert we had the mango key lime cheesecake which was also super tasty and generous serve. <br><br>Would absolutely visit any location next time I&#39;m in the states! Cheap and generous with great service!

Not a regular stop for me, but I had heard they served a few island dishes that were exclusive to Honolulu. A delightful server at the bar name, Erin, was helpful in me ordering Poke. It was not like the traditional poke, more like sashimi, layered on chips. The flavor was good, just not what I was expecting. I&#39;ll save The Cheesecake Factory for the Mainland.

You always have to expect a long wait at any good restaurant or it&#39;s probably not good. It was well worth the wait. Huge portions which makes it worth the money. I would consider doing family style ordering the next time we visit, since portions are large. I would recommend salad, pizza and pasta dish, enough for 3 adults (daddy, 1 teenage boy and mommy) and 1 female teenager. It also includes all you can eat bread. <br><br>We order slices of cheesecake to go, if not, you&#39;ll kick yourself in the pants for not taking the opportunity to eat what, after all, they&#39;re named for. Although...the tall chocolate cake is to die for (it was so good, I forgot what it&#39;s called, my mind went blank and I made up my own name for it, <br>decadence). <br><br>Forget the fricken cheesecake, you must try the 7 layer chocolate cake. It&#39;s decadent!!!!

I love the chicken madeira here.  It is an absolute must-try if you&#39;ve never had it before.  The madeira sauce makes even the asparagus taste like crack. This dish never fails to impress.<br><br>Even more impressive are the sentient robot vacuums that patrol the dining area near the sidewalk. These vacuums are disguised as birds (I think they&#39;re pigeons?), and they do a fantastic a job of picking up all the food that falls to the ground.  I am even under the impression that you can kick them to steer them towards food that you accidentally dropped, if you so incline.  Roombas definitely needs to step up their game, given what I&#39;ve witnessed during my last dine-in here.

We really love the food here and coming here with our family. We had a party of 11 and were told we&#39;d have to sit separately on two tables. We thought it would be in the same area but we were in two separate parts of the restaurant. No big deal but when asked if we could join tables together in another area the hostess said it would take a lot of effort and something about their computer system. Then she admitted they have multiple servers in that area and they want to make their tips. She said you understand how it goes right? No I don&#39;t understand how they&#39;re feelings come before the customers&#39; being that we had out of town guests and it was my daughter&#39;s birthday. But yes please separate our party to make the servers happy.<br><br>We ordered the chicken piccata and Chinese chicken salad. The piccata was yummy as usual. The salad was soggy. I couldn&#39;t tell if there were won ton chips because it was dark and everything was soggy except for the stale fried noodles. We continued to eat it without complaint until we discovered fermented mandarin oranges after eating 2/3 of the salad. The oranges were sour and carbonated. I alerted our waiter who apologized and asked if we wanted another salad. We were already almost done with our meal so I told him no. He said he would talk to the manager about it. He came back and asked if we wanted dessert and if we wanted to box the leftover salad minus the oranges.  Uh no I really didn&#39;t want the salad at this point. I felt he could&#39;ve done a little more to make us feel better about our experience. I suspect he did the minimum because the other party we were with had already paid for our bill and he got his tip regardless of the service he gave us.<br><br>We didn&#39;t order dessert but may have taken some to go if we were told that it was 1/2 price cheesecake day.

Our waiter Travis was not attentive at all, ignoring us on refills and our food was cold. Told another waiter for a replacement order and again the food was cold. Wow, no good service and cold food. Will not go again.

Always great flavours and delicious meals along with the great service. Went as a party of six most of us enjoyed a combo meal of steak Dianne with either salmon or chicken with their delicious mash (which I am sure is swimming in butter that is why it is yummmm).<br><br>We could not leave without indulging in the cheesecakes...try the key lime, this is my new favourite.<br><br>The wait at this restaurant is always a challenge but I just try to be organised for the day.

Actually I want to give 3and half stars because the service is good than before for this time.  The food just say not too bad and not too good.  The salad is so big, we can share it for 4 people, but not too much ingredients, most of lettuce with some cheese and some toast. Other 3 dishes are little rich and make stomach full easily.

Service: awesome service our server Rayanne was awesome. Always checked on us and was very accommodating. Great personality and genuinely sweet. <br><br>Food: our food was very tasty and we enjoyed it. My husband and I ordered a bistro shrimp pasta . Very flavorful and the crunch of the shrimp added great texture to the pasta. Loved it! My husband ordered a burger on sourdough and he was happy with it, <br><br>I would recommend eating here. The food is good. The service is awesome.

Worst Pasta I had in a long time. It was made with sea water from beach in front. So salty, I could not take more than few bites. My wife&#39;s pasta and son&#39;s pasta was the same. Ice cappucino was just coffee with cream and ice in it. <br>Never coming here again.

Went here for my birthday dinner. It was a Sunday night, so typical 40 min wait.<br><br>Food: <br>-Garlic Noodles with chicken: <br>-chicken herb Parmesan <br>-Hazelnut crunch cheesecake<br><br>Food was so delicious. Better than before. As what our waitress Cheryl told us, they changed their menu. <br><br>Waitress: Cheryl<br><br>She was so awesome. She checked up on us constantly. We enjoyed the darker complimentary bread and when it was our second round we kindly asked just for the darker bread and she was kind enough to give us that. She was so patient with us. Will return and ask for her. <br><br>Quality: <br>Quality of the food was so good. About $17 per plate and and not gonna lie the portions were huge! <br>My chicken Parmesan plate came with 3 huge chicken breasts, with a side order of mashed and green beans. It was so good and I wanted to finish it at that moment. But with just one chicken breast, i was already full. <br><br>I do have to say, my boyfriend and I didn&#39;t enjoy the hazelnut crunch cheesecake. There was too much Nutella and couldn&#39;t taste their delicious cheesecake. But they have a good variety of cheesecakes to choose from and can&#39;t wait to try them all. <br><br>ROUND OF APPLAUSE FOR CHERYL FOR GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. WILL BE BACK THANKS TO HER.

Some say this location is the busiest they have ever been to. I think every location from east to west coast is equally as busy as the Waikiki location. The one thing that stands out to me about this location is how amazing the servers are. Personality is everything and every server I have ever had is always fun and bubbly and just enough over the top ensuring you feel like their only patron in such a busy establishment. Items are always fresh and the cocktails are amazing. If you have the time give them a try. The quality of the service and the food will seem worth the wait for a table. Happy eating yeeps!!
Always enjoy the Cheesecake Factory while in Waikiki. The Luau salad is a must and I have it every time. Be ready to wait as this location is very busy come 7pm.

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants to go to back on mainland. I decided to give it a try here thinking that it shouldn&#39;t be too much different. I ordered a burger and it was amazing but the fries were not hot and a little soggy. My husband ordered the steak tacos and he enjoyed them. The service was great but be ready for a wait especially if it&#39;s the weekend. I took one star away because the menu didn&#39;t have my top 3 choices. I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s Hawai&#39;i or the company overall has changed that much. Also the wait was a little long. But it&#39;s definitely worth going if you&#39;re missing your favorite things like me.

Cheesecake Factory by far the best place in Hawaii to come and have lunch or dinner! Great place to hang out with friends or family. The customer service is great. Our server was Seth and he was attentive making sure we were ok- <br><br>This place is a bit packed but if you come with time you are fine !! The wait was not too long.

I placed an order for their Wellness salad online today at 4:15 pm and their website said it would be ready in 15-20 min. I went to pick up 15 min later and paid at the counter. I waited another 30 min on the side waiting for my name to be called but it wasn&#39;t called so I went back to the register to ask about my order. <br> <br>The Waikiki Cheesecake Factory is slamming busy during this time. It was borderline chaos imo. The gentleman at the register knew what he was doing and was very courteous. The counter had two registers but it was only him and the line in front cheesecake display must&#39;ve had at least 15 people.  <br><br>I work in Waikiki and was on my one hour dinner break. 45 minutes pass with no order so I ask to speak with a manager. My order comes out immediately and the manager comps my meal. The manager was apologetic and courteous. I only have like 10 minutes to walk back to work and eat. <br><br>I give four stars because the guy at the register and the manager were sincere and on top of things amid the chaos. <br><br>Also, it&#39;s better this happened to me instead of a visitor to Hawaii. Only 5 minutes to eat...No big deal.

HORRIBLE SERVICE! They do not care about customer service at all. Very rude staff with little to no training. They take way too long to do anything, and the food is marginal at best. I&#39;ve been to plenty other Cheesecake Factories around the US, and this one doesn&#39;t hold a candle. Save yourself the time and anger, and just go somewhere else.<br><br>But the bread was almost as good as the date

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory many times and it was a good experience every single time. The food is always top notch and tastes good. The service also never left anything to desire for. On my last visit on February 28th it was fairly busy because it was lunch hour and hey... it&#39;s Waikiki. But even though it being busy and we being a party of 6, out serve Marissa was really on top of her game. We never had to ask for anything (including our drink refills) and everything was served with a smile :)

Fried fish tacos were good. Had to take it for to go because the service was absolutely terrible. Had a accidental wrong order by the server, he gave us dirty plates with wet bread suck onto the bottom , our food took 45 mins after finding out it was a mistake, server elbowed me in the head as he finished topping my water ( he didn&#39;t say sorry or anything ) , asked for the manager which took another 10 minutes. Overall trash service that day. Would not come back. Didn&#39;t even get to the chance to try the cheese cake.. we just had to get outta there.

Friendly staff, great food. Obviously it&#39;s located in the middle of busy Waikiki so the prices are a little inflated but Cheesecake Factory makes up with it by serving great tasting food. The menu is extensive to cover whatever type of food you might be craving and can honestly be a little overwhelming upon first glance but both times I&#39;ve been here I&#39;ve left feeling more than satisfied with the meal and the service.<br><br>The second time we went there was live music so if you&#39;re into that sort of thing then that&#39;s a plus!

So this is the place to go when you have to please picky eaters. With 20+ pages on the menu, everyone is bound to find something they like. Hubs and I decided to go eat something yummy, and wound up here. Our wait time for lunch at 1pm on a Saturday was less than 5 minutes. They sat us in the front room, which looks out into the alley facing Nalu storage (surf board racks) and open seating on the lanai. Not bad, but definitely not meant to be a romantic seating space as it is 4 2-tops along a bench. Good thing we weren&#39;t there to be romantic! It was entertaining to watch the waitstaff dodge a particular bird who thought he owned the joint. He swooped in a couple of times, and then strutted up and down the aisle until he was shooed completely out the front. <br><br>Hubs had the fish and chips lunch and I went with the Cuban and a salad. The wait time for food was a little sluggish, but at least they were on point with my Big Island Ice Tea. We had some calamari, which had the perfect crunch to ring ratio, and that yummy garlic dip--we had to ask for more of that. Waited awhile for the bread which was supposed to be coming straight out of the oven, but it might&#39;ve had a short delay because it wasn&#39;t piping hot, but it was warm. The fish and chips were crunchy and some sort of cod. My Cuban was HUGE! I could only eat half of it. And it was on-point. The yummy pickles added that special crunch. <br><br>Our waitress offered the cheesecake dessert specials, but there was no way we were going to finish any more food, so we ordered dessert to go; salted caramel for him, and white chocolate macadamia nut for me. We walked out of there happy campers with dessert for later. I always feel like a fatty cakes after a meal like this, but we don&#39;t do it very often so...why not?!

Came here close to closing one night and I must say, it was a great dining experience. The server was really into making us laugh and making sure we were good on everything. I wasn&#39;t hungry but I did order a Mai Tai and let me tell you, super strong! The cheesecake was delicious and I can&#39;t even begin to describe how phenomenal it was! I can&#39;t stress enough how the &#34;aloha spirit&#34; back home makes dining experiences a million times more better. I feel like I&#39;m really big on customer service rather than food quality and so forth when it comes to reviews. Hence, the server was more than 5 stars! Thank you Cheesecake, I&#39;ll be back SOON! :)

We recently ate here twice on our vacation to Waikiki.  Both nights were extremely busy but the two of us were seated quickly.  The first night we enjoyed a patio seat, live music and our waiter was great not to mention the Thai lettuce wraps were delicious.  However the second time our seating was inside and our meal felt rushed.  While our calamari was a huge portion it wasn&#39;t very tasty and our seafood and steak dinner was ok but the mash potatoes were cold.  I suggest asking for outdoor seating even if it&#39;s a longer wait as the ambience is so much better.

Expect for a long wait! The wait is usually around 45 minutes for dinner whenever we visit, the wait tonight was 1 hour and 40 minutes for a booth (Saturday night). I suggest shopping around the area to pass the time; there is not a lot of seating space near the restaurant where you can wait. There are some benches along the side of the restaurant and a rock wall near the street where people often wait. <br><br>When we got to our table, they were in the middle of clearing the previous meal. We waited to the side. The hostess apologized and chatted with us so the wait wasn&#39;t as awkward... then after a bit, excused herself to help the others clear our table. <br><br>We ordered the fried macaroni and cheese, and fried calamari as our appetizers. The fried macaroni is my favorite appetizer, there are 4 deep fried macaroni and cheese balls, served with a delicious creamy marinara sauce. <br><br>The server could have been better. There was a problem where one of our entrees was taking a while to come out, but assured us that our meal was on the top of the priority list. He even offered us a soup or salad while we waited (we denied), which was nice. We ordered the chicken piccata and the bistro shrimp pasta, which were both very delicious. <br><br>At the end of our meal, we placed our parking ticket with our credit card when paying our check, and later found out that it was not validated and we had to pay the full price of parking. This was the first time we had this problem, hopefully this was a mindless mistake and it hardly happens to other people. The food at Cheesecake Factory is always very good, it&#39;s the wait and the service that usually gets the negative review from me.
I love going to the Cheesecake Factory!!  The service is great and the Tomato Basil Pasta is the best!  This is my favorite place to eat, I love it!

I&#39;ve been to this restaurant many times over the years... The service had always been great everything I&#39;ve came and I never have a problem with the long wait times because when you come with great friends, it really doesn&#39;t seem that bad. <br><br>I always have drinks or wine when I come, and of course cheesecake at the end of my meal. But it&#39;s the actual meal that has never impressed me. Maybe the menu is so large that I&#39;ve just never found the right entree for me? Until... Now! I absolutely loved the chicken with lemon couscous! Please don&#39;t ever take that off the menu if you do a menu change...! That entree is AMAZING!

Usually not a big chain restaurant goer but I have been wanting to try Cheesecake Factory for some time now.<br><br>The wait times have always been too long any other time I have tried to visit this restaurant and I have tried in 5 other states. Typical wait times that I have run into are about 2 hours plus if you are trying to hit up dinner service. Today was an exception because we set out for an earlier meal. Waited about 45 min.<br><br>Did not know if I could expect some Hawaiian influence on the menu seeing as how it is downtown Waikiki and I guess there was a fair amount considering the vast menu but I kinda expected a bit more local variety. Yes, it&#39;s a chain but given the location and the demographic there could be a little more thought put into local flavor, especially on the dessert side. <br><br>Kid friendly enough and price point was as expected given the location and type of establishment. <br><br>Our waitress Danielle was attentive and doing a great job despite being double sat and the level of business that was walking through the door. She answered all of our questions and handled our special requests flawlessly. <br><br>The staff seems to work together when it comes to service and food running and pre bussing which is much appreciated and let&#39;s things move at a good pace.<br><br>Food was good. Exactly what I would expect as far as taste and quality from this type of restaurant.

I&#39;ve only eaten in this restaurant twice and was thoroughly disappointed both times.  Once it was to use a gift certificate I had gotten as a gift.  We ordered our food and it was meh... then we were told that the whole amount needed to be used or we&#39;d forfeit the balance and it wouldn&#39;t be counted toward tip... ok whatever <br>Second visit was with a group of family.  We were sitting on seperate tables between between a walkway, looking into the kitchen.  Boyfriend notices a bunch of weird things happening as the staff go in and out if the kitchen area.  Things you don&#39;t want to see employees doing as their serving food you&#39;re about to eat....  so we order and the waitress has trouble getting things down on a notepad.  Ok.  Our food comes out after whatever confusion she&#39;s dealing with and we&#39;re eating.  Again, food is meh.  To add to the already unpleasant evening, a worker decides he need to clean dust off a vent directly over us, WHILE WE ARE EATING!  Seriously?!  We probably have a million dust particles and god knows what in our dinner plates now.  So boyfriend asks &#34;do you really need to do that now?&#34;  And his reply was &#34;uh, yeah&#34; and continues.  He mentions that we&#39;re trying to eat and he pretty much ignored us until he was done dusting the air vent.  THANKS.  <br>Then when it comes time to pay, my mom has a bunch of gift cards and coupons for free cheesecakes that she mentions she wants to use.  Again, the waitress is confused or irritated/flustered about the situation.  Goodness, I&#39;ve heard that it&#39;s actually hard to become a server or waitress at the cheesecake factory..  well the current employees aren&#39;t really representing if that&#39;s what &#34;elite waitstaff&#34; is supposed to be.  I feel like mcdonalds workers could do a better job if not just as bad.  <br>The only thing I can give the cheesecake factory props for is the dang cheesecake.  If it weren&#39;t so far I&#39;d have it more often.  Not to mention parking is a bit of a pain.  Most times the wait is annoying as well..

This was honestly one of the best experiences I&#39;ve ever had at any restaurant ever! The service was absolutely amazing. We got seated quickly (even when it was completely packed) the staff were very friendly and quick with the drinks and orders thrown their way. The food and drinks were also AMAZING! I would definitely recommend 100%

Cheesecake factory is the perfect place to go if you have no idea what type of food you&#39;re craving for. They have such a diverse menu, from american food to italian to thai to even some local dishes like loco moco. I&#39;ve been going here since I was in high school, so that would mean over a course of 10 years. And, no matter what I ordered, food is always so delicious.<br><br>Out of the many dishes I&#39;ve tried, there are a number of them that I don&#39;t mind reordering again and again. These dishes include the portobello mushroom burger, pasta da vinci, sweet corn tamale cakes, bang-bang chicken and shrimp, and fried calamari. The tartar sauce and marinara sauce that comes with the fried calamari are by far my favorite compared to other restaurants. <br><br>For majority of my visits, we received pretty good service. Prices are reasonable as well. My only but biggest complaint would be the wait time, although I know that there&#39;s nothing they really can do about it. No matter what time you decide to go and no matter on what day you go it&#39;s always so busy.

It&#39;s Labor Day madness here in Waikiki. Decided to come here for a lunch with 6 of our friends and since we got here when they opened we didn&#39;t have to wait a long time which was awesome. The hostess was nice and lead us to our table and let us know who our server was, gave us our menus and left. We were at our table for about 10 minutes before our server even greeted us and I get it, it&#39;s busy now so she took a little bit to get to us. Ordered drinks and the corn tamale appetizer which was delicious, however the drinks took about 25 minutes to get. I don&#39;t know what it is about Waikiki and everyone taking forever to make some drinks but I think this is why I never like to come here.  <br>Food came out and we were missing multiple items but the kitchen didn&#39;t read it correctly or there was a miscommunication because we had about 6 extra sides of eggs (we like egg on pasta, we&#39;re weird) none the less we were missing items and our 2nd round of drinks took awhile as well for a glass of wine. <br>Lastly we ordered shots to end our lunch because why not it&#39;s a holiday but the server didn&#39;t ask if we wanted it chilled, salt, lime or anything. As soon as she heard the word shots she left and put it in. <br>Good meal but I hate Waikiki and there shitty service. Thanks for the gift card atleast.

What can I say about the Cheesecake Factory that hasn&#39;t been said already. First and foremost if you are trying to dine in the weekends you can forget it because you going to wait 2 and a half hours if that. Yes the wait time is insane on the weekends plus the location where this particular restaurant is at is a tourist bazaar. The best time at least for my company and me is on a weekday after 9pm. <br><br>I eat at the Cheesecake Factory at least once a month and it has never let me down. The food here is just amazing and at the same time does not put a hole in your wallet. The portions are beyond my expectations and most of the time satisfy me to my outmost limit. I always get their variety of smoothies they offer. The top two are the strawberry and the tropical fruit smoothies. They come equally balanced with ice and fruit. The rest of the smoothies such as peach and mango bring too much ice and that dilutes the flavor. There&#39;s nothing to say about their bread, it&#39;s always banging. They have the best antioxidant salad, and I always add a piece of salmon to complete the dish. <br><br>I haven&#39;t ran into any bad customer service in all the times I have been to this Cheesecake Factory. They are always on alert! I think majority of times the reason for why people tend to get bad customer service is because they give bad customer vibes.<br><br>Overall it has been a great experience!!!

This was my first time to Cheesecake Factory on Oahu.. I haven&#39;t been since 2010 so clearly I was hyped and super excited to go. My friends and I went on a Sunday afternoon with our children and we were sat extremely quick! +2STARS. The hostess that seated us was so polite and very welcoming +1 STAR. She knew we had 4 kids with us so she put us in the round booth so it&#39;d be easier to seat the kids.. +1 STAR for excellent customer service... So far. Our waitress came to take our drink order rather quickly +1STAR. I noticed she seemed a bit snooty but I was just so excited to be there I let it slide... She came back with our drinks and asked if we were ready to order we asked for a few minutes and she left. <br><br>Now when she came back we asked for her opinion on certain items and she was so cold and really seemed like she hated her job. Now being that we had our children there you&#39;d think she crack a smile or something.. But NOTHING -2STARS. We get our meals, which are delicious, and we have to ask for water refills and everything she served came with an attitude -1STAR. It&#39;s extremely disappointing because the atmosphere and food is so amazing but ONE WAITRESS could and can bring that down. After having our drink slammed on the table and a rude server... I think next time I&#39;ll get take out.

Came in for dinner at 10:00pm  15 min wait for a table only.  The pasta carbonara was freshly made, my fiancé had some type of steak which he loved and my son had a teriyaki chicken dinner with rice.  All were amazing and the service is always top notch.  It&#39;s a must!!!

I gotta say this is by far the best cheesecake factory I&#39;ve had. The waiters were on their A game. The food came nice and hot. I got my usual Cajun jambalaya and it was juicy &amp; fresh. The wait time was not that long for how busy this place was. I&#39;m going to go back before my vacation is over.

Lucky me who got to take out a Mac &amp; Cheese burger last night.  It was so great I almost ate the whole thing.  There was the buttery soft sweet bun, the thin sliced pickles, onions &amp; tomatoes. It also comes with thick cut wavy fries which seemed to be warm and fresh.  The featured of mac &amp; cheese patty was specially delicious it became an amazing combo with the beef patty.

Where have the good old days gone?  This is my second visit in less than a week.  It is still a crazy place to get seated.  My wait was only 55 minutes or so today which isn&#39;t bad compared to other days.<br><br>My waiter was Mark from the Big Island and he was upbeat and courteous with all his interactions.  I was having issues with my voice and he didn&#39;t hesitate to lean in to hear what I was trying to say.  My interaction with him was probably the best part of my experience at The Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>I ordered the spinach artichoke dip and it was okay.  Some of the artichoke hearts completely missed the blade in the blender.  It didn&#39;t have much flavor, but the salty tortilla chips helped it out.  My favorite dish here is Chicken Madiera so it is my &#34;go to meal.&#34; <br><br>Last week the chicken breasts were smaller and the sauce was salty, but the potatoes helped absorb that and the meal balanced out.  Today though there was barely any wine sauce and I think I had at least half a pound of mushrooms on top of my chicken breasts.  The chicken breast was tender as usual and the asparagus was its usual as well.  I only had three bites and debated on whether to get something else, but didn&#39;t.<br><br>Tonight the meal fell flat so I decided to just go for dessert and take the meal home. My excitement quickly subsided as I looked over the menu.  I was even more disappointed in the cheesecake selection.  They seem to have removed a large selection and the ones available were not up to my standards.  There was only one cheesecake with coconut and it had more chocolate than coconut.  I looked tirelessly for the pineapple upside down cheesecake and lo and behold it is gone too.  <br><br>Overall if it was not for the service Mark gave me, I&#39;d be giving them one star.  This is not the quality of what I am used to from The Cheesecake Factory and I doubt I will be coming back here any time soon .

My husband was served raw salmon twice. Our server was apologetic &amp; did his best to make it right than the actual manager on duty that night. He ended up sick in the stomach later that night. We will never go back to this Cheesecake Factory.

Great service, familiar food. <br><br>We got a little tired of local food...at least for a few hours. So we decided to just have some good ol&#39; cheesecake factory.<br><br>Beware, the line is so crazy here. We only waited about 10 min for two, but larger parties could be up to two hours regularly. <br><br>Portions are big, drinks are good!

We make Cheesecake Factory a must stop location every time we come to Hawaii. We went around 5-6 ish to beat the dinner rush and it was perfect waited about 5 minutes and was seated in a nice romantic location. The waitress was very nice and took the time to talk to us about her visiting Oregon where were from. The manager stopped by and apologized for the long wait which we were confused cus there was no wait but it was nice of him. the food was great and in large quantity which we take home to eat the next day for leftovers and still tasted perfect. Of course the cheesecake was great with many option they also pack your left overs for you. Highly recommended it.

Date of Visit: 2/18/14<br>Occasion: My wife&#39;s cousin&#39;s last day in Hawaii before she went back to ice cold Canada.<br><br>I don&#39;t have much to say about this place because it&#39;s always busy and I hate waiting.  What makes up for it is the Hibachi Steak...nuff sed!  The awesome fried tempura asparagus with mashed potatoes goes well with the hanger steak which is drenched with some sort of teri (asian) sauce...yum!!!<br><br>Probably won&#39;t be back here because I don&#39;t like waiting...my tummy can never wait.  The Hibachi Steak saves this review :)
Amazing food! Amazing service! Amazing drinks. We want to say thank you to our server Santana for making our dinner experience even better! Great service!

As residents of Hawaii we usually avoid Waikiki &amp; the crowds. However last night we went to see the Christmas decorations &amp; decided to make our way thru the groups of people &amp; check the wait time <br>at Cheesecake Factory. To our amazement it was only 15 min. And in 10 min we were seated at a lovely table for 2. Our waiter was tops. Our entrees came XL, piping hot, beautifully served &amp; delicious.  Something we remembered from frequent dining there in days gone by. Our waiters name was <br>Seth T.  He was outstanding and a tremendous help choosing our take-home cheesecake. We&#39;ll be back!!!. :-)

We ate here during our stay in Waikiki. It is one of the largest Cheesecake factory I have visited. It has the twice the number of seating compared to your traditional Cheesecake Factory locations. It is located in the Royal Hawaiian shopping center. <br><br>The restaurant gets very busy at night with all of tourists. You can expect to wait well over an hour before you are seated. Luckily, they provide you a pager so you can shop at the nearby shops while waiting for your table.

My husband and I come here all the time. We like to try and find two spots at the bar as the wait can get crazy during the dinner hours. It usually works out and we sit at the bar and you can order food there as well. <br>  The service is great always. They bring bread quickly. The drinks are very good. I&#39;ve had several of their cocktails and they are all delicious. The mojitos are my favorite though. The food is consistently great and I like the miso salmon the best. (Can only eat half of entrees as they are huge portions) love this place and it will continue to be a go-to.

The hostesses are inefficient and rude.  We checked in and was told 45 minutes and requested inside the restaurant cause it was a hot and muggy day.  We were called 20 minutes later and was very pleased.  Only to be lead all the way in the back outside!  So we mentioned we asked to be inside cause it&#39;s hot outside.  She walked us all the way back to the front and was told nothing.  So we waited patiently...30 minutes later we decided to check, if we were forgotten.  She says because we didn&#39;t like our table we were put in the back of the que for another table so you&#39;ll have to wait.  WHAT?!!  If I didn&#39;t have my heart set on eating there and starving by now, I would have left!  They didn&#39;t even offer a free dessert or anything for our inconvenience.  I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going back.  There&#39;s lots of other good restaurants in Waikiki.  So disappointing!

Came here recently with my husband because we were just so bored on a Sunday evening and wanted to get out of the house.<br><br>It was so crowded so we ordered some food a cheesecake to go.  The lady said it was going to take about 30 min, so we walked over to the bar area and found some seats right away. In the future we&#39;ll probably just sit at the bar and order food instead of waiting for takeout. <br><br>I ordered a whiskey cocktail type of drink, which was pretty strong. <br><br>For cheesecake we ordered the dulce de leche and lemon raspberry, which were both pretty bomb. <br><br>I freaking love the Cheesecake Factory :)
This was an ok place.Waitress was nice. Food was plentiful class is OK little crampy in the booth.Overall great place.

Great food and lots of it served so be ready hungry...<br>Lot of line but goes fast for dinner,  lot of staff working very bz place<br>But great service, and be ready for the loud noise. Although is good communication  for sure, highly recommend this place.

I couldn&#39;t decide on the star rating so i gave a 3 only because our food tasted good. I would have never ate here is it wasn&#39;t because my kids like cheesecake. First off if you know your restaurant is super popular- how about creating a reservation system. 2nd - when you do have a flock of people lined up to put down their name how about having someone help with keep order. This place is choas!! The amount of people blocking the exit is a recipe of disaster. And of course, the final one- need better lighting- i had to use my iphone flashlight to read the menu. Couldn&#39;t hurt to redo the pricing &amp; portions too. On a plus, our server was super helpful and friendly- too bad the atmosphere is not!

Wanted a steak. Got a steak. #winning!<br><br>I had been craving a steak for a few days when a friend of mine suggested we grab lunch at Cheesecake factory. I figured the craving could just be put aside for a calorie bomb cheeseacke. <br><br>But HOLD THE PHONE the menu here is so extensive that they actually have several steaks on it! omgomgomg!<br><br>I decided on the grilled ribeye (rare) because I figured go big or go home. In order to be somewhat health-conscious I switched out french fries for steamed broccoli and was actually really happy that I did. I didn&#39;t need the carbs to make me feel full after putting away the entire steak and veggies. (Although I did eat the free bread that came to the table so I did have some carbs...) I dipped my broccoli into my steak juice for extra flavor because it&#39;s seriously just steamed (no seasoning even I think)<br><br>I was so full that I didn&#39;t even get any cheesecake. Which made me happy (yay save money &amp; my pants still fit) but sad (aww I love chessecake). <br><br>Guess I&#39;ll just have to go back and get a slice some other time my omnivorous self isn&#39;t clamoring for red meat.

Ate here more than once and great value for money!<br>Whilst in Hawaii, I decided to eat here on numerous occasions for lunch and dinner. Why? Because the service was fantastic, menu choices left you wanting to try everything and the meals were absolutely delicious! And great serving size. Not to mention the amazing range of cakes .. so good! <br>The super antioxidant salad was fabulous .. had that more than once and the spaghetti and meatballs was delicious! <br>For dessert, my favorite cake was the limoncello one but I also tried the red velvet and key lime cheesecakes.. both also very very delicious! <br>No waiting time during the day but expect at least a 30 minute wait for the evenings. I didn&#39;t mind it because I know my meal would be satisfying. <br>Perhaps a good idea might be an sms system rather than allocated buzzers so the front of the restaurant isn&#39;t congested with others waiting for their table. <br>My favorite place to eat in Waikiki!
Amanda アマンダ is the BEST waitress we have ever had!!! You ROCK girl!! Keep that good vibe Shaka shaka!<br>Thanks for the hot water by the way

Tonight we decided to come down here after we had some drinks. The wait time was 40 minutes and we were like sure. <br><br>We waited and it buzz on time. We sat at our seats and they offer water and breads. We order our food. Chicken piccata and gumbo. <br><br>They offer bread again while we wait. We waited and waited for a hour for our food. My boyfriend food was hot and my food wasn&#39;t. I told the waitress what happen and if they can comp the food.<br><br>The manager came and say they can make a new one for me and I wanted them to pay for my food because I waited for a hour and my food was cold. They are only going to give free cheesecake. I was like omg. Is that all you can do me. So I gave my food back so they won&#39;t charge me. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to other restaurant and when your food is bad they comp your meal and try to make it memorable.  Why only give free cheesecake. I&#39;m not a happy camper. <br><br>Well I don&#39;t know if I&#39;m going to come back here because they might forget about my food. Thanks cheesecake for making this visit memorable for me. <br><br>I know I won&#39;t be back. Peace out cheesecake your services suck. Mahalo.

Came here yesterday with the boyfriend for our anniversary. He&#39;s never been here before so I thought it would be nice. When we got there, there was not much people waiting in line to get a table like usual. Finding where to book our tables was so confusing. There is people everywhere and lines everywhere so how do you know which one to stand in? I ended up making eye contact with a girl and she helped me. The wait was still one hour...like usual. So we had to come back 40 minutes later for our buzzer thing. We walked around to the Apple Store and forever 21 just to look around while we wait. Then we stood outside...horrible experience. This couple decided to stop and smoke right in front of us. I have asthma...so it was rude! <br><br>At 740, we went back and there was a line..so I stood for a little bit because I didn&#39;t know where to go...then I saw people going up to the same girl and getting their buzzers. So I went up there. The place is so cramped..people walking everywhere and bumping into you. It was really annoying. I hated how people came in groups just to order cheesecake. Can&#39;t you wait outside while your friend or your spouse gets the cheesecake? <br><br>Our buzzer buzzed exactly 20 minutes which made an hour wait. So I went over to the girl again and pushed my way through the crowd. Gave her my buzzer and waited again to be seated. Maybe 10 minutes later, we got our seats...it was out in the HUMID air. Ugh...I hate it. The girl was nice, she gave us time to get situated and look at the menu. Got our waters and bread. The bread was cold..I like when it&#39;s warm, but oh well. I got the Chicken Di Pana and boyfriend got the Smokehouse BBQ burger. Our food came out together maybe 10 minutes later? Boyfriends burger came undercooked. He wanted medium but got medium rare. My chicken was good. Wish there was more sauce though...and more broccoli!! <br><br>Overall the experience was good. Just be prepared for the wait...and the annoying people who don&#39;t know where to walk or stand.

This is an all-time favorite of mine! I always and I mean always get the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp meal. I was at Lay Low but Happy hour did not start until 6pm and live entertainment at 7. Initially, the menu did not pique my fancy but I&#39;ll let you know when I go back this evening and have a few drinks at happy hour. Delish

I have wondered why people wait in line for this restaurant. I tried the Macaroni and Cheese Burger - I now understand why.  Everyone must be waiting in line for this tasty treat.  It is a burger with a fried macaroni and cheese ball smothered in a cheddar cheese sauce.  I can&#39;t wait to have this again (I do recommend sharing - the burger is quite large, and you&#39;ll never have room for cheesecake if you eat it all.)

Our waiter Ian was totally amazing. The restaurant was super busy as I am sure it always is but we didn&#39;t have to wait very long at all for our food and drinks. Our waiter was on it the whole time. I had the Farfalle Garlic Chicken Pasta and for desert the most amazing cheesecake yet! Celebration Cheesecake. This place is hopping so be prepared to potentially wait for a seat.

Love this place! Super busy but worth the wait.  It&#39;s a bit hot in the restaurant but I&#39;m guessing it&#39;s because it&#39;s so packed. Had the Steak Diane and Salmon combo. Very good. The Poke appetizer and Avocado bread appetizers were great. Top it off with cheesecake, mine being a new one Coffee Chocolate Dream Extreme. Awesome!

We checked in for two walk in party of two. It wasn&#39;t a long wait got sat in like 5 minutes. As was told! Got to our table sat there for a good 20 minute. No one came to great us or said anything. I&#39;m a server myself so I know the restaurant business. I am shocked I sat there for 20 minutes an didn&#39;t say anything until we got up to leave. There was a table that got sat right after us next to us. There was a server that had greeted them brought bread an took there drink order. As I&#39;m sitting there waiting for our server to come witch I&#39;m pretty sure he was our sever in the end. Hasn&#39;t greeted us or took the time to come over to our table. Haven&#39;t had this happen to us not once being in Oahu. All I Wanted was to enjoy a good last meal before giving birth an because a server couldn&#39;t take 5 minutes out of his time to come a greet our table it was ruined. So thank you for that horrible experience! Never coming back if I have to wait that long for someone to come an greet my table!

Food was okay, just HUUUUGE portions. too big!!!! i could barely eat half of mine. the wait was so long just for some average tasting salad and chicken. i hope that they step up their game next time.. if i come back that is.
Do not order take out. Even you preorder online, you still have to wait over 20 mins. This is my first try and it will be my last. Very disappointed (still standing here and waiting for my food)

My friend and I came to the Cheesecake Factory in Waikīkī today for lunch. It&#39;s been over 2 years since I&#39;ve been, and my friend hadn&#39;t gone in over 3 years. We rarely come to Waikīkī because of the crowds of tourist and traffic, but we decided to venture out today.  This location is usually crowded and busy, but today at around 2:15pm was not that bad.   Our server was Tracy and she was very helpful and attentive to us throughout our meal- she even helped us pick out the perfect cheesecake for dessert.  <br><br>We ordered 2 lunch portions of the Chicken Piccata, split a dinner portion of the Cobb salad, and had the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake for dessert. The servings here are HUGE- and the lunch portions were very filling.  Ever since going to New York and eating a Cobb Salad at Bouchon Bakery - we have been trying to find a Cobb Salad of comparable taste here in Hawaii.  The Cobb salad here at Cheesecake served it&#39;s purpose for me and it did satisfy my craving. The Chicken Piccata was ono, as always, and the capers are still my favorite. The Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake was divine, and as my friend put it - &#34;it&#39;s like eating a truffle!&#34; You cannot come to Cheesecake Factory and not eat cheesecake (even though we almost didn&#39;t order cause we were soooo full!)

This place is yummy and a good set up for a nice relaxing dinner. <br><br>There&#39;s a new bartender (female) and if you do happen to order food with her, maybe spell it out. She has gotten every single one of my orders wrong lol.

If the Cheesecake Factory weren&#39;t so darn far away I think I&#39;d eat there more often!! They are located in Waikiki in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center on the ground level. Parking is pretty convenient in the parking garage. They don&#39;t take reservations so you have to go and sign in. You are probably going to wait to be seated, but while you are waiting you can go and check out all the cheesecakes they have for sale. The menu is quite extensive, with appetizers to full on meals, so take your time and choose carefully!! Many of the appetizer portions are big enough to share, so that&#39;s another way to order, you can share with your dining companions!! The pizzas and sandwiches are great, but my personal favorite happens to be an appetizer! You gotta have the Spicy Ahi Tempura Rolls. This is some serious deliciousness! It&#39;s served on a bed of deep fried long rice and served with two different sauces. Enough for two! The dining companion swears by the shrimp rolls, which isn&#39;t really a favorite of mine, but hey, to each his own!! We will usually order a pizza to split also. Great service and friendly interaction with the waitstaff make dining at Cheesecake Factory an enjoyable time. A little noisy in there, but a great place to sit down to some great food and conversation. If you&#39;re a big dessert fan, make sure you save some room for it since you&#39;re pretty much in dessert heaven!! So head out to Waikiki someday and have a great meal here, I&#39;m sure you&#39;ll be glad you did!!

haven&#39;t ate here sinxe 2009 n it was alright, wasn&#39;t a fan of there food.  Now heading towards 2019......  ll be bacK next week!!! Food and servixe iz Grade A!!  i Had a wonderfull experienxe this time around!!  i sounded super fat
Very busy but that&#39;s to be expected. Wait time wasn&#39;t too long, and we were served quickly during the dinner rush. Nice live music by the patio. Very nice.

5 stars because of the food and awesome service, but if you have over 12+ people you&#39;ll be waiting for a long time. We waited for almost 3 hours but when your in a group of 5 or less, waiting hour for you is faster but make sure to check in right away and you can go a head shop since forever 21 is next door. <br><br>FOOD!!! My favorite is the Chicken Madeira and always get the mango smoothie! It&#39;s pretty big the portion but I always finish mines XD <br>Shrimp Scampi is always great can always share with everyone since every portion is pretty big and expensive. Great place for a date since it&#39;s dark and depending on where your sitting, live band singing while you eat.

Given the number of people that are always sitting outside waiting to be seated, the restaurant seems to turn tables pretty quick. The staff is always friendly and the service has always been outstanding. We had the pleasure of sitting right in front of the live performance by Beach 5 and thoroughly enjoyed the music. The food came out quickly with no issues whatsoever. We will definitely be back on our next visit.

Me and my family went here for the first time at a Cheesecake Factory and everything was really good and it is so pretty from the inside and our waiter was really nice a bonus is that this restaurant is affordable to eat at and there was only one con about this place is that there is a lot of people so the wait time is like one hour to one hour and a half but it is understandable because after going here no wonder there are so many people!
And 3 years later... I haven&#39;t been back...<br><br>No comment from CF?  No contact?  Just let it slide?  <br>Terrible...

This has been our family&#39;s go to and favorite restaurant for years (we think we started coming in 2004 but maybe 2005)! We used to come about once a month but now with both my brother and I being adults, it&#39;s hard to get a family dinner together. We probably come every 3 months and sometimes we&#39;re missing a person (usually me) but the missing person gets their order taken home to be enjoyed for second sessions. <br><br>We usually come around 3 to avoid waiting for a long time and we like to sit in the 80s because of the beautiful view. We usually sit at table 85. <br><br>Coming here is like lunch/dinner and lunch tomorrow! Our usual course of action is bread but we ask for no white and double brown bread, 2 orders of the tempura spicy ahi roll, and the chicken lettuce wraps. A lemon drop for my mom, a Long Island for my brother, and my dad picks something new every few visits-yesterday he got the bourbon and honey which he said was smooth and delicious! <br><br>Now let&#39;s talk about those apps-if you are a family of 4, you can not order one roll. You will fight over those pieces. It&#39;s better for everyone to just order two and let everyone get enough pieces to be happy. After you&#39;re done, the brown bread dipped into the sauce is THE BESSSSTTT! The lettuce wraps are my mom&#39;s favorite, she sometimes orders them for her entree she enjoys them that much. They come with 3 sauces that are all delicious and I like to put all 3 into my lettuce wrap. <br><br>Entrees:<br>My dad almost always orders the jambalaya/gumbo (I&#39;ve included a picture). I don&#39;t remember which title it has because my food is so delicious I don&#39;t pay super close attention but he always gets the same thing so it must be awesome. <br><br>My mom usually gets fish tacos which I always want a bite of but never do because I&#39;m so full by the time she offers. <br><br>My brother and I switch around a lot. He usually gets steak and I used to order chicken. Our favorites are the chicken costoletta, the chicken Madeira, and the chicken Marsala. But seriously if you haven&#39;t had chicken costoletta-you should 100% order that. <br><br>I gave up being vegetarian yesterday because it was such a tease not eating chicken costoletta so I ordered the herb crusted salmon yesterday which was also delicious and served very similarly to the chicken costoletta.<br><br>Our family always orders dinner sized entrees because we take home half or more and have it for second sessions around 7:30 or for lunch the next day. <br><br>Dessert:<br>Our normal route is to order 1 for the table so we can all have a couple bites and then one each to take home. <br><br>The one for the table is usually something new or the seasonal cheesecake. My dad always orders the Godiva, my brother always orders the kahlua and I used to always order the Adams peanut butter fudge ripple but now I take after my mom and try a new one each time. I have to say it&#39;s rare we order one we don&#39;t like. They&#39;re all very good. Yesterday my mom ordered the tiramisu for her take home which is one of my favorites and I got the s&#39;mores cheesecake which was super delish! We saved our leftovers for lunch today and busted out our cheesecakes last night and each only ate half so we&#39;re super excited to have leftovers AND half a slice of cheesecake in our lunches today. <br><br>So yes, Cheesecake Factory is a chain. However, they provide consistent, delicious food with fantastic customer service.

I&#39;ve been to this restaurant countless of times and every single time the food was worth the wait. It&#39;s portions are pretty big and there&#39;s a lot of dining area to seat a lot of people. Servers and staff are friendly and very nice. They greet you and thank you for coming when you walk pass them. The only thing is that it was my first time seated outside and I didn&#39;t think it was sanitary. Yes it looked really nice and neat but as I was eating... The birds kept flying over our heads and constantly popping on the floor. It was the floor so it&#39;s not too bad but what if they flew over someone or their entree and pooped over that? If come back here hands down but I&#39;ll avoid the outside seating area now.

Oahu is home and when I want to have a cheat meal, I know the Cheesecake Factory does the trick. Unhealthy and tasty all in one. I was wearing a Hawaiian crop top and shorts and was asked if I had a towel, sweater, or anything to cover myself up with. Me response: Even if I had it, I would not cover myself up. It&#39;s a hot summer day and it&#39;s Hawaii! What&#39;s the manager thinking? <br>We left to never go back. When friends, family and clients ask, we will make sure they don&#39;t go there. <br>We ended up eating delicious food right across the street at California Pizza Kitchen where we tasty food, great music and awesome service!!! Aloha

This place is my family&#39;s go to restaurant since when I was still a little girl. After few years it&#39;s still my go to place for something special day. I never had a bad experience here and employee here are always professional and even when I had to order something complicated my waitress always accept and kindly takes my orders ! Love this place, I wish this place had other location in honolulu ! Planning to visit soon again and again !

Loud, fun and great people watching. Add this plus their extensive menu wonderful service and its my favorite family restaurant. Great for screaming kids and strollers everywhere. Eat outside and enjoy the waikiki madness. People from all over the world. Menu is overwheming and plates are huge for sharing. Prices are reasonable and yipppeee they brought out all the hot meals for all at once! We shared the miso salmon the steak and the lettuce wraps. All perfect...and Im picky. We dined with a grumpy 1 yr old but it was perfect. Definately share some meals as this place never fails me. Just save room for the cheesecake...cause thats the reason for coming!

Today i stopped at cheesecake factory to pick up a take out cheesecake.  It must&#39;ve been about 3pmish.  And i must say the service was horrible.   The amount of time i soent waiting it felt as if i was waiting for a table!  So they have this roped off area in front of the case up to the registers in which a line will form.  <br>As i was waiting in which i was 1st then cashier #1 takes 2 take out orders from these people that were not even in the line then an employee that was waiting in the line came out and went to that same cashier and placed an order also.  This cashier was an older lady hollering out orders in a very unprofessional way.  She had ne personality whatsoever.   <br><br>In the meantime cashier #2 is with his headset calling orders and getting extremely overwhelmed because orders are not being made.  Then he has to call the mgr. over for some overides.  <br><br>The employees preparing the cheesecakes were honestly busting their butts off!  I thought this was going to be a quick and fast take out considering the timing but i was wrong.

Very large portion sizes would be my first comment. The food was delicious and the drinks (hot ones we had).<br><br>Our waitress was a delight so we left her the maximum tip with a bit of extra.  She was very attentive and always communicated how far our drinks and food were.<br><br>This place opened at 11am and we were 2 of a total of 14 people that waited for the place to open. By the time we left which was 45min later this place was probably about half full... yes it is popular so if you want to try it I&#39;d recommend to go when they open, at least this way you can decide whether you want to sit inside or outside. <br><br>We&#39;re pretty much fully booked until our departure so this will have to be on the list for when we return but most certainly I&#39;D RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

A great place to enjoy great tasting food with family, friends, coworkers, or by yourself. The food was amazing, their steak tasted very good and was very tender and juicy. I loved their Calamari and salmon. I especially love their Tiramisu cheesecake along with their original signature cheesecake. The price range is very affordable, though there is no reservation so if you go you have to wait a min of 1hr and 30min to be seated just like EVERYONE else.

Let&#39;s make this quick:<br>Since the beginning I&#39;ve been coming here for dinners when in Waikiki. The food was good especially their pasta but now I&#39;m not sure what to think of it anymore. Prices have raised and portions are much smaller.<br><br>The lines are terrible! The wait is always 1-2 hours long! -.-&#34; To be honest.... just take out the cheesecake. The line for takeout goes by fast so don&#39;t worry!

Cheesecake Factory has one of the most underrated Brunch menus of all time. When I talk about CCF&#39;s Brunch selection with friends, none of them are aware of its existence. Works for me because we easily find seats on Sunday morning while everyone else is stuck waiting in line at other Brunch spots.<br><br>We shared the fried chicken and waffles benedict along with the jambalaya hash. Both were bountiful, unique and satisfying.<br><br>Finger of shame for not offering Happy Hour. Every restaurant chain that&#39;s in the area has an happy hour but not this one. I&#39;ve also enjoyed happy hour at other Cheesecake Factory locations so I&#39;m alittle disappointed in Waikiki&#39;s omission.

It is hard to eat at this place due to everytime I go its always busy &amp; the wait is ridiculous...<br>Just happen to have Lunch with my mom &amp; sister at this place &amp; it wasnt even busy (phew). <br><br>I ended up ordering the Ceaser Salad with Hawaiian Pizza. The salad size wasnt that bad &amp; the pizza was a lil bit bigger then a personal pan (about 5 slices). <br><br>For dessert we had the Vanilla Bean Cheesecake, it was sooooo good &amp; fluffy. Between the 3 of us we couldnt finish it (we are trying to watch our weight, lol).
This place is busy, busy, busy. it doesn&#39;t matter  what day, it&#39;s busy!!!  Food is reliable and good.  Lately, their staff has stepped it up with smiles and helpfulness all around.

Stopped by here for a quick bite on our honeymoon after a long day. When we arrived we were told the wait was 40 minutes, but it was more like an hour. Our waiter wasn&#39;t very attentive, didn&#39;t ask us many questions, and only came to our table to take our order then give the bill. We split a meal and they didn&#39;t give us an extra plate, nor did our waiter stop at your table, so that was interesting to split. It was a little frustrating because he had a large party by our table, and we watched him stop there multiple times, super attentive and friendly, but not the same for us. Bummed we &#34;wasted&#34; a meal here.

It is crazy busy here so be ready to wait at least 45 minutes to an hour for a table. They definitely need to start taking reservations or come up with a better system for seating customers! Once we finally got seated, they tried to seat us outside in front of the restaurant. No offense but I don&#39;t want to be seated right next to people who are still waiting to get a table and have nothing better to do than to watch me eat. So we waited a few more minutes until a table near the kitchen was ready. We were seated under the air vents and they started to leak water! I&#39;m pretty sure someone else complained because they quickly tried to wipe all the vents. <br><br>Service here is okay, nothing impeccable, but pretty standard for a restaurant food chain; you&#39;ll get your beverages refilled and fresh bread on the table so that&#39;s all I expected. Some of my favorite items on the menu is their Famous Factory Meatloaf, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, and Factory Burrito Grande. My go-to cheesecakes are the Fresh Strawberry cheesecake and the Adam&#39;s Peanut Buttercup Fudge Ripple cheesecake. The place is pretty noisy so it can be hard to have a conversation. It&#39;s definitely a family restaurant, I can&#39;t see myself going on a date here.

18 June 2017. (8:45pm- 12:17 am while writing this) and 1 star Because my food was good. Service sucked. 1.5 hour wait for a table. 1 hour wait for food to arrive. 1 hour wait for waitress to bring checks. Informed manager and rather than accepting poor service she made excuses. <br><br>HORRIBLE HORRIBLE SERVICE -EVERYTIME I HAVE EVER CAME HERE

Excellent dining experience...just like on the main land.  Enjoyed the service and food.  Although this place always seems busy, they tend to seat you rather quickly.  We ordered entrees and sandwiches, along with some appetizers.  Everything was well prepared and served on time.  We were in and out within an hour and 30 minutes.  We look forward to dining here again.  Who wouldn&#39;t?  It&#39;s on Waikiki beach!!

After seeing many reviews about portion size being so big that people were too full to try the cheesecakes, my boyfriend and I ordered an appetizer (spicy ahi tempura roll) and a main (pasta Napoletana) to share. We were still very full by the end of it but managed to share a slice of fresh strawberry cake. The food and service was amazing!! We were there for dinner and there was live music as well.

This is a fun classy place for a date or the whole family.  The cheesecake is amazing!!!  I like how there are many options on the menu.  It was my Birthday celebration tonight and we stopped in for dessert... Normally we wait forever for a table but we got right in tonight.  The server had them put happy Birthday on my plate with a candle, it was very fun.  Everything tastes so good here.
Awesome service! The wait was about an hour but once we were seated it only took a few minutes to get appetizers and our food. Really reasonable prices for Waikiki.
