I always come here for birthday celebrations or to just celebrate anything in general. <br>So tonight was my brother&#39;s birthday &amp; we came here for dinner. Wait time wasn&#39;t too bad; 40 minute wait. Usually it&#39;s way longer than that considering Cheesecake Factory is ALWAYS busy. After we got seated, since we&#39;ve been here so many times, we already knew what we wanted. For appetizers we ordered the Calamari, artichoke dip, firecracker salmon rolls, &amp; Thai chicken wraps. Everything was excellent, my favorite were the Thai chicken wraps even though they can eat a bit messy, they&#39;re super flavorful. I also liked the fire deck salmon rolls; super flavorful &amp; crunchy. I even liked the cabbage with the sauce it was served in, kinda like a little salad which was nice. My entree was the endive salad, I didn&#39;t really eat much of it because i was able to eat a lot of the appetizers. The food came out super fast, our server was awesome, friendly &amp; made sure that we were taken care of. She gladly packed up all our food &amp; our cheesecake so that we could eat it at home because the kids were getting tired. We will definitely be back :)

BEST OF THE BEST Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been too!! THANK YOU! <br>Yes, they are completely full ALL the time, we went on Tuesday and Friday but we did not wait more than 5m. Thumbs up. Food excellent, service is outstanding AND the cocktails were not washed out, our party of 5 tried at least 8 different drinks and they all were 5 out of 5!! Definitely recommending this particular location of Cheesecake Factory!

Here&#39;s the thing... No one comes to Hawaii to eat at The Cheesecake Factory. Seems silly, right? But when you have a diversity of food palates and everyone is hungry, and you are tired of trying to please everyone, it makes sense. <br><br>We only had a ten minute wait and then we were whisked to a table. Our server knew we were starved and moved at cheetah like speed to take our drink and meal orders. <br><br>If you&#39;ve ever been to the Cheesecake Factory, you know what the food is like but they found a way to make it special. One of our guests had to step out for a call, so our server, Cory, put his plate away to ensure his food stayed warm. When the guest returned, he even brought fresh rice.<br><br>More on Cory... This guy was a real class act. He gave us the exact amount of attention we needed, was friendly and professional, and had both a sense of urgency and patience. <br><br>I know you shouldn&#39;t visit &#34;chains&#34; when you are on vacation, but if you need an easy crowd pleaser, I highly recommend it.

I don&#39;t know why I keep on eating here if I know the service is going to be bad. <br><br> Tip: only dine in if you have about 3 hours to spare. That&#39;s taking into account the wait time, the time for your food to get out, and time for your bill to come. Today, we waited about 10 minutes to be seated. We spent an hour waiting for our bread and appetizers to come. The wait took so long for our entrees to arrive that we weren&#39;t even hungry by the time it came. We had gift cards for cheesecake which forced us to order dessert. Same thing: waited long for dessert that we weren&#39;t able to take any more than 2 bites of it . <br><br>Now I&#39;m currently writing this review as I&#39;m waiting for the bill to come. It&#39;s taking that long! <br><br>Food: made the mistake of ordering the luau salad. I regret it. It was overdressed and super oily. I&#39;m pretty sure a pasta would&#39;ve had less calories than the salad I ordered. I should stick to my usual -- the Thai lettuce wraps. <br><br>I hope Cheesecake Factory decides to build another location that&#39;s not in Waikiki. I think another location would serve for better service.

Oof. Not a fan. I really wished for a better experience but I left feeling ill. <br><br>The restaurant itself is really cool and has a nice ambience later at night. They had live singers during my visit so that was really enjoyable. We came around 9, and it was still smoking busy. The hostesses seemed very overwhelmed. <br><br>I got the thai lettuce wraps to start. They were very okay. They weren&#39;t bad but I definitely wouldn&#39;t get them again. My friends and I shared a slice of oreo cheesecake and I wasn&#39;t a fan. I usually like regular NY cheesecake so this was overkill for me. <br><br>I will make note that our server was great. The food was just disappointing. :(

I enjoy the food here. Especially good is the Miso salmon with snap peas. The wait times can get very long but once you are seated, the service is prompt. Drink orders are correct and not watered down. I go here quite frequently, parking across the street at International Market Place and walking over. The wait staff is very attentive to children and my girls (11) and (9) feel welcomed.<br>The calamari appetizer is very good. Crisp with lots of taste. I do not eat the bread offered but there is a few varieties to choose from in the basket and my kids like it.<br>If you have a preference as to inside or outside seating, mention it to the check in staff before you are given the buzzer to come back when your table is ready.

Poor service. We ordered takeaway over the phone to save waiting in line when we got here. They said that was fine on the phone.  When we got here we asked the welcome people where to pick up our order. They said join a long queue. Bit annoying but oh well it&#39;s a popular place.  Anyway after twenty minutes in the line we get to the front. They say oh you&#39;re in the wrong line. And sent us to the real line finally. Another five minutes wait and finally our order is with us. Full disclosure... Yet to try the cake. <br><br>Update. Cake is ok but very very rich and a bit sickly!

Service was excellent but it&#39;s your typical national restaurant chain. I had the New York steak and it wasn&#39;t anything special, probably was slightly overcooked so it was dry. The mash potatoes w/skin was tasty. My friend had the Pasta Da Vinci a chicken w/ Madeira wine sauce which was similar to a marsala sauce with bow tie pasta instead of penne which was actually pretty good. She had hoped the chicken wasn&#39;t breaded but rather grilled as a healthier option. The sauce was tasty. Then, we each had different cheesecakes, 1) Godiva Chocolate and 2) Lemon rasberry. Both were good but nothing special. I&#39;ve tasted cheesecakes from other places and was either the same or better. I dont think it was anything special that I would visit again and wait for a table.

Cheesecake Factory is Cheesecake Factory so you know what you are going into. We asked for a table for 2 at around 9pm and the front desk told us it was going to be a 30min wait so we just decided to get a bar table instead. When we finally found an open table, the table next to us opened up also. As we were waiting for our table to be busted, their were two young ladies that sat down at the table next to us. The waiter  clearly saw us there waiting and yet he decided to clean the other table first and started talking/flirting with them. Then we waited patiently for another 15min until someone else came and cleaned our table.

This is one of my favorite restaurants, even though the wait list is always long and you have to wait at least 15 mins to get your table. However, their food is good, and the portion is huge. Their Luau salad and steak Dianne are amazing, and no doubt that their Cheese cake is to die for. Staffs are friendly but sometimes the restaurant get busy and they are not being attentive.

We were seated at 11:15am and couldn&#39;t be better!  Our waiter was JAY and his assistant was JENNY.  Very nice, personable, professional, and friendly.  I felt like a King and my wife a Queen.<br><br>The meal was the Cobb Salad (lunch size), for my wife and I opted for the Fried Calamari (appetizer).  We also had an Iced Black Tea and a Beer (on tap).  The drinks came cold and frothy.  The ambience was satisfactory; though not of their fault.  There are just too many people walking and driving past the dining area that it becomes not a nice view, rather, a bother.  <br><br>When the meal arrived we were overwhelmed with the size of the portions.  The &#34;lunch size&#34; Cobb Salad was enormous and the Calamari was large enough for four people!!  It was delicious and prepared in both taste and presentation to an appealing fashion.  We were very happy with the experience and it only got better...<br><br>When it came time to order the famous Cheese Cake, we opted for the Vinilla Bean Cheese Cake and I will order the Low Carb Cheese Cake tomorrow (there are a few options available within this catagory).  The CC we ordered was for takeaway and came ready to go.  While we were waiting for the CC, I ordered the Espresso and it was, actually, better than that which can be found at Starbucks.  <br><br>When it was time to leave, we received our bill and wasn&#39;t taken aback by the charges.  All included, it came to $43 and with tip, $53 out-the-door.  You can&#39;t beat that for a Waikiki Beach &amp; famous restaurant for lunch.  They earned 5-Stars.

Ok so we came on FOURTH OF JULY, It was obviously busy after the firework show! I was so shocked the wait time was like 10 minutes for a table of two! staff was on point and so was the food! The bread was WARM (PLUS)!!!!!! Everyone is on top of their game!!!  Yummy, might drop by again before we leave!!!!

Cheesecake Factory never fails! #1 reason why we came here on a Friday after 5pm-we were missing the CF back on the mainland and despite it&#39;s tourist magnet location, we said what the heck-their food is worth it.<br><br>Some tips:<br>DINING for 2: Head straight for the BAR area. Self-serve seating! As soon as you see an empty table grab it and plop your behind down! There service is quite attentive and someone will catch your eye and drop some menus. I&#39;d pass on the heavy wait at a regular table unless ur with a group-there are always ppl waitin swampin the entrance. <br><br>AMBIANCE: Huh?! What did you say?! Yes! It&#39;s loud in there. Of course mainly bc of the volume and traffic of people. But who comes to Cheesecake Factory anyway to have a &#34;quiet candlelight&#34; dinner. The lighting is pretty dim though. Better have ur phone flashlight handy. <br><br>DRINKS: Hubz ordered a Manhattan straight-up (for you hardcore drinkers, u know how tuff it tastes). Waiter was on top of his drinking game and new his liquor well. Was well made with Bourbon, Vermouth and all. Don&#39;t forget the cherry! I had some Tropical martini. Came straight up with a cute orchid flower in it-not cough syrup tasting at all. Thumbs up!<br><br>FOOD:<br>APPS: First off, they serve you warm yummy bread-and that brown loaf with the oats is bomb by itself! Try not to fill up on it even though it is bottomless. 1st up. Can&#39;t go wrong with there &#34;Fried Mac-N-Cheese&#34;! Comes in 4 tennis ball sized pieces, breaded outside toped with sauce, slice down the middle and watch the cheese ooze right out.  Yah better dip that bread all up in der. Mmmm!<br><br>MAIN: Tried there newest &#34;Harvest Salad&#34;-recommended by our waiter. Was divine! Refreshing-arugula was not heavy and too crunchy like how romaine lettuce could be. The edamame and pine nuts added texture. And the slices of parm cheese added juss a perfect amt of salt. Even took the rest home! This was a half portion! Hubz ordered the &#34;Smokehouse Burger&#34;-also recommended by our waiter. Size was not impressive, was cooked as asked, seasoned well, and the BBQ sauce was not too sweet. He enjoyed it!<br><br>DESSERT: Sad to say, they no longer have one of my favs-&#34;Pineapple Upside Down Cheesecake&#34; so we shot to try another recommendation from our waiter and tried the &#34;Tuxedo&#34;-and I&#39;m glad we did. It was  chocolate goodness all over! The ganache, fudge, and mascarpone cheese-heaven! Also we ordered a classic, the &#34;Strawberry&#34; cheesecake, gotta love that graham cracker crust and large fresh strawberries. Mmm..<br><br>WRAP IT UP: Would we be back?! For sure, wouldn&#39;t make it a regular spot but CF has always delivered on their food. Always satisfied. One more note-their menus differ a bit fr mainland in that it doesn&#39;t have the mini plates/tapas at the front of the menu (addtl 2-3pgs) and a few other items but thats fine bc were in Hawaii and the special is not &#34;Mahi Mahi&#34; like it always was back in the mainland lol. Thanks CF for another great dining experience! Keep up the good work.

Went to this place with a bunch of friends last Sunday. We beat a crowd of people, so we waited only 20 minutes, any longer than 25 minutes is not worth it. Ordered the shrimp scampi, was glad it was big shrimps but didn&#39;t like that they had some breading on it. Also got a long island iced tea which wasn&#39;t that bad either. It&#39;s not like the broke da mouth food. Service was attentive. All in all, had a good time with my friends and felt like I was a tourist for a bit.

Food was delicious. Portions were huge for lunch. Went during about 2:30 pm and still had to wait for 20 min for a table. It&#39;s very dark in there that we had a hard time reading the menu. <br>My niece had the Italian Sausage with shrimp pasta which was pretty spicy, so she only ate 1/4 of it.<br>I had the Shepard&#39;s Pie which was Ono.<br>We also tried the Salted Caramel, Mango Key Lime and White Truffle Raspberry cheese cakes that were yummy<br>Most of all, I really liked our waiter Jimmy, he was very attentive and very knowledgeable of the different choices on the menu.

Food is fine, butter rich and fine. Nothing exciting, but we needed something quick and nearby on the way to the airport that would fill us up for the next sixteen hours as we had an eight hour overnight flight ahead of us. We sad inside which was a bit stuffy.<br><br>As soon as we sat we told our server that we needed to be pretty quick since we had a flight to catch and the service was impeccable. The waitress checked with us regularly and made sure our food was on rush so everything came out quickly and efficiently.<br><br>Seriously, the staff here is SUPER SUPER NICE!! Can&#39;t say I&#39;d come back because I don&#39;t like eating at chain places when on vacation. However, if I had to and needed to, I would come back without hesitation.

Well we are not pressing charges.  Won&#39;t be a cry baby about it but never returning.  Wont recommend to any of family and friends.  By the way I forgot to add that when we got kicked out. We paid our bill 187 and some change. Gave 190$ decided not to tip since we are getting kicked out!!! And the nerrrrrve the server comes back and ask for tip.  Seriously..... so I guess when things like this happens, they are numb to it... but whatever.  Wish I could give -5 stars.

We came because all our friends (both local and tourists) recommended us to. It was very very busy but we got a table right away. Portions were huge for us but we managed to finish most. Food was not the best, but good. Was too full to go for the cheesecake but should&#39;ve ordered to go. Our wait staff was the friendliest! You could tell she was so tired but was really upbeat every time she got to our table. For us as tourists, tipping can be expensive but to have a wait staff like her who pushed through it was worth it. Oh and drinks were good!

My daughter loved the gluten free pork. The gluten free vegetable pasta was blah, but we were hungry, so we ate it. The fries were so salty we had to wipe them off with a napkin before eating them (and I like salt). The gluten free Godiva cheesecake is AMAZING!!! (I would like to give 10 stars for the cheesecake.) The service was excellent!

We&#39;ve been here before a long while back, we loved it then and we still love it now. They told us the wait time would be 20 minutes which wasn&#39;t that bad of a wait.<br>Our waiter was pretty attentive despite how busy it was. We had the warm crab and artichoke dip which was so yummy. I had the shrimp scampi and steak diane, my boyfriend had the herb crusted salmon and the steak diane, it was delicious. Of course we had to try the cheesecake, we had the Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake which was delicious. I can&#39;t wait to go back.

Seating was quick for a busy Saturday summer.<br>It&#39;s 5:30pm on a Saturday. We were told 20 minutes, but got buzzed in 10min.<br><br>Waiter was friendly, loud and clear when he talked with us. He was very detailed on the menu which I appreciated.<br><br>Complimentary bread came first. Three mini loaves two whole wheat, one sourdough. Warm and fresh. Nothing spectacular.<br><br>We ordered the Baked Potato Soup, Potstickers and Kobe Steak Burger.<br><br>Appetizers and Main dish arrived in a timely manner. The Potstickers were ok. They arrive swimming in the dipping sauce with garnish on top. Potstickers were likely steamed and then seared. The filling inside was generous, but wasn&#39;t flavorful. The filling was dry, but the sauce compensated.<br><br>Baked Potato Soup was standard fare. Generous serving, but nothing that punches out the taste buds). We did need to ask that it be heated up. It came to us on the warm-borderline cold side.<br><br>Kobe Burger was good. I ordered mine medium rare and my wife got a well done. Both were cooked to order. Burger was moist, but the taste was a little overpowered by the sautéed mushroom and onions. It also came with an aioli side which complimented it well. I&#39;d give the burger a 3 out of 5 (McDonald&#39;s is a .5 out of 5 for comparison).<br><br>Tip: low group numbers probably was the advantage of getting seated sooner than later. It was only me and the wife.<br><br>Sum it all up. Service was excellent. Food was good. Need to return and try other menu items. I&#39;ll be back.

If I could give this review no stars I would. We were told the wait was an hour and a half. Ended up waiting 2 hours and 15 minutes to get SAT, 20 minutes to get DRINKS which one alcoholic beverage was forgotten. Also had an entree that didn&#39;t come out until everyone else was finished eating. Server said he was working to get fans turned off on patio and obviously nothing was being nothing about it. Manager came over to &#34;talk&#34; to our table about the bad service and her comment was &#34;Sorry it&#39;s taking so long, it will be out shortly&#34;. Worst manager attitude possible. DO SOMETHING FOR THE CUSTOMER. Eat at any other restaurant in the area. Worst customer service ever. I&#39;m a server myself and know what it takes to make the customers experience the best possible.

This was the one time where I found Cheesecake Factory was the better value meal coming in at an affordable price.<br><br>Dang Honolulu is expensive. Like San Francisco or NYC expensive.<br><br>NOTE: The line gets incredibly long. It&#39;s easy to have an hour wait because this place has a prime location on the strip. I&#39;d suggest calling in 45 minutes before and setting up a reservation.<br><br>I went to TCF and ate a ton of bread rolls and a massive salad. I was full the rest of the night into the morning.<br><br>Same old Cheesecake Factory as anywhere else. It&#39;s a classic.

Seems strange to give The Cheesecake Factory in Hawaii of all places 5 stars but it totally deserves every star we&#39;re giving!<br>We had the Herb Crusted Salmon with Mash Potatoes and Asparagus from the lunch menu and Carolina&#39;s BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich. The salmon was fresh and cooked perfectly with delicious dressings. The sandwich/burger was absolutely YUM! The pulled pork was juicy and divine. Servings are huge so come hungry!<br>Service was also great (as is in most Hawaiian restaurants &amp; shops).<br>Will definitely return!

The line was long so we sat at the bar.<br>Very friendly ,fast bartender, though he was busy making drinks.<br>We had meatloaf and Shepard pie to go.<br>Their portions are BIG.<br>Two thumbs up,Cheesecake factory.<br>Oh,,don&#39;t miss the cheesecake here.
The service sucked. I waited almost 40 minutes for 2 slices of cheesecake after I paid for it.

One hour wait? Don&#39;t care! No reservations? Who cares. It&#39;s worth it to come here<br><br>YES I&#39;m reviewing the Cheesecake Factory - a chain restaurant. Yes, we are here multiple times on vacation.  As t swift says haters gonna hate- I don&#39;t care the fold here is good, the portions are good! Lunch is more bang for your buck. Dinner is amazing. The wait is LONG but give in your name to get a buzzer- they give you a estimated wait time- go shopping and come back in time to be called so the buzzer works!<br>Good for vegetarians and non vegetarians!<br>My family lives the Cheesecake Factory - we don&#39;t have any in Canada. In Waikiki- the Cheesecake Factory has a Hawaiian flare - with the servers all in cool shirts. The macadamian crusted Hawaiian fish is sooo good. As are other items, including the avocado egg roll, crab wontons and so on. <br><br>The free bread is good- I don&#39;t care qhTs in it.<br><br>Dessert is good - or save room and get some shaved ice at the stand outside!!

Very long wait to get a table and then to get our food. One of my friends didn&#39;t get her pizza until we were almost done with our dinner. Management didn&#39;t seem to care that we were waiting forever.

The Island Cheeseburger is absolutely to die for! I went back a second time just to get it again! The food was absolutely perfect, drinks were delicious, service was on point, and everyone was so friendly! Highly recommend!

My name is Sandy Y. Lai.  My middle initial Y. signifies that I am respectable and also that I am a signatory.  That means that I am a person of superior status, and without surprise am part of the Executive membership participants for COSTCO food group. <br><br>During the process of my MA in Education I went to the Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki.  My first time I had the Thai Wrap which consisted of lettuce with meat and peanut - it was delicious!  I also went back and felt compelled to have a sandwich once.  The place is really big - it seats lots and lots of diners.<br><br>I remember being happy that Waikiki has so many good places for eats.  And I bought a little stuffed teddy bear which said &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34;  on it - and remembered that with my little pouch of a belly --- Sandy Y. Lai is chubby and chaste and sweet!

This place is on the strip, right down the street from Waikiki beach.  While it is huge, don&#39;t think you won&#39;t have a long wait if you go for dinner!  My suggestion...go about an hour to an hour and a half before you want to eat and put your name on the list.  They&#39;ll give you a buzzer and then do some shopping - but don&#39;t go too far!  <br><br>The menu is huge - over 200 options so they say.  To be honest, they could probably cut down the prices a bit if they didn&#39;t serve such huge portions.  The portion sizes are huge that you essentially get 2 dinners for the price of one.  <br><br>Service is good, and the food is quite tasty.  Yummy smoothies and of course, dessert!  <br><br>Nice patio too - if you get out there!

I really don&#39;t think the wait here is worth it.  It&#39;s not even great. The food was meh.  I got the eggplant parmigiana with the pesto noodles. Let me tell you, it wasn&#39;t pesto. It was more like, butter sauce drizzled with parsley flakes and with tablespoon of salt. Boy, it was so salty and a piggy myself could not even finish it. The eggplant was really oily but it was good because of the mozzarella cheese. I didn&#39;t eat any desserts although I should&#39;ve to probably make up for the salt I just ingested.  I always enjoy the bread though.

I go to Cheesecake Factory all of the time, BUT this was the best one I&#39;ve ever gone to!!! They are the busiest location, but the service was great!! And--they have live bands every night that are so good!!! We wanted something we knew we would love and not only did we get that food wise, we got it service wise as well. Mahalo

I looove the cheesecake factory. So many options on the menu shareable portions and amazing cheesecakes. We all know how awesome the cheesecakes are i am sure you are not waiting for me to say it lol. I love going to the cheesecake factory share a dish with someone and then share a piece of cheesecake and i would be full for the rest of the day!! I finally tried their burgers also and they are on point just like everything else !!

This was a fav place of my co-workers so have been here a dozen times. Have to say my co-workers enjoy a lot more than me. But we learned how to get stake out a table quickly in bar area! Large menu. Great drink &amp; cheesecake selection.

My brother chose Cheesecake Factory to celebrate his birthday ... And this place was a zoo!!! The wait to get in was 90 minutes. Upon entry we waited another 2 hours to order and receive our food. My brother being the happy go lucky guy that he is -- enjoyed all the food, drinks and desserts that was ordered. <br><br>DO NOT GO HERE EXPECTING FAST, QUALITY SEVICE!!!! Very disappointed.

Came here to have a dinner for my birthday, we came in late so the wait isn&#39;t as crazy. They sat us on our seats and the server Jocelyn came in, she wasn&#39;t attentive at all. My boyfriend said it&#39;s her birthday and she looked at my ID and didn&#39;t say anything, rude! She barely checks in on our table so when we had our second cocktails we already finished our food. <br><br>And when we decided to take a cheesecake home she said we could just order it in the table, we only wanted to order a small size but according to her almost all of their cheesecake were sold in full so I have no choice but to get their plane strawberry cheesecake, sad but hey it&#39;s a cheesecake. We waited for our takeout cheesecake for almost an hour. Not happy at all though we still gave her a good amount of tip. Overall this is probably gonna be my first and last visit to cheesecake factory.
I felt as if the cheque practically ordered us to pay a gratuity fee of 20%. The wording should be changed so as to not feel so forced.
My family and I just come here mostly for their cheesecake because it&#39;s so good. We only waited 10 minutes for our waiter to come and ask what we wanted to order and food came in on time.

Celebrated a friends birthday here because her favorite dessert is... cheesecake! Judging by the name many think they only serve cheesecake, not so. They have an EXTENSIVE and tasty MENU, we tried the Impossible burger and it was the best burger we ever had, you would never think it was meatless. Selecting which cheesecake to try was a struggle but it turned out great naturally; it is the cheesecake factory after all:) We tried the Lemon Merengue, and the WHITE CHOCOLATE CARAMEL MACADAMIA NUT CHEESECAKE and they were DIVINE! Portion sizes are on the bigger side, but that&#39;s a good thing. The wait time was a bit long but the delicious food made up for that, besides if you&#39;re in good company the wait time doesn&#39;t matter so much. We are definitely going back there again, we had an AMAZING time. They also sang the Happy Birthday song which was another kick! Thank you Cheesecake Factory!

I don&#39;t know what it is about the cheesecake factory, but we like coming here and splurging every once in a while on a piece of cheesecake. The ladies at the front are always rude but we still insist on coming back here lol! <br>We don&#39;t come here for the food because we did have a bad experience once, so cheesecake it is. They also validate parking for Waikiki shopping plaza down the street, so that&#39;s a big plus. <br>The best cheesecakes we&#39;ve had so far are the Turtle, the banana cream, the carrot, and Adams peanut butter chocolate. <br><br>YUM!

First time at the Cheesecake factory and wow was it busy. They don&#39;t make any reservations so it&#39;s all walk ins. I mean the wait time was an hour and a half to 2 hours long! They said the best time to come was either before 5:30 pm or after 9:30 pm.<br><br>I came in around 9:30 pm and they said it was only 20 minutes. That was fine considering there were many stores around that I could check out while I waited. <br><br>The atmosphere...set the mood the the restaurant. The music was a little loud when you first walk in, so you couldn&#39;t really hear the hostesses. But getting to your table the music kind of died down a little. The lighting of the restaurant was dimmed all around with the tables having their own lights shown on then. <br><br>The menu...was crazy! 21 pages of over 200 different varieties of items to choose from! I really don&#39;t know how the server would remember all of that. But apparently she told me that they have an excellent training program. <br><br>The food...was pretty good but not what I expected. I ordered the filet mignon, which is one of my favorite steaks. Normally the filet is suppose to be a lean cut of steak with no fat to it, just all meat. But the one here is the first ever filet that I&#39;ve found some fat in. I mean it was good, but it could&#39;ve been better without the fat. <br><br>For desert, I was suggested either the banana cream cheesecake or the key lime cheesecake. I ordered the banana cream and it was amazing! I&#39;d say that one cheesecake is enough for one to two people. So if you order, try and get different types and share! They are known for their cheesecakes after all. <br><br>The value...of my food could&#39;ve been better. Typically the price of a filet is around $29.95 - $32.95. I dint think that it was with it for the filet, however, the Cheesecake was amazing! And the value of my service was excellent!<br><br>My server was Olivia and she really knew her stuff. She was very attentive and made sure all her tables got what they needed. She answered many of the questions that I had about the menu and that really impressed me since there are a lot of options on there. And congratulations to her! She is due to give birth in 6 weeks! <br><br>As I was leaving the restaurant I spoke with one of the managers named Bryan and told him about my experience. He was also very knowledgeable about the restaurant. He gave me some good tips about how to be successful in opening up your own restaurant. <br><br>Overall, I would highly recommend this restaurant. But if you do decide to go, go in either before 5:30 pm or after 9:30 pm. If you need to go on between this time, it&#39;s fine, since you can go shopping or walking around waikiki to kill some time.

-2 stars for the wait alone. <br><br>Their food is good. My favorite is definitely their gumbo. I would wait in line for that while I shop next door. And ofcourse their cheesecakes are to die for. There is soooo many. Apple caramel streusel is awesome. Their Oreo cookie-yummmmmmmm their red velvet oooooh yeah.

This place is crazy busy during dinner time so we decided to &#34;pick up&#34; and take the food to our room.  Even though you don&#39;t get the same experience as sitting down it did not disappoint. The food was awesome. For myself it was the Seared Ahi Tuna. Excellent! Try it! Trust me! For dessert you can&#39;t go wrong with anything they have and I went with the <br>Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake. Delish! Pick one, you can&#39;t go wrong. My wife had the Herb Crusted Filet of Salmon. She says &#34;fantastic&#34; and she loves to the try salmon wherever she can. Always trying to one up her last perfectly done salmon meal. She had the Pumpkin Cheesecake. She loved it. However you decide to get a meal from here you will not regret it.

Always love this place no matter what location. Chicken Madeira is the bomb!<br>Daughter had Orange chicken and loved it.<br>Wife always gets the chop salad but they mistakenly gave her a Cobb salad instead and she loved it too!<br>Long waits but worth it.

Fantastic! Everyone is so friendly and attentive to your needs. The meals are great. We ate here a few times during our stay. The salads are cool crisp. You get alot for what for you pay we always had left overs.

I usually stop in after work for just a slice of cheesecake after a long day but last night we decided &#34;eh why not, let&#39;s drink.&#34; Whoever was in charge of the lava flows last night, probably the best lava flow I have ever had. Absolutely perfect! And my salad was huge as always but so satisfying. They never stiff me on the amount of chicken in my chicken caesar salad here. And to top it all off the service is always friendly and more than accommodating when asking for our cheesecake to go. :)
The food was delicious! Be prepared to wait in line approximately 30 minutes but the service and food made up for the wait.

All I have to say was the food was bomb!!!!!! Never disappointed with the food and service except for this night. Still receiving a 4 star though. Waiter was sort of moody and she needed to go home! Food tasted great and the runners worked really hard. <br>Ambiance is really dark and we need our phone lights to read the menu. After waiting for 2hours to just be seated, the food was worth it.
Great Food, Great Service...really enjoyed ourselves at this restaurant. Just be prepared to wait 1-1.5hours if you want a table for a large group.
Passion fruit Margarita is a great choice for Margarita lovers who want something different from the typical Margarita. Don&#39;t let the martini glass full you it is full of flavor.

Cheesecake would get a five from me if there wasn&#39;t always such a long wait. I get it, it&#39;s Waikiki, but I wish they could take reservations. The food is always excellent here, regardless of the wait time, I always keep coming back! I haven&#39;t ordered a dish I didn&#39;t like here. The cheesecake is delicious too of course. They will validate your parking - that&#39;s always a plus!

Always have a good meal here no matter which location. I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed the Waikiki location. Service was fast and food was cooked perfectly. Feels upscale and worth a visit if you&#39;ve never tried it. Wait can be long at peak hours. Enjoy.

I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factories and I have been to the waikiki one several times. We were in the area and decided to stop by for lunch.<br><br>Atmosphere: Standard cheesecake factory decor. Many booths and plenty of seating. I don&#39;t know how they handle all the customers but they do a great job.<br><br>Service: Our waitress was top notch. Very friendly and always available. No issues with our orders. <br><br>Food: The menu is humongous! It&#39;s like the restaurant, but I just don&#39;t know how they manage to produce good quality and fresh food in such short time with the menu as large as it is. They really are a factory. I ordered the buffalo wings, caesar salad and pesto chicken pizza. I enjoyed my entire meal and everyone else at the table was also very happy.<br><br>Intangibles: I typically don&#39;t care for chain restaurants but when they do such a good job like this Cheesecake factory I can&#39;t help but like it. I would recommend going here to anyone who is looking for consistent good food.

The food and drinks at CC Factory are great for a relaxed night on the town.  I just went for like the 50th time and my visit was very pleasant which is normal.  The staff places an importance on customer service and making sure your enjoy your dining experience.  They actually made a mistake on one of the dishes and left that as a comp for the table.  Great customer service.  The pear martini was awesome and the Sandwiches and appetizers are very tasty.  All the other entrees we had were also excellent.  <br><br>Try the Asian pear martini before they get rid of it.

This is one of my favorite restaurants on the island.  My love for the Cheesecake Factory shows every time I brave the Waikiki crowds and the hour wait for a table just to get one of their pasta dishes. <br><br>While this restaurant is known for their namesake (and their cheesecake is good), I ALWAYS come back for the Pasta da Vinci. It&#39;s penne pasta in a delicious (and addicting) wine sauce with chicken, mushrooms and onions. The waiter normally will freshly grate/shred cheese on top of the pasta. There is just something about that pasta sauce that calls to me; it&#39;s slightly sweet and not too rich.  I&#39;ve never found any entree like it. <br><br>When you&#39;re at the Cheesecake Factory, you always have to save room for dessert. They have a multitude of flavors of cheesecake, plus other types if desserts too. I usually get the vanilla bean cheesecake - it&#39;s surprisingly light for a cheesecake. The flavor isn&#39;t overpowering or overly sweet. I&#39;ve also had their lemon raspberry cream, peppermint (seasonal), white chocolate raspberry truffle, and the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut cheesecake slices. No matter which ones I&#39;ve tried, the vanilla bean still takes the number one spot for me (okay...that peppermint cheesecake for the holiday season is a close second - if only they had it year-round!). Also, keep in mind, that with all cheesecake slices, they give these huge dollops of whipped cream. Just delicious! (I try not to think of calories when I eat here)<br><br>The food and the cheesecakes are amazing here and their bread is just as fantastic.  At other restaurants, I normally don&#39;t eat the bread so I have room for appetizers, the entree, and dessert, but here, I skip apps and I eat the bread. If I didn&#39;t love that pasta so much, I&#39;d consider eating just the bread for my meal. It&#39;s that good. Plus, it is complimentary. <br><br>Tips:<br>- When you come here, expect at least a 45 minute wait to be seated<br>- get your parking validated<br>- always save room for dessert :)

Cheesecake Factory is one of our favourite restaurants.  They are not in Canada, so whenever we are in the U.S., we always hit one up.<br><br>The food and service is always 5 stars.  This Honolulu establishment food and service was 5 stars.  The big burrito was so big, that I could not order any cheesecake.  All four of us were so full with our orders, we all passed on dessert.  My daughter had pasta in white sauce which was delicious and a huge serving.  She could barely finish it off for lunch the next day.<br><br>Now we have been to lots of Cheesecake Factories over the years.  And have waited for most of them.<br><br>But waiting for 75 minutes was to much.  It puts a damper on the meal, especially when Waikiki is bursting with great places to eat.<br><br>Love ya CF, but I&#39;ll be avoiding the Waikiki establishment.

Oh how I&#39;ve been craving some cheesecake. After talking about it for months since my husband has never eaten here and it&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve eaten here. We finally put the talk into action and drove all the way into Waikiki. Not that it&#39;s hours of driving but when you live on Oahu anything not 10min away is a long drive...haha.<br><br>Parking is in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. We failed to do our research and ended up in line at their prime time on a Sunday evening. The wait time was 45min. Normally, we wouldn&#39;t wait that long for a table, but we drove all this way for some cheesecake and we were not back out now. Upon check-in, you&#39;re given a pager. Luckily, there are several places in that area, so the wait time didn&#39;t seem too bad. We walked around the shopping center. <br><br>Next thing you know, we&#39;re being paged. So off we head to the front of the line, handed our pager over and was guided to wait on the side to wait for our someone to seat us. Once our name was called, we anxiously followed our hostess to our seat. How disappointing it was to be seated just behind the counter at the bar. It was loud and very dim. I&#39;m not sure if the rest of the restaurant is as dim but it was dark enough that I had to hold the menu up close to read it.<br><br>After waiting all that time, we opted to have our dessert first. I was pretty adamant about that because when we go out to eat we usually are so stuffed from our food that we end up passing on the dessert...well not this time. I had the white chocolate raspberry truffle and my husband had the Salted caramel. Both were delicious but I thoroughly enjoyed mine better. You can not go wrong with white chocolate and raspberry in my opinion. We then ordered the Kalua pork nachos...so yummy, so yummy! After skimming through the menu, I was so undecided on what I wanted to eat because there was so much to choose from. I decided to wait, since the nacho portion size was so big. My husband ordered the Hibachi steak. And it was very flavorful. I had a few bites of my hubbys plate and opted not to order a meal because I was stuffed. Of course we ordered a cheesecake to go, we went with the dutch apple caramel streusel. My husband swears he had his cheesecake fix. But I found my cheesecake the next day half eaten by him. <br><br>Overall, the food and cheesecake was awesome. We will definitely return, but I&#39;ll make sure to request seating outside of the bar area because it was hard to hold a conversation even though we were sitting right across the table from each other.
We had the most  amazing food and experience last night! Scott and Larry took such great care of us! Seriously the best steak tacos and cheese cake I&#39;ve ever had!

Other then long waits unless you are an early bird eater this place is the best. I mean what&#39;s not to love. Ginormous meals, delicious cheesecakes and bread mmmmm always ask for two honey wheat, who needs the sour dough. <br>I have yet to have a bad meal or service experience here. All I ask is that Cheesecake Factory open a location closer to my house lol

Service and food was very good at our table. Both will draw me back here again, but the outside seating during the day was a bit too much. <br>The pigeons were a pest!  It&#39;s constantly scavenging for crumbs, flapping around your legs and occasionally dive bombing over our heads. We had to duck and dodge several times!  There were only two fowl when the host sat us. Then, the neighboring table fed bread crumbs and half bitten French fries until a dozen showed up for the free buffet as we exited. <br>Kalakaua Avenue is busy throughout the day with foot traffic as well as the continual river of cars, loud motorcycles and delivery trucks. You could look on the bright side of this venue and try to soak in the experience of exciting fire truck sirens and the ambulance stopped across the street. But, this is not ideal for paying attention to your spouse and the family conversation. <br>Table Servers and food was very good; the seating and environment was unpleasant. Hope this helps.

Everyone and their mama knows about Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s probably one of the biggest food chains across the country. That&#39;s probably one of the main reasons why it&#39;s always so busy. If you come here for lunch, wait times are actually good. Usually if you get there before noon, you can get sat right away. But if you come here for dinner, you better eat like a side meal or bring a snack because wait times can go up to almost 2 hours! And sometimes they even run out of pagers, so they just give you a piece of paper and ask you to come back later for a pager.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory has a very large and expansive menu, over 250 dishes! They have everything: lunch specials (served until 5pm), breakfast all day, burgers, regular entrees, alcohol and CHEESECAKE for dessert. I normally come here for lunch with my coworkers and we usually take advantage of their lunch specials. They have couple options on their menu that comes in lunch-size portions: salad, soup and salad, salad and pizza, pasta, chicken, salmon and other specialties for reasonable pricing. I normally get the salad and pizza (BBQ Chicken Pizza is my favorite) as I always end up taking home leftovers because the portions are large for me. My boyfriend usually appreciates when I have leftover pizza for him to eat lol. And of course you can&#39;t forget about their famous cheesecakes. I normally don&#39;t make it to dessert, but they have over 30 different flavors. And depending on the season, they may have special flavors to try.  <br><br>On my most recent visit, we came here for dinner around 6pm for a party of 8. The wait was 1 hour and 45 minutes. OMG. But since this is where the birthday girl wanted to go, we decided to walk around Waikiki and just wait. We luckily got buzzed 15 minutes earlier, but because our big group split up during the wait, only 3 of us were able to make it back to the restaurant first. They wouldn&#39;t sit us until half our party was there. A bit ridiculous if you ask me as we were already waiting for so long. We told them they were in the area and on their way, but they still wouldn&#39;t sit us. So as we waited for the rest of our party to show up, we prayed they didn&#39;t give our table away. <br><br>After we finally got sat, the first thing everyone asked was &#34;are the lights on?&#34; It was so dark, we had to use the flashlight off our phones to see the menu better. On top of that, our waiter, Brian I think was his name, was the real MVP (sarcasm). When he finally took our orders, he would take down 2 orders, then disappear, and then show up again, and then disappear again. It was quite annoying as he did that with our water refills too. And when we asked if it was possible to split the check, he tried to make us feel bad by saying it&#39;ll take longer to split. And before he left to place our orders, he made another comment that he thought was funny by saying &#34;I had to stop my temptations to tell you I can&#39;t split the check.&#34; I know I probably gave him the death stare after he said that because that was just rude! After we got our food, he was non-existent until we got our bill. The only highlight of that night was there was live entertainment that played oldies but goodies songs. <br><br>Other than that rude waiter, the food here is actually not too bad. I did like the Chicken Madeira. The chicken was tender, had lots of mushrooms and asparagus and the sauce was delicious. I liked the cheese, but it may have been too much cheese on the chicken. Their Miso Salmon is another favorite of mines. As for their cheesecakes, my favorite is probably their Pineapple Upside Down cheesecake. And I recently tried their Oreo Dream Extreme cheesecake. It looks really rich, but it was actually light and fluffy. And it came with a huge oreo cookie on top!<br><br>Customer service isn&#39;t the greatest here as on other occasions, service is usually slow, even during lunch time when it&#39;s not too busy. But I usually come back here because of the food.

This is a restaurant chain. I&#39;ve also been to the one in Miami. The things they both have in common is there is always a long wait and the air conditioning is pretty high. So bring a sweater. We came at an irregular hour so got seated fairly quickly. <br>Don&#39;t eat any bread cuz the portions are big. <br>For appetizers we got the Avocado Egg rolls. Although it&#39;s fried, it&#39;s very good! The guacamole was good but a little spicy even though we asked for mild, and it&#39;s repetitive of the eggrolls. Hubby got the ahi poke and said it was ok. <br>For the main we got the Avocado Salad with chicken. It was too spicy and saucy. My mother in law got the falafel salad. It was too creamy. <br>Next time get something else and make sure it is not spicy at all because everything seems to have added spice. <br>The only reason I&#39;m giving this a 3 star is cuz I remember the food being better.

This is gonna be the worst Cheesecake Factory they I&#39;ve ever been in. My wife and I love Cheesecake Factory and we&#39;ve been to so many in other states as well.  Kapolei Cheesecake Factory is super goood too. But man coming down in town near Waikiki is the worst one yet.  First they got our order wrong. Second they didn&#39;t really cook the food right.  And to top things off, my wife have gotten really sick with stomach aches and #2 through out the day. I don&#39;t know about you but I wouldn&#39;t suggest coming down here at all.  In case I forget, they never came back to top my water.  Our waiter was so rude and I felt like he was racist or something.  We gave him a $20 tip anyway.  My wife mentioned it was food poisoning and I think it&#39;s more than that.  Thoughts of spitting on your food or just giving you food from the fridge that other customers ordered and changed their mind. I am very disappointed and super sick to my stomach.  I haven&#39;t had the runs like this for a very long time. Don&#39;t ever come here because you will get sick. And whoever is the manager down there, you&#39;re lucky we are leaving town on Monday July 2nd and have better tasting food somewhere else.  I can&#39;t believe you guys made us sick.  Unbelievable!!!!  You guys need to train your staff a little better or hire those that are passionate about their job and not those who are racist and spit on our food just for pleasure.  However you made us sick today, reflects ultimately on the manager.  I can verify that I was there early today. Maybe it&#39;s because we&#39;re local and they think we&#39;re dumb or something. But karma will come right at you and I hope and pray you make your peace with the Almighty because someday someone will come and sue you.   <br><br>Advice to everyone who likes Cheesecake Factory is that you go to the Kapolei side. More friendly and more local style.   I can&#39;t believe I&#39;m still feeling sick right now.  Just poor management and bad cooks.  You should be ashamed of yourselves.  Love the people that comes to your restaurant and try not to kill them. Like I said, someone will show up someday and I hope you guys lawyer up.  Giving people spoiled food is not right.  Spitting on people&#39;s food is not right.

This is the only Cheesecake Factory on the island so when I am craving their cheesecake, I have to go out of my way and go to Waikiki, which I try to never do. <br><br>Came here on a Saturday night around 5pm... Never again! The hostess said the wait time would be 45 minutes for a table for 2 and we waited almost 2 hours. <br><br>They have good food and I LOVE their cheesecake, but the wait time is not worth it unless you don&#39;t mind the wait. I had a gift card there so I used it all up the next day and just got takeout which was faster.<br><br>It&#39;s so crazy busy here that the service is not that great but how can you blame them! It&#39;s a zoo here on the weekends! <br><br>I always get the Fettuccine Alfredo with grilled chicken, broccoli and portobello mushrooms and I never finish it because the portions are huge! I think my new favorite dish here is their tempura fish tacos. Oh. My. Gosh. To die for!!! Great to eat during happy hour. And their cheesecakes speak for themselves so I don&#39;t have to say too much about that. <br><br>Also, they validate parking for the Royal Hawaiian Shopping center parking garage for up to 2 hours. Still had to pay though because I was waiting for a table for 2 hours :( boo.

Okay the food is fantastic as always, but the service was the best we&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory or even just any restaurant at that! Our server was Tyler, and he did so amazing. He brought us a free banana for our baby boy!

The worst customer service ever. I waited 25 minutes for a seat. They put me in the back on a very small table because I was single. Waited a other 20 min. For a waiter. Then he said they were out of bread and they are making it, what a lie the person next to me got bread. I had to stop a bus boy and ask what happened to the bread and he had no idea. The waiter brought me my ice tea and placed a previous order earlier, I knew the way things were going it would be a while to be served. After another 40 mi utes of waiting for the bread that never came I decided to <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fgo.my&amp;s=36bb475cb66b1592cebbf6f1427b21f147918a4c06e9cb8c0dad0d6b0ce98c42" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">go.my</a> feeling is that this is bot s place for single people. Their loss. It is my favorite restaurant but never ever want to have that experience again. Please let your servers know that every customer. Single or many are just as important. I got the strong vibe he didn&#39;t care because his tip would not be as big with one person.too bad, the food is great but the service stings big, big ,time. He only had a few tables. It wasn&#39;t as if he had alot of tables, I counted he only had four at the time. I saw he tell that to the bus boy. Please get your act together or I will spread the word to many of my friends not to go there again. Respect single people, it doesn&#39;t matter about the tip, they will tell other single people. All are important. If I was the manager there this guy would be off the payroll. 40 minutes, plus 20 minutes, plus another 20  and did not get my meal. I ended up walking out.

We just finished a FANTASTIC post-hurricane lunch at Cheesecake Factory and the service we received was excellent. Thank you Kainoa, job well done. Everyone left with a smile on their face and a VERY full belly. <br><br>Portions are huge!! My burrito was so large that I&#39;ll have the leftover for lunch tomorrow. Hell even the kids portion of Mac n cheese and side of fries were much larger than my 3yr old twins could finish (they shared 1/2 and 1/2). <br><br>We&#39;ve eaten here before and this by far was the best experience we&#39;ve had thus far. Why only 4then?  I&#39;m not a fan of long waits, never have been, never will be, although this wait was only 35 minutes ( short by normal times here ) I still considered not going. Also, why don&#39;t they take reservations? I would be happy to secure mine with a credit card to insure I show up. I think that&#39;s a GREAT IDEA. Look into it Cheesecake Factory.
Got the snickers cheese cake.  It was DELISH hope to get again tonight hahahahahahaha
Everything is great! The atmosphere, the food, the drinks! I guess a big brand is more trustworthy than some  ratings.

Great location with the traditional Cheesecake Factory fare... the server even told me so! However, she was quick to point out the local selections, which today included the Mac-nut crusted Ono ($28). <br><br>The atmosphere was relaxing for lunch, with ample seating in their patio (facing Kalakaua Ave). The indoor seating is dark and cool if you need to cool off from the Honolulu sun. The bar has a fun Waikiki style, with pineapple lamps along the bar.<br><br>Park at the Royal Hawaiian Center parking garage (entrance is past Lewers); they will validate your ticket and you might get away with not having to pay for parking during lunch.

I embarrassed to admit that we ate at the Cheesecake Factory during our stay in Waikiki.  Husband wanted to go but seemed like every time we walked by there were huge long lines waiting to be seated.  We decided to have a relatively early dinner one evening.  At the desk we were told it was about a 10 minute wait at that time so we took a pager and checked out the menu.  About 10 minutes later the pager did go off so we went back to the desk where they took the pager and then had us wait behind the desk, I&#39;d estimate another 5 to 10 minutes before we were seated.  Sly, break up the wait time.  We were wondering if this was the largest Cheesecake Factory as it seems immense so looked it up on Google.  That honor goes to the one in Dubai.  However, this one serves more meals than any other restaurant on the island.  I sure would like to see their kitchen turning out so many meals.  Once we ordered it didn&#39;t take too long for our food to arrive.  Hamburger or him, and it was huge and a chicken club sandwich for me.  Both meals were tasty and filling.

AMAAAAAAAAAAZING! Awesome service by hostess Jenn and our server Jess. Jenn started out our night by making conversation while walking us to our table. It was small talk, but genuine. She wasn&#39;t rushing us to our table and she made sure everything was said with a smile. <br>After we were seated our server, Jess, came to our introduce herself and give us the run down on the HUGE menu! Gosh there are so many choices one of my friends decided just to go with salad so he wouldn&#39;t have to read everything lol. <br><br>I asked Jess to recommend some things to me and I am blown away with how great her recommendations were. The chicken Katsu with a spicy miso sauce- MUST TRY! Now i know what hawaii people are thinking- chicken Katsu? Really?- but DANG! That was the best ever. Very juicy crisp slices over a bed of rice topped lightly with delicious sweet and spicy miso sauce with sautéed veggies on the side- win. She also recommended the peach Bellini-NO IFS ANDS OR BUTS MUST TRY! Mmm i would come back JUST for that drink. We ended it with an amazing blueberry white chocolate cheesecake. I am now FAT FULL and SATISFIED. Thanks for making this an amazing night out!!!!!
Great experience <br>Server was quick and always checking on us<br>We got our food really fast <br>Only problem was the line but that&#39;s given

Let&#39;s just say i popped my cherry for The Cheesecake Factory And I&#39;m glad I finally did ! When we arrived it was at the upmost of a 20 minute wait. We were then seated and our server was JESI  we ordered drinks,food as well as appetizers. She later came back with our drinks and complimentary bread. I would say, roughly; we got our food in 15 mins. It was very fast ! Our server has outstanding customer service. Always checked up on us if we needed any refreshment refills or how our food tasted. Thank you JESI for making my family&#39;s night a blast with your kick ass customer service! Y&#39;all if you want a good first impression; she&#39;s your girl

I love Cheesecake factory! The pictures and name should have already sold you. I&#39;m guessing this place isn&#39;t a 5 star establishment because of the long lines and the location. Us locals usually dread going into Waikiki because everything is so touristy crowded, and over priced. Aside from that, i love it here. <br><br>I get the salmon, either herb crusted or miso, its always a toss up, they&#39;re both so good! And i&#39;ve recently discovered the steak diane and shrimp combo. #toodiefor Its really good, and a generous portion. But too much if you are trying to save room for dessert. I used to like all the fancy cheesecakes like the white chocolate raspberry, but lately i&#39;ve been a plain with strawberry kinda gal. <br><br>They really need to do cheesecake samplers in big shot glasses so i can have more than one! And so i dont feel so guilty!

Who wants to eat at the Cheesecake Factory in Honolulu when there are so many other choices around? The answer is &#34;YOU DO!!! The portions are huge and the good expertly prepared with super fresh ingredient. At peak times expect a wait of 30-45 minutes. At non-peak times you can still expect to wait 10-15 minutes. It&#39;s worth the wait. Great service too. Save room for cheesecake! You&#39;ll be glad you did.

All the favorite. Thats why a lot ppl eats here.<br>A long wait but worth it if you know what to order or whats good. <br>We ordered calamari,  thai wrap, shrimp pasta and chicken madera pasta. All delicious!<br><br>45mins wait to be seated but the food is fast when you order right away.<br><br>Oh we ordered black out cake, carrol cheesecake and sneakers cheesecake. So yummy! <br><br>They validate parking if you park by royal hawaiian parking.<br><br>I love this place!

This review went from 4 stars to 1 in a matter of mins. I was totally flabbergasted when I saw a lady with her non service animal dog with its head on a table, then lap up water from a drinking cup! I&#39;m sorry I didn&#39;t get a pic and even more sorry we came here. <br>The bus person halfway wiped the table and the the next customers were seated. I&#39;m in total yuck!! Hubby called the MGR over and he was fully apologetic and had the table properly recleaned.

1st: Our server Marc was beyond awesome. He offered great customer service and knew which dishes to recommend. <br><br>2nd: The food portions were enough that you would have a good amount for lunch the next day. <br><br>3rd: I had the Pineapple in paradise. This has many layers when it comes to taste, which was very good. It comes with 2 straws but it is not actually enough to share or potent enough. The whiskey smash will take care of you in that department.

Had dinner tonight with my girlfriend. We were seated right when we got inside. THEN our waiter, Kristy(?), acted a little unusual when talking to us. After we ate our food, we waited a good 30 minutes for her to offer us any dessert or if we wanted anything else. So we basically sat in our seats waiting for her. The two tables next to us were waiting for to-go boxes and their bill as well. She didn&#39;t come back for quite some time and we told the host. When she finally came back, we ordered dessert and it took her 15 minutes to come back to our table every time we needed something. We were always looking for her. Didn&#39;t like the service from her and probably won&#39;t come back.

I visited the Cheesecake Factory on a Thursday night around 8. The wait time was about 35 minutes. The host that walked to our table was very friendly. He was super sociable! Then our waiter took our order. I tried the fried Mac &amp; Cheese, 4 Cheese Pasta, and a side of Mashed Potatoes. Also I order a Red Sangria! The Red Sangria was delicious!! It&#39;s a chilled wine with fresh fruit. I highly recommend! The food was pretty good. I would say it was worth wait time. I also tried the Chocolate Cheesecake. It was very rich and delicious. <br><br>The restaurant inside was huge ! The atmosphere was very loud and  the lights were dimly lit. Almost a little difficult to hear across the table. <br><br>Overall good experience and I would come back again.

We&#39;ve been to this Waikiki Cheesecake Factory many times, and the service and food is always outstanding and is worth the 1 hour wait. We went there last night and was happy to know that the wait was only 30 minutes. Our waitress was Bianca who seemed more like a robot who showed very little personality, customer service and never smiled. Almost like she wanted off that night but was forced to work kind of attitude. <br><br>My wife was the only one that ordered a salad, which came quickly. But within 5 minutes our entrees arrived including hers. Why bring a person&#39;s entree when you just got your salad? When my wife told them that she&#39;s still eating her salad, the waiter asked if she&#39;d like for them to hold her meal in the kitchen while she finished her salad. My wife agreed that would be best. About 5 minutes later Bianca told my wife it would be best if she could take her entree now or it&#39;ll be cold. It wasn&#39;t my wife&#39;s fault, so why the choice of either now or cold food? They should have made her a new dish when she was done with her salad. We also never got our complimentary bread as we usually got in the past. <br><br>When Bianca told us of the specialty cheesecakes, she rattled them off so quickly like it was something she was forced to do rather wanting to tell us about. We ordered our deserts and also one coffee. The deserts came but not the coffee. <br><br>Overall, the food was good as usual. I always order the chicken picatta, which I haven&#39;t found better at any other restaurant. It was just the service last night was terrible. That&#39;s why the wait was only 30 minutes, it&#39;s because they skip the bread, bring the food out while you&#39;re still eating the salad, and Bianca was just a waitress robot.
This place rocks. Always busy. You won&#39;t find the quality or quantity anywhere else. Just take a look at the kitchen and see how hard all these people work!

Cheesecake Factory is always a fun place to go to for dinner! They have such a variety that my bf hates it because he can&#39;t decide what he wants. Lol Which is a good thing for me at least. <br><br>Our server was probably one of the best servers we have had in a very long time. He was very attentive and always made sure everything was okay. We always had drinks on the table wether it was alcoholic, soda or even water. He kept us stocked up. <br><br>We had ordered something off the menu and didn&#39;t realize it had pork on it. It was totally our fault. Regardless, the manager came over and apologized and even took it off our tab. We even explained that it was our mistake and we were taken care of. That is incredible service! <br><br>If I can give them more than 5 stars, I would. Thank you to all over here! <br><br>I will update this review with our servers name.

Nothing worse than a lying manager. Just be honest . My salad and bread were timely. Entree took 40 mins. Manager came by to say it will be a few minutes. I asked him if they forgot he said no we sat 70 tables in the last hour. Oh really? Well several people around me came way after me and got their food. Honesty isn&#39;t a thing. Don&#39;t deflect dude, be a positive example for someone and be truthful. Dang it I love Cheesecake Factory at home. This place was horrible. Just to add.. the napkin that sits in the bread was brought to me used! Disgusting. Will the bartender is very fast and efficient.... just saying

The problem I have with this location is that you are packed in like sardines.  I don&#39;t enjoy sitting so close to the people on either side of me that I feel like I am a part of their conversation.  I come here once a year and regret it every time. I live in Waikiki and this my least favorite restaurant to come to not because of the food but because you are literally herded in like cattle.

My sister and I sat at the bar for lunch and Courtney was absolutely amazing! She was very personable, good sense of humor, and pretty damn good at making drinks! Hands down the best service we received while on island.
Great service, food and cheesecakes!  This place is always busy, but makes you feel relaxed during your wait.

The #1 rule of good management: Feed your people! My team and I were setting up for our Yelp booth at Spam Jam and I decided to pop over to Cheesecake Factory to grab take-out for the looooooong event ahead. <br><br>I tried to order my favorite thai chicken pasta but the woman at the counter informed me that it had been discontinued. I shook my fist in the air and screamed &#34;Noooooooooooooooooooooooooo!&#34; After my fit and several rounds of crying, I proceeded to order the tomato basil penne pasta and a french country salad which consisted of greens, asparagus, beets and goat cheese. I ran back to my booth and returned twenty minutes later for my order. Back at the Yelp booth the three of us (me, Thomas O &amp; Pua P) dove into the two dishes. The portions in classic Cheesecake Factory style were gigantic! The pasta was nothing too adventurous but satisfying. The french country salad exceeded my expectations and was very tasty! It&#39;s something I&#39;d certainly order again on a return visit. $25 fed all three of us so it wasn&#39;t too shabby of a deal!<br><br>The service at the bakery counter was alright but I thought it lacked overall attentiveness. They seemed really busy checking on their registers and cheesecakes, but wouldn&#39;t it have been better to tend to the customer first? I waited for someone to help me both times while ordering and upon my return to pick up my food. The phone kept ringing again and again while I was there and all I could keep thinking was &#34;That&#39;s your customer on the phone. Will someone pick it up?!&#34; I know I&#39;d want someone to answer my phone call if I was calling.<br><br>I&#39;ve decided to pull back a star because well...I want my damn thai pasta! Bring it back! Bring it back! Bring it back! I&#39;ll see you soon for a strawberry shortcake...<br><br>Yelp 365 Challenge: #218/365 (The Bring Back My Thai Pasta)

This review is solely on our food and service. <br><br>Let me start by saying that our server Denise was fantastic! She was very attentive and made great food suggestions for us. She was a bright light in such a chaotically busy restaurant.  <br><br>After an hour wait to get a table we were thrilled that the food &amp; service was so good. We&#39;ll be back!

Serviced sucked&#39; food was bland, wayyyy to busy! SOoo many tourist, but of course haha I&#39;m in Waikiki .. Lol soo loud, <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdef.ly&amp;s=bfa64e13b377aa7834fb38b320db99fed3d342097ba1505260056efeedcca001" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">def.ly</a> not a sit down and enjoy your food kinda place.  But if you&#39;re in a rush and just want to eat and get the heck out .. This is a place for you. Oo I almost forgot there is always a wait time 1hr or longer lol! This is a place if you want to just grab a quick bite and have a drink or two. Food was great but it was ok. Food very pricy being that it&#39;s a place for tourist. We have this in Cali! Jaha I wouldn&#39;t waste a dime more at this place again I can wait to go to one in Cali! Where it&#39;s not super busy and the food is more flavorful lol!<br><br>-chicken biscuit was a hit like always you can never go wrong with that! <br>-the burgers always good too you can never go wrong with that! <br>-calamari was ok!

We stopped for a late dinner during a recent stay in Waikiki Beach. There was a bit of a wait even at 10:00pm, but we found the service and food to be good with good atmosphere. Marisa was our server and we found her to be very professional, attentive, and polite. We&#39;ll certainly be stopping in again the next time we&#39;re in town. Food A+, Atmosphere A+, Marisa A+.

My husband and I went here on our honeymoon and definitely loved our visit! We are just very impressed by the quality, quantity and price of the food! There wasn&#39;t a long waiting time between our order being placed and food served on table. Great customer service! We loved Shawn, our server! He made our visit so much more fun. The cheesecake is the best cheesecake ever! We got the Cinnabon Cheesecake this time, and it was heavenly! We&#39;re just surprised for how great it is, and literally incomparable with any other restaurant in town!

I always love this place it&#39;s great food great atmosphere  all around goodness. If u don&#39;t mind waiting the line is long but worth it!! who can resist their deep fried mac and cheese. the best chiken picatta and the chicken marsala with garlic mashed potatoes. I also love the tamale  corn cakes very unique. I think its the sauce that makes it but its delish and unexpected
Excellent takeout for those in Waikiki area. 10/10 times it&#39;s ready in 25/30 minutes.
Good fast food<br>Usual Cheesecake experience, long wait for table, but when we sit down good service, friendly staff and good fast food.<br>June 2016

We arrived at Cheesecake Factory today at about 10:15 a.m., shortly after opening. <br>We got seated quickly.  Our server&#39;s name was Eric H. We ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad, two Chicken Piccatas, Fried Chicken and Waffles Benedict and a Kids&#39; Spaghetti w/Meatball. For beverages, we had the Arnold Palmer.  <br><br>Let me first begin with no bread. The kids&#39; Spaghetti arrived after 15 minutes. Then, another 20 minute wait came the entrees, but no salad.  We asked Eric H. for bread and about the salad.  He said that he thought we wanted the Chicken Piccatas instead of the Chinese Chicken Salad, but what he &#34;thought&#34; and what we said were not the same.  <br><br>Service was very slow. Very Disappointing!  This was a terrible dining experience! Not how I remember the Cheesecake Factory Waikiki in the past.  We wanted to order Cheesecakes, but decided to order it on our way out at the counter display because we didn&#39;t want to wait another 20+ minutes.  <br><br>The entrees were good, but the Arnold Palmers and Shirley Temples were terrible. <br>Much improvement is needed primarily with the service; beverages too.

For cheesecake this is a 10 Star Joint!!  For Food this place is above average but below great!<br><br>My favorite Appetizers are the Avocado Egg Rolls and the Fried Macaroni and Cheese.  For sandwiches my favorite is the Grilled chicken Avocado Club.  For brunch the Brioche Breakfast Sandwich is delicious.  <br><br>I personally like their breakfast, lunch, and appetizers more than most of their dinners.  When coming here use the menu to your advantage remember this is not an Italian restaurant or steak house this is an American chain restaurant so order accordingly.<br><br>Obviously it&#39;s impossible to go wrong with their cheesecakes whether it&#39;s their original or any of their specialty cheesecakes!  Order the Dulce De Leche Caramel Cheesecake or the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake they are both heavenly.<br><br>This Waikiki so yea if it&#39;s a Wednesday-Sunday you will be waiting and possibly up to two hours.

Great atmosphere here (probably because it&#39;s Hawaii!) There are a few items on the menu that aren&#39;t available in Texas, where I live. I went with the pizza and red Velvet cheesecake and both were amazing! The service was great, and the staff very friendly.

Cheesecake Factory is my favorite place to eat.  Food was delicious. I had the shrimp scampi and Diane steaks with linguine pasta with a side order of alfredo sauce.  For my drink I ordered the mango smoothies it was super delicious. The service was awesome, our server was Cecine she was very quick and nice.  Actually the rest of the staffs was awesome.  For the desert I ordered the Godiva cheesecake as my birthday cake, it was delicious.  I will be back again.

Had the fish tacos. Food was cold when it arrived so I sent it back. Manager came out and asked if I wanted the plate I got reheated or a new plate. Told him it he could reheat it. Got my plate back and it was not much better, maybe a couple of degrees warmer as in Luke warm. Ate it, but will not return.

Second time coming here while on vacation, we had Bo as your waiter and he&#39;s a dream! Loved my food and my drink (J.W&#39;s Pink Lemonade). Nice atmosphere and pretty quick service for such a touristy location.

Everything is fresh (not frozen) and made from scratch on the premises. Try the crab cakes....better than any I had in Maryland. The sesame crusted Ahi is da bomb and enough for two....brown rice instead of noodles is a good substitute.  Sit in the front or back Bar for a shorter or no wait.

Came in with a party of six and the service and food was exceptional. <br><br>Pros: delicious food. Great staff (all helped eachother out) Our server was awesome at giving us suggestions &amp; never kept us waiting. <br><br>Cons: No reservations. Expect to wait 30 minutes or more during rush hour. We waited for maybe an hour or more for a table. Dim lighting in the restaurant. Hardly any good lighting and it can feel a bit claustrophobic during rush hours. <br><br>Please try the avocado egg roll! It is so good and if you&#39;re new to their structure and Cheesecake Factory, park in the Royal Hawaiian parking structure that they are located in because they will validate your ticket! (I wish I knew this beforehand) <br><br>P.S Don&#39;t try the banana cream cheesecake if you&#39;re expecting it to taste creamy and sweet because it totally wasn&#39;t creamy nor sweet. It tasted more tart and almost tasted like a lemon key pie (very off putting)<br>Overall, I would definitely come back again and I honestly think that waiting for an hour  to be seated was worth it.

Love this place. Great drinks apps and of course cheesecake. A must do for locals. We love Erica the bartender. She really makes the experience and makes you want to come back. Very friendly and knowledgeable of the drinks and food menu. The avo egg rolls and ahi carpaccio are must dos. The mango key lime cheesecake is out of this world.
Excellent service,excellent food. Everything is good and you get alot! Chicken Salad Sandwich,Luau salad and Renee&#39;s Special were perfect and had lots to bring home

We&#39;ve been to this restaurant often even though the wait is long and it&#39;s in busy Waikiki.  But we&#39;ve never experienced rudeness the way we did on 5/30/16.  Our waiter, Richard M was getting ready to mention the specials which were fish dishes and stopped himself to tell us they were out of the fish.  He came back to take our order which is our usual Miso Salmon off the regular menu and he repeated himself they were out of fish in an irritated tone.  It wasn&#39;t necessary for him to tell us that way because he wasn&#39;t clear earlier that ALL FISH, even from regular menu was out.<br>He then brought our drinks and flinged the drink napkin to me.  I starred at him wanting to give him my reaction but I guess he didn&#39;t want any of that so avoided me.<br>Then the whole night he was short and abrasive with us.  We were thinking must be a tip pool because he would get his share regardless how he treats his guests.<br>We&#39;ve never left less than 15% tip ever.  But there&#39;s always a first time!

The best Cheesecake Factory I have been to. They got cheap pineapple drinks. Sean was an excellent server and made us all laugh. The food was delicious and we have been here twice now. This place gets really busy so make sure you have plan accordingly.
Great service and the food was awesome. Can you say cheesecake?! You bet!! How can you have that Cheesecake and go anyplace else?

My number one place to eat!<br><br>Love the Godiva cheese cake. I come in to Waikiki just to get my cheese cake fix from here.  <br><br>You can park by the Sheraton public parking and get validated at the restaurant.  It&#39;s a nice walk from the parking to the restaurant through royal Hawaiian shopping center. I love the food. Can&#39;t get enough!<br><br>The wait is super long. Every night the wait is long.  Saturdays are the busiest time and you will wait 1.5 hours before being seated. Its crazy.

The Honolulu location was packed every time we went by but we lucked out and found a free table in the bar right after we put our names on a list. The Parmesan crusted chicken was incredible. And huge. I had to box up half. And of course the cheesecake was good. But the service was the best part. Our waiter said he had worked for the company for 25 years. He could list everything about the items on the menu. And for the Waikiki area, reasonable pricing for sure

Absolutely horrible service!!! Went out on a Friday night with a group of 12 (10 adults 2 kids). We knew it would be awhile to be seated so we waited an hour and half so we could all sit together. While we waited, we saw plenty of smaller tables open up but waited to sit together and the hostess kept reassuring us that we could sit together as well. When we were finally called to be seated, we were ushered to TWO BOOTHS that were back to back that sat 6 each. Really?!?!?! Why did we wait for an hour and a half while looking at various empty 6 tops?? <br><br>But ok. We decided to grin and bear it and sat down. There was one kid at each table. We decided to order the kids meals first since we had waited quite a while and they were getting antsy. Those were placed and then my table ordered all the drinks and appetizers. We got our drinks and then decided to order our dinner. The table I sat at received 2 appetizers in about 20min. We did not care for the deep fried macaroni since it was burnt and wanted to send it back. So we waited and waited and waited for the waitress to come back. We she finally came back we decided to ask about the kids meal since it has yet to come out.
