She said she would find out, get us refills and then she disappeared again. <br><br>An hour and some change after we sat down we have no food, no drinks, no kids meal and burnt macaroni balls. We are all getting agitated because the little girl at my table was starting to get fussy as well. Waitress comes back, without refills and says she apologizes but they are waiting for my Filet Mignon to finish. I laughed because I ordered it medium rare and two people ordered salads. Waiting for it to cook? After this comment my friends were over it. The manager did not offer much condolence since he stated he could not locate our food or drinks. We asked for our checks, cashed out and left.  The funny part is, our partner table had FINISHED their meals by the time we got fed up and decided to leave.<br><br>I will never visit Cheesecake Factory again. Shortening the menu will do wonders for your service. I must say, Wendy&#39;s on Nimitz offered a great baconator combo for the car ride home.

Boo... The wait here is crazy long but it helps that there are shops to occupy you during your wait. If you really want to dine here, you should at least come an hour before you actually want to eat. We came around 8pm and didn&#39;t get seated till 9:30pm. But what else can you expect on a Saturday night in Waikiki. <br><br>Boo...our server wasn&#39;t very friendly and didn&#39;t check up on during our dinner. It was just a downer especially after that long wait<br><br>Boo... Parking is expensive and hard to find. Waikiki in General is expensive and can get really overwhelming with all the tourists. <br><br>Woohoo! Everything I&#39;ve tried is very tasty and I especially love their carbonara! I can never finish it though because their portions are so big!  My boyfriend had their steak done med rare and it was really great too! It came with perfectly salted fries and a couple of onion rings, but those weren&#39;t that great.  <br><br>Woohoo! Tonight, I wanted to try something different so I ordered their mango smoothie. It was well made and made my tummy very happy. They mixed a raspberry purée in it (I think) and some coconut juice. Must try it next time! <br><br>Woohoo! Their cheesecakes never disappoint me. I&#39;m kind of boring and really enjoy their original cheesecake but when I&#39;m feeling adventurous, their Oreo dream is so...dreamy! They&#39;re great for sharing, especially after a big dinner. <br><br>I probably won&#39;t be back anytime soon only because it&#39;s a hassle to get out to waikiki. But the food is definitely worth coming back for!

Not a day goes by that I don&#39;t see an overflowing amount of people waiting to get a seat at Hawai&#39;s only Cheesecake factory on the island. Call me lucky but, of all the times I&#39;ve dined in, I&#39;ve not had to wait for more than 20 minutes. Upon leaving your lovely name on the list with the hostess, you&#39;re given your nifty restaurant pager. Cheesecake factory sits on the right side of Kalakaua&#39;s busy street (next to Forever 21) on the first floor. You can&#39;t miss it. <br><br>Wooden furnishings and marble tiles give the vicinity a nice elegant touch with very light metalwork elements. On the right side of the entrance, people form a separate line for takeout and making ordering easy for slices of their famous cheesecakes. That is if you only want to want a pleasuring dessert on the go. The line goes fairly quick.  With an already large restaurant, Cheesecake Factory seems to have a fast turnaround with seating.  An inviting part of the restaurant is the bar with large screens for the sports fanatics. Seats line the bar as well as high top chairs as an option for dining in a more laid back scale. Their clean restrooms are readily available on the right if you break the seal too soon (if you know what I mean). Seats are available in family style and large parties. I very much enjoy their outdoor seating option as it gets freezing cold inside the restaurant. It&#39;s also very dim and not enough light on the inside. Why not dine outside and appreciate the alfresco with the fresh smell of the pacific ocean.<br><br>My dining companion and I wanted to dine outdoors and we were seated after 10 minutes.  A server had stated she will be with us shortly. At this time we still have not received our waters or even any service for that matter. The restaurant wasn&#39;t at all busy yet. We were very forgiving and gave her another 5 minutes or so. After she returned repeatedly serving the table behind us it was already 15-20 minutes later. I upsettingly flagged the server on the opposite side asking for waters and for service. He immediately discovered my unruly tone and called for a manager. Slade (the general manager) approached us and immediately apologized for the lack of service and checked on us from time to time. Bobby (our new server) had apologized and served us wonderfully during the duration of our entire dining experience.<br> <br>After enjoying their nicely toasted white and wheat bread with butter, I enjoyed their Garlic Noodles. This is a nice spaghetti dish with fresh asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, nice whole oven roasted cherry tomatoes with parmesan in a garlic sauce. This is beautifully served with a nice big part of the chicken (can be ordered with shrimp or chicken). I enjoyed this dish with all the vegetables and the chicken as my protein. The chicken is delightfully juicy and not greasy and the little part of the skin was crunchy after the first slice into the meat.  <br><br>Overall, I very much enjoyed my recent experience here with a slight bump on the side. Their customer service is great with them recognizing the flaw right away. I&#39;ve also enjoyed many of their cheesecakes in the past. With my cheesecake cravings, this is definitely my go to place. It&#39;s that simple.

I love Cheesecake Factory! I don&#39;t come here often, but when I do, I&#39;m always satisfied. The food is great! And there&#39;s always enough food to take home too. The only con to this place would be the wait. So if you&#39;re starving and can&#39;t wait, go somewhere else. I had a party of 11 and we waited for 45min. We made up for the time by going shopping :)

Of course, the wait will always be long here! But is it worth it? I believe so! The best part is that their buzzers you hold while you wait allows you to walk most of royal hawaiian shopping center! We came here on a friday night around 7:30pm and was quoted an one hour wait time which was exactly on the dot. Staff are always friendly every time I&#39;ve came here. As soon as we sat down our waiter got us our drinks and was ready to take our orders for appetizers as we were already starving!! We ordered the crispy crab wonton and the spicy ahi fried roll (don&#39;t remember the exact name). Our appetizers cane out within 10 minutes nice, fresh, and hot. Very delicous! The crispy crap wontons just melted in your mouth after you bite through the wonton part of course and the spovy ahi fried rolls were not to spicy and tasty which came with a gyoza like dipping sauce. We also shared a Pineapple Paradise alcoholic drink where you literally drink from the pineapple. If you like a sweet, juicy, and not so strong alcoholic beverage this one is a must try. Since we wanted to save room for the cheese cake we shared the steak diane and chicken marsala (not marsala but something similar, sorry forgot the exact name again!) Combo which came with marinated in mushrooms and asparagus, and of course the garlic mash potatos. You can never go wrong ordering this combo. Price not so bad either at $23.90 for this dish. As for the cheesecake, i got the Oreo one and MY GOSH its heaven!!! Not to strong on the chocolate or the oreo, i felt it was a perfect balance not over powering the cheesecake itself. We stayed there for dinner for about 2 hours and noticed we had to keep waving down our waiter but couldnt blamed him based on how busy we saw the place was! If anything this was a 4.5 star rating based on this visit.

Alright alright. Whose crazy enough to wait for an hour or more to be seated..  I am. :) I love their cheesecakes and their foods. <br><br>Checked in around 6:55, was told to come back for a buzzer at 7:25. And then another 15-25 mins for a table. Not bad. Not bad. Especially when were near forever 21. Yep. And I just got paid. HA! <br><br>Any who. I&#39;m not one to stand around and wait to be called. But I make exceptions with this place.  <br> <br>Food was amazing. Service was great!  What more can you ask for?!

I like the Cheesecake Factory franchise but this Cheesecake Factory is a major tourist trap.<br><br>The bread brought to the table was cold, hard, and did not taste like Sourdough. I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and had the Lemoncello Cream Torte. The pasta was good and the torte was the highlight of the meal! <br><br>Be prepared to wait a very long time to be seated.

Cheesecake Factory is one of those chains that anyone in your party can find something they&#39;ll enjoy. Portions are massive and always good to share. While I&#39;m not a huge fan of &#34;chain restaurants&#34; I do enjoy few things on the Cheesecake Factory menu. <br><br>This past Valentine&#39;s Day weekend we did a staycation in Waikiki. It was in our plans to shop around Riyal Hawaiian while we waited the hour plus for a two top. But luckily, the bf spotted two sweet seats at the bar. Score!<br><br>I struggled with what to order since you know the menu is a freakin&#39; novel with advertisements in them too. Lol. After a few sips of my Long Island Ice Tea I decided on the lunch special with choice of pizza and salad. I ordered the Caesar Salad and Chicken Sausage Pizza. All of the staff there said it was a great choice as that combo one of their all time faves. BF ordered his usual Bistro Shrimp Pasta. Yummers! <br><br>Cheers to a chain that&#39;s consistent and has something for everyone.

This places is pretty good and I would probably come back again. <br><br>The trick to the wait time is come around 4pm for dinner, I know it seems early but this way you&#39;re done in time to walk to beach for sunset!<br>We were a party of 5, and waited 25 minutes for a table outside! Not bad!<br><br>We got a few drinks, and appetizers:<br>1. Kalua pork pizza 13.95, it was ok the pork was dry.<br>2. Chicken BBQ pizza 13.95 good, but very few chicken pieces.<br>3. Fried calamari-excellent get it!<br>4. Chicken caesar salad with Chicken 14.95 also very good.

My husband and I came here for date night. And I was really surprised at how efficient and fast the service was here. <br><br>We had our drinks and food and dessert to go within an hour. Which was surprising because the restaurant was completely full. We only had to wait 15 minutes for a table which was also surprising. I guess if you are a restaurant in Waikiki you have to be ready for a high volume of people.<br><br>The food was great, cheesecake was amazing and the service was mind blowing. I guess it&#39;s what you expect from a restaurant in Waikiki/Cheesecake factory.
It&#39;s good. Not great for how long the wait is. No reservations unfortunately. But the cheesecake is bomb!! Red velvet is a must.

Good service. Good food. Nice location. What&#39;s not to like?<br><br>Well, when all Cheesecake Factory restaurants took the Thai Chicken Pasta off their menu a couple of years ago, they automatically lost a star, no matter what. That was my all-time favorite dish off their ridiculously large menu. I&#39;ve since moved on to the Bang-Bang-Chicken and Shrimp .. but I usually like to have more than 4-pieces of shrimp in my dish. Come on, now. <br><br>Now they&#39;ve dropped the Tropical Martini. WTF? The menu is like a novel, and two of my three favorites are gone? What next? The Avocado Eggrolls? SMH.

Okay so it&#39;s a chain and the wait is hideous. But I appreciate the salads as big enough to fill you up and healthy enough you don&#39;t feel sick. <br><br>We are here twice this week as they have a pretty decent kids menu too. <br><br>But two issues that occurred on both days.<br><br>1. If you order a second beer it will not arrive unless you ask to cancel the order because you&#39;ve finished the meal and then it arrives - flat.<br><br>2. The Luau salad is awesome. But it says it comes with pineapple (or orange) pieces on the menu. I can&#39;t actually remember which because it didn&#39;t appear either time. Shame it sounded great. It&#39;s not like pineapple is hard to get here.

This place is literally more like a factory than a restaurant. With a menu containing over 250 items and as thick as War and Peace it would be almost impossible not to find something you like. The place is always packed with people waiting in line as bookings cannot be guaranteed. <br>The atmosphere is frantic - and the staff numbers required to serve all the patrons is staggering. But it all works like a Swiss watch.<br>The variation of meals is amazing and even the appetisers are big enough. Be sure to leave room for one of their 50 choices for desert and cheesecakes. <br>Another amazing American food outlet.<br>#ResearchAndTravelServices<br>#facxual_events
Waitress was rude.  Seemed to be annoyed that her table was being taken up by our small party.  Will not go back...

I never had good experience with Cheesecake Factory in the main land. But this place is good. The food is fresh and big in portion, and tasty too. The Kobe burger is good for its price. The Gumbo is beyond average. Did I mention they have decent drinks too? Ha, they have it all. Way better than the main land. The waiting line can be very long for rush hours.

Great service and great food! The wait was only 30 mins! Put our names at 830 got seated by 9! The server was awesome and whatever we requested it wasn&#39;t a big deal for her which is great! The only thing we had an issue was we got the water and drinks after we got our appetizers which was odd and we were seated above the AC and some of the water was leaking! They need to get that fixed! Other than that, we had a great time and it&#39;s been awhile since I came here!

The Cheesecake Factory probably has the largest menu in all of Waikiki. Go there on an empty stomach because the servings are huge. You can easily share one meal between two. Make sure you save room for dessert, cheesecake of course! Head to the bar for a drink while you wait on your table, they make a really good Long Island Iced Tea.

Whenever I see a cheese cake factory I feel like one of those losers whose vacations doesn&#39;t seem fulfilled without stopping in for a meal. I live in Toronto and the closest one is in Bufallo, NY, so it&#39;s always a treat to visit one when in the US.<br>While in a primo location, I found it to be fairly quiet considering where it is....all the better for us !<br>Food portions are gigantic, cake slices immense, service friendly.<br>Best part was listening to a couple from Japan (who spoke minimal English) arguing with the waitress about their bill. It was a hoot as neither knew what the other was saying.<br>It&#39;s a cheese cake factory...no surprises, you know what you&#39;re getting

I came last night and i love the food here. Super good. I had the four cheese pasta n thats delicious if you love cheese. I also had the caesar salad and a oreo cheesecake. Yummy! Just the cheesecake is very sweet though. So i dont recommend eating it you have diabetes or something. <br><br>The only downfall i have here is how they dont take reservations. I know its a busy restraunt but to me they should take reservations for big parties at least if they really dont want to except reservations. Since they dont take reservations our wait was 2.5 hours long. We didnt get seated till 9:50pm. I had a party of 18 of us and all of us was getting grouchy because we was all hungry and we had to wait that long. I find it ridiculous of how long the wait is. <br><br>There was also one more thing that happened that night. My boyfriend had ordered a filet mignon and we was wondering how come his food didnt come yet because all of ours did and they told him that they gave his food away  even more so i was like wth. But it was nice of them to offere him a soup or salad to wait cause they had to remake his food so even more long he had to wait to eat. Remember we was already waiting 2.5 hours and then he had to wait even longer for him to get his food. I felt bad for him cause he was really hungry and that happened.

We knew what we were getting because we have these at home - but our waiter just didn&#39;t pay attention: he forgot my order completely, I received  fries instead of the ordered salad, and no gluten free bun that I had also ordered. He disappeared when it was check time so we had to flag down another waitstaff to get our checks. Fair at best.
Good food excellent service, sat ourselves in the bar area we were served promptly....

We love cheesecake  factory, the only bad thing is they clean the sealing when we are eating, it doesn&#39;t look good that they come with a old looking mop to clean all the water that built up by the AC . The establishment is always busy. The owner should had enough money to have a state of the art system and not have the employees clean the ceiling so often ! <br><br>Other than that, food is pretty good and of course, the cheesecake!!

Flew in late in the evening and did a quick walk before going to bed. Had my first Mai tai here to start my vacation. As it was late we had no problems getting in. Came in for the cheesecake. Staff were friendly and the place was still buzzing. They had a live band playing Hawaiian type music. Nice ambiance.

Not an enjoyable experience. Myself and four friends decided to go for a late dinner. We waited 50 minutes which was no problem. Our buzzer and off and it took another 5 minutes to be seated. Our server was friendly, not the best but he was young and nice enough. We put in an appetizer that took a while to come out and then finally put our order in. After about 20 minutes of waiting the food started coming out. Everyone was served their meal but me. I ordered the impossible burger with no cheese and no sauce. My friends started eating and I still had no food. Our server brought out my fries and then a salad and a potato chowder, which I don&#39;t eat (and you think they would&#39;ve picked up on this because I ordered a vegan meal). My friends finished eating their food when finally my burger was brought out. I asked to get it wrapped up and a manager walked over to the table. He greeted us on the side of the table that has like a divider on it(not meant for people to talk to you on that side of the table). He said to the whole table, not knowing who ordered the burger, that it would be out shortly. He had no idea that it was already out of the kitchen and was now being wrapped up. He said sorry and walked away. The server asked if he offered me anything and I said no. He was kind enough to go see if I could get a free desert or get the meal for free.Again if they paid any attention they may have realized I don&#39;t eat any of the desserts on the menu. He came back and said I could pick a dessert so I offered it to my friend. The whole thing was so frustrating and clearly the manager didn&#39;t care about my experience. I live very close to this location but I won&#39;t be back. If you&#39;re looking for a nice sit down experience, don&#39;t come here.
Love to eat in here but wait time is pretty  long on the weekends. So I like to eat dinner somewhere else and good to the takeout counter to take some cheesecake back to the hotel.

The cheesecake factor always has its good and bad days, simply because it caters to such a large crowd of people.<br><br>First off, it&#39;s located in Waikiki, which means you will most likely be waiting 2 hours at dinner time.  It&#39;s such a pain but sometimes it&#39;s the only place that works for everyone because they serve such a wide variety of foods- soups, salads, sandwiches, pasta, pizza, seafood, steak, etc.  The list goes on and on.<br><br>My favorite dish is probably the Luau Salad.  It&#39;s really fresh and filling, and I&#39;m a huge fan of the crunchy wonton that comes with it.  I also loooove their baked potato soup (but their soups change daily).  I could eat a bowl of soup and bread and be completely satisfied.  THEY MAKE IT FROM SCRATCH! I asked.. Their sweet potato fries are good as a side.  And I also like their herb salmon, which comes with mashed potatoes and asparagus.  Their kalua pig pizza and four cheese pasta is good too but both are heavy heavy dishes so be wary!<br><br>You guys all know about the cheesecake so I don&#39;t have to convince you on that.  I personally just like the strawberry one or the blueberry one, but I&#39;m a simple cheesecake girl like that.<br><br>Service is usually pretty good and so is the food.  But it&#39;s crazy busy all the time so I think sometimes that can affect the service and the food.  It&#39;s good if you want somewhere that is decently nice but not too expensive.  The only annoyance I have is that it&#39;s always too busy and you have to park in the royal hawaiian.  They validate for sure but it&#39;s only two hours and you&#39;re usually waiting for 2 hours just to get into the restaurant.  You&#39;ll have to pay for parking beyond 2 hours.

Waited about 45 minutes for an open table at the bar which is first come first serve somehow the waiter pulled the tourists to be seated while I waited right in front of him. He literally told me he didn&#39;t see me. The service is really bad waiters don&#39;t communicate. The place is always to busy and bad customer service. They don&#39;t treat the local resident with the Aloha spirt. Spoke to the manager and it just seemed like she sided with the waiters. Customers  I guess isn&#39;t first priority especially if your local residents.
We had great customer service and the food was onolicious!!!!!  We ordered shrimp scampi, Baja chicken tacos and fresh strawberry  cheesecake we were very happy with our dinner!!!!

The food is great. I had a mac n cheese burger. Get some apps&#39; to tide your hunger til the main course arrives. I recommend the mac n cheese balls.<br>Did i mention i really like mac n cheese? <br>^_^

A really bad experience. Really long wait to get it( can&#39;t ding them for this most Cheesecake Factory have a long wait to get seated).  But after we got seated took an extra long time to receive our food. We felt like they had forgotten about us.  When the food did arrive a chicken parmesan  sandwich the bread was dripping with oil and the tomato dip was floating in oil.  Almost as someone had spilled olive oil on the whole plate.  And then to top off the bad experience the waiter charges us the wrong amount. They charge us the table next to us bill. We are on our honeymoon from Las Vegas, I will never go to this restaurant again.

Yummy!  Yummy! Yummy!  I&#39;ve never had a bad meal there, and the trick to getting in without waiting an hour and a half is to get there early - like around 4:30.  My favorite cheesecake is the mango/key lime.  If you love tart, you will love this cheesecake.

As the name implies.. the only thing worth paying for here is the cheesecake. The food is bland. The waits are long. The service is just alright. Invest the fortune you&#39;ll spend here at one of the many delicious hole in the wall places elsewhere in Waikiki.

This was my third time eating at this location. We came here with a friend who was visiting from Japan. Our waiters name was Austin and he really made the meal EXTRA special! He was very attentive and professional. Honestly, one of the best food service experiences I&#39;ve had in a long time. My friends and I definitely appreciated his service. The food was great and although I didn&#39;t eat all of it, I can guarantee you I enjoyed my leftovers.

I love this place! It was really busy, but the wait was worth it. Waited about 20 mins which wasn&#39;t bad since there were shops all around to get lost in. <br><br>Ambience was causal, a little loud, but nothing you wouldn&#39;t expect for being in town and around so many people! The lighting is kind of dark, but it makes it to be more romantic if you need it to be. <br><br>Soooo many items on their menu! And the drinks all sound sooo yummy! Their sangria is the best I&#39;ve ever tasted! <br><br>Their portions are so big, you will definitely be brining home left overs because you need to save room for, of course, CHEESECAKE! Their choices are so delicious and are a good size. <br><br>We had the fried macaroni balls, which was definitely my favorite! I love macaroni and I love fried things, so naturally, I had to have it. I had gotten their famous meatloaf and it was the best! Mashed potatoes and a yummy vegetable medley. I will definitely be coming back on my next trip.

RIP OFF WARNING!  Nicole from the cheesecake take out counter took my girlfriends order. My girlfriend speaks broken English so Nicole may have mistaken her for a tourist. Order total was $16.20 but she only received $0.80 change.  She corrected Nicole&#39;s error and received the correct change, though Nicole wasn&#39;t exactly pleasant about the correction.  In hindsight, I think it may have been malicious with all the foreign tourists who pass through there. Of course it&#39;s impossible for us to know for sure, but be sure to count your change!<br><br>On a side note, the cheesecake was delicious as usual.

Very consistent for good quality of food across their various chains in America<br>We have tried many items on their menu in different outlets and I cannot think of a bad choice <br>Very famous for their dessert<br>Special shoutout for their fish tacos in Honolulu branch<br>Pricing is approx USD 35 per person to fill you up<br>Only thing I hate is the queue for lunch or dinner <br>Overall will definitely return to have another meal before leaving Honolulu

Posted on Yelp<br><br>12/10/16 Saturday night. My friends &amp; I decided to eat at this place the night before the Honolulu marathon. Our waitress was the WORST &amp; the MANAGER was too!!! They were both ignorant, arrogant, &amp; rude!!!<br>1. My friend &amp; I decided to share our food, ordering a pizza &amp; pasta. When she took our order, we told her that we wanted the BBQ pizza &amp; the garlic noodles but with a creamy sauce instead. She said she wasn&#39;t sure if that can be done bc it will change the taste but I told her it was ok if it did. She tried to argue with me what I wanted so she said she&#39;ll ask the chef (she had an attitude at this time) When she came back, she brought out the manager (Marshall).  I explained to him that we liked what&#39;s included in the pasta (fresh asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, oven-roasted tomatoes) but to change the sauce to creamy. He recommended the Pasta carbonara, I told him that yes I like the sauce but I didn&#39;t want to pay extra for the veggies. He said the veggies was not the problem for cost but for the sauce.  Sauce in Hawaii is expensive.  I repeated myself telling him that I didn&#39;t want to pay extra for the veggies &amp; he said &#34;yes&#34;<br>2. Free bread was brought out &amp; of course we ate it leaving couple of the darker ones,so when she came around she saw that someone else already brought out the bread  so she skipped us.  I flagged her down &amp; ask if we can get more bread.  She looked at me with an ugly, mean attitude &#39;like seriously, you wanted more bread look&#39;.  Even my friends saw her look &amp; was surprise.<br>3. Food came out, all was good.<br>4. Obviously we couldn&#39;t eat all of our pizza &amp; pasta so I asked her if we could get some boxes &amp; she said &#34;what??&#34;  With an ugly, nasty attitude!!! Again, we all looked at each other &amp; said what is her problem??!!<br>5. The Check came out - We were charged (not a surprise! )for the veggies that I specifically told the manager Marshall before placing my order that I didn&#39;t want to pay extra for the veggies! She said it was the manager who rang our check. Low &amp; behold, he came out telling me that &#34;this is a one time courtesy that he was not charging for the veggies&#34; I told him that I didn&#39;t want to pay extra for the veggies &amp; he agreed not to charge me before I placed my order. He had the audacity to say that he didn&#39;t say that, he said that veggies are expensive.  What the HELL!!! He basically called me a liar!!! We were all stunned by what he said!  I told him that I will not be coming back &amp; he basically said whatever &amp; didn&#39;t give a $hit!!<br><br>Seriously the worst service by the waitress &amp; the manager by the name of Marshall!!!!<br>I understand that they get a lot of tourist &amp; they probably don&#39;t give a damn for all the tourist but please don&#39;t lie to the people who pays for your salary!!!!!

Cheesecake Factory has always been our family&#39;s go-to restaurant in Waikiki. The staffs are very accommodating to our request to be seated at a booth. We tried almost all their cheesecakes already. Love the fact that they have quite a selections of ethnic cuisine and not just pasta pizza and burgers. Although all these are all sooo good too !!!<br>Great food !  Friendly and cheerful greeters and servers.

We love the Cheesecake Factory! Came here Saturday morning to have their waffles. ;) Greeter was super sweet and our waiter was awesome! The food came out in a timely manner. The only thing that was not so good was my waffle was a little extra to sweet this time around. Maybe to much butter? Not sure, but we will be back again very soon. We love this location but I advise you to come early- right when they open. Lines do get super long and waiting time can be longer than expected. Our waiter even gave us ice cream for my hubby&#39;s birthday. Super cool! ;)

Went to the Cheesecake Factory as a group with friends, and our waiter Joe B was amazing! He was most definitely the best waiter I have ever had. He was very friendly and loved talking to us. He was such a funny guy talking about his personal food favorites, and funny stories! He made our experience at the Cheesecake Factory more entertaining!

This is a late review but I just had to give credit to this restaurant and the people who work here. The line can be ridiculously long, and the wait can be up to two hrs. But the staff is always smiling and so kind and friendly. The first two experiences I came here weren&#39;t that great for me. Service was awesome, servers were always attentive  but I guess I just ordered the wrong things for me. Third times the charm! Our server was great (as always), always checking on our table, never rushing us, and cracking jokes w/ us girls. Another bonus was the 50% off cheesecakes, yumm!

The location is buuuuusy. I wouldn&#39;t even bother coming here over the weekend. Especially for dinner. How we were able to get a table for 2 on a Sunday afternoon right away is beyond me as every other time we walked by the restaurant there was a sea of people waiting to be seated.<br><br>The next part of this review might explain why there&#39;s such a long wait. I don&#39;t know about all the staff, but our waitress seemed to really embrace the laid back, take it easy nature of the island lifestyle. Service was very slow. There&#39;s a fine line between pestering the customer and not being attentive enough, but ours just vanished for a long period of time. It was hot, so when we sat down, we were happy when she said she&#39;d be right back with bread &amp; water. She came back, with nothing, and took our dink orders. She then finally came back after another wait with our drinks and bread (still no water). We then had to wait around for an unusually long time for our order, and then again for the bill.<br><br>My wife would, without a doubt, say Cheesecake Factory is her favorite restaurant so we&#39;ve been to many many locations. We&#39;ve never experienced such laid back, non attentive service before. It wasn&#39;t enough to upset us, but the whole time we were there, we kept commenting on how off the whole experience felt. It was like we were in a Cheesecake Factory that just wasn&#39;t a Cheesecake Factory. We would look around and watch them forget to buss tables before others were seated &amp; other customers looking around for their waiters. Just not what we&#39;ve come to expect from Cheesecake. It really bummed her out.<br><br>Oh, and decided that I&#39;d try the Hawaiian fish sandwich as I wanted to try something I couldn&#39;t get at another location. It was okay. The coleslaw, though tasty, was a bit overpowering so I couldn&#39;t really taste the grilled fish. Oh well.

I guess Cheesecake Factory is bad no matter where you go. We checked in very easy sat inside. There was a terrible smell of mildew maybe a dirty rag to clean the table. Fruit flies were everywhere so I was battling that. Elizabeth is the reason they are getting 2 stars for the 5 min we interacted with her she was sooooo sweet and kind I wish she would have remained our waitress but we end up getting another lady. Ok she was hilarious we asked her about a waffle she starts to dance lol and bopping her head I just laughed what else can you do ha! I ordered the soup of the day which was bake potato soup I was offered a sample which was good so I ordered a cup I said no bacon because I have given up meat for some time now. And extra chives. Someone brings it out bacon stacked to the ceiling I said ummm I don&#39;t eat bacon she laughs oh yea extra chives I was amused. They bring back a bowl loaded with cheese this time what do you do just deal with it it&#39;s 7$ it was not good at all. The bread which I usually love wheat only was disgusting and hard as heck. Cheesecake Factory is terrible from LA, to SF and now Hawaii I can&#39;t deal

It goes against my normal rules to eat at a chain in a city full of great local food but we did.  <br><br>Our good was great, considering the book like menu I was surprised.  My son had a pepperoni pizza loved it.  We also has seafood pasta and pasta carbonara both were very good.<br><br>And of course dessert, to go.  We had a piece of chocolate fudge cake and also cheesecake with peanut butter, pb cups, butterfingers.  Those were both worth the trip!
Loves out sever. <br>He was a awesome help!<br><br>Plus he reccomend the desserts we got which were to die for!
Amazing cheese cakes, food is great. The service here was very nice, thank you. Music outside brings a good ambience..
Food was great as well as the drinks - however we tried to come back on a Monday evening and it was an hour and 45 min wait. We had to give up and go elsewhere.

The service was such a great experience. Those waiters, chefs, and everyone who is employed at Cheesecake factory does such a great job taking care of the customers.  The food was delicious and portions were huge. Birthday cheesecake was my favorite.

I never ever complained about the food here because its always really good. First off our complementary bread was burnt and tasted nasty! I ordered my usual shrimp &amp; Chicken Gumbo, buffalo blasts and calamari it was over the top SALTY! Not to mention the brown rice they put on my gumbo and friends food was hard like little pebble rocks. I also found fried chicken tenders in my calamari. Now that was ridiculous, like did yall run out of calamari??? I have never been served such salty, burnt and hard food like that before. It was terrible! Whats going on cheesecake factory??? Youre usually known for such great food and Ive been coming here for years. I hope no one else gets served crappy food like this!!!

First time here for a nieces birthday and I must say I&#39;m glad to have had a great experience. I heard so many nightmare stories about the crowds and long wait times but the manager was so awesome to have clarified our wait time and 45 mins wasn&#39;t bad at all considering our large party of 12. <br><br>My hubby and I both ordered the combo...chicken Madeira w/ Steak Diane and it was delicious! Thumbs up all around. We&#39;ll definitely be back!
This place is so full of tourist it&#39;s always slow and wait time is horrible.  The food is obviously amazing and the cheesecake is top notch.  We come by just to grab a slice.
Host was very rude. The server&#39;s customer service was excellent and food came out pretty fast.
Besides the long wait the service and food was quit delightful. Music and environment was also a plus! You&#39;ll have to park across the street.

I always love coming here to eat whenever I&#39;m in Waikiki. However, do expect a long wait. Wait can get as long as 2 hours when extremely busy. However, this place is always worth the wait. They also do offer takeout if waiting is impossible.

After spending a couple of hours at Ala Moana shopping center with the kids, I wanted to treat them to some yummy cheesecakes so in we went at 5:30pm. Surprisingly we were promptly seated, and our server were very attentive and nice. The food was just meh but their cheesecakes are divine. Needless to say, the kids polished off their broccoli just so they can eat their cheesecake!

Is there a Cheesecake Factory in the US where they don&#39;t make you wait more than 30 minutes for a table? What&#39;s up with that? Their menu is awesome because they have everything. If you go with a big group, I recommend the appetizer sampler. It&#39;s super good and it will feed 6 people. I&#39;m also a big fan of the cheesecake but I wish it was half the size. I can never finish the whole thing by myself. <br><br>If you&#39;re ever lost in Waikiki and you can&#39;t figure out what you want to eat, this is a good place. The Cheesecake Factory also has the best parking perks in the Royal Hawaiian Center. Their validation is for 2 hours and if you go past the 2 hours it&#39;s $1.00 per hour.
Love their selection of cheesecakes. There are so many delicious choices it&#39;s hard to eat just one. I personally love their lemon meringue cheesecake.

I love cheesecake factory, but the branch in Waikiki is not the right choice for me. I ate here several times and each time was not a good experience.<br>I never got exactly what i ordered, and the food was rare.( even the boiled vegetables) the service was poor. And the manager is a joke and i cant believe is getting paid for what is doing there!<br>Go eat somewhere else, in CF Waikiki you wont get value for your money.

Had a great time with family friends here. We came during lunch time, and our food came to us really fast. The food was DELICIOUS. Don&#39;t forget to save up for some cheesecake afterwards. <br>My only complaint is that the waitress was very slow even though the restaurant wasn&#39;t as busy. Other than that, it was really good!

5-stars for really great wait service!!<br><br>It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory...they are everywhere and the food is consistent of their chain.  This location is ESPECIALLY busy because it&#39;s in the middle of Waikiki so expect to wait if your party is greater than 2, otherwise small parties are seated pretty quickly.<br><br>Visited twice because it was convenient to where we were staying and because the kids dig it.  Kid menu items for children aged 10 and under with large portions for less than $10.00 - a real deal in Waikiki; kid drinks are unlimited.  <br><br>The wait and buss staff are excellent - even in the face of the daily/nightly chaos they still smile and are friendly and make you feel welcomed.  The hosts/hostesses don&#39;t make eye contact, aren&#39;t friendly, and made us feel like it was a chore to seat us each time we were there.

I do like the Cheesecake Factory but this last time was not a good experience.<br>Showed up for early dinner, got seated immediately, great! Ordered some appetizers, great stuff and enjoyed it. Ordered out entrees and it was good but quite salty. Because we had appetizers and wanted to save space for dessert, asked the server to pack our entrees, which each of us only ate half of. The server took the plates but didn&#39;t take mine because her hands were full and said she was coming back for it. Another server, later found out it was a busboy, took my plate. About 10 minutes later, the original server brings everyone&#39;s doggy bags, but not mine. I see the busboy that took my plate and ask him if my food was packed. He actually blamed me, that I didn&#39;t say I wanted it packed. The nerve. I already asked my original server, who said she was coming back for my plate, my plate was more than half full, and shouldn&#39;t the worker ask ME if I wanted to take it home, especially with so much food on my plate? The busboy actually blamed me 3 times and said he was going to call the manager, who never came. My real server apologized and gave me a new, full order of my meal to take home.
This place gave me diarrhea! DO NOT EAT HERE! It&#39;s not worth the pain! I ordered the Chicken Marsala &amp; a salad.

My girlfriend and I were just wandering around Waikiki looking for food when I happened to remember how busy this place always seemed so we decided to stop in and see what they got, I got the fish tacos and the chipotle sauce they put on them were phenomenal! My girlfriend tried their seared ahi and the season they put on it was out of this world! 100% recommend this restaurant coupled with their red velvet cheesecake, it will not dissapoint!

This is my first visit to Cheesecake factory! I went in on Monday evening at around 6 pm and had about 10 mins of wait time which was not at all bad. Jeffrey (if I remember his name correctly) attended to us and was so  courteous and helped with his recommendations. He kept checking in on us and updating us to let us know how long it would take for the would to come in. Another guys came by promptly to clear out the appetizer plates to make room on the table for the next course. We were very pleased with the service (Jeffrey even took a bow at the end while wishing us a nice evening!!!) and the quality of the food. The portion sizes were huge, which Jeffrey had told us before we ordered, but I did not pay much attention to.AFter the appetizers (avocado egg rolls and chicken sliders) I realized I was full and had ordered too much food. <br><br>Overall, very very pleased with the service and food and definitely will visit again!

What da heck, Cheesecake Factory?!! I just ordered a salad, dressing on the side and you can&#39;t even get  THAT right?!! By the time my salad got to the table, my entire family were done with their meals and ready to order dessert. We&#39;re local and rarely venture into Waikiki and you just enforce the reason why. No negatives on our waitress, Haley, as she was awesome. But the customer service from your manager was the worse! Disappointed.

This place was crazy busy. I&#39;m not sure why other than it&#39;s a huge tourist trap. All we wanted was a couple of burgers to go. The lady on the phone said 50min. Okay. Well, we arrive 40min so we can wait in the long line to checkout. Our food must&#39;ve been out there for at least 20min because it was cold. Ever eat cold, soggy fries and a barely warm burger? It&#39;s pretty gross. Needless to say, it was disappointing, and we won&#39;t be back. Go to Hard Rock Cafe instead of you want a to go order. They have really nice staff there and your food won&#39;t be cold when you pick it up!

The wait is ridiculous! We waited nearly 3 hours just to be seated and over an hour for order. We arrived at 6:30 and didn&#39;t eat till after 10. A lot of our orders were wrong. It&#39;s really not worth the hype! I use to love coming to the Cheesecake Factory but their service has definitely slower. It&#39;s probably better to go during lunch when it&#39;s slower. Don&#39;t go during dinner unless you&#39;ve already ate b/c by the time you get your meal you&#39;ll be starving

We came here for dinner at around 5pm and was seated at 7pm. It took another 25 minutes to receive our food. The wait times are long, however that is expected for this location. This location is really nice and the food is great as always. Our server was very kind and attentive. The prices are fair for the amount of food given and for being in Hawaii.

Horrible service... youll wait forever for food yet right before leaving i decided to get a slice of cheesecake... absolutely wrong thing to do... this cheeesecake factory is quick to order but tremendously slow to serve... highly not recommend it here unless you have alots of time to waste...  good luck.. 1
Food great but someone was playing with our lights. Went off and on about 6 times. Server was great and shepherd pie was Da Bomb!

My 5-star rating applies to their Cheesecake, nothing more.  I&#39;ve personally sampled their Tiramisu, Chocolate Raspberry Truffle, and Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel cheesecake slices, and they are all winnahs!  <br><br>I LOVE to order these slices &#34;to-go&#34; from the take out counter, that way I can pig out in the comforts of my own home.  What turns me on almost as much as the cheesecake itself are their whipped cream dispensing machines that they have at the take out counter.  Similar to how kids (and some adults!) like to spray the cheeze-whiz directly into their mouths, I would love to consume their whipped cream directly from that machine, with a side of cheesecake to go with.  Mmmm!

Five stars. I like it here. The activity going on, the atmosphere, the food, just an overall enjoyable experience! The sirloin steak that I had reminded me of Kauai&#39;s JJ Broiler old Slavonic Steak. The butter garlic flavor grilled to perfection. I really enjoy the brownie sundae too. Excellent!

My parents and I recently went to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner and we encountered the best service yet, in addition to probably our speediest dining experience here ever.<br><br>Our server--I think his name was Mark--was stellar. Of course, we were there for Sunday for dinner around 5 p.m. and the restaurant was bustling, but he never skipped a beat. He always made sure that our water glasses were full, he packed our bread in a separate to-go container (without us even asking for one), he asked if we wanted our entrees to-go in a timely manner and he was just overall really attentive. He had lots of other parties to wait on, but I was thoroughly impressed by his service. <br><br>I also wasn&#39;t expecting to get seated so quickly--even though we had a small party--but I think we only had to wait for 5-10 minutes. That was record timing!<br><br>My parents never deviate too much from our Cheesecake Factory favorites, but everything tasted even better that night because of the great service. Here&#39;s what we got:<br><br>&#34;Fried Macaroni and Cheese&#34;: This gooey, cheesy mac and cheese mixture gets even better when deep fried and covered with a thin, crispy crumb layer. Cheese simply oozes out of the shell with every bite (truly a must for cheese lovers). The four mac and cheese balls are served with a creamy marinara sauce (not a very strong tomatoey taste) and bits of shredded cheese on top.This dish can be found under the &#34;Appetizers&#34; portion of the menu. It&#39;s great for sharing if your tablemates love mac and cheese ... or, if you&#39;re like me, it&#39;s perfect as an entrée because it&#39;s just that good. <br><br>&#34;Chicken Madeira&#34;: This chicken dish is famous as the eatery&#39;s &#34;most popular chicken dish.&#34; Flavorful and savory, this one is definitely a winner. The dish contains a couple pieces of tender, sautéed chicken breast topped generously with melted Mozzarella cheese and pieces of asparagus. It&#39;s also covered with flavorful mushroom Madeira sauce and is served with fluffy mashed potatoes. Both of my parents usually get this dish; they like it so much that they never want to try anything else! My mom really likes the savory mashed potatoes, and both of my parents enjoy how much cheese and mushrooms top the tender chicken breast. <br><br>&#34;Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple&#34;: This decadent dessert features the original cheesecake in an Oreo Cookie crust and includes caramel, chunks of Butterfingers and Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cups, and peanut butter throughout. My dad always orders this cheesecake, and I always benefit because I can bank on having a bite--or two--while ordering my own cheesecake. Although I&#39;ve tried several of the different ones on the menu, &#34;Adam&#39;s&#34; still reigns as one of my favorites. In fact, sometimes both dad AND I order the exact same thing for dessert. He always gets his with coffee, though, since it&#39;s really, really sweet. I usually eat mine straight up, and my favorite part is the dollop of creamy peanut butter on top.<br><br>&#34;OREO Dream Extreme Cheesecake&#34;: Though I prefer the original version of this cheesecake (and want it to return), I was glad to try this slight rendition. This cheesecake differs from the original OREO one because it includes a layer of moist fudge cake and OREO cookie mousse atop the cheesecake. It&#39;s similar to the original in that it has OREO cookies baked into the creamy layer of cheesecake and is topped with a milk chocolate icing. I had mixed feelings about this cheesecake and preferred the original just because I was not a huge fan of the mousse layer (I don&#39;t like mousse in general ... nothing against this cheesecake). But, I really liked the layer of moist, fudgy chocolate cake interspersed with the layer of cheesecake (similar to my favorite &#34;Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter&#34; cheesecake), and the OREO cookie chunks baked into the cheesecake itself is probably my favorite component of the entire dessert. If the mousse layer were eliminated, I would have no problem with this cheesecake being on the menu instead of the original OREO creation. It took some guts for me to deviate from my usual &#34;Adam&#39;s&#34; or &#34;Reese&#39;s&#34; cheesecake, but in the end, I was glad that I tried something different. <br><br>&#34;Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar Cheesecake&#34;: My mom decided to get something different in terms of dessert and opted for this Hershey&#39;s cheesecake. It&#39;s one that we both always wanted to try, but never took a chance on because we always get the same thing. This chocolaty creation features Hershey&#39;s cheesecake between moist chocolate cake and comes topped with creamy chocolate frosting and chocolate chips. A true delight for the pure chocoholic! I think I ended up liking this cheesecake more than my mom, who said it was a bit too chocolaty for her. I liked the fact that the cheesecake and chocolate cake were interspersed, so it actually cut down on the sweetness. My mom thought it would have been more effective if the original cheesecake layer was used in between layers of the chocolate cake, and Hershey&#39;s bar chunks were inc

Great for a large group.   High enough table turnover that they can handle parties if 6, or 8, or 10 without missing a beat.<br><br>Pretty good food.  Nothing is a home run, but every thing is respectable.  Lots of variety on the menu, so everyone is sure to find something they want.<br><br>Parking is easy, 2 hours free with validation, just $1 an hour after that.<br><br>Highly recommend for birthdays, or after graduation, or anytime the whole extended family is gathering together.

This is probably my favourite place for Cheesecake Factory. Yet, i have to say it was the first place that began my love for the American cuisine. The first time I dine here, I had the best waitress who connected with us and made the best recommendation to make our choice that much easier. Trust me, it gets really overwhelmed with their options. This location is also one that can&#39;t be beaten. Right in the heart of Waikiki and near the Sheraton hotel was so easy to get too. I recommend the dark bread with oats , the miso salmon with mashed potatoes instead of the rice which they glazed with sweet honey and the Louisiana chicken. Both were mouth watering and every time I&#39;m back, it&#39;s hard for me to order anything else. Hope you enjoy it here!

I&#39;ve came to the Cheesecake Factory multiple times &amp; the service &amp; food was always fantastic. My boyfriend &amp; I came for our dinner anniversary &amp; we were very disappointed. <br><br>Our waiter was not enthusiastic or confident in his job at all. It made the dinner kind of not enjoyable. When we ordered our food the waiter kind of made faces and remarks like the dishes we ordered weren&#39;t the best. Sure enough when we got our food it was not what we expected at all. We both didn&#39;t like our dishes. The noodles seemed very hard &amp; over cooked. <br><br>But of course the cheesecake is amazing, hence why the restaurant is called &#34;The Cheesecake Factory.&#34; We ordered the fresh strawberry cheesecake to make up for our junk dishes we ordered

Waited 3 hours when they said 2. Plus the stupid ass pager didn&#39;t work.  They said there was a runner that called us but I didn&#39;t hear shit.  Fuck this place.  Not the first time this happened.

Another night in Waikiki and another one of our favorite stops on our eating tour. Man I gotta hit the gym tomorrow. Steph got tai lettuce wraps to start then she got spaghetti and meatball and myself the Shepard pie. We got here at 5pm and No line. Waited bout few minutes to be seated. Awesome!

2 days ago with my classmate, who was doing a &#34;Restaurant Evaluation&#34; for Dining room. We got there about 1ish. <br><br>The guy controlling the front was polite and direct. When it came to our host, Paul, the atmosphere went from 100% satisfactory to sero really quick. He just grabbed the menus and started walking in a rush, and no one was behind us. There was no greeting at all! If there was it was under his breathe. I would have preferred a more welcoming introduction or &#34;have you guys been here before?&#34; Keeping that upbeat and positiveness. The one and only thing he did right was openning a seat for me. As awkward it kind of felt for him because I was a guy, he still did it and smiled the whole way through. I would not call this much of a &#34;nice save.&#34; A smile only gets you so far, it is the attitude and actions that matters. <br><br>To start off, there was no proper greeting. Started off asking for drinks, but no formal greeting. She asked if we wanted bread, i dont know if you were suppose to make that a question. It just sounded weird when she ASKED us. As we observed, there was a lot of inconsistency. She greeted the guest next to us properly, &#34;I&#39;ll be your server for today.&#34; We were working literally eating bread, and some guy with long, dreadlike hair asked if he can take it away. That was done very poorly. And we actually wanted more after. One great thing about the service today, a lot of teamwork. Towards the end though, instead of asking if we wanted dessert, she asked if we wanted dessert to-go. Is that the Cheesecake factory way? Overall, we experienced that it seemed like because we were young, our server paid little to no attention to us. But, from noticing the guests next to us, she seemed like an alright server. Aside from the end, both us and the other guest was waiting for like 15mins on our check and there were a few servers who just passed to set tables. They obviously saw that we were done and said nothing. We felt kind of discriminated possibly because the thoughts of us having a lack of knowledge on serving. I enjoyed observing because this was a perfect example of &#34;Poor service&#34;. Wheres the smiles? Where is the welcoming, Aloha-spirit? <br><br>The only reason they deserve one star and because I can&#39;t do 0 is their timing on food. Food was amazing, as always! Nicely done with portion sizes and presentation. The Front of House was very inconsistent, disriminating, and unwelcoming. Very rushy, like they didn&#39;t want to serve us. I mean, would you like to take-out any dessert? What if we wanted dessert there?

Uggghhh.....GROSS!!!!!<br><br>I don&#39;t know what happened to Cheesecake Factory in Waikiki.  When it first opened up, the food was great, portions big, and service excellent (given how busy it gets in there).  Me and my family &amp; friends would often go there to eat for the past few years.  Last time we went was around 3 months ago.<br><br>In the last 3-4 years, I&#39;ve noticed a huge decline.  The food quality is poor, and their signature dishes taste like crap (food seemed old, overly-greasy, and smaller portions).  Some of the waiters are good while others have an attitude.  I&#39;ve let management know and received a call from a manager.  The manager seemed like he was giving me a bogus talk and didn&#39;t seem to take what I was saying seriously.  <br><br>Save your money &amp; time, don&#39;t go there until they can get their act together!

The wait is pretty long but it&#39;s been a while since me and my boyfriend have eaten here so we decided why not give it another try. It took us about an hour wait as we finally got in there was a crowd of people hovering the hostess area waiting to be seated I thought the point of have the buzzer was to avoid the crowed area at the hostess area. When you walk in it is very dark. <br>We started our meal with 2 appetizers the calamari and the tempura spicy ahi roll. The spicy ahi roll was DELICIOUS.  I would come back and get 2 orders of that. <br>As for our entree the boyfriend had the steak Diane with shrimp scampi and I had the steak Diane with herb crusted salmon. I don&#39;t know much about salmon but when I think salmon I think pink. But it was white and didn&#39;t really taste like salmon more of a mahi mahi taste. Idk it might have been just me. But the sauce the salmon was in had a strong lemon sour taste to it while the steak for my plate was tougher then my liking. The mashed potatoes were amazing super creamy and not chalky at all. <br>Over all experience it was okay probably will not be back for a couple years. The fried spicy ahi roll was the best part of our dinner and will probably be the reason I&#39;ll come back. It might have been the food that I ordered that made it and okay experience.

Updated Review: <br>My fiancé and I called ahead to make reservations for a group of 6. The lady that answered said they do not take rsvps and that in order to get a table, we would have to walk in. We arrived at about 5:30 and told the ladies at the front desk that we were having 6 people. She gave us a pager and said that we would be seated in about 30 minutes. We went to the bar to drink. Bryce was our bartender and the only good thing to come out of our dinner there. He was very chill and made our drinks to perfection (5 stars for Bryce). Our friends forgot their wallet in their car and left for 5 minutes to get it. (Their car was in the parking garage by Ross). The pager beeped and we went to get seated. The usher gave us a SUPER hard time about our table EVEN THOUGH OUR PARTY WAS THERE and told us we only could have a 5 minute wait window otherwise he would give up our table and we would have to wait on the list AGAIN. I told him nicely that they went to get their wallet and we still had 4 of the 6 there already. He still wouldn&#39;t sit us! Finally after a lot of going back and forth and he saw our party, he finally sat us and had an attitude about it. I asked him to get me a manager because I did not appreciate him being an a**hole to me or my party (manager never made it to our table). <br>Our server was &#34;interesting&#34;. We waited about 20 minutes for our first round of drinks and water. Everytime we tried to order the next round of drinks, she would only take 2 orders and leave the table. My girlfriend and I waited over 30 minutes just to order another set of daiquiris! Same thing for the food order (she took half the party&#39;s order then left and took the rest). One of our friends waited 30 minutes after we got our appetizers and entrees before her food got to us. We ended up cutting the night short here and taking our business elsewhere due to the ridiculous wait times for things and customer service from their workers.

Came here for dinner the other day around 5:00pm on a Wednesday. Didn&#39;t have to wait more than 5 minutes for a party of 2, but it was definitely crowded! We enjoyed the avocado egg rolls, the vegan cobb salad, and Evelyn&#39;s pasta. All three menu items were vegan and delicious. There are lots of vegetarian options, but NO dairy free or egg free desserts besides being offered &#34;a side of strawberries&#34;. You&#39;d think such a large company who specializes in cheesecakes would make at least one cheesecake that is vegan. This is the case for this establishment across the country, so it isn&#39;t a dig at this location, just an overall observation!

Ate here 3 times in 2.5 weeks lol - twice i had the Meatloaf which was delicious, and once the smokehouse burger, which was also delicious.  Unlimited refills on soda, friendly staff and good cheesecake as well.  Huge menu and huge portions.  I am a fan ;)  probably just as well we don&#39;t have them in NZ as I would visit too often!

I love the Cheesecake Factory but this one is way too busy. Waiting 40 minutes for a table at the bar. The wait was even longer for a regular table. But the staff was great and they work hard. The atmosphere would have been relaxing if it weren&#39;t so loud because of all the people. If you could hear the live Hawaiian music, it was nice music. Because of the noise I wouldn&#39;t bring my kids and 3 month old baby here. But it was okay for me and my husband. I got a blue Hawaiian cocktail and the nachos, which could feed 3 grown adults. Huge portion size. The cheesecake was amazing like always. But I will not be coming back to this location at dinner with my family. Maybe lunch but not dinner. Just to busy and loud.

I absolutely love this restaurant in general. This location was HUGE and very popular. There was a 40 minute wait when we got up to the counter with a ton of people behind us, yet the staff was super friendly, put together and did a great job of sorting everything out and making everything run smoothly. The menu is very large as well as the portions. I never leave hungry. The cheesecake is to die for. It is definitely worth the wait at this location! Our waitress was also very helpful and friendly.

The CF is one of my favorite chains.  Having said that, why would you fly all the way to Hawaii and eat at one?  Don&#39;t.  There are so many local eats that shouldn&#39;t be missed.  I came here around midnight for coffee and desserts.  That should be your only excuse.  I rated this lower than other CF because the hostess was ridiculous.  She gave us one of those buzzer things, which is good.  Then she buzzed us, which is good.  Then she told us to wait in a spot where she told a million other customers to wait.  Then she yelled as us for blocking the narrow hallway.  That was lame.  The manager needs to manage otherwise this silly hostess will continue to an bozo.

Stumbled across CF while visiting Honolulu. We decided to dine in with high hopes they would have our favorite cheesecake- Pineapple Upside Down. Considering the Pineapple Plantation is a short drive, we were certain they would have it!! we were wrong and so disappointed ;(<br><br>Overall, the service was good. Pleasantly surprised there was no wait, was seated upon arrival . Food and drinks consistent with other CF locations.

We ate here twice during our vacation in Hawaii. Once we ate for brunch/lunch and the other for dinner. The first time when we ate for brunch the place had very little patrons and we were seated immediately. Service of the food was a little slow, we ordered a dessert that took a while to come out. The second time was for dinner and there was literally an hour and a half wait time to be seated unfortunately. Once we were seated the food took a while to come out. For dessert I wanted the 30th anniversary chocolate/original cheesecake and the restaurant ran out, this was one of several cheesecakes they ran out of, smh. I was highly disappointed. But it&#39;s expected because this restaurant is in Wakiki, a heavily tourist area. Be prepared for a wait for dinner.

Parking is validated if you park in the Royal Hawaiian Center. Normally I don&#39;t do chain restaurants too often but was specifically craving their cheesecake and said hey why not. Lesson learned, will not return.<br><br>Menu is huge, thus will suit anyone taste buds! (Hoping they will have something that sounds pleasant for you) and you&#39;re in Waikiki expect the prices to be high!<br><br>Ordered the salmon egg rolls as an appetizer, it was delicious! Though I wish it was a somewhat bigger portion, ate the red cabbage it was served with - had a nice crunch and the sesame flavored sauce was refreshing. <br><br>I myself had the falafel salad. Overly dressed, so I recommend to order the dressing on the side! I am a believer of not returning food unless it was not specific to my personal order so that was my mistake. The falafel was good! Not too oily and had good flavor for sure.<br><br>My date had the fish encrusted with macadamia nut or whatever. Being a market priced item, I was disappointed, very small portion and overcooked. The rice and veggies it came with was good though!<br><br>Cheesecake rules thus any flavor is delicious, salted caramel was on point, wish that was the only thing I ordered. <br><br>SERVICE - makes or breaks you as a restaurant but I guess not in this case, it absolutely was not up to par. Was seated but didn&#39;t receive water or introduction for 11 minutes. I understand it was busy but an acknowledgement would&#39;ve been appreciated. Waitress looked exhausted, didn&#39;t seem very friendly - more robotic and monotone, turned me off didn&#39;t really want to ask questions or for recommendations (that&#39;s why I ended up with a salad ha). But the turn around for time for food made up for lack of customer service there. <br><br>They are busy, I completely understand that part but acknowledgement would&#39;ve made the experience better.

If I could rate this 0 starts I would. I usually like coming here and have decent service. But the service I just recently had was so horrible. There were so many horrible things that the server has done, her name&#39;s Nicole. First of all, when she was giving our water, she didn&#39;t come to our table. She passed it over the little gate they had between the table and walk way. Secondly, when we were ordering our food she didn&#39;t repeat our orders back to us, so when we received our meal it was wrong. My friend ordered sweet potato fries instead and my other friend got a well done burger but got a medium well. Also, when I got my pasta they didn&#39;t offer if I wanted cheese..since that&#39;s why they usually would ask. So when she came back she just DRAGGED my plate which pushed my utensils to the side and made a loud noise. Like excuse me?! After that I was just so irritated. It was my friend&#39;s first time at cheesecake so he wanted to order a cheesecake but our server DID NOT INFORM us that she&#39;s taking last call for food or cheesecake. She just gave us our checks so I asked her if we could order cheesecake and she says &#34;they just closed, sorry about that.&#34; We was so pissed, HOW CAN YOU NOT KNOW WHEN LAST CALL IS?! I don&#39;t know if she&#39;s new or what but she was so horrible. So beware for shitty service if you do get this girl. I love Cheesecake Factory but I don&#39;t know if I&#39;m gonna go back to the one in Waikiki I&#39;ll just drive to the Kapolei location.
Excellent food we had great service and there was live music at dinner time. Place is always packed how ever we only had a 15 minute wait for 2. Will be back again!
For the love of God and cheesecake.  Please build another location on Oahu.  If you build it, they will come....
Pros:  huge portions, inexpensive, convenient       <br>location, full bar, <br><br>Cons:  wait can be long at times

My sweet boyfriend sat at the cheesecake bar since I wasn&#39;t there to be seated... waiting for me to finish up shopping at forever 21. I was craving a juicy burger and sweet potato fries earlier in the day. He surprised me with exactly what I wanted and an extra bonus... Caesar salad and a Maitai. All I can say  &#34;it hit the spot&#34;. These dishes were delicious.

Ok seriously - why are you considering eating at the Cheesecake Factory when you are in Hawaii?!?! What are you doing?<br><br>Are you a newlywed or something? Well do you want to stay married? Then this is not your spot.<br><br>This restaurant has the longest and unnecessary wait time on the Waikiki strip. Every night I see dozens of people with these sad, starved faces sitting around the Royal Hawaiian waiting for their little buzzer to buzz for more than an hour, when they can go right across the street and get a great meal for less money.<br><br>It makes zero sense, because you aren&#39;t getting anything here you can&#39;t get at any other Cheesecake Factory. Actually that&#39;s partially true. You will definitely get a bill priced higher than what you are used to seeing. But hey, if you flew all the way to Waikiki to pay for it, who am I to judge.<br><br>Food wise, consistency wise, and quality wise, this location is on par with the rest of the chain. I&#39;ve eaten here twice (situations beyond my control) and never had an issue. <br><br>But when you are in Hawaii, and you have tools like Yelp at your disposal, there is no reason not to go try something new!

Today was National Cheesecake day! Awesome! Get a slice for half price!!!<br>Took my 2 daughters today as it is one of their favorites!<br>If you go around 5pm, you can get seated pretty quickly &amp; if you park at the Royal Hawaiian shopping center, get ticket validated,  Parking is FREE! <br>We always get the crab artichoke dip which is so creamy with lots of crab.  Gotta eat it warm with the crispy toasted french bread!  The fried chicken sliders are so moist &amp; tasty with the mayo, thousand island dressing, lettuce, tomato &amp; pickles! You need to order the Pasta Da Vinci because the penne pasta is cooked a la dente with lots of chunks of chicken &amp; slices of mushrooms. <br>Wish they would have parmesan garlic cheese bread like they do at the Cheesecake Factory Restaurants in LA.

Not like Waikiki...I was so excited that its near my residence here in Ewa .. being I work in Waikiki..couldnt wait to go to this one in Kapolei..it sucked..waiters has no personalities..too serious..try smiling. It would have been nice to be asked if I wanted to sit at the bar, or a table outside on the patio..but NO we were just shuffled over to a small table cramped in the corner with dimmed lighting..are you guyz trying to say something?? Heh Manager!! I going spend my money some where else. You guyz suck
Amazing!!  I love the menu and my favorite dessert is &#34;dulce de leche with caramel cheesecake&#34;. The avocado toast is delicious!

Tonight a friend and I drove to Waikiki to eat at the Cheesecake Factory. We waited about 30 minutes to get in- which was quick for dinner at this location. Once we got in, we had the best service that I&#39;ve ever received at any restaurant! Travis was phenomenal! The food was served at perfect intervals, our drinks were always full and we are leaving so stuffed that we are waddling! I cannot say enough positive things about Travis at this location- we were blown away by his amazing customer service and will request him by name the next time we stop by! Wish that we could clone him to serve at all restaurants!

Came here for my Birthday lunch on March 1st and the next day. Visiting from California. Front desk/ seater (young white lady with blonde hair and dark roots)need a little help or need to be happy with a smile greeting customers. It is Hawaii after all. Tons of visitors come from around the world the least you can do is smile and welcome people. On the other hand...Matt is a fantastic server!! He is a very happy guy and the service team can learn alot from him.Got our food quick, very easy to talk to, and respectful.

We came here on Sunday and it was packed for football, but we got lucky with two seats at the end of the bar. <br>The bartender was super busy but made it a point to let us know that she saw us and to let her know when she was ready. When we were ready we ordered our first round of drinks, and she gave us some time to look over the menu. The menu is HUGE, so many options, but a little overwhelming. But it&#39;s great when you don&#39;t know what you want, because there is a little of everything. <br>We finally decided on two burgers. Real original, I know. The guy next to us got his food before us, and he ordered a while after us. The bartender noticed as well and immediately got someone&#39;s attention and asked them to check on our food. <br>A few minutes went by with nothing, so she called for a manager. A manager was over by our side promptly,  apologizing for the food taking longer than expected. He told us that when we finished our burgers that desert was on them and even if we were full to order it to go. <br>While we waited for our burgers, another patron was talking to the bartender as if he knew her and his laugh was contagious. He seemed funny and someone full of spunk and stories. So we decided to send him over a shot. He was awesome and came to thank us. :)<br>Our burgers came!!! Yeah! The food itself was good. Nothing over the top, cooked to the temp that we ordered!! <br>The burgers were huge, I couldn&#39;t finish mine. (which is rare) we were soooooo full!!! So, we ordered the red velvet cheesecake to go. (it was amazing) <br>The manager came back over to apologize again for the slow service (it ended up being a mix up in the kitchen) and said because we only got one desert that he took off the shot that we ordered. It was so nice, over the top and not expected. Thank you!! <br>Also, another thank you to the waiter that was so nice, polite and had such good positive vibes. He wasn&#39;t our waiter, but he was walking by and my bf was curious to what drinks he was carrying and he took the time to stop tell us what drinks they were, what was in them, and he even suggested his favorite. It was just really nice because he took the time to stop and talk to us, he wasn&#39;t annoyed or taken back. <br>The bartender&#39;s name was Erica, the waiter was Joe, and I apologize I forget the managers name, but I want to say it was Bryan. (but I&#39;m not 100% sure on that one) the three of them deserve some recognition for thier outstanding service!!! <br>Thank you so much to all three of you for going above the standard and making my birthday lunch perfect!! We will be back, soon!!!

The girl at the front was very rude. My family were walking behind me a little slower because her leg. She wouldnt seat me until my party was in restaurant. Now i have to wait for all these people that walked behind me to gwt a seat. Hawaii always like this

Ate out in The Waikiki Cheesecake Factory while on vacation. Food was really good, our server Pat was really nice and friendly. Very pleased with our meals. It was really dark in there but that&#39;s normal for the Cheesecake Factory

I love the Lunch Hours! Why, you may be wondering...because I&#39;ve never waited more than 3 minutes for a table! All the times I&#39;ve eaten here have only been their opening hours and I like it that way. <br><br>On my recent visit the Hostess took us to what I thought was &#39;the Dungeon&#39;. I don&#39;t know why she thought that four women, three of which have poor eye sight, would be fine sitting in a round corner booth with barely any light. Sure some may think that dimming lights make for an &#39;Intimate Experience&#39;...blah! Not here! It does not look classy to see ladies pulling out their phones to use the flashlight to read the menu! Even after asking the waitress if they could brighten up the lights in the corner or if they had any glasses that had an LED light, she sadly replied that the restaurant can&#39;t change the lights and no light reading glasses. For this lack of light set us 10min more into searching into &#39;The Cheesecake Factory Menu Book&#39; for our Lunch. <br><br>Appetizers to try: <br>Crab &amp; Artichoke Dip! Yes, everyone should try this dip that will not only make you moan because of the taste, but will feed four people very well! We attacked the toasted bread slices, which weren&#39;t that much, and the squaw &amp; Italian bread with the crab and artichoke dip! Even after the toasted slices were eaten, we began asking for a second helping of warm bread to place the dip in between and have a nice crab sandwich - which I also recommend trying! <br><br>Soup of the Day: when I ordered my Renee&#39;s lunch special (chicken and almond salad sandwich with a small baby green salad with blue cheese dressing and a bowl of soup); the soup which was called, &#34;Spicy Mexican Chicken Soup with cheese and crispy tortilla strips&#34;. This is must try! The closest to this soup in taste is at Chili&#39;s - but this clearly out bests Chili&#39;s. After one spoonful and I ate the whole bowl of soup before I even touched my salad and sandwich! The soup was very tasty, the Spicy - meaning full of spices because it wasn&#39;t hot in rector scale but pipping hot in temperature. This soup can be eaten on a cool Fall evening on a porch staring out into the sunset! Yes, I would definitely go back just for the soup! <br><br>Entrees to try that will make you content - <br>Fish &amp; Chips<br>Factory Meatloaf <br>Fettuccine Alfredo <br>Renee&#39;s Lunch Special<br><br>And of course the cheesecake! Though I&#39;ll let you decide which is your favorite! Though something I noticed and liked is that they have special cheesecakes for certain holidays. Way to celebrate Cheesecake Factory!!

It&#39;s been at least 10 years since I&#39;ve been here, and like many locals, hardly frequent the place because it takes forever to get in. My last and only memory of this place was that the food was good, not great, and everything else was mediocre. <br><br>I was in Waikiki for 4th of July weekend and understandably it was more crowded than normal - 2 hour wait at 9pm at night. No thanks. But I came back the next morning and around 945am it wasn&#39;t crowded we got seated quickly. <br><br>The hostesses (male and female) left a lot to be desired. Not real friendly or engaging - the bare minimum. The guy leading us to our table just confirmed our name then started walking, no welcome or anything. Luckily we had an awesome server. She was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and she had a great happy vibe. She made us all feel comfortable. Timely visits to check on us and very accommodating. <br><br>The food was excellent as well. Of course everything in Waiks is overpriced but here they give you so much food it&#39;s like two meals. The food tasted fresh and was very flavorful - good salads and soup, pizzas, and my steak tacos. <br><br>My party all got their food before me and mine took a long time. The manager came out (without prompting) and said the cook overdid my steak and would cook a new dish. She politely asked if I minded waiting, apologized, and offered me a choice of a free side menu item or cheesecake. How awesome is that?!<br><br>I&#39;ll be honest - the normal wait times are too long for me and I may not be back for a while. But great food and great service (except for the hostesses) makes this one of my favorite overall restaurants!
