Love the food there! Always ordering take out after work, very convenient, they always answer the phone right away and it&#39;s super easy and fast to order

Do not eat here if you have a food allergy. They will serve you food with the ingredient even if you ask them to remove it (and then charge you for the meal after they have to replace it with a different meal - not to mention waiting for both, and never receiving what you originally ordered). <br><br>I was really disappointed as I specifically sought to eat here and it was my last meal in Hawaii. Don&#39;t suggest eating here if you have a food allergy or as a final vacation meal - you&#39;ll be left with a lasting impression but not the one you want.<br><br>Also- followed up with management as requested in their comment back on this post and never received a response.

Love the food! I don&#39;t ever recall being disappointed with my order ever. If you are not bold with trying new things get the chicken medeira... it&#39;s my fiancée , my sister, and my favorite dish to order. But the best reason to even visit this place is duh.... for the cakes! And not just cheesecakes, cuz well not everyone is a fan of cheesecakes. If you have a mad sweet tooth and veins of chocolate like me get the chocolate truffle tower. It&#39;s a ridiculously huge slice so I never finish it but I always take my left overs home with me! &amp;though the food is great I had to drop a star for two things.... one, never go during dinner rush! They don&#39;t take reservations so you will more than likely be waiting a long time to be seated, especially if you have a big party. I&#39;ve found that the in between lunch and dinner time is the best time to come if you wanna get seated right away. And secondly, pigeons! It&#39;s an open restaurant so if you&#39;re seated outside or near the outdoor patio you will definitely have some unexpected guests around. Once, a pigeon flew right over my head , so close I felt the air gush as it flapped over me. I hate pigeons! But easy solve, now we always ask to be seated inside lol. All and all , good food and decent service...

We came when it was 50% off cheesecakes on national cheesecake day july 29 and july 30. :) <br><br>We got the Paradise in a Pineapple, which was beautifully and creatively presented and also delicious. In it, is Captain Morgan, Sailor Jerry, and Myer&#39;s Rum blended with tropical juices served in a whole fresh Hawaiian pineapple. Definitely recommend for $15.<br><br>Also, took advantage of cheesecake day and got a mango key lime cheesecake. I&#39;m not sure if this was true for all the cheesecakes in Hawaii but the graham cracker crust on our cheesecake was laced with yummy shredded coconut. <br><br>Stop by for a refreshing treat after enjoying Waikiki Beach! Sit at the bar to save time if you are just coming in for a snack!

The wait on a Sunday at 6 wasn&#39;t too bad, but trying to get to the hostess stand was like cattle being herded...seriously!  Once we reached the hostess, they took our name and said about 20-30 minutes, not bad all things considering.  They gave us the buzzer and we walked over to Forever 21.  Huge store and was able to satisfy our wait for dinner. <br><br>I ordered the salmon, steak, and asparagus, really yummy.  My friend ordered one of the pasta dishes, the portion was huge!  For apps we got the buffalo blasts and something else I can&#39;t quite remember.  Not memorable means not great.<br><br>Anyway, I avoid Waikiki like the plague, but I think a trip to Cheesecake Factory once in a while is worth the drive in.

WOO - 5 STARS! This review is strictly for the restroom.<br><br>Honolulu/Waikiki is the perfect place to be - day or night...walking around Ala Moana and Kapiolani shops. There&#39;s always something to do, see, or EAT. ABC Stores in every corner and good eats in between. The only downfall is if you&#39;re not on the beach side (where the restrooms are), and you gotta go - you gotta find a place. And there&#39;s only 2 choices - a nearby hotel or a restaurant.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is the absolute BEST place. It&#39;s ALWAYS busy, FULL of people, people going in and out that they don&#39;t really check if you use their restroom or not. Heck, they probably don&#39;t care!<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory, for being there for me when I need a place to go!

Went here for lunch with the hubby and friends! <br><br>5 stars for the wait, we were quoted 15 min but got paged in 7 and seated 2 minutes later.<br><br>The host who seated us was very nice, funny and professional. So hard to balance that but I have to say that he did a really good job.<br><br>The waitress we had was fantastic! I wish I had asked what her name was so I could ask for her section again. <br><br>I got the pizza &amp; salad lunch special and it was great and big enough for 2 or one really hungry person. I wanted to share with  my friend, but unfortunately we didn&#39;t do that. I got the hawaiian pizza and caesar salad. The hawaiian pizza had kalua pig, pineapple, red peppers and red onions. The pizza wasn&#39;t much to look at but it was so delicious that I wanted to keep eating it. The half salad I got was also pretty big and had a lot of dressing on it, I would highly recommend asking for your dressing on the side, I know I will. We all shared the wild blueberry white chocolate cheesecake and it was absolutely delicious. Because there were 4 of us sharing we were given an extra dollop of whipped cream. Overall from the time we got there until the time we left it was about 75 minutes. The longest wait for our food, about 20 minutes. Very impressed!
Great Appetizers!  Great Service!  But a long wait!  Came here for Xmas dinner. Busiest Cheesecake Factory location in the world!
Went to this place twice during our trip. Good to see that their food and service is consistent. Servings are enormous! However the food is good!

JOE!!! We sat outside today and had Joe as our waiter. From the time we sat down he has been the best! Very attentive and new our needs before we asked. Great personality! Next time I come back I&#39;m definitely asking for Joe!!! His spunkyness made my lunch break!!!

Other than the expected one hour wait for a party of seven, our service was over the top. I wish I got our waitress&#39;s name but I was so busy tending to my newborn that it was the last thing on my mind. She was very friendly and always checked up on us since she knew I didn&#39;t get a chance to eat the complimentary bread or if we needed anything extra. She upsized my older son&#39;s drink rather than giving him the kids size cup. She offered to bring a cup of hot water to sanitize my baby&#39;s two pacifiers that dropped during our dinner. I haven&#39;t been to a restaurant lately that went over and beyond to check up on our family considering we had three young kids with us. Although they didn&#39;t have my meatloaf dish available or the seasonal pumpkin cheesecake I love, this place deserves five stars due to her outstanding service.

Went here for lunch because food usually is very good but not this time. Our entire experience was lousy from the time we gave the girl our name till we actually ate. Waited almost a half hour after we ordered our food till it was brought to our table and while We were waiting I saw 3-4 roaches crawling on the bar which was right next to our table which was not very clean either. If there&#39;s roaches in dining area how many are in the area where the food is being prepared. What I ordered was a club sandwich, the bread was over toasted and even black on the ends and was hard from being over toasted. I definitely would not recommend this location, they need to shut it down and redo inside because I don&#39;t think anything&#39;s been done since it opened.
It was pretty good. My favorite is the pasta jambalaya. Usually I don&#39;t like cheesecake but this was a must try

Recently went for breakfast while staying in Waikiki for Easter weekend. Walked right in, no line like at night which is usually an hour to and hour &amp; 1/2 minimum. Great breakfast menu options as well as the rest of the menu which was also available. Their serving sizes always seem big and were with breakfast too, I always feel like I get my money&#39;s worth here. Got the eggs Benedict and it was really good. Our server was friendly and we got our food fast. Will definitely be back for breakfast here again.

Last night our whole family went to dinner...we didnt have to wait long...we were lucky to just beat the dinner rush! They give you a buzzer to hold on to for when your table is ready...we waited no more than 10 min. Customer service was excellent. I ordered shrimp scampi/salmon combo..my oldest son ordered s salad, which was huge! Everything each of us ordered was delicious! No complaints!! Our server ...i think his name was &#34;Rodrigo&#34;?? ...was attentive, friendly, helpful with our menu, kept us up to date with our food...our table was constantly kept clean of empty dishes, which was great!
KeyLime Cheesecake was so good!! Definitely the best!! Definitely would go back. Original Strawberry cheesecake was also very good.

I haven&#39;t been here in a very long time and don&#39;t remember how it was. My friend and I were determine to get a chance to eat here. We decided to come her for her birthday. <br><br>We came here 6/21/14 with our boyfriends. We came in the morning right when they opened because we knew that they get crazy busy and wanted to avoid that. As we walked in we were greeted to a friendly staff. Our waiter was nice. Though some time took between our appetizers and entree we didn&#39;t mind. The appetizers were good but I was very sad that all of our pasta was on the salty side. We didn&#39;t want to be rude and try to eat as much as we could. We ended up telling our waiter but only about one of the dishes and just decided that we wanted to get dessert already. Love the cheesecakes!! (main reason we really came lol)<br><br>Overall I would like to try this place again.

Cheesecake Factory is always great! But I won&#39;t review Cheesecakes food, or deserts, or ambiance, because it&#39;s always amazing! And love love going to cheesecake! Today I want to review the service! My family and I went to celebrate life at Cheesecake Factory, we had some gift cards lol! The young lady that served us was AMAZING! She was so helpful and so kind and attentive. I can&#39;t remember her name but she was a white girl, dirty blonde... I believe... super friendly! BEST server I have had in a LONG time!!!

Despite eating at several extremely expensive fine dining restaraunts (joe&#39;s in Haleiva and 53 by the Sea), this was the BEST FOOD I had in Honolulu and a relative bargain. LOVED the Louisiana Chicken Pasta and even came home and searched for the recipe online. Sat at the bar and service was average but it was nice to be able to watch my favorite show with captions, &#34;Shark Tank&#34;. Might have also enjoyed people watching at the outside walkway tables. Ironically, this isnt a restaurant I normally think of going to in any other cities and went only because of the other yelp reviews  . Because of the great food at this location, I may try it in my home city.

Been eating here since they opened in 2003 (at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center).  Great prices, varied menu, huge servings, awesome/attentive waithelp, relaxing atmosphere!  It&#39;s my go-to restaurant when in Waikiki.

Classic food location - nothing too unique, but always good. Lots of food options so all will find something they enjoy. The food never disappoints the mouth (except for the high calorie count). Great go to for a family event.

The wait is really long. Luckily I was patient enough to wait an hour and a half. If you are not into dark lit restaurant, be prepared to have your flashlights out. The service was awesome with great smiles. Personally I think the appetizers were way BETTER than the actual dishes. Cheesecake was okay. Overall my experience was okay. The only highlight was the customer service, great management.

My mom and I came in tonight at around 10 and shared the macadamia nut fish dish. It was amazing! We also got a side of mac and cheese. Great vibes, and our server, Tyler was amazing, really hospitable and seemed truly genuine and friendly! Good job Cheesecake Waikiki!

Previous 5 star review still stands.  In short, this is great food at a decent price with huge portions.  If you sit on the patio and arrive before 5, I&#39;d be surprised if you left here dissatisfied.  We dined here Saturday 3/16 and felt it was one of the best meals we had this trip.<br><br>Enough reviews on the food, service and normal topics.  What I want to share here is the insightful discussion we had with our sever that impressed us on many levels.<br><br>There was a fire in the kitchen earlier this year that shut the restaurant down for about a month.  We had read about it in our online edition of the Honolulu Star Advertiser shortly after it happened and were immediately inquisitive about how corporate handled it with their staff, etc.<br><br>I&#39;m pleased to report that according to our server they really stepped up and took care of everybody.  First, some interesting stats: this is one of the busiest locations in the nation. With over 400 on staff, they seat between 4,000 and 5,000 people PER DAY.  That alone amazed us. The efficiency of this place is astounding.<br><br>Our server said that one of the first things they did was have several get togethers with tons of free food.  There isn&#39;t another Cheesecake Factory nearby so they couldn&#39;t transfer the inventory. Corporate gave it all away to the staff.  <br><br>Secondly, they took care of them financially.  Granted, with the numbers they push through here, it wasn&#39;t practical to let everyone go and then re-hire and attempt to train again in a month, so paying everyone while the restaurant was inoperable was really the best business decision.<br><br>Still, corporate is to be commended on their fairness.  They averaged their employees last six weeks of 2012 including tips and came up with a weekly salary.  In addition, they also allowed for you to cash in vacation time if you so desired.<br><br>Our server said some employees grumbled, thinking they should have gotten more but not him. He thought it was more than fair and even took the opportunity to take his family on vacation.<br><br>My wife and I could not speak highly enough about this Cheesecake Factory.  The food. The service. The atmosphere (patio, early seating) and the way in which they took care of their staff....all outstanding!<br><br>Oh, and this night&#39;s dinner?  Delicious as always. I tried a new dish per our server&#39;s recommendation: Bang Bang Chicken and loved every bite!

We walked in and got seated promptly on Sunday around 4 pm! Surprised us because every time we try to go it&#39;s packed with a very long wait! The food was pretty good! The kids meals come loaded! If you have small children and they eat like birds, have them share if they will. The spaghetti and meatball kid&#39;s plates are the size of an adult&#39;s entree! All of our Plates were fully loaded! Great prices and great food! Our waitress was friendly and stayed on top of our drinks making sure they were refilled! Grab a slice of the Red Velvet Cheesecake! You will not be disappointed!

This restaurant is by far one of the best places to go in Waikiki. Came here for the fifth or sixth time and the food and portions seemed to have greatly increased in size! Got myself the Diane steak and their salmon and it was to die for! The mash potatoes were perfectly seasoned and cooked as well as the salmon and steak. First place in a while that has gotten the steak cooked just right! And the cheesecakes top it all off! Be warned, big portions and it&#39;ll fill you up fast! The price is a bit on the higher end, but is worth every penny! Great staff and food service! Will return for sure!

I understand why residents flock to the sole branch of the Cheesecake Factory in Hawaii, however I don&#39;t get the masses who come from other cities that have Cheesecake Factories and wait for an hour, just to get a table for four. It&#39;s the same menu! Anyway, the Waikiki location of the Cheesecake Factory is simply another restaurant for me that offers an insanely large menu, decent service, and a nice ambiance. It doesn&#39;t offer anything outstanding (beside an outstandingly LONG wait time for a table), however at the same time the food and service certainly doesn&#39;t disappoint. <br><br>Let&#39;s start off with the obvious, if you during the lunch or dinner rush, be prepared to wait and wait for a table. It is a rather large location, however the masses come and it can be quite a bit of wait for a table and they do not take reservations. <br><br>The menu is large and will please any palate. It is by far the largest menu selection I have ever come across (and build it yourself burger combination&#39;s don&#39;t count). However, if I&#39;m paying for my meal, I really don&#39;t want to see ads in the menu for local establishments, nice marketing touch, but a little un-classy in my book. <br><br>The food is decent, however there are only a few highlights for me. The fried macaroni and cheese is heaven. If there was ever a moment I could die happily from one bite of food it would be that item. Nicely cooked macaroni with the perfect blend of cheeses and coated in a perfected layer of bread crumbs and deep fried, what is not to like about that! Their shepherd&#39;s pie is pretty good and I have to say I was rather impressed with the perfect blend of meats and vegetables to mashed potato ratio along with the homestyle flavors that come through. Everything else on the menu I&#39;ve had such as the chinese chicken salad and their burgers and sandwiches are all decent, however nothing outstanding or noteworthy. Oh, note, the portions are pretty good sized, so if you have an appetite, you certainly can get your money&#39;s worth.<br><br>Now, that&#39;s out of the way, let&#39;s be honest. You came to the CHEESECAKE factory for cheesecake? It would be weird if you went there for a sundae in my book. Anyway, the Godiva Chocolate cheesecake is bites of heaven if the mood for chocolate strikes you. The texture is a little heavier than your standard cheesecake, however the rich and bold chocolate flavors will certainly put a buckle in your knees. Try the Dulce De Leche cheesecake if the mood for caramel strikes you or perhaps the Strawberry if you want something sweeter. Note, the strawberries they put on are large and amazingly good. The Chocolate Raspberry Truffle is a nice blend if you want something sweet and savory and the Oreo cheesecake is perfect for the cookie lover in us all. Did I mention I like cheesecake...<br><br>Service is good with the wait staff being extremely pleasant and generally speaking very attentive. It has been rare that my water has gotten close to empty and they are quick to check in on you and the food arrives in a wonderful orchestration.<br><br>Parking is available in the Royal Hawaiian Center lot and it is a bit of walk from the garage, but they validate for up to two hours. The ambiance is comfortable and while dimly lit, it serves its purpose well for group outings or that nice dinner for two. If you just want dessert and go, the cheesecake counter is right at the front of the store and you can always take your dessert out on the beach!<br><br>Dessert and service are certainly extreme highlights, however it certainly doesn&#39;t make up for the long wait and the so-so meal menu.

The food and the service were excellent. We were treated by Chris. He made it obvious his name was chris. He was very friendly and showed us his napkin folding skills. I had folded a flower with my napkin, and he saw. That&#39;s when he showed us his skills. I wanna give it 5 stars, but the wait was just too long. We waited an hour for a table, but the order time and meal time were satisfactory. The prices were okay, and the food was good. We had an appetizer, entree, and dessert. It was hard to keep room for all this food in our stomach. <br>Our appetizer was fried mac n cheese balls, and they were so good. Our entrees were Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta and stuffed tortillas, both were excellent. We had only eaten half before we grew full. For dessert, we had the oreo cheesecake and the white chocolate macadamia nut, both were supreme. <br>Overall, we would come back here, maybe if the wait were shorter, it would get 5 stars. We understand that this is a Waikiki hotspot, but the wait was just too much.

This is my go to place when I want a great meal. You know the food is good when no one minds an hour plus wait. I&#39;ve been going to this Cheesecake Factory since it open and I&#39;ve really never been disappointed. Everything is good from drinks to desserts ... my favorite is their Passion Fruit Mohito, firecracker salmon appetizer and any of their chocolate cheesecakes. The entrees are huge btw, you&#39;re going to end up taking leftovers home unless you share. <br><br>The last time I went there, my Chicken Bellagio was REALLY salty. They took it back but said their basil sauce is usually salty. But I thought it was too much. An otherwise yummy meal made totally inedible. I ended up just sharing my friend&#39;s entree. The Chocolate Tuxedo Cheesecake made up for everything.
This place would be 5 stars but the wait and prices are actually extreme even for Waikiki

I know, I know...&#34;You get all the way to Honolulu and you&#39;re eating at the Cheesecake Factory??&#34;  I&#39;ve heard it before!  But hey, I&#39;m not coming to this place for any ordinary reason.  This place is known for making one of the BEST mai tai&#39;s I&#39;ve had on Waikiki!  No doubt!  They are by far the best!  Mix it in with a little fresh bread and their baja chicken tacos, and it&#39;s a match made in heaven!<br><br>The ambiance is nice with the tiki torches out front.  Everything else is pretty standard for a good ol&#39; Cheesecake factory, including the wait.  A trick for this location, in particular, sit at the bar!<br><br>There&#39;s no putting your feet in the sand here, but that is one kick a$$ drink!

The Cheesecake Factory is an overrated tourist restaurant. Sure the food is delicious but it&#39;s not that amazing that you have to wait an hour and a half just to sit down. The only thing I am extremely impressed with is their honey oat bread and their selection of cheesecake. You don&#39;t really need an entree with their bottomless bread basket and the size of their appetizers. But they have a large selection of entrees so it appeals more to the picky eater. Also their entrees are good, being from New York its hard to find pizza out here that I actually will order again. Their portions are large so it&#39;s almost worth the price. Except for the cocktails, they&#39;re small and really not worth it. Just order water like a normal person and go have happy hour at a bar. <br><br>My suggestions: <br><br>Appetizers:<br><br>-Avocado Egg Rolls<br><br>-Fried Macaroni and Cheese (Personal Favorite)<br><br>-Spinach and Cheese Dip<br><br>-Caesar Salad<br><br>Entrees: <br><br>-Tomato, Basil and Cheese Pizza <br><br>-Cheese Pizza <br><br>-Americana Hamburger (Okay I don&#39;t actually eat meat, but I&#39;ve never heard complaints)<br><br>Cheesecake:<br><br>- Godiva Cheesecake (The reason why I don&#39;t order any other cheesecakes)<br><br>-Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake<br><br>-Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake

Despite always having some sort of wait (ranging from 10 minute to 1+ hours), it is well worth it. Having been here roughly a dozen times, the service has generally been great. This means that they were friendly and capable of answering questions.<br><br>Food choices? TOO MANY! Come in at lunch time for sizeable portions for a bit less. And trust me, you&#39;ll still get your fill, considering you&#39;ll be eating that mandatory dessert right? On top of the listed choices, meals such as the salmon have different flavoring! And they&#39;re very accommodating if you&#39;re allergic or wanting that extra sauce. <br><br>Now onto the cheesecakes - my suggestions:<br><br>For those that want a light, but neutral flavor cheesecake that goes well even when you&#39;re full - the vanilla bean cheesecake. In fact, I would have to put it in my top 3 cheesecakes because it&#39;s delicious and very satisfying.<br><br>If you want something fruity and familiar, my absolute favorite - dutch apple streusel cheesecake. My favorite because I love dutch apple pie and it&#39;s not overly sweet, despite having caramel in it. The nuts and cinnamon dutch pie crumbs help to keep the sweetness in check. A definite win.<br><br>Want something sour? KEY LIME. Prepare to have your face implode. If you like sour, but not painful sour, the mango key lime pie is a better choice.<br><br>Chocolate lover? The Godiva or new Oreo cheesecake is very delicious.<br><br>Random dessert? I suggest the Chocolate Truffle Tower Cake. Not a cheesecake but enormous and very flavorful. <br><br>It does not receive a full 5-stars because it is exclusively in Waikiki and locals, such as myself, must travel from the other side of the island to enjoy the delicacies that is heaven.

This place always has a very long line outside. We waited to be seated. After they took our buzzer, we waited for 15 more mins because the host weren&#39;t attending to us. After we asked what&#39;s the reason for the hold up, they said they had us wait because they are trying to find a bilingual host. And then they asked &#34;Do you prefer Chinese, Japanese or Korean?&#34;. Just because we are Oriental doesn&#39;t mean we can&#39;t speak English! We told them we wanted an American server, so we got seated already.<br><br>The server was nice, very happy and energetic. We ordered our dish then she brought out our drinks and the bread. I guess it&#39;s because that the place is crowded and packed with customers that our food took a very long time to be served. <br><br>The food were good the portions were big. The Hibachi Steak is only a few slices of steak though. I love the Fried Mac and Cheese! <br><br>I guess we shouldn&#39;t have ordered too much because we didn&#39;t have room for desserts. <br><br>It took longer for us to wait to be seated and wait for our food to come out than the time it took us to eat.
Always crowded. Skip the line and go to the bar area if with a smaller group.  Food is always well proportioned. Best value in town for quality and quantity.

We came at 4:30pm on a weekday afternoon and was told the wait will be 45 minutes. We expected there would be a wait so we already planned to take care of some business beforehand. They gave a  buzzer that would let us know when the table was ready. The time they told us the wait is always a good estimate. Ordered the Garlic noodles with chicken. It was delicious and ate every last bite. I enjoyed the oreo cheesecake for dessert. Good service and food comes out fairly quickly.

My Wife and i came to eat dinner. We got Seated right away. Our waitress was Sacarra. She was great, our food came out Fast. Food was delicious. We also got the Godiva cheesecake which was super good.
The five stars are for our server Tyler. <br>I and my wife have never met a better server ever. <br>The cheesecake was also awesome. <br>What a view of the Christmas parade too. <br>The Hogans

Cheesecake Factory has always amazed me with its mouthwatering dishes,prompt services and huge portions..<br>But today, one of the server&#39;s ruined my night.<br>He never cared to attend to our needs ,or would walk the other way when we tried to call him for something n was reluctant to hear what we had to say.<br>On a close watch ,to know why the attitude,he seemed to be very friendly and polite with the other customers and as soon as we called him for something,his face would show displeasure.<br>Now thats racial!!<br>I couldn&#39;t even eat my food because I was very upset with his behavior.<br>Ruined my holiday trip!!<br>Am sorry I had to give one star because of just this one person!

Was a little let down by this Cheesecake Factory location.  Came in for the strawberry shortcake only to find out they ran out of shortcakes.<br><br>Instead we tried the vanilla lemonchello cake with ice cream and while it was delightful it does not compare to the strawberry shortcake!<br><br>Perhaps next time

Cheesecake is a MUST when eating at the Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;m pretty sure any cheesecake you try will taste equally sinful and deliciously yummy.  I tried the Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake the last time I went and it was the bomb.  It didn&#39;t matter that I felt like I gained a pound with every bite..the taste was delectable!  It tasted like a combination of chocolate, nuts, toffee (?), and...coconut.  Bottom line: super ono.  <br><br>The main course dishes are pretty flavorful too.  I enjoyed the orange chicken (could actually taste the orange flavor) and roasted vegetable pizza (winners!).

We recently did an overnighter in Waikiki.  Of course my kids insisted on going to Cheesecake Factory for dinner. We got there at 7:50 pm and had to wait a little more than an hour. We were seated in the back of the restaurant with open windows facing a garden space. My kids got mosquito bites and some kind of bug buzzed our table. It was also very hot. Our waiter was very nice and did a great job. The food was marginal. We had the spinach artichoke dip, which was a bit too chunky for my taste. The tortilla chips were kind of stale. I had a soup, salad and sandwich combo. The onion soup was a watered down French Onion soup with a little cheese. My daughter had the carbonara pasta, which she said tasted oily.  My son had the chicken and biscuits which had hard and crunchy carrots. Lots and lots of carrots. The cheesecake was really good. Next time, I think we&#39;ll just go for dessert.  I&#39;m not sure I would wait an hour for that again.

Come early!!!!!!!!! This place had the longest line I have ever seen, like 100 people lol (ok more like 50-60).  Basically it was really long and I was only coming here to pick up some cheesecakes to go and that line was long too.  Long story short, if you got to eat here, make a reservation, come after peek hours, or place your order to go, otherwise be prepared to wait a long time!!

Very friendly staff and prompt service. Soooo many options to choose from but done really well. Would definitely suggest the fish and chips and if you have room to squeeze in more- their signature key lime cheesecake

I wanted to write a brief update about my recent visit for Sunday brunch:<br><br>Sunday brunch is served from 10am to 2pm, and consists of 13 items with the 13th item being a &#34;kids&#34; brunch sized portion.  Sunday brunch items include pancakes, waffles, eggs benedict, and steak and eggs.  I went with a friend, and after looking over their menu I decided to order the Baja Chicken Hash, while my friend decided to order the Crab Hash.<br>Both of these dishes come with your choice of tomatoes or potatoes, as well as white toast, wheat toast, or a plain bagel.  Please see<br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thecheesecakefactory.com%2Fmenu%2Fwelcome%2FWelcome&amp;s=8de7dd2b21bb4d63986deb2f3d2d024b9ed8f5084e5ec6c7908a7fdbf1ddc64b" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">thecheesecakefactory.com…</a> for the full Sunday Brunch menu, as well as their complete menu offerings.<br><br>NOTE:  The plain bagel comes with cream cheese, while the toast comes with strawberry jam.<br><br>For the 2 dishes that we ordered, I thought the price we paid was very reasonable for the portion sizes.  I was so tempted to finish my entire dish, but were it not for the fact that I wanted to save room for dessert I most likely would have devoured all of my food!  Seriously, no visit to Cheesecake Factory would be complete without dessert!!  My friend decided to order the red velvet cheesecake, while I choose the 30th Anniversary chocolate cheescake.  Now let me just say this chocolate cheesecake, a hybrid of their original cheesecake and fudge cake, was simply delicious!  Your taste buds will be doing the happy dance for hours on end.  Amazingly, I finished nearly the entire piece of cheesecake.  <br><br>SERVICE:  The service on this visit was phenomenal!  The server was just so friendly, outgoing, polite, helpful, and the list goes on and on.  Exceptional service indeed.<br><br>Bottom Line:  Take advantage of this once a week food spectacular!

Went to Waikiki and decided to eat at Cheesecake for my son&#39;s bday. Food was good, however the service was lousy and terrible. Server lady was maybe 10% helpful &amp; demeanor was unpleasant (never smiled and looked bothered). Never checked on us after food was served and had flag her to ask for ketchup which should be standard with fries. Even after this, we had to ask her to clear table of empty appetizer dishes to eat comfortably.  Would never go back. Kapolei location is way better and even has live music.

What can I say, I love this place. Yummy food, affordable, and good location for Waikiki. The Herb Crusted Salmon and Steak Dianne Combo is so good!<br><br>The only negatives are it&#39;s super busy during dinner and NOISY! I suggest coming for luch or right before dinner to avoid a wait, also try and sit outside or in the very back, it&#39;s better lit and somewhat quieter.<br><br>Park at Royal Hawaiian shopping center and get validation, 1st hour is free then only $1 every hour after that.
We ate here twice before this time. Both of those times we had a not so good experience.<br><br>However, this trip was amazing. Food was great, service was great.

The wait is always long, but if you can get a table it&#39;s always a great experience. I&#39;ve been going to cheesecake favorites on the mainland for who knows how long, and their menu is fantastic though overwhelmingly long. Always a great ambiance with perfectly dim lighting and beautiful details in the restaurant, and this particular location is very well done. They even have some local flair on their menu. I had the chorizo omelette one night here and it was AMAZING. Also if you get a salad, try the avocado ranch dressing. So delicious! Oh and portions are huge so you&#39;ll almost always take home some.

I have been to other Cheesecake Factory restaurants but this is my first time here in Waikiki. I wasn&#39;t disappointed. Always good food and services. Ordered the shrimp angel hair pasta and Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta. Even though very busy restaurant, our server gave us the attention and good service. This is a tip: if you plan to eat at 7 pm , be there and enlist you name at 6 pm. Worth the wait though.
I thanked my children for sharing a slice of cheesecake, it was delicious. I need to return to your eatery for more.

This place was amazing!!! We came here for my friends birthday during their lunch hour and we didn&#39;t have to wait. The prices were very reasonable . Our meal cost a total of $103.78 and tip an extra $16. I ordered the chicken katsu and it just melted in my mouth. I love how the sauces go so well together, it had a hint of Sriracha on the side which gave it a kick of spicy. We got good customer service and complimentary bread. Overall I had a great experience here.

I went to The Cheesecake Factory with my husband tonight, and it was really busy as expected. The things that I didn&#39;t like was the fact that one person was writing times on a receipt for people to come back for pagers while the other worker was giving out pagers and taking people&#39;s information down. After waiting 20+ minutes, I noticed that a waiter walked toward the line of people who were waiting to put their name down, and pulled 2 women who hasn&#39;t put their name down yet and proceeded to seat them. I was upset because everyone else had to wait a long time and these two women were bypassing all of this. I brought it up to the women working the front desk and was told that busboys sometimes pulls people for the back bar when seats become available- this would&#39;ve been believable if he didn&#39;t bypass other people to do so as well as bypass people that had already put their names down. One of the managers overheard me and offered to sit me immediately. However, shortly after ordering my food another manager comes to the table and says that they ran out of the dish I ordered- I was already irritated at the lies being told earlier so I just ordered something else. I ended up not liking my food and told the waiter but I was still charged for it. I just wanted to get out of there so I just paid for the bill.. I will not be going back there again.

I&#39;ve always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory.  Food is always consistently good and portions are huge.  If I have to complain, it would be to decrease the menu items as it is a bit overwhelming.  <br><br>We came here on a Sunday night, not expecting a crowd.  Boy were we wrong.  The line was out the door and it was a 90 minute wait.  To place a takeout order it was 45 minutes.  Obviously, other people are as fond of this restaurant as we are.  <br><br>Overall, the experience was as good as any other Cheesecake Factory.  While waiting my wife and I couldn&#39;t remember a time that we waited 90+ minutes for a table.  But we did here because we were on vacation and had nowhere else to be.  If back home, I doubt we would have done the same.
Very good food and great service, bar personnel very friendly! Nutella cheesecake delicious

Nosh and Nibble came here for a late dinner and I had a great taste of the following:<br><br>French Country Salad ($10)<br>Parmesan-Herb Crusted Chicken ($16.50)<br>Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo ($18)<br><br>Before any of this started though, we were greeted with a (freely refillable) basket of bread. I&#39;m usually not a big fan of filling up on carbs but there was a good variety to choose from here. Each ready-to-split piece was quite chewy and moist. Easy on the butter if you can help it though since generally there is a lot to come.<br><br>The French Country Salad came with mixed greens, grilled asparagus, beets, goat cheese, candied pecans, and vinaigrette. The acidity from the vinaigrette is what made all the other ingredients stand out. Each bite was quite tasty but I wish there were a few more beets to be found since they were claimed to be so fresh.<br><br>The Parmesan-Herb Crusted Chicken was a plate of sautéed chicken breasts coated with parmesan-garlic. On the outside these looked like cute hamburger patties but they were actually made of kitchen. The sauce had unfortunately sploshed around on my plate by the time it arrived which soiled the presentation a bit. Taste-wise, the bread crumbs added a nice texture but the chicken was a bit dry in some places. There was enough sauce to compensate, but I don&#39;t think this sauce compensation should be a long-term solution.<br><br>My favourite plate of the evening was the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo. This was a mixed plate of shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage, tomatoes, peppers, onions, and garlic simmered in a spicy cajun style broth with cream and topped with steamed white rice. This was a very exciting dish as it came, though I feel the herb bits scattered around the white rim of the plate should have been kept to the middle ring. This tasted great though! The meats were all cooked very well and while the other two dishes were a bit of a miss for me, this gumbo was good enough to salvage any meal.
We have travelled throughout the USA, if you want consistent great food, go to The Cheese Cake Factory !

Pros:<br><br>-Every single dish I&#39;ve tried here are quite tasty. Some dishes have great portions and others are quite small.<br><br>-Service. One of the best service you can get in a restaurant in Waikiki. These guys here at pros and work their butts off every day.<br><br>Cons:<br><br>- Takes way too long to get your food. The problem stems is that this restaurant is very packed and the kitchen does look a lil smaller than what you expect for a restaurant this size.<br><br>- Price. Jesus H Christ it is expensive here. You will break your wallet if you eat here often.<br><br>- With the name Cheesecake Factory, you figure their Cheesecake is good. Wrong. The cheesecake tastes old and not fresh and it is VERY expensive too.<br><br>I don&#39;t expect much to change on this restaurant as they are always packed with tourists. There are definitely much better spots to spend your hard earned money here.<br><br>100 Reviews, 1 Day 31/100<br>January 12, 2012
Wait time was 50 mins for 5 on a busy Saturday night.  No too bad.  The waiter (alvin) was ok.  We celebrated our daughters birthday.  Alvin was disappointing.  Food was good though.

Why would I come here again?<br><br>Of course you know about the insane wait already. Besides that, we had such a bad dining experience we literally started laughing.  <br><br>We were actually looking around for the hidden cameras as we couldn&#39;t believe it was real!<br><br>Our food was inconsistent, but the service was the worst I have ever experienced.  The management should be let go for putting such a bad server on the floor.  Our waiter was a boy named Jesse and if it wasn&#39;t his first day ever in a restaurant I would be surprised.<br><br>After an amazingly bad service, he capped it off by making us wait for our check for 15 minutes while he talked with the lady at the table next to us - five feet away!  If I wasn&#39;t in vacation mode I would have exploded.  Instead we got to laughing so hard I cried. <br><br>Jesse obviously had never been trained.  Good thing this place doesn&#39;t need our business.

If you&#39;re looking for a filling and delicious meal, look no further than Cheesecake Factory! The wait is long, but it&#39;s definitely worth it. <br><br>Our table was set for two and we were promptly greeted by our server Chonte.  She explained the menu with expert knowledge and made her recommendations.  <br><br>We started off with the fried mac and cheese which was fabulous. <br><br>We settled on the BanBan Chicken Curry which was flavorful and delicious, and the Ahi special. Our food was served to us and we enjoyed it. <br><br>I was most impressed by our server, who was knowledgable and knew her menu items well. In addition to her prompt service, she took the liberty of correcting mistakes the kitchen had made.  She was incredibly enjoyable and fabulous. Thanks, Chonte! We will be back.

As a fellow Canadian we don&#39;t have the Cheesecake Factory in our neck of the woods so every opportunity I get to dine here I jump on it.<br><br>We came here on our last day in Hawaii for Lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We were told it was a 10-15 minute wait and were handed a pager. Within in 10 minutes our buzzer went off - quickest wait time I&#39;ve ever experienced.<br><br>The hostess led us to the back of the restaurant, there was some confusion with finding out table and we were left stranded for a minute.... She then returned and led us to a two seater table along a banquet.<br><br>Our waiter promptly came over and took our orders. I was mainly here for the cheesecake however I did order a little something to pass the time until dessert.<br><br>I love the complimentary soft and warm bread they serve here. The dark rye is my favourite.<br><br>For Main I ordered the:<br><br>Asian Chicken Salad w/ Grilled Chicken, Romaine, Carrots, Bean Sprouts, Green Onions, Cilantro, Rice Noodles, Wontons, Almonds and Sesame Seeds Served with Sesame-Soy Dressing<br><br>The description of this salad sounded soo enticing and I love a crunchy salad however after a couple of bites I found it too be quite boring and lacking something in the flavor department.<br><br>My husband ordered<br><br>Smokehouse B.B.Q. Burger w/ Smoked Bacon and Melted Cheddar with Crispy Onion Rings and B.B.Q. Ranch Sauce<br>He loved his burger, it was pretty juicy cooked perfectly medium rare and a hefty burger too!<br><br>Finally dessert - my main reason for coming here <br><br>Reese&#39;s® Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake - Chunks of Reese&#39;s® Peanut Butter Cups in our Original Cheesecake with Layers of Delicious Fudge Cake and Caramel<br>As a chocolate peanut butter lover this was heavenly to me! Sooo rich and delicious I was happy I hated my main as I was able to devour every last sinfully scrumptious bite!<br><br>Overall the Cheesecake factory is what it is. Our waiter was great, constantly refilling our drinks and checking on us. But the cheesecake is always my highlight of coming here and the reason why I always crave to return!<br><br>FYI If you want a booth make sure you advise the hostess at the desk when requesting a table

Oh cheesecake, how you disappointed me in Waikiki!<br><br>I&#39;ve been to a dozen cheesecakes around the states and this is the worst one. First they don&#39;t have the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu in Hawaii so don&#39;t come here if you like to watch unnecessary calories. (And I know in their regular menu they make dishes with unnecessary calories)<br><br>Second I ordered the herb lemon roasted chicken and 10 minutes later the manager comes to tell me that they can&#39;t serve me that because the chicken wasn&#39;t cooked or something. She hands me a menu to order something new and my waiter had no idea and was baffled when I went to order the Parmesan- crusted chicken. <br><br>Third- my husband wants to order a torte and I asked for a side of raspberries since I love fresh fruit with whipped cream. They don&#39;t have rasberries! And the strawberries that came on it were not fresh.  <br><br>I will continue to support you in the mainland states but for the 6 years I live here, I will not visit this Cheesecake again. Fortunately for me, Oahu offers an array of AMAZING restaurants . So you won&#39;t be missed.

It&#39;s been a while since I last ate here.   I am glad that as soon as I checked in with the concierge,  they told me wait was going to be about 50 minutes,  but I guess to me the buzzer let me know that my table was ready and the staff was very kind to let me wait until my party arrived.   Our waitress was really on top of her game tonight by checking up on us to see how everything is going and how our food was.  She was the best and if you come, ask for Lauren, she was awesome and she really takes care of the people and I wanna say thank you for making the night the best and making sure she does a great job.  I was however,  was a little taken aback with how my chicken parmesan sandwich was presented.   I felt that the chicken was almost falling off the bread, which I was able to use a fork and eat it as well as my side order of my fries, which we were a little salty and I did ask for them unsalted.  Other than that,  my food was delicious and I will order the chicken parmesan sandwich and I hope it does stay on the bread and when I do order a extra order of fries, they will be unsalted.  But the main thing is that they did remember not to put bell peppers.   So I will totally be back again for dinner

So how crazy busy is this Cheesecake Factory you ask? Here are some hints - <br><br>* It&#39;s steps away from Waikiki beach. <br><br>* It&#39;s open normal hours and busier than the Las Vegas location which is open 24/7.<br><br>* It&#39;s the highest grossing location in the chain. A bartender told me 26M in 2012! <br>That&#39;s right; 26 million from one location! <br><br>* At peak times the waits are two hours plus. The crowds are so huge you&#39;d think a superstar was about to arrive. <br><br>So would I wait two hours for a meal? Absolutely not but that doesn&#39;t mean I don&#39;t love these folks. I&#39;ve never had a bad meal here. The menu is ginormous and the variety will satisfy everyone. The prices are commensurate with the quality and huge portions. The adult libations are strong and the waitstaff is competent. This chain does it right. <br><br>So go at an off peak time and be prepared to enjoy yourself!

I&#39;ve lived in Hawaii all my life and only got to eat here for the first time ever today! I&#39;m glad we got to sit right away because I was told the wait is long and you can&#39;t make reservations :( <br>Anyways, came in for lunch and ordered avocado egg rolls (which was AWESOME!) and Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta or something of the sort. I ordered the lunch portion pasta which is pretty large and filling! My boyfriend ordered the lunch pizza. The salad was a full plate of salad, not those mini skimpy side salads. The pizza is 8&#34; ish..? Lol. <br>Definitely had way too much to eat that I wasn&#39;t able to eat dessert... :( need to come back again to try some! <br><br>The only downside to the restaurant is since it&#39;s a large amount of people that eat here, the noise level definitely proves that. Lol, don&#39;t expect a quiet place to eat, it&#39;s pretty noisy!

I decided to check &#39;er out one night before I left the island and parked up at the last end spot at the bar.<br><br>A typical, packed house it was. Spacious - I think I heard a live musician somewhere, or was it the music? Of the 2 I&#39;ve been to in Seattle during the night, this place is perhaps slightly-y-y-y more dim.<br><br>Chad, the bartender, was very smooth and on tempered rails as I watched him make various drinks over the course of the night; he&#39;s also very laidback &amp; chill.<br><br>I went for ze incredible grilled eggplant sandwich (overstatement?) and it was very nice---messy---but nice! Good stuff, along with the subbed sweet potato fries. One thing I forgot the CCF has is complimentary bread! Ohh, I especially love the dark bread. The Kentucky Tea drink came out in a slendered out glass and had a subtle buzz. All was darn good to me.<br><br>I usually try supporting the less-reviewed but I thought heck, just give it a whirl.

We came here hoping they would have the same happy hour specials as they have on the mainland--big shock, they didn&#39;t. But we were happy nonetheless. Our food was delicious, as it always is at Cheesecake Factory, and the service was phenomenal. Our server, Matt, really went above and beyond to give us a great experience here. <br><br>Also, we got lucky and didn&#39;t have to wait!
Delicious food, just the wait is the negative part. The service however was excellent! Eric was the bomb!!!

What can I say - the service was super! Our server was outstanding... The food however was so-so/meh... Of course this was my first visit &amp; this is Waikiki. I am excited about the new Kapolei location &amp; will definitely give them another try.

Gotta love the steaks! What&#39;s not to love about the Cheesecake Factory. The place has awesome music and food that makes you happy. As a chef I know good food &amp; the food here are good as it gets.

The food is always good. They could turn the lights a little brighter and the service could be faster. I get they&#39;re busy, but it took forever to get our drinks and dessert....the server was nice though.

I know, I know: it&#39;s not cool to review a chain restaurant. For some reason, everybody hates chain restaurants. Well, I like The Cheesecake Factory. Like, not love. I&#39;ve been to the flagship store in Marina del Rey, the one in Macy&#39;s S.F. with the view of Union Square, and the one here in Waikiki three times and every time I&#39;ve had excellent, professional service and very decent food in a great setting. <br><br>If you can, get a table in the extreme back of the restaurant overlooking the lush garden. It seems to be a little less frenetic back there. I recommend any of their salads, especially the French country salad with beets, asparagus, goat cheese, and pecans. The last time I went, we had the goulash, which I really liked, and the chicken and biscuits (actually, biscuit) which I moderately enjoyed (it was a tiny, tiny bit too sweet for my taste). The server actually gave us a strawberry shortcake biscuit, which was such a hit with the table, we ended up ordering--guess what?--a strawberry shortcake for dessert. I always get the fried calamari too, because it is always so perfectly seasoned and crisp on the outside and I love the garlic aioli and cocktail sauces.<br><br>Stay away from the Asian-style courses, unless of course, you enjoy pseudo-Asian fare like the kind served at American Chinese restaurants. I actually haven&#39;t eaten the cheesecake here since I was a kid, so I don&#39;t remember what they taste like!

Dining Experiences: 1/15/10 and 1/16/10 <br><br>For the location, prices and consistently good food, Cheesecake Factory just can&#39;t be beat. I love to visit during the evening hours for the people watching. The only downside is that the wait time is always long (as it is with most Cheesecake Factory&#39;s). The first night I ordered the Bistro Shrimp and it was delicious. Went back the next night and ordered the Opa. This was also pretty good if you are in the mood to eat healthy. If not, I definitely recommend going for the Cajun rib eye, jambalaya pasta, caramel chicken, or pizzas. My mouth is watering just thinking about it! For dessert, the winner for me is Craigs Crazy Cheesecake -half carrot cake and half cheesecake...OMG! <br><br>Don&#39;t be scared - Give it a Try!

The buzzer call remotes are very frustrating. Waiting out front for an hour after told 20 minute wait. We were told they buzzed us. So they said 5 minutes more. Still waiting after 30 minutes. Bummer birthday waiting in crowded lobby.
Our server was amazing she didn&#39;t just have great customer service but info in where we should go. Food was good as all cheesecake factory&#39;s, the burgers and the bread was great.

First off, this is one of my favorite restaurants on the island. The wait is always pretty long but I don&#39;t mind because the great food &amp; awesome service make up for it. <br>I&#39;ve had great waiters in the past when I come to this restaurant but tonight I was blessed with the best waitress of all. Jess P. is such an amazing, upbeat, energetic &amp; efficient waitress. It always makes your visit 100 times better when you can laugh &amp; joke around with your waitress. I came with 10 other people &amp; she didn&#39;t miss anything. She was fast to refill drinks, fast with the appetizers, entrees, dessert, checks, everything! I will definitely be back in the hopes of being served by Jess P.
Everytime I eat here I can expect great service, the food, drinks and desserts are delicious. I love this place.

You know how sometimes when you&#39;re on vacation and you&#39;ve eaten at all the new places and local places and different places and suddenly, you just get homesick for familiar places. Enter Cheesecake.<br><br>This place is HUGE! We brought the big stroller so the host was trying to maneuver us around to best seat our carriage. He pretty much gave us a tour of this place and it is BIG. It&#39;s very deceiving from the outside the enormity of the place.<br><br>The place was packed too. We got a pager to hold on to while waiting. Probably also because it was President&#39;s weekend. Not too long for the wait. About 15mins. Just enough time to keep Mama from shopping on the strip. <br><br>We both ordered our usuals that we get from our local Cheesecake. (Ironically, I haven&#39;t even reviewed that one) Mama had the luau salad. She actually gets that back on the mainland! Haha! I got the crispy spicy beef. YUM.. effing MY!!! Overall, we were home again... <br><br>Our server was awesome and the atmosphere was great. We&#39;ll definitely come back when we have a hankering for homesick food. Well, maybe we&#39;ll go to Denny&#39;s next time. :)

Good food. We got seated within 10 minutes during the dinner rush. Our server was helpful and quick. This place was insane at 6pm but our meal was enjoyable. We took dessert to go.<br>Always a pleasure with Cheesecake.

Because I work nearby I frequently stop in here for lunch. Both dine in and take out. I have to say that the folks that work here are good at what they do. Big kudos to the gals that handle the take out orders. They are always so cordial and accommodating. Great job to everyone at the Cheesecake Factory Waikiki!!!
I visit Cheesecake factory at least 3 times a week.<br>Great food, great people.<br>High quality meals for a reasonable price.<br>Come earlier to avoid the line
Food and service was amazing, no wait time for dinner! Recommended for indoor or outdoor seating !
Huge portion. Love the luau salad. Would def try the cheesecakes sometimes. The calories were a lot to handle but food is everything !

Parking is probably the biggest issue I have with this place but other than that, the food is on-point. I love getting the pasta alfredo here and my cheesecake of choice is anything with peanutbutter :-P

Stopped in tonight to get a piece of cheesecake and it was the smallest piece of cheesecake ever. I didn&#39;t look at until I got home because it was so crowded and just wanted to get out of there. Super disappointed. I usually love their cheesecake but this well fell short of happiness. It was the chocolate chip cookie dough but I didn&#39;t realize there were nuts on it :/  it happens. The lady running the cash register sure wasn&#39;t the happiest employee ever but it was probably a long night so I don&#39;t exactly blame her. I need to just stop coming here.

The wait is always long, the restaurant is always so crowded and loud, but the food is good! We had a couple of drinks at the bar while we waited to be seated and the prices were outrageous one drink was $14. I ordered the combo with chicken tandoori &amp; steak Diana loved the chicken but the steak was tough. My husband ordered the shrimp scampi with was crunchy but saucy it was pretty good!

The Cheesecake Factory always excites me. It looks so grand inside, a little dark but it&#39;s got a nice, low key atmosphere. Its easy to forget about busy kalakaua outside.<br>    Dinning in for lunch never disappoints. Service is usually quick and the servers are helpful. It might be the lighting but they always seem to overlook my bf&#39;s need for a water refill. It usually doesn&#39;t take more than 8 mins for the water refill. If it does I just give him mine. Their Caesar salad is great, as well as the pizza. I got both as their lunch special offered a smaller portion. Love the lunch special. <br>     Dinner is a little more difficult. I should have called for reservations for dinner on a Saturday night for four. But I didn&#39;t. We got there and waited in line for 10 mins to get to the host desk. It was about 6:30 when we got our buzzer from the host and she told us the wait would be about an hour and ten mins. On point estimate!!! We walked around while we waited and at 7:45ish the buzzer went off and we were seated.<br>     After being seated we waited a while for our server to come by and when she finally did she asked if we were ready to order, we gave her our drink orders and she asked us again if we were ready. I guess she wasn&#39;t concerned about the drinks... We have her our order and got our drinks soon after, then the appetizer, then the entrees. I got a little irritated. My bf&#39;s water was empty and we couldn&#39;t see our server for a good 10 mins. So I tried to get the attention of the bussers for a few mins before succeeding and ALL of our drinks were refilled. We did not see our server again until she gave us our check. <br>     The food is great! The service not always, but I&#39;ll still come back. I understand it gets busy.

My wife and I have been here many times, with the latest being today for lunch with my mom. We&#39;ve always expected a long line/wait so we just factor that in...also need to be aware that you wait with a pager...then after your pager buzzes, you wait to be seated. One thing to keep in mind,  however, is you can go to the bar and get seated if there are seats available. I&#39;ve done that before and their bar offers full service.<br><br>For lunch today,  my mom ordered the Renee&#39;s Special (One-Half of a Fresh Turkey or Chicken Salad Sandwich, a Cup of Our Soup and a Small Green Salad) and she raved about the chicken and artichoke soup. The wife had the Navajo Sandwich which she always loves and I tried the Chicken Picatta. We all loved our meals and saved some room for cheesecake and coffee, of course. Why, it would be like going to a steakhouse and ordering tofu or something if we didn&#39;t get some cheesecake.<br><br>All in all, food cost us just over $54 less tip.

Honestly, this was the best TCF I have ever been to. The food was great! The lines are long and the service was a tidbit slow (because the kitchen was so backed up), but our server Damon was AWESOME and so friendly. You can tell a good server when you have one, and this guy is a pro. Thank you for the great St. Patrick&#39;s Day lunch, Damon!

Man, I can never go wrong at the place.<br><br>The food is good, huge portions, and the free bread is amazing and endless.<br><br>The place is a little dark, noisy, and the prices seem to have gone up alot (what stands out is almost $8 for a piece of cheesecake).<br><br>I think this, like many of the other mainland chain stores in Hawaii, is the #1 sales producer in the States.  Always crowded and if you don&#39;t get there before 5pm, a guaranteed wait.<br><br>Some things we like - chinese chicken salad, shepherds pie, cheesecake, salmon, angel hair pasta with shrimp, sliders.<br><br>Finally tried the orange chicken (I know, just get it at Panda) and was mildly impressed.  Actually tasted better the next day for some reason.<br><br>Lunch has the best deals......I would pass on the mini entrees and spend a couple dollars more for the full size.......the extra amount you get is way more than the few dollars and you have lunch or snack for later.<br><br>If you also want to get a validation stamp with no questions asked.....this is the place.  So crowded and chaotic, they can&#39;t tell if your legit or not.

Service was absolutely amazing! Food was delicious and huge portions! Although I was stuffed, I couldn&#39;t pass up a cheesecake for desserts. Mm mm!! I had the celebration cheesecake and it was Devine!

Love this place!  No matter what state we are in the menu, service and food is always constant.  Their menu is very versatile and extensive.  Today we ordered the Cobb Salad with Balsamic Vinaigrette dressing in the regular size because my husband and I was planning to share it.  Wow!  When it came out it was BIG, plenty for two people.        The food was delicious and our server was so pleasant and professional.  We sat outside and people watched as we enjoyed our meal.  The weather was perfect and our experience was wonderful.

I always prefer to eat at mom n pop eateries but there&#39;s something about cheesecake factory that I like. Their menu is extensive(!) so I can&#39;t say that I&#39;ve tried most things. BUT the things that I have tried, I&#39;ve liked. <br><br>I love their strawberry lemonade.<br>I dig their avocado egg rolls.<br>The firecracker salmon app is yummy.<br>Fried mac n cheese balls are also great.<br>Their meatloaf tastes just like mama made it. <br>The chicken madiera has never let me down.<br>The bistro shrimp pasta, strangely, tastes better on the mainland. <br>Their salads are ginormous.<br>And I love, love, love their dulce de leche cheesecake. <br>Service is friendly.<br><br>However, I wouldn&#39;t wait over 90 minutes to eat here. It&#39;s too bad the cheesecake factory is located in waikiki. All the tourists flood this joint. If you&#39;re lucky, it&#39;s self seating at the bar and you can order off the dining room menu.

Called in for take out. The person who answered phone was really efficient and nice. <br>I am satisfied with the service and the food but they only validate for an hour now. Used to be 2 hours but now an hour less and it&#39;s a huge change for me.
Friendly service, awesome food quality for the price. Amazing ambiance. Live music every night from 8-closing.

Always a pleasure visiting the cheesecake factory for an impromptu dinner. Tried the lemon herb chicken with white rice and watercress. It was decadent, the perfect combination of flavors the chicken was moist and juicy. Skin was a little burnt, but could be overlooked because of the delicious flavor. I would definitely recommend this dish it&#39;s hands down my favorite dish out of all the ones I&#39;ve tried at the cheesecake factory.

Came to celebrate my husband and son&#39;s birthday together...food is good like always but really did hope they had a complimentary birthday dessert for the hubby or any occasion as a matter of fact considering this our go to place for anniversaries and birthdays! On the bright side my son got a free one! Would have given a 5 star if they had actually given me the cheesecake I ordered instead of a different one.
Best deserts in Honolulu. <br><br>Food is fantastic and the wait service was excellent. <br><br>Definitely be going there again

The most racist hostess. Worst hostess. I work as a host for 11 years, you never ask if that person want a English menu. That is the worst why to welcome your guest with racism. Thinking because I am an Asian person, that I don&#39;t know how to read English.

I once decided to have my birthday dinner here and knew the wait would be long - especially with 20 people...so I planned accordingly: told my friends that dinner is at 8, and since the wait would be long - we will all meet there at 6. If I had to wait, so did everyone else! It was MY BIRTHDAY, after all! It all worked out well and I had no regrets! <br><br>Anyway, I love coming here for any meal, but I hardly every have room for dessert :( But I don&#39;t really care for cheesecake anyway - I usually get the carrot cake! It&#39;s soo huge and delicious - the last time, it lasted me 4 days! <br><br>I really like their Grilled Shrimp and Bacon Sandwich - I saw it featured on the Oprah show as Chris Rock&#39;s favorite sandwich a loooong time ago and have been eating it ever since! It&#39;s clubhouse sandwich style - so there&#39;s that 3rd slice of bread in the middle, but guess what! You can ask to have it without that slice...it makes it slightly smaller and less messier. A waiter asked me if I wanted it like that way a few years back, and that&#39;s the only way I eat it now! With Sweet Potato Fries...so good, you don&#39;t even need ketchup! <br><br>Best time to go is lunch and early, early dinner! Or, you can try to bypass the wait and grab a high top in the bar area - those are open for anyone!

I never expect much from chain restaurants and this Cheesecake Factory was no exception. With anything new there will be excitement at first, especially for people here in Hawaii a little bit of the real USA creates that sensation...I&#39;ve been everywhere lived many places and dined in the best restaurants throughout America..but the food in Kapolei Cheesecake Factory was horrible!  I&#39;ve had hospital food that was better. The restaurant itself was overrun with frenzied waitstaff yet it was dirty and the floors sticky..the noise was at ear splitting decibels only over powered by the singing of happy birthday  at least 3 times during 1 meal <br>After finally getting my chicken and shrimp gumbo, it was disgusting! The rice was crunchy and grossly undercooked the shrimp looked recycled and I&#39;m not sure that was chicken. I waited way too long for a lemonade that came with melted ice and after I decided that this was a terrible experience I went home where I was ill from the tainted food. I won&#39;t go back...not to Kapolei Cheesecake Factory..the food is just so bad on Hawaii
There is a little wait but well worth it. We ate in the bar area  instead of waiting for a booth. Chad, the bartender is amazing! He makes awesome margaritas!

Pros: The food is excellent here. Menu items are a little pricey but the portions are plentiful and very delicious! Love the layout of the restaurant, with an open seat area overlooking the Waikiki streets. Once seated, the service is normally quick and the servers are very friendly. <br><br>Cons: <br>1- Wait time: If u want to eat here, come early (when they first open for lunch time and early evening for dinner time). Do not come during the busy hours unless you&#39;re willing to wait sometimes up to an hour and a half. Yes, I&#39;m serious. We showed up once during dinner time and was told the wait was that long. No, we didn&#39;t wait. It was already 8:00 pm, and with a little one, we needed to hurry and head back to the hotel to put him to bed. <br>2- Parking: No private parking. This is in the heart of Waikiki! What do you expect!  You have to park in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center parking structure and walk through the mall to the opposite end. It&#39;s not a very far walk, but nonetheless, it&#39;s a walk. <br><br>In a nutshell, if u love CF, the pros will far outweigh the cons!

I haven&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory in a long time only because it&#39;s all the way in Waikiki.  But tonight since my daughter is staying at the Halekoa we decided to go.  I am so happy we did!  We had the greatest waiter named Cory with the cool mustache.  He was polite, quirky, funny and gave us sincerely humble service.  The food was delicious especially the fresh banana cheesecake!  The service overall was great and the ambiance has a trendy island vibe. Can&#39;t wait till they open in Kamakana Alii.  Maybe Cory lives on the Westside and decides to transfer.  I&#39;ll be looking for him for sure!

Unbelieve... an order was placed for take-out and when I went to pick up the order, the manager and cashier refused to give me bread because I was not the original placer of that order!  So, they also asked me about some others of which I did not place and interrogated me about some $200 of cheesecake food that was wasted today and as a result... they wanted to make sure that this bread was for the customer- of course, it is?  U seriously think that stopping me from delivering bread is going to reduce your costs today on some unpicked up orders by others?  Like- how rude and unprofessional!  I expect better from cheesecake factory.  Uncoth, presumption with a minor disagreement at the counter, she finally decided to give me the bread for my customer- even though she was not sure if they wanted it or not, hello?  Its free bread, its like asking for water and she (the manager with a thick Spanish accent) by the way refuses to give me her name at the end of all this.  She is seriously wrong and misjudged the situation- and I will report to corporate Cheesecake Factory.  And- I will also find out her name, update this file and report it here, that is no way to treat a guest of the cheesecake factory- or anyone walking in there... for example!  God bless you and have a rotten days.  Jesus Louisus!
No Sheldon Cooper. No Penny. But plenty of fun on the bun! So what there was a line? The food was worth every step and every bite. The atmosphere was worth the hype!

Omg couldn&#39;t get enough of their food! All their dishes were on point... outstandingly good! Kids ordered 1 kids pizza, the biggest kids pizza we&#39;ve ever seen (same sz as a dinner plate) &amp; kids mac n cheese (cheesy &amp; moist). Husband had the Steak Diane (sooo fricken good) &amp; I had the gumbo (tons of flavor, the best Gumbo I ever had). It was perfect! Service was okay but our server dragged the entire time we were there and seemed like he was either exhausted, didn&#39;t like his job or maybe it was the end of his shift! Reason I still gave 5 stars is because all of our dishes were beyond good! And don&#39;t forget to try their Paradise In Pineapple (blended tropical cocktail in an actual pineapple) So good!

Wish I could remember the name of the gal that looked after us as she was super great and so lovely to our kids. One of the best meals we had in Waikiki. Cheesecake was delicious. Need to find out the name of the wine I drank as it was spot on. Thank you for liking after us, it was a lovely dinner. Only waited 10 mins for table which was amazing considering it was 6pm and we had two little ones with us.

There was food and debris on my seat, so I used my hand to clear it off. On the first swipe, a shard of glass got caught in my middle finger. My blood loss (some got on the table, my fork, and seat) was only worth a free dessert ($8.50)...REALLY?! I thought my pain and suffering would&#39;ve been worth more than that!!! Come on #cheesecakefactory you can do better than that. Don&#39;t worry, I&#39;ll be making sure everyone knows what happened until I feel like enough has been done to correct the situation.

Great customer service. Waitress was very attentive and personable. All sorts of cheesecakes and menu items as well. Kids menu is a plus, good value. Glad we finally got to visit the cheesecake factory.

I went here for lunch this time, which means getting a table is a breeze. No 2 hour wait time. Lol. Lunch was pretty good. I had the Renee special which gives you a choice of sandwich, soup, and salad. Can&#39;t go wrong here. Big portions and tons to choose from. And of course cheesecake but I was too full to get one.

We went for dinner last night. We&#39;ve been here before so we expected the 1hr and 20mins wait. We went shopping to make the time pass faster. Our table buzzer went off right on schd. <br>We were sat and greeted. However, it was very busy like always so it took sometime for our server to get to us. When he did we placed all of our orders with him. I found that it&#39;s just faster to pre-pick what I want ahead of time. <br>Drinks came out slowly, but they were both delicious. The house bread, sour dough and oat whole wheat, was warm and yummy as always. <br>We shared the shrimp summer rolls and the hot beef dipping sandwich. Both were very good as well and worth the wait. <br>We planned to have cheesecake at the end however the blueberry one we wanted was not in season. Which turned out to be a good thing because we were stuffed and going home with leftovers. <br>I thought that the restaurant was a little too dark, but that is just my opinion. <br>We&#39;ll be back, the food is alleys great when I go!
Great menu! Food is always consistently good!  A little pricey and the wait times can be long but def worth it! <br><br>Try the well mannered martini and steak Dianne, by far my favorite

This place is pretty on POINT* located in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center right next to Forever21. But just expect a fkn long ass wait! It&#39;s ALWAYS HELLA PACKED*<br><br>You go up to the hostess stand, they put you down on the wait list, pass you a pager&amp;WAH-LA you&#39;re on your way to an experience at &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34;...love their bread that they give only the wheat though, its BOMB! The waiter/waitress sits yall down after the buzzin of the beaper goes down&amp;recites the specials. The menu is intense so be prepared!<br><br>*If you bring your own wine you don&#39;t have to order any from them&amp;they&#39;ll just pop&amp;serve it to you for like a $10 fee. Which is maikai! ;D<br><br>The food is always top notch&amp;for a busy ass place the food comes out promptly! always gooood so yup worth the wait. try this place out:)

Came in on a Sunday morning, thought we&#39;d grab a quick breakfast before a fun afternoon of hiking and zip lining, however... breakfast was anything but quick. Though they seated us quickly, our waitress didn&#39;t take our order until 20 minutes later. She brought out some bread 45 minutes after, and when we asked about our food she rolled her eyes and said she&#39;ll check on it and it usually takes about 20 minutes. We explained that we&#39;ve waited for over an hour and she barked at us like a dog in heat and said that its Sunday brunch, so they&#39;re very busy. We decided to leave after that.  <br><br>GOT SEATED 10AM WAITED TIL 11:10AM AND LEFT WITHOUT FOOD

There is always a wait but the dessert is worth it.  The food is good and they give you way too much but let&#39;s face it, if you&#39;re dining here it&#39;s not really for the food, it&#39;s for the cheesecake.  My faves are red velvet cheesecake, Oreo cheesecake and the lemon cream cake.

Not sure why this place is ALWAYS so crowded. Like how does it get the hype? The lines are ridiculously long. The food is decent, but overpriced. The redeeming factor is definitely the complimentary bread. SO WARM, CRISPY, AND DELICIOUS! I just can&#39;t stop eating it. <br>The Oreo Dream Cheesecake is also to die for.<br>Those two factors get this place three stars.

Below the typical Cheesecake Factory quality were used to....<br><br>Service was slow, my drink got taken and a refill never came until I asked. Our waiter knocked my glasses off the table, then swore and apologized...not professional. Glad we weren&#39;t with kids. Bread was rock hard, butter was frozen...we weren&#39;t happy with our entree and the server let us get another one but I was surprised the manager didn&#39;t stop over to make sure we were satisfied, as most other locations the manager is active.<br><br>Food was good as always but this location needs some help to keep up with the Cheesecake Factory brand.

I always love coming to the Cheesecake Factory. Even though we always have to wait, the wait this time was good with us because it was shorter than we imagined and they took us in earlier than we thought. They told us 40min (party of 2 at 6:30pm) and we got in within 30 minutes. <br><br>Our waiter was super friendly and was probably one of the best waiters we&#39;ve had. My boyfriend always drinks his water so fast, but our waiter was always there to refill it, so he never ran out of water. ( That was literally a first because he always runs out of water and has to wait long or ask for more water) idk our waiters name but it was a cute guy &amp; we sat by the bar. <br><br>The food was really good as always. We got the Chinese chicken salad and Louisiana chicken bow tie pasta. The cheesecake is outstanding and everyone should come here! I love the Cheesecake Factory.
One of my favorite places to eat in Waikiki. Service is usually good, but can depend on how busy they are. My absolute favorite dish is the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp. Love everything about it.

For a chain resteraunt very good.  We decided to go for Valentines Day and not like most resteraunts we were told 20 minute wait, it was 20 minutes.  <br><br>We received the best service from our waitress.<br><br>The food was delicious and at a very good value.  We could have ordered one dish and shared. <br><br>Got the cheesecake to go.

Been to this location several times. Like all Cheesecake Factorys (Factories) I&#39;ve been to the food is always delicious, drinks are tasty and the service pretty good. Once in a while you get a forgetful waiter but it&#39;s never been so bad that it warranted a bad review. At regular meal times they do get pretty busy so there might be a wait.

Went to this cheesecake while we are on vacation and was provided such great customer service. Our waiter Sean I. Just went above and beyond to help satisfy our sweet tooth and welcomed us with his great sense of humor! Thank you!
