We arrived in Waikiki late and I was starving as LAX has no GF options.  I didn&#39;t even care what I ate, just wanted food in my belly.  I ordered a burger and fries (yay for gf buns).  M ordered some pasta dish and pot-stickers.  All of it was phenomenal.  The server was great<br><br>Our last day we decided to stop again.  The server was horrendous.  He was lost, screwing up everyone&#39;s orders around us.  We waited 20 minutes for our avocado and crab app.  I ended up ordering the burger again.  I never did get any ranch.  <br><br>Finally I just asked for the bill because we had been there for 2 hours for a LUNCH.

If your hungry, you might need to try and find somewhere else to eat, because you will be lining up for a while. On our visit to the island, being from Australia, the Cheesecake Factory is a very hard place to walk past. We had walked down the Main Street quite a few nights in a row to find that the Cheesecake Factory ALWAYS had massive lines out the front. This one night, we finally bit the bullet and decided to line up. About 45 minutes went past of being in this line, till we finally walk through the front door. Another 10 minutes goes by, and yes. We made it to the front of the line. The server asks how many people, which we reply only two. The server then hands over a pager &amp; tells us to wait outside till we are called. Are you kidding me I think to myself.  We were at the edge of wanting to walk away but hung in there because of the journey so far. <br><br>Another 35 minutes later and we were in. Like all other Cheesecake Factories, the menu is about as long as the Bible. The quality of the food was much the same as the main land, however lacked something I couldn&#39;t quite put my finger on. The staff were lovely, however they seemed to rush you a little, but judging by the line out the front that kept on growing, it was somewhat understandable.

Got here around 4 pm on a Saturday. Pretty busy but no line! Got seated in a few minutes. Ordered Black Iced teas for my gf and I. Wow they have a large menu and everything looks good. Started with Crab cakes.<br><br>Waitress brought over some bread. I needed extra time to look over the menu. Decided to get the lunch portion Miso Salmon, it turned out to be the most moist and tasty salmon I ever had! I don&#39;t really care for salmon but am trying to eat healthier, so if I say it&#39;s good, it&#39;s really good! My gf had the  combo steak Diane/ shrimp scampi.<br><br>Crab cakes were good and so was our meal. Too stuffed for dessert but we ordered it for take-out. Oreo cheesecake for me and caramel pecan turtle for my gf.<br><br>Excellent service. Our iced teas never went below half way. Came by couple times to check on us.<br><br>If it wasn&#39;t for the idea of driving into Waikiki, dealing with traffic and parking we would definitely come here more often.

The line was hectic. My friends and I had to wait for an hour and forty minutes for dinner. <br><br>The spaghetti was really big. The raw salmon was super small, but expensive for that portion. The cheesecake was so so.

I haven&#39;t been to the Cheesecake Factory in years but we recently found an old gift card &amp; decided to out it to good use. We chose to go for Saturday lunch right at noon in hopes of beating the rush.... we luckily did and got a lovely booth in the back where it was quiet and we had a view out an open window. I decided since it was the weekend (and almost time for vacation) to treat myself to a couple bloody Mary&#39;s. They were actually very good; super spicy &amp; just enough booze kick. Zing, good morning! ;) My boyfriend and I both went with lunch specials. I think people need to remember what great desks they are - good prices &amp; lunch size portions and combos from the regular menu. My man went with Renees Special - salad, 1/2 chicken-almond salad sandwich (or fresh turkey) and a bowl of soup of the the day, which happened to be baked potato. I went with the pizza &amp; salad combo, the Portofino pizza sounded right up my alley at that moment. You can pay $1 to upgrade your salad to ceasar PS. My pizza had basil almond pesto, grilled chicken, calabrian peppers &amp; three different cheeses. Fresh &amp; toasty delicious! My garden salad had a really beautiful light dressing &amp; lots of tomato. Boyfriends caesar was classic; the almond-chicken salad sandwich was way bigger than expected &amp; on buttered toast that was mouthwatering by itself. The baked potato soup was extremely creamy &amp; tasty with lots of chunky potato and crumbed bacon. You knew it had to be high calorie but you couldn&#39;t stop licking the spoon. We were both very satisfied and at a good price. We had to finish off the meal with cheesecake of course so we went with chocolate chip cookie dough. NOMNOMNOM!! We had great service and our waitress was friendly. She was obviously well trained. This wasn&#39;t a five star dining experience but we had a lovely tasty meal in Waikiki without feeling totally like a tourist without breaking the bank. I remembered why I used to love coming here :) As we were leaving we saw a crowd coming so timing is important but definitely a good meal.<br><br>Also...Lunch specials are served til 5pm FTW.

Been coming here for years now and they never disappoint. Service is top notch with the cuisine to match, always a good time here. Sometimes it&#39;s a bit of a wait for a table but what else do you expect for a place this great? Worth it every time!

Go here only if you have 4 hours to burn.  Seated right away, 45 minute for bread, another 15 minutes we asked if the food was coming.  The obese waitress said when she has time she will check.  She went and cleaned off some tables.  We saw her again and asked if it normally takes that long for the food to come out and with an attitude she rolled her eyes and said- yes it takes 20 minutes to cook.  We explained to her that it&#39;s been over an hour.  We left.  <br>The food was probably cooked a long time ago and she sneaked into the kitchen and ate it all.

We came here for our Father&#39;s Day dinner at 4:30pm, great there was no wait! I had the chicken di panna, I tried this at my wedding reception in Vegas at grand lux cafe in palazzo. Chicken is so so moist in a wine sauce, it usually comes with mash but I like it with angel hair! There so much on the menu it&#39;s hard to decide. Cheese cake is always good but come early or the might be a long wait!

The wait is long when you go for dinner and sometimes during lunch. Always ask for brown bread when they serve you the complementary bread, it&#39;s so good and not hard like the regular bread. But be careful not to eat too much because you&#39;ll end up like me and not eat all of your main dish . I always order some sort of pasta and they never seem to fail although I may say it&#39;s always too oily for me so (being a rude table guest) I get my plate and drain the oil onto another plate.. Don&#39;t forget dessert! Their cheesecakes are to die for!! The Oreo and I think it was the double fudge was just too sweet for me. I love the salted caramel cheesecake (best one on the menu) if your not looking for too sweet and just to hit the spot kind of dessert

So disappointing! My food came AFTER my entire family FINISHED eating their food. The manager came over to apologize for the delay. The server apologized also. I would&#39;ve been ok with that, UNTIL the person behind me got a free cheesecake when his meal was late!!!! What the heck?!?!? I was so disappointed in them! How could they give one customer something free and another NOTHING for the same issue?!?!? So, so disappointed in you Cheesecake Factory!!!!

Always crowded. Food is good, but it seems there burgers are smaller in size than before. Gotta eat there brown wheat bread... so good! Comes free with french roll.  Cheesecake is good, but pricey. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Parking is pricey if parking in waikiki.  The Royal Hawaiian Parking lot allows 2 hours parking with validation. After that you pay big bucks.

3.5 to be exact.<br>Kamaainas but first time at the Cheesecake Factory. Pass this place many times &amp; the long lines scared this local girl away. but hubby wanted to try it so we got into the long line &amp; reached the check in counter at 7:45pm. we were informed that approximate wait time was 1hr 25 minutes. they didn&#39;t have those buzzer things (all gone!) so we were told to return at 8:30pm. returned at 8:30pm &amp; was given one, then to be told that I had 45 more minutes of wait time. on a regular day I would be like, screw that, but I was feeling good so OK. <br>we got buzzed in at 9:15pm &amp; got seated in front of the 2 guy band. songs were OK but personally, they need to jam it up a bit. it was too mellow for a Saturday night.<br>we ordered the bistro shrimp scampi, harvest chicken salad, crispy crab wontons.  complimentary bread while u wait. <br>the food was very tasty. huge portion so hubby &amp; I shared. service was great, our waitress was nice &amp; attentive although she took awhile to come back around, but we didn&#39;t mind.<br>my ONLY complaint... not the wait because I knew after reading the Yelp reviews that we were gonna wait.. my complaint was our B52 shots. It wasn&#39;t one. when we got it, I knew the bartender had it wrong because it was COLD. this drink comes in room temperature. it consists of grand marnier, baileys, Kahlua... prepared in that order. I don&#39;t know wtf he put in there, it had some type of green chopped something. hubby drank his &amp; almost barffed. I told my waitress of my disappointment. some minutes later the manager came &amp; I told her the shot was made incorrectly &amp; I don&#39;t want to pay for it. she apologized &amp; said of course not I won&#39;t pay for it.<br>when the bill came in... of course not I did not pay for my shot that I refused to drink, but I was charged for hubby&#39;s one. OK I&#39;ll pay... but from the bill I knew what the bartender did not put in the shot: grand marnier.<br>for a big &amp; national restaurant, it was very disappointing that their bartendar(s) are not familiar with drinks. lesson learned: I wont order any special drinks not on the menu.<br>other than that. good food experience!

We were at the bar top and the service was fast.The bartender was awesome ( I think his name was Bryce) such a hard working and knowledgeable bartender.Me and my Husband had awesome time during this visit.

Very busy establishment<br><br>We ordered the 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cheesecake -- hubby loved it.<br><br>Coffee -- cappuccino , average<br><br>Definitely recommended  for cheesecakes! Might need Reservations if dining.

Me and my boyfriend decided to have a nice lunch and we xecided to go to the cheesecake factory. It was amazing! Service was amazing ! I think his name for christian a long hair blonde guy lol ask for him! He was very attentive ! Always filled uo our glass of water and check up on us. I love it the food was amazing we had calamaru and shared a meal i forgot what it was called but it was one of the most popular dish. And i was in love. And the cheesecake we had was a chocolate tuxedo cheesecake. So yummy

One star for the Chef working the kitchen. I understand it&#39;s extremely busy however I&#39;m very disappointed in the service and shockingly the food. My wife and I ordered a factory shop salad and fish tacos at exactly 1:08 pm and we received half of the order at 1:48pm. The fish tacos were missing the side salad and ingredients not to mention we got a Cobb salad instead of the factory chopped salad we had ordered. So we waited another 12 minutes and we received another salad that was not the one we ordered. The pictures above demonstrate the quality of food we received notice the to go bag was full of tomato juice so disappointed.  The salad was suppose to have chicken but instead just plain. The whole experience sucked. The manager on duty didn&#39;t care at all. This is the worst money spent on this vacation. AVOID THIS LOCATION GO TRY SOME LOCAL FOOD.

Hit or miss... Depending on who is serving you, your experience is great or horrible.<br><br>They don&#39;t take reservations so I recommend anybody who&#39;s coming here to put their name down and go shopping while they wait. Food portions are HUGE. Some say it&#39;s expensive, but to me, you may pay extra $s but your are getting three times bigger meal than the normal restaurants.<br><br>I like it here overall... :)

We went to this restaurant tonight and ordered a pizza. We had to wait over 30 minutes for our food. It was very busy but that&#39;s not an excuse to make their customers wait so long. I highly recommend going to eat at any other restaurant that serves their customers in a timely manner...no more than 15 minutes. And their prices are ridiculously high. We ended up leaving with our pizza ...the manager didn&#39;t charge us because we had to wait so ridiculously long. I will never go there again and I highly recommend everyone else do the same. Unless you want to wait forever for your food that costs an arm and a leg!!!

Visited for the first time ever a few days ago... Both the food and the service could not have been better.. The wait for a table was a little long but that is just evidence of how good this restaurant really is.. and over all the wait was worth it... We will definitely be going back and very soon.. A well deserved 5 stars.

I normally love the ccf experince, but the wait is ridiculous and the fact that they dont take reservations and the chaos it causes at the entrance. The fries were cold, the waiter and staff were friendly, but its not the atmosphrre for peace or quiet.

There was just two of us and we had to wait almost an hour for a table. Our server was very nice and he was trying to give us service while looking after 10ish other tables. We ordered the chipotle pasta with chicken on the side, but there was chicken in the pasta =( The waiter was very sorry and the manager came by to speak with us also - the manager seemed quite indifferent but he did apologize as well and said &#39;things can get crazy here at times.&#39; We had to wait several minutes to get our new pasta dish. The cheesecake was spot-on and so were the avocado egg rolls. My mood was quite bad with the chicken in the pasta - the waiter saw this so he credited us money for the pasta dish.<br><br>Decent place, but you are better off finding a less commercialized and over crowded place.

The server Jeffery extraordinary at his job in every level and category of serving everyone especially with the very big group of people we had he remembered everyone&#39;s order without writing it down the food was prepared perfectly. <br><br>The only major problem that we encountered was very poor traffic management coming into the restaurant and getting everyone seated in an organized timely fashion

Not happy with the experience.. we like to dine here for lunch and dinner but they messed up our food twice is not really a good experience. First I found a long hair in my food and the second time we visit they messed up our order and the manager said that they give our food to other tables and we have to wait for another 30 minutes to get our food  and not even really busy when we came in .

This was our first time at a Cheesecake Factory as we are visiting from Australia and I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised! We ordered the carbonara, steak Diane, calamari, herb crusted salmon and the Honey truffle Chicken. Everything was absolutely amazing and delicious ! The original cheesecake was delicious too! Make sure you come early as the line starts at about 5.30
Miss coming here on Sundays and Mondays and Friday nights and overall just miss this place. Love the variety of foods, Sunday brunch and live bands etc.

So the 4th of July me and the family went here before the start of fireworks. We got here about 1730 and didn&#39;t get seating till 1845 but we knew it would be a long wait. The food was pretty good, my youngest daughter had a Cuban sandwich I asked for no mustard and they still put it on there.

Honestly, The Cheesecake Factory was one of my all time favorite restaurants, but suddenly my experience there was absolutely different from all of the amazing nights I&#39;ve had. <br><br>Although, this restaurant does not take any reservations, we&#39;ve waited for 2 hours to get a table, which is normal if you wanna eat there. I told myself &#34;the wait will be worth it&#34;, since they&#39;ve never failed me. Perhaps, I spoke too soon. Our hostess was very polite and casually spoke to me about her favorite dishes on the menu and recommended me her favorite &#34;Chicken Madeira&#34;-chicken breast, topped with mushrooms, asparagus, Madeira sauce, mozzarella cheese, side of mash potatoes. A pretty big size! So I figure I try it! They first give you bread and butter to start with, which is always my favorite! Cocktails are always tasty there! Bartenders are really good! Our appetizers were awesome, except we ordered the soup of the day- &#34;baked potato soup&#34;. At first, our server said that they ran out, they she came back to let us know the kitchen was making a brand new batch so we stuck with the order. Soup came, and it was watery and didn&#39;t care for it anymore. It wasn&#39;t really a big deal for us, and didn&#39;t expect the manager to come by to apologize and offered us a free cheesecake which was really nice of them. My entree came in first, and wondered why the other dish hasn&#39;t come in at the same time. Server mentioned that the pasta was given to a different table and making a new one. So the manager came by again to apologize so the delay. As we began to eat, I looked at our food and it looked so good and smelled really good as well! I&#39;ve eaten a quarter of my meal until I notice a hair on my food. I didn&#39;t realize that until I started cutting more of my chicken, and I was pretty upset and, yet, I was pretty hungry. I&#39;ve told the server about the issue and told the manager. I ended up eating the pasta to share and didn&#39;t want to order a new entree. Manager was apologetic again, and I&#39;ve never experienced this at the restaurant ever, so it really brought me by surprise. <br><br>I truly must say, our server was very understandable and she was really nice and apologetic of our experience. I&#39;ve given this restaurant a 3 star because I feel that although our service was meaningful, the food and the duration wasn&#39;t at its best during the time. <br><br>Overall experience, parking will be difficult to find, since you need to find a good parking rate and walk to Cheesecake Factory. They do not take reservations, it&#39;s a walk-in restaurant that will make you wait 1.5-2hrs. Service by the servers were good, hostess service was good, management team is good. We were just disappointed of the experience after being loyal customers to this restaurant for many years. I&#39;d still recommend this restaurant, but I&#39;d hope on our next visit, it&#39;d be better.

I wish I wasn&#39;t so hungry when I came into this location, If I wasn&#39;t I would have took some pictures but I eat everything too fast! <br><br>I order the beat and goat cheese salad, it was so fresh and tasty after a long day on a charter boat fishing with some friends. <br><br>Then for my actual meal I order the chicken medera. It is a creamy oven baked chicken with a white sauce that is sprinkled with garlic, lemon and butter. <br><br>So so GOOD <br><br>And then dessert. No dinner is complete without dessert. <br>Banana Cream Cheesecake <br><br>Oh my wow oh wow... <br><br>I wish I would have taken a photo, it really would have lasted longer!

Me and my husband spend our anniversary here, his place is great, only the waiting time too long, we wait like 1 hour outside and inside. <br>The taco r great, and the Hawaiian drinks, hope I can have it everyday:)<br>Last, cheese cakes, can&#39;t praise more,just great!

Poor service.<br>Really have to wait over 30 minutes for a half filled restaurant?<br>Management does not know how to staff.<br>Food is salty and oily.<br>This is not a good representation of American food for all the international tourists that visit the islands.

Whenever I&#39;m in Waikiki, I stop by the Cheesecake factory to get my daughter her favorite dish: Pasta DaVinci <br><br>Service was great, choice of selections is a bit overwhelming, but in my eyes thats a GOOD thing.

Absolutely fantastic service! Was a large crowd when we arrived and the wait was minimal. We really didn&#39;t expect to get seated so quickly. <br>Our server was Avery knowledgeable and attentive. Food arrived as ordered and was cooked as requested. The shrimp was a little on the bland side but not too awful bad. Would expect something a bit fresher being on an island in the Pacific. <br>Cheesecake selection was out of this world and of the two we tried, both were absolutely wonderful!

PERFECT for your dessert fix, but I have to admit that I have mixed feelings about The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>BTW, not sure if other yelpers have experienced this, but I couldn&#39;t find this business on yelp after searching for &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34; or &#34;Cheesecake Factory restaurant&#34;. However, after typing &#34;THE cheese...&#34; It popped up. Definitive articles matter!<br><br>The first time I came here, service was awesome for a busy place. We were quickly seated, attended to, ate, paid, left. Quick experience but no complaints there, being the food filled our bellies and our waitress was nothing but sweet and bubbly.<br><br>Second time, however, was bit unsatisfactory. There was a wait, which I didn&#39;t mind. We held onto their alarm vibrating pager, which looked suitable to shave Dumbledore&#39;s beard. We asked for water that we were not provided, and it came, long minutes after several intense sessions of eye-rolling and sighing, compliments of our waiter who I felt tended to rush us to order. <br><br>We ordered, and our food finally came. I didn&#39;t recall ordering an Everything Pizza with half burnt pepperonis, but I guess that was just the special that night :/<br><br>The rest of the food was yummy, especially the cheesecake, which was really the reason why I came in the first place. <br><br>Their cheesecake is to die for, but for food and customer service.. :/ maybe on a less busier day. Nonetheless, this restaurant is very popular and I would return due to my sweet tooth.

The food is always good here and the staff is always friendly... The line is always a bit long but besides that I have no complaints. What can you really expect with such an awesome place that everyone wants to eat at.<br><br>Besides the AWESOME variety of Cheesecakes i totally LOVE the MOJITOS they have... One of my Favorite and affordable places to eat when I&#39;m in Waikiki

Fettuccine alfredo was too watery, filled with butter and seasoning mixture this made it hard to eat. My sons burger bun was soaked with grease and my wife&#39;s pot stickers was a undercooked noodle covered in soy sauce. Sooo yea but I have eaten here before and the cheese cake is always good.

Always a fan of Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>When we visited Honolulu, our condo rental was around the Waikiki area so we did a lot of walking up and down Kalakaua.  There was never a time where it wasn&#39;t busy at Cheesecake Factory!  There&#39;s this circular water fountain thingy just outside of CF and it was always shoulder to shoulder of peeps sitting and waiting patiently for their buzzer to go off!<br><br>It was the middle of the afternoon and my husband and I wanted to sit down somewhere to grab a bite.  You can never go wrong with CF so we put our name down.  The wait wasn&#39;t too long - about 20 minutes or so.  We were given a pager for when our table was ready.  The good part is CF is smack in the middle of the shopping area so you can go inside the neighboring stores while your partner (haha) waits outside so you&#39;re still within the radio frequency!<br><br>We decided to order just one kalua pig pizza as again, we weren&#39;t really hungry and just wanted to rest.  We decided on this pizza because we hadn&#39;t seen it on any other CF menu we&#39;ve eaten at and was the most &#39;hawaiian&#39; one there - except for the obvious Hawaiian pizza of course, but you can get that anywhere.<br><br>The pizza was a perfect small-ish size for us!  I love any slow roasted pork on anything.  This one was nicely salted with red onions and little pieces of sweet mango!  Nice addition.  Would definitely recommend this pizza to others.<br><br>Service is always good and consistent all across all CF&#39;s i&#39;ve been to.<br><br>One star decreased because they don&#39;t take resos... but considering how busy they are, business-wise they don&#39;t need to.

Thank GOD this restaurant is here. Best restaurant on the island. I hope they will open a lot more locations. Everything on the menu is delicious and a lot of food. It is by far the best balance between cost and quality of food. Also a very wide variety of choices. <br><br>The fresh vegetable salad is awesome!!!<br><br>Mahalo!!

Was a little let down after hearing how I have to try this restaurant. <br>Wait time was long. But it was to be expected. We didn&#39;t mind the wait. <br>Got the Hawaiian pizza (was too overwhelmed with the menu so I got something familiar) and I didn&#39;t care for it. It was really floppy and soft. Not crisp like a pizza should be. I didn&#39;t really like the flavour and there was maybe ONE pineapple piece on each slice. Sometimes two if I was lucky. <br>The waitress knew I didn&#39;t like it and at least took it off my receipt so I appreciated that a lot. <br>Got a salted caramel cheesecake slice to share which was very good. <br>Everyone else enjoyed their meals and the portions are definitely generous. <br>I gave it 4 stars since I didn&#39;t wanna let my bad experience completely negatively influence my vote. Especially when I got compensated and everyone else liked their food. :)

Just visited Cheesecake Factory for lunch.  No wait time.  Perfect!  I had the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta ($17.89), which is shrimp and chicken sautéed with onions, tomato and peppers in a very spicy Cajuns topped over pasta.  The taste was just excellent, a perfect hint of spice and the portion size is huge, I shared it with my friend.  We also had the red velvet cheesecake.  I was a bite disappointed at the cheesecake, it was dense and WAY TOO SWEET.  Oh, my other friend had ordered the Misoyaki Salmon with rice.  The salmon was perfectly cooked, totally moist.  <br><br>This is always a good place for a decent meal with great atmosphere.

We are &#34;regulars&#34; at the Cheesecake Factory at the Ceasar&#39;s Palace in Vegas and visited a few others so when we were looking for a place to grab a bite near our hotel after we just arrived in Honolulu the local branch of Cheesecake Factory was an easy decision to make.<br><br>The quality is amazing just like in any other Cheesecake Factory so there&#39;s little to add... just go there for lunch, dinner or just for a slice of cake and you won&#39;t regret it.

Oh lordy, this place is RIDICULOUSLY packed come dinner time.  I believe there is even a wait to actually put your name down to wait for a table!  But what can I say, its Cheesecake Factory which is always good in my book.  I honestly don&#39;t understand why tourists would come here when they can eat at any of these local seafood and steak restaurants but hey, that&#39;s their choice.  Since I&#39;m moving off island I&#39;ll just go ahead and share my secret:  Eat at the bar.  The bar and the table tops around the bar are all open seating.  We always get lucky and find someone paying their bill, grabbing their leftover bags and getting ready to walk out and then we snag the table in less than 10 minutes.  I wouldn&#39;t eat here otherwise.  The wait is just so damn long!  Then we order a slice of cheesecake to go and enjoy that at home in our PJ&#39;s watching a movie.<br><br>Onto the food - my favorite dish is the Chicken Castoletta.  Its perfection, I don&#39;t know how to describe it.  My husband got me hooked on it awhile back and we usually get that when we come.

I always think I&#39;ll like the entrees when I come here but I never do. Either I&#39;m ordering the wrong items or I&#39;m just gonna stick to their appetizers!!<br><br>Update: the Cajun Jambalaya pasta was better the next day.

*Be prepared to wait an hour or longer.   We went on a Saturday evening around 630ish and were seated around 8pm, but that&#39;s the usual wait time*<br><br>Pros:  cheesecake is always good (gotta be, that&#39;s what they&#39;re known for) and the spicy ahi tempura roll is delicious.  Oh and if course the free bread.  <br><br>Cons:  The long wait of course, they don&#39;t take reservations!  They need to work on mixing their lava flow and piña colada drinks, cuz that just tasted awful.  It can be noisy.<br><br>Just to explain about the noise...We were seated all the way in the back adjacent to the Royal Hawaiian Hotel.  Unfortunately there was at outside party that night at the hotel and the loudness of the base and music made it difficult for us to carry a conversation, hear our waiter and it was just a bad experience.  It&#39;s too bad they don&#39;t have the option to close the outside when theres events being held at the hotel.   I could tell that we weren&#39;t the only ones that weren&#39;t enjoying ourselves.  Some of the older Japanese tourists were covering their ears and making faces.  I don&#39;t mind noise in restaurants, but this was just bad.  <br><br>Now the food.  We had a party of 8, and everyone ordered something different so we all can taste because there are SO MUCH items to choose from!!!  To be honest, they could get rid of a lot, because they jut did not taste great.  Not to be too critical, but I think you would have high expectations especially when the wait time is so long.  To tell you the truth, none of they entrees we ordered had a wow factor.  It was just all &#34;okay&#34;. The only great or tasty meal we enjoyed is again, the bread, cheesecake, and the spicy ahi tempura roll.<br><br>Ah service...it was eh, ok.  When they brought out our food, they told my mom that they&#39;re still cooking her asparagus and it would be out shortly.  My mom waited and waited, and just started to eat her meal.  Of course it never came, and when the waiter came to check up on us, she explained that she was still waiting.    You could tell she was upset, and he brought the manager over.  The manager and over apologizing with a plate of asparagus (which was only 2 pieces), and she said that she didn&#39;t want it since she was already done eating .  The manager then offered &#34;1&#34; free cheesecake. ONE!?  Are u kidding me?  We&#39;ve gone to other restaurants and they would take a percentage off the bill and they only thing he offered was a slice of cheesecake!?    Kinda mind boggling, but they&#39;re just not interested in customers returning I guess.<br><br>I remember eating here years ago and remembering the food tasting a lot better.    My advice is to skip the wait, don&#39;t waste your time, and they sell cheesecakes at Costco, so YOU know WHERE to go! :)

OMG! I had the warm apple crisp. Delicious! I couldn&#39;t finish it though...big portion. In addition to the apple crisp, the dessert came with 2 scoops vanilla ice cream, whip cream and caramel topping. Service was great! Will need to come back and try the brunch and dinner menu.

I ordered the Steak Diane and Herb Crusted Salmon. My steak was cooked just how I ordered and was tender and flavorful! The salmon on the other hand wasn&#39;t what I was expected...to say the least, they need better herbs. Our waiter, Michael, was great! Excellent service and was on top of everything we asked for. He seemed to know the menu inside and out and suggested entrées based on our preference. He made great chit-chat and was very polite. Also, the cheesecake options were endless and super creamy that makes you go in for every last bite!

Here we go again. The voices in my head are conflicted in what to say. (Welcome to my world.)  Yes, like many of the previous reviews I had been to numerous Cheesecake Factory outlets . ( Redondo Beach;Pasadena ;Beverly Hills)<br> <br>It is however unfair to make comparisons , you see this is Hawaii where you should leave your expectations at the airport counter and just have a good time and enjoy where you are ,paradise it&#39;s not too hard .. I have been doing it for 10 years <br>That&#39;s how long we have been coming here. ( some voices have come and gone but,needless to say they are still multiple)<br><br>Yes, there will be a wait,after all this is the busiest restaurant in ALL of Hawaii . Stop whining about it . It&#39;s either you want to be here or you don&#39;t . Stop complaining about the wait,come when they open the wait will be minimal.(see how easy the remedy to your conundrum was.)<br><br>There&#39;s got to be more to your lives than to leave miserable &amp; frankly mean spirited reviews for this place,consider this facts. Over 100+ employees at a given shift ; 2000+ meals a day served those are staggering numbers for any restaurant operations . Yet , selfish as we all are we want perfection , our excuse is that we are customers &amp; we are paying for it .... That&#39;s not an excuse to be rude &amp; belligerent to other humans. Yes, that was you we are talking about. So let it go already . <br><br>Here&#39;s the scoop .<br><br>We have had excellent service to mediocre service.<br><br>We have had superb food to meh food.<br><br>But , we keep coming back !!!<br>Why you may ask?<br><br>We think the Cheesecake Factory is just like us ... With multiple personalities . <br><br>There will be good days and they will be bad days.<br><br>It does not matter what Rx you<br>have been ingesting...in the end it will always be that....multiple personalities.<br><br>Just accept it .<br><br>As they say acceptance is the hardest pill  to swallow .<br><br>ALOHA

I was there and I ordered pasta and the pasta was awful soooo terrible that I cant describe it.....my meal was enough for two more people.....the cheesecake are terrible.....whats wrong with you....? <br><br>I know german cheesecakes and I know Italian pasta....why you cant do it like other restaurants.....or is your philosophy quantitate is better as quality???<br><br>Never ever......dont waste your time guys...

I have visited Cheese Cake factory a couple times and the food just really isn&#39;t good to be honest.. there isn&#39;t very good options on the menu and the wait is always long..... I think your paying more for the atmosphere than the actual food... it is quite overpriced too... now I have only been to the one in Honolulu so I hope to visit one on the mainland soon!
I went there early and got a table. I had shrimp gumbo and it was very delicious! Love strawberry margarita too!

On food alone, this place would get 5 stars.  It&#39;s actually one of my favorite restaurants to go to period.<br><br>So why only 4 stars?<br><br>(1)  You have to park at the Royal Hawaiian and walk over.  It&#39;s not THAT far of a walk, but still.  It&#39;s not easy to just run in and get take out.  Plus, the location is in Waikiki.  I reallllly don&#39;t like coming into Waikiki if I don&#39;t have to.  If they built another one on island that wasn&#39;t in Waikiki, you can guarantee I&#39;d be there all the time!<br><br>(2)  Twice I&#39;ve gone there and they ran out of over half the cheesecakes, AKA, all of the flavors I&#39;d want.  It reminds me of when I went to Buca di Beppo and they said they ran out of cheese.  An Italian restaurant running out of CHEESE?!?  That knocked out 93.7% of the menu.  <br><br>(3)  The wait for dinner is insane.  Like, 2 hours, insane.  Wish they took reservations.  I suggest if you&#39;re having a craving, go during lunch time.  I went at around 1 PM on a weekend recently and we waited only 5 minutes.  I dig that.  If you&#39;re waiting for dinner, I suggest trekking over to Forever 21 next door.  That store is huge.  Great place to kill time.  Just make sure your buzzer thing is within reach, or make sure someone else who&#39;s with you stays closer to the restaurant with it.  :D<br><br>The food is what keeps me coming back the few times I brave the wait and craziness of Waikiki.  I alwaayyssss have to order the calamari.  It comes with cocktail sauce and some kind of garlic aioli (I really don&#39;t know, but it tastes delicious).  Probably one of my favorite places to get calimari, period.<br><br>The menu is so extensive here, but I pretty much always end up getting the steak diane and salmon combo.  Aaaand the oreo cheesecake to top off the meal doesn&#39;t hurt either.  I wish they had some kind of cheesecake sampler though.  I always want to try different flavors but am always worried I won&#39;t like it.  Also, best strawberry lemonade.  Period.  They don&#39;t just use lemonade with strawberry syrup, they blend real strawberries.  You can see the strawberry seeds in the glass.  Free refills at that.  ;)<br><br>Build one in Kapolei or something!

My daughter and I visited the Cheesecake Factory on a Friday evening.  Service was a bit spotty, but the food was consistent with other locations.<br><br>I didn&#39;t really care for Steak Dianne.  The shrimp was good.  My daughter had a pizza.

I love Cheesecake factory, especially their shrimp bistro pasta (which of course was featured in those online articles of &#34;eat this not that&#34; as a do-not-eat-this dish).  Each Cheesecake factory makes this dish taste delicious, and this location was no different. It was yummie!!  <br><br>We had visited the Cheesecake factory twice while in Hawaii.  During my first visit, I ordered the fish tacos (grilled).  I really did not enjoy it. The fish portions were SUPER small.  They probably would have looked much larger if they were battered.  The tacos were more tortilla, cabbage, and salsa than fish.  (Thats why I had to return to Cheesecake factory another time to get my pasta dish--my fault for trying something new).<br><br>I really wanted to eat a slice of cheesecake here but I really had no extra room in my stomach for it. The portions here are huge!! Plus, they give super delicious bread and butter before the meal arrives, which made me even more full! I love this place!<br><br>Service is always good here and they are so busy that they have to be hard workers!<br><br>The line for dinner was ridiculous. When we arrived at 6pm, we were told a 1.5 hour wait.  When we arrived at 5pm, we were told a 10-15 minute wait.  Get here for an early dinner if you can!

I love love love cheesecake factory!! Hands down, the best sangria in town. When it comes to catching up with my bestie this is the place to go. We come around lunch time because the wait is not ridiculous. Also they have a lunch special which is a good portion for good price. We never have room for dessert but we get it anyway.. It&#39;s cheesecake.. How can you not..<br><br>It&#39;s always a hit or miss with the server... They can be really attentive or never be seen. Which doesn&#39;t brother me because the overall staff help makes up for it..<br><br>I don&#39;t recommend coming at dinner time. The wait is outrageous. After all it&#39;s Waikiki

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I&#39;VE EVER HAD!<br><br>Okay so I have been to this Cheesecake Factory a few times before and we had excellent service and everything I tried before was very good but this last time we went we had HORRIBLE customer service. Our waitress we had didn&#39;t seem in the best mood and wasn&#39;t the friendliest(which of course I understand we all have our bad days and that place gets crazy busy). Anyways we ordered our food and I order a pasta dish I&#39;ve never tried before it was the Four Cheese Pasta(it normally comes with marinara but I asked for Alfredo sauce instead and it didn&#39;t seem to be a problem). I got my order and just decided I really did not like it so I asked our waitress if I would be able to switch it out for something different that I&#39;ve had before and I knew I for sure liked(and no I don&#39;t normally do this at restaurants) and she said yeah sure no problem. Well then about 5 minutes later I see this guy(pretty sure he was a manager, I&#39;m not sure though) come out with my same pasta dish that I asked if I could switch out and he says &#34;so you made us do a special order for you, this item on our menu is a special request item(which I didn&#39;t know I guess I didn&#39;t read the fine print closely enough), and now you don&#39;t want?&#34; I said well I don&#39;t really like it to much I&#39;m sorry I can just keep it, it&#39;s fine. He said &#34;alright I&#39;ll just box it up for you then&#34;. He left the table and our waitress comes by a couple seconds later and I asked for her to just cancel my other order then because I don&#39;t really want to pay for two dishes and she said alrighty no problem. Then about 10 minutes later the guy walks up to our table with our bill, my to go box, and the other dish in a box that I asked her to please cancel it and he said &#34;well here&#39;s your quesadilla, do you still want it or do you just want me to throw it away?&#34; And I told him that I told our waitress to cancel it and he said &#34;well we made it so what do you want me to do with it?&#34; I said well I don&#39;t want to pay for two dishes sir I&#39;m sorry I don&#39;t know what else to tell you. He said &#34;alright I&#39;ll just got throw it away&#34; and then gave us our bill and left the table. I was so angry with the tone he was using with us, the way he handle the whole situation...I was just shaking so bad because I did not know what to say to him or how to even handle the whole situation. Any other restaurants I&#39;ve ever been to and end up not liking a dish they either offer to switch it out or take the dish off the bill entirely and are very nice and respectful about it. I will never go to this Cheesecake Factory again even though I love most of their food.

First off it was an hour and a half wait, the place is always busy so understandable, however the hostess said wait time is 50 mins, we got one of the thicker pager like buzzers, it doesn&#39;t buzz if you go too far away from the restaurant but she insisted it would be awhile, so we walked around waikiki mall for only 30 mins it took us 10 mins to walk back, the buzzer never went off. So we started to worry and politely asked again how long its gonna be and that it never buzzed we waited over our expected time frame, they looked confused and basically got us a table within seconds with no explanation. My guess is they messed up and didn&#39;t want us to complain so they sat us as soon as possible. The staff was friendly but in my opinion they need to check there equipment, and no apologizes or explanation, makes me uncomfortable.<br>  Other then that service was fast, friendly, food was great, the filet minogne was soft like buttah! Macaroni cheeses bites was winnah! And the snickers cheesecake was awesome! Although we live far away it was a great experience but I don&#39;t like the wait time.

I really really realllyy love coming here for whatever reason. Too bad they are somewhat on the expensive side for me. But I think it&#39;s worth it! :D I came here so many times for friend&#39;s birthdays, and even for work occasions. It really is one of my favorite places to eat in Waikiki, for both lunch and dinner.<br><br>If you are coming here for dinner, I think you should definitely come earlier than you intend to eat. The waiting after 6pm is terrible... when my friends literally decided on last minute to eat here, we had to wait like about a couple of hours for a table. We were so annoyed cause we were dying to eat after 5 hours of karaoke. But good thing the neighboring stores helped us to kill time. We spent some time in Apple Store and Forever 21.<br><br>The first time I came here, I ordered the charbroiled flat iron steak. It was good, but very tough to bite AND cut. I had a hard time, but maybe that&#39;s cause I&#39;m kinda weak and have no upper body strength but still. The fried calamari appetizer was delicious though.<br><br>After coming back often, I found out that my favorite appetizer is definitely the spicy ahi tempura roll. I could literally just eat that and be full. But I also do like eating the fetticini alfredo as well :D andddd last but not least, they have the best cheesecake. I don&#39;t have a favorite since me and my friends always like trying new and different ones everytime we come here. But my favorites are red velvet and I don&#39;t remember the name but it had coffee in it lol.

IF YOU LOVE CHEESECAKE, YOU NEED TO COME HERE!! Even if you don&#39;t love cheesecake, you still need to come here!! =)<br><br>First of all, The Cheesecake Factory is located along the infamous Waikiki Strip on Kalakaua Avenue in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. Parking is free in the shopping center as long as you get your ticket validated at the reception desk.<br><br>For those of you who have never eaten at a Cheesecake Factory, there is more to this restaurant than just cheesecake... SO MUCH MORE!! Their huge menu is one of the largest I have seen for any given restaurant, which makes it both a blessing and a curse... I certainly love their wide variety of selections, but it also makes it very difficult to choose!!<br><br>And don&#39;t expect to get seated right away at this Waikiki location... It is almost always extremely busy, and you would be considered really lucky if your wait is less than 30 minutes. Probably the best times to go are weekdays during lunch. Dinners and weekends are definitely the busiest. But being that busy just shows you that there&#39;s something good in store for you inside.<br><br>Like I said earlier, the menu is FRICKEN HUGE!! So determining what to actually eat might take awhile. But whatever you decide to order, I can guarantee you that it will be a hearty portion!! I almost always have a problem with not finishing my food, and that&#39;s not even counting the dessert!! I have eaten at this particular Cheesecake Factory at least a dozen times, and normally I get my usuals... Crispy Crab Wontons and the Miso Salmon... Both, in my opinion, are exceptional dishes and I have never been disappointed by ordering them at this restaurant or any Cheesecake Factory restaurant for that matter!! I haven&#39;t really tried anything else, except occasionally tasting some of my friends dishes, but anything you order is pretty much going to be good and have good portions.<br><br>And finally, THE DESSERT!! I absolutely love cheesecake and always have a problem choosing one from their three dozen selections they have on hand... AND THAT&#39;S JUST THE CHEESECAKE!! For you non-cheesecake lovers, they also have different cakes and ice creams to choose from. I&#39;m normally too stuffed by the end of my regular meal, so I get dessert to go.<br><br>So if you&#39;re willing to wait to be seated, The Cheescake Factory really does have something for everybody, and not just cheesecake!! =)

Went there around 5:45 with a party of 4, got seats instantly. We were anticipating waiting around for a while, but were very pleasantly surprised. Food was good, nothing spectacular, but we were very full and satisfied.

Like any typical Cheesecake Factory. We were craving some food and this was the closest to something at home. It&#39;s very packed with tourists, esp on Sunday&#39;s because of their brunch. <br>It has a variety of food for vegetarians, meat eaters and gluten free people. <br><br>Service is good but at times slow due to the waiters taking care of so many people.

Okay, we decided to go to Cheesecake Factory since we haven&#39;t been here for more than a year. We remember liking the food there so it wasn&#39;t a hard decision for lunch. Just the two of us so no wait for Sunday lunch. <br><br>We ordered a cup of cream of chicken soup. It&#39;s pretty tastey. Creamy, I should say. We both shared two dishes. The fried macaroni and cheese was just as cheesy and deep fried as I remembered it. Still good. I had a Monte Cristo sandwich somewhere and I liked it so decided to try the cheesecake factory. I was wrong. It was nothing like the one I tried. It was too soggy from the syrup. The potatoes were burnt so I wasn&#39;t that edible.  I didn&#39;t say anything though. I&#39;m surprised that the server brought it out. <br><br>The server was nice and the bread was still as amazing as I remembered it. Yups, the bread was the best part about lunch there. Of course, I wrapped up the bread. I couldn&#39;t resist.  And of course, the portions were so big that we couldn&#39;t have any cheesecake. <br><br>I think I will just be back for the cheesecake, next time.

We always enjoy food at Cheesecake Factory in California, but we always visit it here also for its availability of fresh fish options. This place is super busy all the time. We got lucky that we could sit at the bar right away without any waiting. The bartender Will was very cool and helpful. He offered that day&#39;s fish special (yellow fin tuna), and we also got ahi poke. Both were very very delicious. I only wish they had a bigger selection of beers, especially IPA&#39;s. Per Will&#39;s recommendation Maui&#39;s Big Swell IPA was good (I usually prefer Sculpin and Racer 5 flavors). Oh, and my wife&#39;s favorite Mango Key Lime cheesecake was not available, kind of a bummer..

Cheesecake Factory has it all!!! Had a large party for a celebration and I knew there would be something for everyone. Our server Jeffrey was on point and was incredibly patient when we asked for some group pics. The kitchen crew run by Chef Steve at the helm made some serious magic happen. Crab cakes (that taste like crab, no fillers), always gotta get the avocado rolls, Sesame Tuna, Local catch (ono) with Mac nut crust, fish and chips, my 4 year old devoured her grilled cheese and fries and of course cheesecake for the grand finale. Can be stressful getting a large group together and choosing a restaurant. Cheesecake Factory will not disappoint. Big Mahalos!

Gosh - I normally don&#39;t like going to chains but we can&#39;t help but to keep coming back tot eh cheesecake factory!!! It&#39;s consistent - food is always perfect - and the staff is always so friendly and helpful. We come here at least once a week. It&#39;s a guilty pleasure for sure. Their chicken and biscuits are my go to food. So yummmmmyyyyyy!!!!

I thought the only thing to eat here were the cheesecakes...and salads. Cheesecakes and salads...then I ate the Rib-Eye. OMG. Have a salad, have the Rib-Eye and don&#39;t forget the cheesecake. Life is good.

I had never been to The Cheesecake Factory before, and with both the good and bad reviews, it&#39;s difficult to ascertain whether or not it&#39;s worth a visit. But because my family decided we&#39;d celebrate my brother&#39;s girlfriend&#39;s birthday by going to The Cheesecake Factory, I was going to be able to form my own opinion.<br><br>One thing The Cheesecake Factory is known for is their slightly ridiculous wait time. If you&#39;re expecting to eat here for dinner, do expect to be waiting atleast an hour or so before being seated. Fortunately, the lunch shift is a bit more relaxed in the sense that we&#39;d only had to wait for fifteen minutes. After being buzzed, we had to fight our way to the reception desk where we were promptly--though midly hindered by a busboy being harangued--seated. When the waiter finally arrived, he gave us a brief introduction about the place and left to give us some time to look over the menu. What I really enjoyed about their menu is that they had a great variety of different choices that would even suit the pickiest of eaters. So even though we all had our different tastes/palates, we were all able to find something to our liking.<br><br>When the waiter returned, we&#39;d asked what their most popular appetizers were. And unfortunately, I can&#39;t recall what he&#39;d told us, but we ended up ordering their lettuce wraps and fried calamari. If you&#39;ve been to P.F. Chang&#39;s before, they too, are famous for their lettuce wraps. But in my opinion, I much preferred The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s lettuce wraps. It was just well put-together and the food combinations were delicious. The fried calamari was a real treat too as their batter was very light and crispy, almost like a mix of rice and mochiko flour. <br><br>For the main course, we ordered an angel hair pasta dish with red sauce, a skinnylicious chicken dish with asparagus, tomatoes, and onions, the bang bang chicken and shrimp, and the eggs benedict with tomatoes and spinach. All of us enjoyed our dishes except for my brother who&#39;d ordered the bang bang. It was unfortunately, without much of a &#34;bang.&#34; But other than that, everything went smoothly enough. We weren&#39;t able to try any of their cheesecakes considering we had an ice cream cake waiting at home, but maybe next time.<br><br>Overall, The Cheesecake Factory was worth visiting, but I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s a restaurant I&#39;d return to.

Good service good food! Went to check out the new H&amp;M n do some shopping needed to girl up before we did that lol Haven&#39;t been here in years... Reminds me what I&#39;ve been missing out on! First Get the brown bread yum! My son loved it! And my son who&#39;s 1 got a complimentary soup from our waiter to start him off since the food would take awhile .. Another plus soo accommodating for children n babies love that he did that for us! Got the lemon herb roasted chicken it was delicious! Gobbled it all up! Me n my family shared the tiramisu cheesecake! Very delicious.. Coming back more!!!!!!! Gives me one more plus when going shopping at f21 and H&amp;M n prolly need to check out more new shops in waikiki!

We were on a weekend staycation for my niece&#39;s 16th birthday and we decided to go to dinner at the restaurant. We understood that they were busy and we told the manager that when she came to apologize for the long wait. But what got to me is the our server, Claudia D. who doesn&#39;t have any patience when she was taking the order for my son&#39;s drink.  I just let it go since i could see that it was busy but comes worse when she delivers our food to our table, she doesn&#39;t even let us know which order it was and just left it on the side of the table and left. So when she delivered our food, we didn&#39;t know whose pasta order it was, so my sister assumed it was hers. We only found out when the manager came to apologize to us for waiting too long for our food because that is when the server came to let us know that we were still waiting on 2 of our orders. She didnt even know that we had 2 tables until my other niece has made a request to her if they could sing happy birthday for my niece and had the audicity to say, &#34;oh sh*t, i didn&#39;t even know&#34;. Also when she was clearing up our table to box up our left overs, she kept on throwing the forks and spoons on the plate while collecting them and that got my sister all irritated and just wanted to leave.  So please collect them more nicely in front of your customers.This place is such a popular place to eat from so I hope this will be a lesson to learn from. That the next time she will serve someone that she has the courtesy to give her best no matter how busy work is because you will never know that the people who came to eat also had a long day and just wanna eat out and relax and not go through the hassle of cooking. I hope this won&#39;t happen again next time to someone else because the service that you provide will depend on it if the customers will want to keep coming back.

L-O-V-E ALL of the Cheesecake Factories that I&#39;ve visited.<br><br>My fave is San Fran, located in the heart of the city in Macys. I took a quick trip up there a few months ago on a weekend to have a &#39;fun&#39; getaway with a special someone.<br><br>We dined late one evening at the San Fran Factory under freezing conditions. The food, and the company, was well worth it.<br><br>Flash forward to last week when my rugrats were on Fall break. We made a trek into Waikiki to visit the Honolulu Zoo and wanted to treat them to a nice lunch at a new place.<br><br>Surprisingly enough we got in immediately--NO long lines, NO 2-hour wait. Just waltzed right in and sat down--LOVE it!<br><br>The girls ate their usual standard--mac and cheese and pasta alfredo. I enjoyed a veggie pizza and a salad combo. It was delicious AND filling. We all couldn&#39;t finish it and took it home for dinner that night.

We had a delicious meal, had to wait for almost 45 mins, but had a few deinks at the bar until we could be seated. <br><br>Our waiter was funny and very helpful. He even suggeated to share the spaghetti, to leave room for the aweaome cheesecake. <br><br>This place is a must to visit!

Went here on our anniversary 8/12/13 and I was expecting to pay a WHOLE lot more. <br><br>First we walked in and were put on a waiting list. We didn&#39;t wait longer than 10-15 minutes. They called our name and we were taken to our table. Note that you should probably show up before lunch/dinner rush because you will most likely wait a LONG time. We arrived between 5-5:30.<br><br>The only thing about the whole experience was that our table was SO close to the table next to us. I felt like I had to whisper not to bother the couple next to us but couldn&#39;t because the atmosphere was overall really loud.<br><br>We ordered two main courses meals and they were FANTASTIC. We got so much food. Worth the money. Then we both got drinks as well and both ordered a cheesecake along with getting the babysitter a piece of cheesecake. I was expecting a $80-$100 bill but only paid $65! We pay that at Chilis in pearl ridge for just meals half this size &amp; two drinks! So I thought that was a great deal.<br><br>Also they validated our parking at the Royal Hawaiian so we had free parking! It was overall a fantastic experience &amp; I plan on returning again more often!

I&#39;ve never eaten in however the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic is delicious! It&#39;s rich in flavor. I just wish they took reservations and had more restaurants besides Waikiki location.

3.5 is accurate<br><br>This restaurant does not take reservations and of course, it doesn&#39;t really need to because they&#39;re packed. It helps to go about an hour before you actually plan to eat, to sign in. The time it takes for you to be seated, order, and get your food is enough to strike up a healthy appetite.<br><br>Also, try not to order appetizers unless you have a big group. You want to save room for the meal and DESSERT which is why you&#39;re at the CHEESECAKE Factory, right?<br><br>About a week ago, we all came for a celebratory dinner. The wait was about half an hour around 5:00pm and we were seated near the outer area (which I prefer because inside is too dim).<br><br>Being such a big fan of steak, I decided to order the ribeye. However, on their menu, they only mentioned the ribeye being grilled and not &#34;char grilled&#34;. Hence, the special request. Unfortunately, I don&#39;t think the waitress knew the difference. She stated, &#34;oh, it is.&#34; when I asked for my ribeye to be char grilled. Needless to say, the food wasn&#39;t up to par. The fries which came with the steak were great though! The ribeye itself is actually better than the one I&#39;ve had at Roy&#39;s Waikiki unfortunately and at half the price, I shouldn&#39;t complain.<br><br>I take the points off for the lack of reservation options and the food. Although there was nothing WRONG with my food, I was just not impressed. My friend on the other hand had a bad dinner. Check my pictures for reference!

I&#39;ll get right to the food : Nachos, with real cheese not the liquid one, no meat, not enough jalapeños but &#34;THE BEST&#34; I&#39;ve personally ever had. Chicken sliders with french fries, delicious. Shepherds Pie, filling and pretty tasty. Good flavor to the ground beef. Crab dip, meh, I&#39;ve had better. Miso grilled salmon with chinese peas and mushrooms...awesome!!!, Linda&#39;s cake, amazing, I wish I could have a piece daily with coffee, lol...it is so yummy. Mocha coffee, pass, for the price the flavor isn&#39;t up to par. Dinner bread is good too. <br><br>The wait is long, ridiculously long and it&#39;s so crowed, uncomfortably so. The staff are very friendly and patient. John Helm is there in the evening providing live music.
Always amazing! We had a tiny error with our order, but Stephanie the manager made it right and we will definitely be back for more food soon! Mahalo!

I love Cheesecake Factory! <br>The dishes I normally order never comes out consistently made the same way each time.. but they were delicious regardless. They never came out bad like the one I received today. <br>I understand that there&#39;s different chefs but I ordered a monte cristo for brunch and I was so disappointed! The bread was just dry/stale bread with pieces of cornflakes on it. It was not near a French toast at all (as described in menu), and the breakfast potatoes were burnt! How the hell do you have the nerve to serve a fully burnt breakfast potatoes?! Anything burnt shouldn&#39;t be served! You know it&#39;s burnt when you find onions that you never knew was there because it&#39;s burnt black too. <br>I had to ask for syrup and show the waiter that he forgot the syrup because he insisted he put it on there. The syrup didn&#39;t help the terrible sandwich at all. The syrup was the only thing good on my plate.<br> I asked the waiter that if they could just make me new potatoes at least (because there were already two of the fours cut pieces of the monte cristo eaten, so I didn&#39;t want to bother them too much because it&#39;s busy). The waiter said he will check if the chefs didn&#39;t put away the ingredients because it just passed brunch hour. I waited and ended up not eating the rest of the monte cristo because I really didn&#39;t like how was made. Our original waiter never came back, because I guess he went on break and another waiter stepped in. Got our $70 check, left a tip and immediately left to get me something to eat, at McDonald&#39;s. I was so displeased and hungry. Cheesecake factory ain&#39;t cheap! And I am disappointed to the point of not wanting to eat here again but I know they have good pasta, nachos and cheese cake... but idk maybe they weren&#39;t meant to do breakfast items..

Came here to eat with my girlfriend and friend and expected really high quality service! And seeing how I work in the industry of serving I know what good service is!<br>Started my meal off with a strawberry lemonade and it was delicious! One of the best that I&#39;ve ever tried!<br>For appetizer I got the deep fried mac and cheese balls! It was really rich but soo delicious with the marinara marinade was excellent!<br>For my main course I decided to go old school and get spaghetti in meat sauce and it was average! I little salty but not too bad!<br>But for everything the service made this meal exceptional! If you ever go to cheese cake factory ask to sit with Santana he is a very good server and made this experience one to remember!

First time at Cheesecake Factory. I was surprised by the wait and the volume of people wanting to eat there. Most of the crowd appeared to be tourists. Was seated after 30mins. Server was lovely. Cocktails were very large and tasty. Order chicken blaster appetiser and it was HUGE. Such a large serve shared between 2 of us we were incredibly full before mains. Mains were Americana burger and crispy fish tacos. Burger was delicious. Tacos were average. Was so full that hardly ate half the main meal. Ordered &#34;outrageous&#34; cheesecake to go. Was delicious.

Always a busy place. LOVE their cheesecakes and whipped cream, never fail me. <br><br>Because it&#39;s a busy place, lines can get messy.  We were in  the front of the line to get cheesecake, it started to get busy around us. An employee told us to form a line and we ended up at the end.  I told the employee we were there 1st but it didn&#39;t matter to her.  So we left. But in a matter of a little while kids really wanted cheesecake so we stood back in line. Employees need to be trained with more customer service skills.  <br><br>We did bring it up to the manager and she was nice enough to acknowledge what had happened.

I have been to this Cheesecake Factory before and I&#39;ve had decent service, but tonight was great! Although it was pretty busy, we were seated pretty quickly (party of 4). We just did dessert, but the portions were huge and tasty as usual. We split 2 desserts between the 4 of us and still had leftovers!<br><br>Our server was Dustin M. and he was awesome. Very attentive, but not too much that he bothered us. He knew his menu and made great suggestions. He definitely made the night! And if he is reading this, you may remember me by, &#34;Thanks Kiddo!&#34; =P

We went here tonight for my birthday dinner. Great time!<br><br>Drinks are great! I had their red sangria... Super tasty with apples and strawberries inside. My husband had a blueberry and a passion fruit Mojito and loved them both.<br><br> I&#39;m a lover of kalua pork and the Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t dissapoint. We ordered the BBQ kalua pork sandwich and the kalua pork pizza. Both were amazing! My only complaint was that the pork sandwich was a little fatty... But that&#39;s normal for kalua pork.<br><br>We shared a piece of the coffee cheesecake. Yum!

First our food was good. We had a pasta shrimp dish that was extraordinary. Our server seemed frazzled but it was a Friday night. It was extremely loud and dark. The lights went way down while we were eating. We joked we needed to use a flashlight.

Pal-ing around with a Japanese tourist from my hostel, we ended up here because he wanted &#34;American&#34; food. Being on vacation, I was skipping everything that I could find on the mainland. But this is where we ended up.<br><br>Mid-week, around 8PM, is when we stopped in this place. There was about a 10 minute line just to put our names on a waiting list! Our estimated seating time was an additional 55 minutes. Yeah, mid-week, this place was packed! So we walked up and down the street a bit going in and out of various stores &#34;just looking.&#34; We were seated right about the 55 min mark.<br><br>I started off with a Mai Tai (with upgraded alcohol)...which was good! I ordered the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp. It too was pretty good. Now being in Hawaii, I expected the prices to be higher than normal...and they were. But here the prices were not increased as much as some other places...at least for the food. Alcohol...well, that&#39;s always a roll of the nice at any &#34;hot spot&#34; regardless of whether you are on vacation or not. So two for dinner with just a couple of drinks plus tip...about $80. So for me, this place was just like the CCFs back home...so just average in my book.

This review is long over due (2005).  My husband and I visited Hawaii for our anniversary and on our last day, we came here for lunch.  I ordered a shrimp &amp; chicken dish that said spicy and I requested it to be less spicy.  After I placed my order, the manager came to our table.  He asked what my tolerance level was for spicy food and I told him it was average.  He explained to me that the dish isn&#39;t that spicy and they can&#39;t adjust the spices; otherwise, it would be flavorless.  After his explanation, I decided to let them cook the food as it&#39;s supposed to.  The food came out great.  It had tons of flavor and it was not spicy at all.  Customer service was excellent.  I&#39;ve requested this dish in the California before with the same request but the restaurant never told me that you can&#39;t adjust the flavors to the dish.  Usually, they&#39;ll just cook it their way without letting you know.
I feel like the cheese cake factories in Ca all suck as compared to this place. Loved the food. Not a fan of the pineapple drink.
Good food ! Had the French toast and red velvet cheesecake! Always a favorite!  park at the royal Hawaiians and be sure to get validated.

This place is pretty awesome and for the most part customer service is on point.<br><br>The parking situation is not bad at all which I love its the cheapest place to park if you go to waikiki and they are always so busy that even if you don&#39;t go to eat there they are so busy they won&#39;t even realise you didn&#39;t eat there and bam super cheap parking.<br><br>The food is pretty good but I think its either pre-prepared, or comes frozen. One time we ordered food and they brought out the food and it was super cold. Awesome customer service they immediately fixed it and brought us out some hot food, they didn&#39;t charge us for that plate and didn&#39;t charge us for our cheesecake.<br><br>The only thing I hate from this place is that they don&#39;t take reservations, and the line is usually crazy long!

A big group of friends and I came here the other evening because we were in the area for a conference.  All the big restaurants down this way are always very busy, so we expected to wait.  Which we did!  We showed up around 5:30pm and ended up waiting about 1 hour and 10 minutes.  But we sat outside and chatted and browsed a few nearby stores, so no biggie!  <br><br>This was smack in the middle of Spam Jam (a big celebration of Spam), so the whole area was PACKED!  So Cheesecake was an absolute madhouse of people by the time we were finally called in.  I mean swarms of people!  But you can&#39;t fault a restaurant for being popular!!<br><br>Thankfully, we were brought to a table outside in the front of the restaurant.  Inside, it seemed dark and loud.  So we were very pleased to be seated outside.  Plus, we got to people-watch all the Spam Jammers!<br><br>Even though the restaurant was BUSY, our waitress was a dream!  Her name is Lily (from Houston) and she was a total gem.  Not only was she super helpful and accommodating, she truly seemed to enjoy her job.  She didn&#39;t seem harried or overwhelmed and took her time with us.  Offering to do spilt checks for a large group and even encouraging us to let her know if we needing anything modified.  She said she was the &#34;Queen of Modifications&#34;!  And she was true to her word.<br><br>The food came out in good time and Lily was there to check on us right as the food arrived.<br><br>Me and one of my friends ordered the Rib-Eye steak, and we both ordered it Medium Rare.  Lily asked us both to cut open our steaks to make sure they were cooked properly.  Mine was fine, but my friends looked more Medium than Medium Rare.  Lily took one look and said, &#34;No way!  I&#39;m taking this right back and making it right.&#34;  I kid you not, my friend had another Rib-Eye sat before her within 3 minutes.  And it was cooked perfectly!  Lily made sure.<br><br>Then the manager showed up at our table (can&#39;t remember his name...started with an S) because he had heard about the steak.  He just wanted to make sure everything turned out ok and we were all enjoying.  <br><br>Lily took care of us for almost 2 hours.  Every detail, down to recommending cheesecake to each of us according to our liking.  <br><br>I could go on and on....she was the best!<br><br>My whole table of 8 women couldn&#39;t stop raving about her and the food and the service.  Each of us enjoyed the food immensely.  <br><br>I was so impressed with the quality of service/food/attention we got...period.  Not to mention the fact that the place stayed packed from the time we got there until we left.<br><br>This was business done right and they deserve to know it.  <br><br>If you go, and you can, request Lily.  Tell her the Maui Ladies said &#34;Hello&#34;!

5 star cheesecake for sure!!! Ate here once and thought the food and service was 3 stars. Extremely crowded for dinner and expect to wait at least an hour on weekends. Much better to go for lunch or early dinner. We were a party of 2 and ordered simple dishes with no special requests aside from requesting the Ceasar Salad with my lunch pizza. The waitress did not write down our order but repeated it back to us before she put it in. Food came out before my drink which was forgotten and ended up with the house salad instead of the Ceasar. Was a little disappointed but will continue returning just to grab a slice of cheesecake.
50 minute wait. Not the greatest table. But food and waiter were good! It was super busy.

The server was terrible. She was unhappy that we didn&#39;t order more food I guess since we just came in for an afternoon treat.  Then we felt rushed as she kept coming back to our table looking for payment. Won&#39;t be back to this location again

Tasty rich food. Portion sizes are large. Their lunch menu with half portion sizes are  perfect and reasonably priced. There is great people watching out on the patio since the restaurant is located on the main Kalakaua strip in Waikiki. Great comfort food!

Our service here was great. This review is for the service of the table next to us in case they don&#39;t make a review. Their waitress didn&#39;t even acknowledge them for a good 15 minutes. By then they already had their drink and dinner order. It then took her another 15 minutes to get them their drinks as she was helping other tables and doing who knows what. When she gave them their drinks she ran away so fast they couldn&#39;t even tell her they wanted straws. I believe her name was Abbey. I get that you get busy but that&#39;s unacceptable. Our waiter, however, was great!

Be prepared to wait an hour at least because this place is packed to the very top. The place is beautiful but when you go it&#39;s usually so full it&#39;s hard to appreciate. The waiters are average sometimes you get a good one, sometimes you get one that&#39;s alright. The food is made for someone who hasn&#39;t eaten all month, so you&#39;ll be taking home leftovers. It&#39;s noisey, not cheap, but a good experience.They are just so popular it&#39;s no wonder it&#39;s chaos.

The lunch menu is a little less expensive than the regular menu, the food comes out quickly and is tasty and filling.  Jonathan was a great server and accommodated our requests promptly and efficiently.  Way to go Jonathan!

I&#39;ve been to plenty of cheesecake factories in my life, specially living on the mainland so I&#39;m not new to their menu/service.<br>The Lines were relatively short (15-20mins tops) for such a busy place, and they just have one bench to wait inside, but there is lots of space outside where you can sit and comfortably wait! <br>The service was ok, our server was Muhammad S., he forgot to give us our drinks (which were water) before our appetizers came through, but the lady that dropped our food was kind enough to get them for us right away, so that was nice! I think it was the manager that stopped by shortly after to apologize, it really wasn&#39;t a big deal though, Muhammad refilled our drinks often enough from then on and was relatively aware so YAY! <br>The food was AMAZING as always, makes it all worth it so kudos to the cooks, they&#39;re the real MVPs! It did take FOREVER for it to come, but it only makes sense with such a big busy restaurant. <br>As for the seats, this definitely isn&#39;t a place you go with a date, so make sure that you request a more private booth or something, you&#39;re better off finding more privacy sitting at the bar! The seats for 2 are actually a booth on one side and a chair on the other and these are in a row with maybe 2ft in between each set. I could literally hear CLEARLY every conversation from the couple next to me on both sides and the ones next to them and next to them. I did see some more &#39;private&#39; seats but they were for 3ppl or more, and with the restaurant always so busy, they try to use those for that many people ONLY. <br>Overall, Mehhhh, not impressed but not crazy disappointed either. I&#39;d come

We probably only come to this location 2-3 times a year and I always order the same thing, the Jamaican shrimp.  It&#39;s amazing every time.  I wish they would bring back the plantains the dish once had but the purpose of this review is to recognize excellent customer service.  We just had lunch and Daniel V. was our server.  He was fantastic and went above and beyond.  He was even helpful with our baby and 4 year old!  Awesome job!

Pro: <br>- It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory<br>- Good variety<br><br>Con:<br>- Unless you go early, expect to wait a long time for a table<br><br>We were in Waikiki on a staycation and my wife wanted to eat here.  We were lucky, we went just before 5pm on Sunday and were seated after a 10 minute wait.  Our waiter said the Waikiki Cheesecake Factory is the largest and busiest in the chain.  He said that they could have 100 people waiting about an hour when it gets busy.  The menu is a mix of the traditional Cheesecake Factory menu (traditional American) with a few Asian dishes like Chicken Katsu (I guess for the Asian tourists/locals).  Food was good and service was fast and friendly.  We had nachos for an appetizer and our meals.  I had the BBQ Chicken Salad.  It was good, but could have used a little more BBQ sauce since it was a little bland.  They have big portions so all of us walk out with leftovers.

As a local, I don&#39;t really get to come here as often. Let&#39;s be honest everyone, NO ONE likes to deal with the traffic and parking that is Waikiki. <br><br>I haven&#39;t been here in years, but recently got to return due to a little staycation and seized the opportunity. I arrived Friday around 6pm and was frantically running towards the door after seeing families and couples lining the outside seating area and walls waiting to go in. I was told my party would have to wait an hour. Ok, not as bad as it could have been.<br><br>The wait passed by quickly and we were seated shortly after coming back in. Now, the one thing I usually warn people about the Cheesecake Factory is that the prices are a little steep but the portions are that much steeper. No, they are HUGE. I always have enough for a full lunch the next day. Now that&#39;s saying something, because I usually eat a lot.<br><br>My favorite dish there is the Chicken Bellagio. It&#39;s bread crumb-crusted chicken filet topped with prosciutto served on a bed of basil pasta and an arugula salad on top. And like I said, it&#39;s HUGE. I would definitely recommend this to everyone. I also tried the Chicken Marsala and Mushrooms this visit and dat sauce! Need I say more?<br><br>Onto dessert. Who goes to the CHEESECAKE factory without getting cheesecake?! Blasphemy. I&#39;ve tried several in the past. Honorable mentions going out to the White Chocolate Raspberry, Lemoncello and the Strawberry Original. Tonight, we decided to split the Red Velvet Cheesecake. It&#39;s two layers of red velvet cake along with two layers of normal cheesecake, which equals heaven in your mouth. Done!<br><br>Parking, for those of you not staying in Waikiki, is validated for the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center for you brave souls that wish to enter Waikiki&#39;s madness.
