food 5 stars<br>cheesecake 5 stars<br>service 4 stars<br><br>wait time? for those who complain about the wait time, well it&#39;s not their fault... it just means that they bring in good business and it&#39;s nothing personal... if you can&#39;t wait then go somewhere else:)

My first time at The Cheesecake Factory and it did NOT disappoint! I had the Thai Glazed Salmon and it was delicious!! The service was even better. I wish I could have remembered her name but she was fantastic! Had to wait about 30-40 minutes before we got seated but it was most definitely worth it!

The bathrooms are tastefully decorated! The food, service, drinks, and desserts deliver consistently. Price for a slice of cheesecake is a bit expensive but well worth when you take your first bite.  I&#39;ve been seated in dining area, the bar, and outdoors and all pleasant. Except on a humid day, but want to sit inside especially when you&#39;re on a romantic date (nice dim lighting at night) and don&#39;t want sweat marks on your clothes.<br><br>I&#39;ve tried the oreo, lemon or some tart,  tiramisu cheesecakes and were all rich but not uncomfortably filling.  <br>I&#39;ve had the club house and fries, generous portions.  <br>Appetizers were great, filled me up.  I love using their bathroom!

Not so fast my friend. This place is lame. <br><br>Nothing fresh or local about it. Huge menu filled with mediocrity. It&#39;s better to do a few things really well than do hundreds of things half-assidly.<br><br>Everyone is worse off for having eaten here. I award you no points and may god have mercy on your soul.<br><br>I Crush Your Head!
The service was great the food came no less than 5 minutes it was great my favorite food was the the chicken strips with fries and it took 2 min to get a table

Wouldn&#39;t it be nice to start on page one of their menu and have a different entree on each visit!?  No matter what i eat here, it&#39;s the best!  How do they do that?  I had the shrimp scampi with angel hair noodles. Devine!

this restaurant&#39;s setting is a lot nicer/upscale than the one in &#34;the big bang theory.&#34; ahaha.<br>I like it here. waiters are very curteous &amp; answer any questions you have about the menu. the have very rich &amp; flavorful blended alcoholic beverages.<br>the only down side is that they don&#39;t take reservations! so there is usually at least a half hour wait (I&#39;ve waited over an hour for a table for two before!)<br>the food makes up for it though.

This place is great. The menu is diverse and the food tastes great. The interior is very clean and the staff is friendly. The cheesecake selection is amazing. They even have a low-carb cheesecake that is soo good!! It gets crowded during lunch and dinner. Go early!! Especially on the weekends!!

I&#39;m not sure if my waiter was new .. but the service was sooooo slow . I had to ask for our drinks twice . He didn&#39;t bring out bread until food was at the table .. and he never checked on us not once . To be in Hawaii it was a terrible experience

Have been to Cheesecake Factory in Las Vegas and in Portland. This was my first time to the one in Waikiki. That being said, the atmosphere is the same at the others. However, it was CRAZY busy! Even more than the one in LV. Luckily, we went on the Sunday after Thanksgiving, so we actually got seated right away. There wasn&#39;t an  empty table in the place. These guys turn the seating a over great speed. The server was very good. <br><br>After going over the menu several times, it&#39;s 17-20 pages long. I ordered the &#34;skinnylisious&#34; salad/w chicken. My husband ordered the factory burger. My salad could&#39;ve fed 3 or 4 people. My only gripe is there was hardly any chicken in it! For $19 I would at least expect 4-6oz of it. That kind of bummed me out. I&#39;ve had this salad at other locations and it was generous.  Couldn&#39;t eat all greens, I dug through it thinking there was chicken in the bottom. ZERO! Oh well. <br><br>My hubby&#39;s burger was good but he gave it a 7 out of 10. He&#39;s a burger lover. Says his fav is Five Guys (you can adjust your scale from there). <br><br>We ordered the Lemon meringue cheesecake. We only had a couple bites cause we were kinda full and got the rest to go. OMG Yes, it was beyond yummy! THIS IS WHY ITS CALLED CHEESECAKE FACTOR! It was still yummy when we ate they rest later. <br><br>In summary, go early order what looks good, SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT!

At first we were told that the wait would be pretty bad, but we were seated as soon as we arrived (we did get there around 4:30pm). Our server was very nice and the wait for our food was not long at all. I had the tacos, unfortunately I can&#39;t remember specifically which ones, but they were okay. The cheesecake was the best part! I would love to go again and try them all (lol).
I always love comin fb here just so I can eat the crispy crab wonton and the cheesecakes! I love the chocolate Godiva cheesecake it&#39;s the bomb!!

I eat here often, when eating alone.   I walk by both bars, looking for an empty seat.  If there is not one, I go somewhere else.  The food is great and bartenders never fail to provide attentive service.  Sherry and Julia are the bomb.  They serve huge portions at reasonable prices. I think the negative reviews come from folks who wait 1-3 hours to get in.  I have never done this and never intend to.   If had waited this long I would be very cranky, myself . Why do these people not go to some place that takes reservations?

I am rating this 5 stars because of my experience at the back bar! Excellent service, bartender named Chris was so kind and professional! He suggested us having the Mango Key Lime Cheesecake... all I have to say is that it is my new favorite Cheesecake. Asked for vanilla ice cream of course on the side!
Cheesecake Factory is an iconic place. Great food. Long waiting line during peak hours.

The Cheesecake Factory...yes the wait is long and yes everyone complains about it. But what do you expect it&#39;s in the heart of Waikiki! But you know what...the great service and the good food makes up for it. Thank you Jessica P. for being an awesome server! She made us feel so welcomed and very comfortable by her humorous personality! If I owned a restaurant I would definitely hire Jessica because she knows how to take care of her customers!
I LOVE cheesecake factory. Try to request a seat outside by the torches and right outside the Kalakaua Avenue! I love this location and the food is always WONDERFUL!

I&#39;ve had a gift card to this place that has been burning a hole in my wallet for at least a year.  Unfortunately, I&#39;m not a girl that likes to wait two hours for dinner.  So when my friend suggested lunch on a week day, I&#39;m there!<br><br>The wait was short (plus there&#39;s great shopping while you wait) and we got a booth in the bar area.  The bread basket comes with white and pumpernickel bread, but oh that pumpernickel is delicious-soft, chewy and a little dash of sweet. I&#39;m in heaven.  I seriously have a thing for pumpernickel (see my review for Ruby Tuesday).<br><br>I ordered a lunch special everything pizza and salad combo.  The pizza was tasty but the crust was mostly soggy :(  bummer.  The salad was nicely dressed but otherwise standard.  <br><br>We also ordered the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake..and the flourless part of it tasted...well...flourless.  It wasn&#39;t bad, but maybe I should have made a better choice :)<br><br>Overall, the experience was decent and the best part was I didn&#39;t have the endless wait for a table!

My family has a Christmas tradition of eating breakfast here. I suggest making reservations ahead of time or get here when it opens because it gets crowded fast especially on busy days. They serve complimentary honey oat wheat bread and white bread which are both delicious. I was surprised to find that the coffee here ain&#39;t that bad either. My family usually orders the cuts of steak and always recommend it. They have a wide selection of items to choose from so you have many choices. Service is always good, even when ordering takeout. Prices are what you would expect from a Waikiki restaurant. Fun fact, you can order their delicious bread for take out for just $3 and they give you a big loaf! The only thing that makes me take away a star is that takeout portions are much smaller than restaurant portions. Overall, never really had any significant problems with this restaurant and will continue to come back. 4 shakas out of 5!

Best part was the cheesecake. I got the macaroni and cheese burger and was not too impressed. My burger was a little over cooked and dry. The fries were pretty good. I got the raspberry white chocolate cheese cake. It was SO good! They had so many cheese cakes to choose from! If you don&#39;t go for the food... you have to go for cheese cake

I guess it&#39;s hit or miss with this joint... we went for dinner on Halloween (as we&#39;ve been doing EVERY year with a group of friends for the last 3 years)... and although I don&#39;t mind the hour or two wait... I want my food to taste good when I get it!<br><br>I USUALLY get the shrimp scampi... BUT... the last time I ate here... I ate about half of it, and then had to run to the bathroom to THROW IT UP. YES, THROW IT UP. And NO, I WASN&#39;T pregnant. LOL. Now I can&#39;t even remember the last time I ate out in a restaurant and actually had to VOMIT in their bathroom. It&#39;s pretty damn disgusting though I must say... thank the HEAVENS I&#39;m a nurse and I had a bunch of alcohol swabs in my purse... sniffed those in between heaving so I wouldn&#39;t faint from the bathroom smell... have I grossed you out yet? Because I haven&#39;t even gotten to the review of the food... read on if you&#39;re not gagging...<br><br>We got the crab won tons to start (SUPER YUMMY)... crab meat with cream cheese filling deep fried and served with a shoyu sauce. My absolute favorite appetizer! They NEVER mess this up! Our friends got the fried mac and cheese which I took a tiny bite of (it was okay)... too heavy for me...<br><br>So since you read my lovely story on how I&#39;ll never ever order my ex fave shrimp scampi... I opted to try something new. I HATE trying something new because usually I don&#39;t like it... sigh... such is life of a picky eater! Since the chicken madeira is supposedly the number one chicken dish on the menu (which is a BOOK) I opted for that paired with the steak diane... as well as garlic mashed potatoes. <br><br>Our food was out in a reasonable time... oh wait my boyfriend ordered the steak diane paired with shrimp scampi (cringe)... <br><br>His food he liked... although he ordered his steak medium rare and it came out medium WELL... after telling our waiter this he told a manager who then came by to apologize (not his fault) and state he&#39;d get a new steak out right away... it came out fairly quickly and it was cooked perfectly (so my boyfriend says... I mean I&#39;m all for medium... I don&#39;t like my beef as mooing as he does!)<br><br>Then there&#39;s my food... so my steak diane was cooked medium and it tasted okay... nothing spectacular... but the chicken madeira was a FLAT piece of TENDER chicken which had THE FUNKIEST taste I&#39;ve ever had on chicken. (((sitting here perplexed))) There was also 3 asparagus tips on top (I HATE asparagus)... which made it that much more unappealing. I gave it a bite... and well, it was BLAND, WEIRD, and I&#39;m telling you... FUNKY is the best word to describe it. I sat there thinking how the hell this damn piece of chicken was THE most popular item on their menu?! SMH... <br><br>The garlic mash... (cough cough)... was BEYOND salty! I&#39;m NOT a fan of salt, but this was as if they added a tablespoon of salt instead of a dash of salt... everyone at the table tried the mash and they ALL agreed it was hella salty. SIGH. The other options of starch didn&#39;t quite interest me so I played it safe with french fries to sub out.... I mean you can&#39;t get french fries wrong can you?! They came out just fine. <br><br>I was TEMPTED to send the chicken back... because it SUCKED... and it tasted FUNKY... and it looked FLAT and SAD... BUT I was so over all the food issues that I just wanted to be an 8 year old and play with my food (the chicken) as I had no interest in eating it. The waiter was conscious of me playing with it and asked how it tasted (I was honest) and he was kind enough to ask if I wanted something else but I declined... playing with the chicken kept me occupied while everyone else ate and while I waited for my dessert...<br><br>FINALLY something good... fresh strawberries with the original cheesecake. Can&#39;t mess that up. And we got a red velvet cheesecake. Very dense but very delicious. And I skipped the booze and opted for a strawberry lemonade which is BOMB... so all in all... next time I might as well order my drink, won tons, and go straight to dessert! LIFE IS UNCERTAIN. Didn&#39;t I say to eat dessert first?! SMH for not following my own advice... :)

it was a lot better than what I expected for an American chain.<br> <br>it was 40 minute wait but this allowed me time to walk down to urban outfitters and Honolulu cookie company for some shopping. we were seated promptly after our arrival (20 minutes earlier than originally estimated). <br><br>the server was attentive and quick with ordering and boxing left overs and ringing the check. also, very nice, no attitude or anything negative (what is what I prepared myself for after a trip to hard rock)<br><br>the food was a little expensive but reasonable. it tasted a lot better than what I expected. I&#39;ve had bad lava flows and island ice teas, where the bitter alcohol overtakes the sweetest of the drink, but these drinks were a great balance!<br><br>also the Godiva cheesecake was to die for. I suggest sharing a piece with a friend, they&#39;re dangerously delicious!
Great customer service, the main course is okay, the cheesecake is huge and very tasty, definitely come back next time.

This place is as good or better than any Cheesecake Factory you will visit anywhere in the United States.  Of course it will be loud.  It&#39;s located on the streets of Waikiki.   The food is great.  Go for it.

My wife and I like the Cheesecake Factory, but this location is not very good. We had about a 20 minute wait, which actually went very fast. It took longer for our waitress to acknowledge our existence once we were seated. She didn&#39;t show up for a good 20-25 minutes. From there, we ordered our food, which took even longer. Instead of updating us on our food, she kept apologizing that there was no bread. We were there at 9pm, so there is no reason they should be short on bread, but we just wanted our food.<br><br>When the food arrived, we felt underwhelmed. My usual cheesesteak sandwich was nasty. My wife&#39;s pasta that was supposed to have artichokes was pretty barren. All we got were apologies about the bread, which came after our food. When we told the waitress we didn&#39;t want dessert, she seemed very put off that we weren&#39;t ordering more. <br><br>If you want the same Cheesecake Factory you get at home, you will be sorely disappointed. Go to a local joint instead. Stop feeding chains like this that life tourists away from the real gems in Waikiki and Honolulu.

The bad: Their hosts (or reception desk) suck. They underestimate wait time quite frequently and don&#39;t seem to be very organized. There&#39;s always a really big crowed of people in the waiting area which seems normal since it&#39;s a popular restaurant, but it seems like an abnormally large portion of the people crowded around that area are CF hosts. It&#39;s weird. <br><br>The good: If you have the patience to wait it out, though, the food&#39;s awesome. They have a good variety of food whether you like red meat, chicken, fish, or you want a vegan/vegetarian option. The &#34;Evelyn&#39;s pasta&#34; is awesome. I had it vegan style. The portion was large enough to fill my belly and leave me with left overs. <br><br>Finally, our waiter, Ken, was awesome. He was super accommodating to all my vegan questions. He knew the menu well and made suggestions to everyone at the table who was unsure what they wanted, and everyone seemed pretty happy with their meals.
Went here tonight for my birthday dinner. Everything was great. Ask for Tyler as you server. He was very polite and helpful. Defiantly will come again

This place is always a mad house when it&#39;s dinner time. Either come really early or really late if you don&#39;t want to wait 2 hours for a table. <br><br>First off our host asked if we wanted English menus.....yeah just cuz we&#39;re Japanese don&#39;t ask those kinds of questions if we&#39;re speaking to you in CLEAR English.<br><br>Waitress was the best part of the night. She was on it with everything. I ordered the Chicken Marsala with mushrooms......not what I expected so I wasn&#39;t very satisfied. The sauce was on the sweet side like they added sugar to the sauce. Noodles were al dente but more on the harder side. Very disappointing after waiting 2 hours for a table. Best friend ate half of it &amp; I ate the other half of his Steak Diane.....so good now I know what to order next time I go back for dinner. <br><br>I&#39;m not a big cheesecake fan &amp; I said why not try something like the Reece&#39;s peanut butter cup cheesecake, can&#39;t go wrong with peanut butter cups.....not realizing that they had 2 different peanut utter cheesecake I read the menu again.....Adams peanut butter fudge cheesecake will not disappoint a non cheesecake fan. Took one bite when I got home just to try it......I had to take another bite!!!!

Thank goodness there is a Cheesecake Factory here in Hawaii. Consistently great food. It&#39;s a great place for a group meeting since the menu has so many variety that there is sure something to please everyone. <br>Pros: <br> Great variety of good foods<br> Large portions at reasonable prices<br> The cheesecake of course!<br>Cons:<br> The wait can be really long especially for dinner<br> The services are a hit and miss depending on waiter<br>Foods:<br> Sliders: greasy buttered buns<br> Chicken Marsala: huge portion ...meh<br> Burgers: simple burger, great fries<br> Renee special: good soup and sandwich<br>Why the four stars?<br>Saw a huge outdoor cockroach landed on the table once and inform the waitress and she just ignore us.<br>Otherwise, consistent good foods

I&#39;ve been there maybe 5 times, it&#39;s pretty okay food, the atmosphere is fun.  I don&#39;t love the cheesecake,  wish it was less sweet and more traditional.   <br>But when you have a group it&#39;s great if you can get a seat.  More about the location and marketing.

Not my first time here but the experience doesn&#39;t change. The wait- came in for lunch on Christmas Day. Quoted a 20 minute wait time and seated about 35 minutes later. The service- The server was sweet and friendly but not very attentive throughout the meal (again, typical of the service here probably because they&#39;re so busy). The food/drinks- DO NOT order a Bloody Mary here. Tasted like a pre made mix and costed about $9! The chicken and waffle benedict was great if it wasn&#39;t a Benedict. The yolk of the poached egg was cooked through. Not at all what you expect when ordering a Benedict. Shrimp and chicken gumbo was amazing. Definitely worth coming back for! If not for the gumbo to try out one of they&#39;re many selections of entrees.

The food itself was very good and the service was not bad for the restaurant being so busy.  What ruined the experience was we were sitting outdoors and the smell of sewer from next door wafted in and ruined our appetite.  Everyone else around us was complaining of the foul smell and you could see everyone covering their nose and their mouth in disgust.

Usually Cheesecake Factory is AMAZING to me food &amp; service wise. <br><br>Last night was a huge let down though. <br>The food (of course) was exactly what I expected. Our server last night was Bianca. It seemed as soon as I let her know how much of a fan of their table bread I am, her tone and facial expressions came off extremely annoyed and continued that way while I ordered my food. <br>We didn&#39;t have to wait too terribly long for our appetizer or main course. She did come back once for a refill and I asked for more bread. The next time we saw her, we asked for boxes, some cheesecake to go, and the check. Bianca then told us the reason the refill on my drink and bread had taken a while was because she thought I was &#34;eating/drinking too fast&#34; .........Um, what? My wife and I always go to restaurants starving and yes, eat as much as we can before we waddle out. I thought it was extremely rude not only that she was mentioning she did it on purpose, but that she continued to talk about how much bread I had eaten.<br>I have had MUCH better customer service while eating at The Cheesecake Factory and our appreciation always shows in our gratuity. Last night, the food was up to par but I hope I never have service like that again. Or I might stop coming to the Waikiki Factory.

Ok, so this is a huge chain restaurant but I have found it is the best bang for your buck in downtown. Yes the wait will be about an hour but this place had the best food of anyone on the strip and we had two weeks to cruise all of the big ones. I had the chicken Madeira, shrimp scampi, Steak Diane, hibachi steak, and potstickers. Obviously not at once but over the course of our time in Waikiki. The steaks are amazing! One of the best steaks I&#39;ve ever had and that includes some of the bigger steakhousss that serve sides ala carte! Sounds weird for a big, busy chain but it&#39;s true. I asked for A1 sauce for my steak the first night and ended up not even needing it cuz there was already so much flavor. Plus, it was cooked exactly how I ordered it! It&#39;s rare that everyone gets their food and loved their meal every single time! Do I even need to mention their delicious cheesecakes?! They do have a walk up counter to order cheesecake only to go! Convenient if u just want a dessert. Plus our servers were awesome every night. Very attentive and super helpful choosing from the menu (both entrees and drinks). They are ALWAYs busy but they were on top of drinks and our other requests. Food came out within a reasonable time but drinks can take a while if the bar is busy. Speaking of drinks, they were strong. I enjoyed the pineapple and cucumber mojitos. The wait is long (but the wait area is large and right on the main drag) but I hate to say that the best meals I had were here and I&#39;d come back again.

Food is pretty good for the price although I believe that the novelty of the Cheesecake Factory is its popularity and its location on Waikiki. I made the mistake of sharing both fries, chicken nachos, and tortilla soup with only another person since the food is in huge portions. Make sure to get the nachos if you are  hungry because its a lot of food!<br><br>Location is pretty great, more towards the shopping district than the water. Outside seating is really cool and gives you a great view of tourists and the street, albeit it might take you a little bit longer since the demand is higher. Overall, a pretty fun place to eat that everyone should experience especially if you are coming to Honolulu for the first time.
I waited 1 hour to get my food, after my family got theirs! And by the time I got the food. The chicken sandwich was dry, the chipotle mayo was completely crap. But the waitress was very nice

Having never been to the Cheesecake Factory before I would not have considered it to be a serious choice of restaurants for dinner but I was very pleasantly surprised after having a Japanese Hibachi steak meal, very high quality and bloody delicious. We had to order a Godiva chocolate cheesecake to go as we were so full from the main course. Service was excellent especially from waitress.

I love Cheesecake Factory but I&#39;m sad to say that the quality of food and service was not good today.  <br><br>It took 7 minutes for our waitress to come to our table after we were seated by the hostess.  Our appetizer avocado eggrolls came 30 seconds before our entrees so we had to eat both at the same time.  The eggrolls were soggy and not crisp on the outside.  My fries with my fish &amp; chips tasted stale and salty.  I ordered another batch and although less salty it still tasted stale.  Our water glasses had no waster and the waitress came to our table three times without refilling it.  We finally asked another waitress for water.  We were here at 2 pm.  No line and it was not busy at all.  Very disappointing lunch today.

The Cheesecake Fatory chain is nothing more than mediocre.<br><br>The line is atrocious, I think people were waiting over an hour for a table when there were plenty of empty tables not being filled by any one of their THOUSAND staff members... The service is lackluster, and you can easily go anywhere else to get food of that quality.<br><br>Please don&#39;t waste your vacation away waiting in line for meh-food. Try something, and/or somewhere you don&#39;t have at home!

I&#39;ve been to cheese cake factory in Waikiki several times and the service has always been great and the food is excellent! I will say it is well worth the wait.  The only reason I gave the restaurant a 3/5 stars is because when I recently placed a take out order for cheese cake both of the slices I got were so thin and small.  They gave a bunch of whip cream which seemed to hide the small tiny piece. For the price paid I was very disappointed.  Hopefully they were just running low and cut smaller pieces  that night and it isn&#39;t always this way.

We were sat quickly, which is the only good thing I can say about this place. After being seated, I noticed 2 other couples were seated at 2 other tables. The other 2 were quickly attended and had their drinks.  We however, still hadn&#39;t been asked anything.  We were sat under the ac duct, which is normally a plus, however, my wife didn&#39;t feel well and we asked if we could move to the next table, which was empty, a long with the another 4. While 4 waiters, joked and laughed, the other 2 couples enjoyed drinks and one couple ordered their meals.  We asked the hostess if we could switch and she informed us that we qpupd have to go back to the end of the line outside, that had formed while we sat.  I then noticed that one couple had begun to eat and the ordered, and still 4 waiters laughing and joking.  Which for me was long passed the final straw, as we walked out, I told the hostess thank you for NOT serving us, to which she laughed.

Consistently delivers high quality food at a great price. It&#39;s the only place in the USA that I eat burgers, and they&#39;re fab! Leave early as you&#39;ll have to wait for a table, particularly around dinner time. The only issue we had was the extreme air conditioning in the place, so if you get outside or down the back - you&#39;ll be least affected.
Food was good. Service not so good. Very dark atmosphere.  All in all I&#39;m under impressed with The Cheesecake Factory. Glad we tried it but now we don&#39;t need to come back.

Sorry for my further english mistakes guys<br>But I can&#39;t help not doing this review<br>I&#39;ve been in hawaii for 2 weeks with my friend on the last winter<br>Gave myself this farewell from north America before going back to Brazil<br>My hotel was pretty close to the cheesecake factory so I went there 3 times <br>so, let&#39;s go to what matters;<br>the restaurant is in the most touristic area you will find in waikiki, so expect to wait before going inside, everyone is always so busy with so many clients <br>The food is amazing, tried the burgers and the pasta with meatballs which didn&#39;t disappointed me at all<br>The waiters are always a lot of sympathy <br>Always trying to make us feel some warmth from them and showing they wish of making us enjoy the time there<br>And to finish, the cheesecake is the cherry of the cake<br>Unfortunately they didn&#39;t have all the flavours as they had on the menu which is understandable because I went there always for dinner and on busy days<br>Live music and nice price<br>The best in waikiki! <br>This huge review worth to be written

I can&#39;t tell you how many people recommended this restaurant to us, and we saved it for our last night. It was so delicious and super fast and super friendly service. Now,  they don&#39;t take bookings and they&#39;re very upfront with having extended wait times but this restaurant handles the crowd in the best way I have ever seen. We were told 40min wait for 2ppl on Mother&#39;s Day dinner (so you understand how busy it would&#39;ve been!) and they were exact to that timing. Once we were in service was so fast, as well as all food orders. Very generous servings, so it feels worth it even though it&#39;s pricey. Really well-prepared food. I wish we went a couple of times to try a couple more items on the menu, and of course to try one or two more cheesecakes!

Service was great! Our waiter was very friendly and outgoing but the food was just a NO NO!! <br>I ordered a turkey club sandwhich with avocado and the avocado was BAD! It literally was black!! My aunt ordered the imperial chicken with shrimp and their was not one single shrimp on that plate. The manager took the plates off our checks but I expected more out this restaurant! I wish I could remember the waiter&#39;s name he was awesome!
This is one of my favorite restaurant on the strip of Waikiki. Their chicken Madeira and the habachi steak was amazing!!!! Everything was great except for the wait

Great menu   super kitchen staff<br><br>We were regulars - local customers   mature people<br><br>a manager Michael Mcbane when asked to help us order food to go<br><br>sent us to a long long line<br><br>when ask to help us direct said line was only way<br><br>I said guess we should just leave he Ok with him<br><br> a super bartender Tiffany made our day and got our foo<br><br>Mr McBane needs a tune up in customer service
Great food, great service! Just always super packed, the wait to eat was about 40mins but it was worth the wait! This was a first time eating there for my wife and I! Will defiantly be back!

08/14/16<br><br>dear The Cheesecake Factory... second time here and there was a short line to sign in and tons of parking.. yay... <br><br>We ordered the Fried Mac &amp; Cheese (again) and Made to Order Guacamole and Chips to start... For our meals we ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta; Shrimp Scampi and Steak Diane (again) and the Smokehouse B.B.Q. Burger..<br><br>Fried Mac &amp; Cheese:  just as good as the first time.. yummers...<br><br>Made to Order Guacamole (medium heat) and Chips:  Super fresh and chunky guacamole that came with lots of freshly made chips... it also came with a side of sour cream and salsa.. super yummers...<br><br>the Louisiana Chicken Pasta:  &#34;better than the jambalaya and not as spicy..&#34;<br><br>the Shrimp Scampi and Steak Diane:  &#34;yummers&#34;.. three medallions of medium cooked steak with three jumbo shrimp and mashed red potatoes... i&#39;m a creature of habit...<br><br>the Smokehouse B.B.Q. Burger: &#34;eh, it was okay... BCD is better&#34;..  good thing for uncle Lane someone is loyal to his burgers... lol<br><br>Cheesecakes: White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut; Kahlua Cocoa Coffee; and Fresh Banana Cream...  We were so stuffed again... lol.. But we learned from the last time and since we were going to walk around a bit (read: go Pokemon hunting), we stopped by the cheesecake counter before we left waikiki and ordered them to take home for later...<br><br>Service:<br><br>the Good - Our server this time around (sorry i forgot what his name was) was really attentive...  Our waters and drinks were filled when they were half empty and he even brought more bread without us asking for more...<br><br>the Bad - the the thing that really bothered me were THE BIRDS.. AGAIN!  I really wanted to ask for a different table INSIDE but didn&#39;t want to be that customer and have our meals come with any extra toppings..<br><br>the SUPER BAD - the only other thing that I found somewhat disturbing was a server (who wasn&#39;t the server for this particular table) asking (read: telling) a japanese couple that the cash they left in the check holder would cover the bill but did they want to leave a tip for their server...  when they couldn&#39;t understand what he asking he reiterated that they could leave a tip if the service was 1-star, 2-star, 3-star according to the suggested tip guide on the bill...  frustrated, the couple just handed the server some cash and just walked away...<br><br>verdict:  we&#39;ll be back again...

Okay I&#39;m going to be honest with you...I&#39;m not a big fan of the Cheesecake Factory. I have to admit the semi-upscale chain restaurant is pretty nice, but the menu is just insane. The menu is pretty much on steroids, literally! There&#39;s just way too much choices to choose from, but hey locals and tourists alike love to have LOTS of variety.<br><br>I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake factory multiple times but this past Wednesday was just ridiculous. I went with a party of 15 people (normally my party would be a table of 2)...yes I know it was partially our fault but it was crazy! We pretty much waited a little over an hour to be seated and another half an hour for our food to come out.<br><br>Because of the super-sized menu, I always order something different. This time I tried the California Cheesesteak <a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=VTWSWZlEX2tZu9Yv2xXD2w&amp;select=Y3XJvB0Ij1SA6rb3wUD7BA">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a> for $12.95. The cheesesteak was flavorful and the bread/fries were hot, but what really irked me was the fact that half my cheesesteak wasn&#39;t even in my sandwich! Look at my pic! Half of it was on my plate! I was pretty salty but what made my mood lighten up was seeing my friend trying to eat her soft shell tacos <a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=VTWSWZlEX2tZu9Yv2xXD2w&amp;select=7nZnGSmSl2lCDedt7FxAYA">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>. As she tried to pick up a taco it just broke, leaving her with a taco shell that looked like a donut! The then had the same thing happen with her remaining 3 tacos forcing her to eat her tacos with a fork.<br><br>What redeemed them was their delicious (semi-expensive) cheesecake. For about $8 you can get a slice of one of the many different cheesecakes they carry. The two cheesecakes I got to try was the fresh strawberry cheesecake <a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=VTWSWZlEX2tZu9Yv2xXD2w">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>, and the chocolate tuxedo cream cheesecake. The fresh strawberry cheesecake was good but come on, its just cheesecake with strawberries and strawberry sauce. The tuxedo cream however was pretty amazing! If you love chocolate, this hits the spot! There&#39;s a layer of chocolate, a layer of cheesecake, and a layer of chocolate cake. Making the perfect proportion for cake, cheesecake, and chocolate in a single bite. <br><br>Two and half hours and about 5,000 calories later I still don&#39;t really like the Cheesecake factory. I haven&#39;t been here since last Halloween and who knows maybe I won&#39;t be back till next year. If you&#39;re up for an hour+ wait by all means hit up the Cheesecake Factory. Just be prepared for a super LONG WAIT, the BIG menu (hard for indecisive folks like myself), and big portions of so-so food. But if you just want good cheesecake just get your cheesecake to go!

If you can have a late lunch. We arrived at 2pm and did not have to wait. Service was best so far in Hawaii. Excellent. Food portions are huge. Food is excellent and excellent value. Drinks also excellent and well priced. I had the Molokini and it was awesome. Like Rum icecream with mango. Chinese chicken salad. Fried mac and cheese. All excellent.
Had a great time and the staff was very nice and cheerful. Jeffrey was our waiter and he was knowledgeable and fun!

I&#39;ve been a fan of The Cheesecake Factory from way back. No matter what location I&#39;ve eaten at, the food and of course, the desserts, are always great!<br><br>Eating here is an adventure. First, you have to be prepared to wait, and wait, and wait. We&#39;ve experienced wait times varying from 45-90 minutes. Needless to say, we try to come during off-peak times, but even then the restaurant is completely full. Despite the constant crowds, we&#39;ve always experienced excellent service here, which is saying something.<br><br>Cheesecake Factory restaurants look the same no matter where you are. They&#39;re upscale casual and gaudy. The noise level of the Waikiki location depends a lot on where you&#39;re seated and when you dine since they have live music in the lanai/bar area on weekend evenings. (The music is amplified, so the volume is to the point that you can&#39;t talk over it.) Basically, you have &#34;very loud&#34; and &#34;over the top loud.&#34; My favorite place to sit is the back room, which opens out onto the Royal Hawaiian Hotel terrace.<br><br>The winner here is food and service. Everything I&#39;ve tried from the menu (and I&#39;ve tried many things) has been good. Portion sizes are huge, so I always take home leftovers. Ditto for the desserts, which are definitely big enough to share. Since you&#39;re essentially getting two meals in terms of portion size, it is reflected in the price--The Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t cheap.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is located in the Royal Hawaiian Center, Building C, ground floor. Park in the on-site garage and have them validate. When parking, be sure to pull into the &#34;guest&#34; parking and not the hotel parking! They are open for lunch and dinner every day plus Sunday brunch. Hours are Mon-Thu 11am-11:30pm; Fri-Sat 11am-12am; Sun 10am-11pm.<br><br>Yelp 365 Challenge #54

Service was extremely slow. I was there on a weekday afternoon. I was seated immediately going in, but once I got my table that&#39;s when the trouble started. The waiter took forever to take our orders (remember, it was not a busy day) then the bread, water and our pasta dishes all came out at the same time. I find that to be unacceptable even if it&#39;s a chain restaurant.

This place is always busy!!<br>When we got there it was packed.  The wait was for 50 minutes, but within 15 minutes a nice person named Tommy gave us his buzzer that was going off.  He also had a group of four people but he already had seats.  Amazing!!<br><br>I been here a couple times before and the service is usually pretty good.  The host are always very busy giving out buzzers and figuring out how to seat people.<br><br>The food is good and the portions are big.  I like coming here with a group of people to try different appetizers.<br><br>Here are some things we ordered....<br><br>Crispy Wontons (<a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=rAzzY6jQBe9-Om0E3S3jgw&amp;select=v3saXm_g_MuzRodon3X0ig">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>)<br>This is a good Appetizer!  It is made of a Crab and mayo mixture inside the Wonton good crispy light not like deep fried soft rich <br><br>Guacamole (<a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=rAzzY6jQBe9-Om0E3S3jgw&amp;select=o5Zu3Azm4Ud2yVHUcH4KZQ">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>)<br>I really like the chips that come along with the Guacamole!!  If you like avocado you will like this!!  I liked it!<br><br>Bistro Shrimp Pasta- (<a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=rAzzY6jQBe9-Om0E3S3jgw&amp;select=Mnt_cMl2DblPyekqCc88jg">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>)<br>It was tasty!! but too much pasta for me!<br><br>The free bread was also good too! (<a href="http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=rAzzY6jQBe9-Om0E3S3jgw&amp;select=MRVOWJZNuLG2gsGoRtJUFQ">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>)  The brown bread is delicious!<br><br>I know I will eventually come back, but it is important to think of a backup choice when coming here... just incase the wait time is 2 hours!

Excellent food and great service. I went here with a friend, we split the corn cakes and the vegetable salad. It was delicious and more than enough food for two. I have found the Cheesecake Factory restaurants to be very consistent in quality and service. This one was exceptional.
Great food and even greater customer service!!! There are so many great things to choose from so theres always something for even the pickiest of eaters.

One hour wait, I signed up for, so I can&#39;t complain too much about that. Just know if you come here, it&#39;s rarely &#34;ready to serve&#34;... So, expect a wait and don&#39;t be hungry. 15 minutes after being seated and I&#39;m feeling very lonely... No water! No waiter! And I&#39;m thirsty. Dreading how long it&#39;s going to take for me to get food.

The service was faultless, the food portions were ENORMOUS and the value was fantastic. <br>Back home in Sydney we would expect to pay 3x more than we did here for a comparable meal. <br>Whilst it was a little loud (due to how busy it was) you didn&#39;t need to raise your voice much to talk to the person with you. <br>The quality of the food was excellent.

The wait find was Ridiculous! 2 hours to sit down. 45 mins before Togo food . 35 mins to wait for food. Lost appetite . Ate only the damn bread. So freaking disorganized! This location is popular for its own good need better customer service!!!!! The only thing good is the food! ONLY THE FOOOD ONLLLLLLLLLLLLLLYYYYY THE FOOD!
Came here for my mom and daughters bday.  I had the pit beef dip sandwich which was a winner. I think it&#39;s worth the wait and also a no rush environment.

I have seriously considered going here just for the cheesecake. The wait can be long, but thats usually because people like going there at night. During the day its pretty quick. There is a weird waiter there, I don&#39;t really know how to describe him, he&#39;s just odd. Other than that the food is phenomenal. I love the cheesecake. Its also really dark in cheesecake factory, I&#39;ll never understand.

For our last meal together and after Jeremy looked through my bookmarks we ate here.<br><br>We parked at the Royal Hawaiian Center and walked from that end to the other. It already looked busy walking in but they hostess at the front said the wait would be about 10 minutes which it was.<br><br>Not much sitting room while you wait so we stood on the side and looked through their menus since it was my first time and I wanted to know what they had. Of course I picked up the Korean version.<br><br>Once our buzzer went off, we headed to the front and waited for someone to escort us to our seats. I would have preferred a table outdoors where it would be warmer, but later on during our meal someone got attacked by a bird!<br><br>Anyways, our waitress was a bit awkward. She offered us bread. They have the same bread at Cattle Company, so we enjoyed that. The other one, not so much, though the inside was soft and fluffy. I decided on the mushroom burger, no onions (<a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Finstagram.com%2Fp%2Fea9eHDntwO%2F&amp;s=610cc6894d4165ab1db1c2cc4936bf3d1e0a5e9a906366e9795854a4e430dd7a" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">instagram.com/p/ea9eHDnt…</a>).There was another burger that had mushrooms, but this one had cheese! Good thing we had bread to munch on because it took a while for our dishes to come.<br><br>The elderly coupe besides us talked to us once in a while.  They were friendly, we hoped we gave the same impression in return.<br><br>I had to cut my burger in half so I could eat it without it getting messy. I wasn&#39;t provided a knife so I borrowed Jeremy&#39;s. It still was difficult to eat anyway and I didn&#39;t even finish it. Their fries were good, still hot when it got out to us.<br><br>Originally we were going to have separate cheesecakes but after thinking it through we decided to share one. We ordered the Reese&#39;s pieces chocolate cheesecake (<a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Finstagram.com%2Fp%2FebAx8Cnt08%2F&amp;s=7ea7f7408c898a5c858c0588690bb90eb82db2dc8998a5ac0bfff1b63a9e20e7" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">instagram.com/p/ebAx8Cnt…</a>). It&#39;s actually two cheesecakes together. It was alright. I didn&#39;t enjoy the nuts and after a couple of bites I was already tired of it, so was Jeremy. That&#39;s not something I would order again, even if I shared with someone.<br><br>Sometimes to get our waitress&#39; attention, he&#39;d raise his hand. Ha.

Can I start off my saying WOW!! Me&amp;&amp; myhusband were walking around in waikiki and came across the delicious Cheesecake Factory. We walked in and the wait was less than 5mins which was awesome. They were even kind enough to switch our table to a booth :) our waitress was on-point, super friendly and very helpful. My husband got the the club sandwich with a salad and I got the cheesesteak with fries. Everything was hot and well worth it. But the BEST PART of all was our CHEESECAKE!! I got a double Oreo cheesecake and he got a white caramel macadamia nut one.  AMAZEBALLS thank you Ashley for the wonderful service. We will definitely be back. Oh &amp;&amp;scant forget about the delicious bread and the hot spinach dip for your appetizer. LOVED IT

I&#39;ve tried at least half of the cheesecakes on the menu, and have never been disappointed! This place does its name justice. I havent tried many of the lunch/dinner options though, I will usually just get a salad so I can enjoy dessert! Only con is that the wait is always long, but I say its worth it if you&#39;re craving cheesecake!

Food is always great. the pasta da vinci is my personal favorite. however the line is crazy long you could be waiting for hours and they wont take reservations. <br><br>another thing- they are right on the beach and they don&#39;t have an ocean view? kind of funny. <br><br>if you don&#39;t mind waiting for what seems like hours. the food is great!

Why is the service so bad? Food is good- drinks are  good- service is terrible. Not worth it anymore. Is the service so bad because the majority of patrons are tourists who are exhausted and starving? Why are there pigeons at my ankles? Why do I have no water? I&#39;m so thirsty. Why must I ask for bread 3 times? Other tables are eating bread before their meal. Why is my waitress overcharging my credit card on a half cash half card payment? Did she think she could pocket the cash and I wouldn&#39;t notice? Why are all the wait help flown here not grown here with the exception of a few?
...the hostess that answers their business phone, needs training on how to professionally answer the specific question regarding reservations!

My husband and I went there during lunch hours .  First of all the restaurant is clean, beautiful and no wait time..  The waiter was very attentive making sure our drinks were all fill and did not get pas half way..  Brought us additional white napkins .. We had hot wings , special number 17  chicken pasta top with basil pasta  and my husband had the club sandwich .   The amount of food they give is well worth the money ..  We had to get to go boxes  ...   For desert we had a chocolate cheese cake . It made my mouth water delicious ..  I would definitely recommend this place to my friends

Big menu, big portions, moderate prices. Chicken Madeira was more sweet than savory, but the steak Diane was spot on tasty and tender medium rare. 2 hours of free parking at the royal hawaiian - go for an early dinner (4pm) after surfing so you can avoid the line

Love this place and the wheat bread! <br><br>Cheesecake Factory is kind of expensive to begin with, so I was expecting crazy prices since we&#39;re in Hawaii, but the prices seemed to be more or less the same as on the mainland. I&#39;m pretty sure dinner here was cheaper than what we normally pay at Chili&#39;s for our family of four. <br><br>We arrived just in time to beat the dinner rush, and were seated fairly quickly.<br><br>Our server was FAST and attentive. <br><br>The portions are pretty huge, so there was plenty of food to take home with us. <br><br>Will definitely be returning when we&#39;re in the Waikiki area.

What can I say? It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory! Cheesecake options up the ying yang. But wait! There&#39;s more....Hibachi Steak, ribeye steaks, and plenty more food options to choose from that I&#39;ve never been disappointed with. Sometimes the wait can get long, but if you don&#39;t have a group with you, just go the bars. Yes, there are two of them. The one all the way in the back isn&#39;t as big as the one you see in the front, but has seating.

Ok, so we usually come here for the ambiance and calamari. Today i ordered the shrimp and bacon club which was delish. I usually never give a bad review unless something stands out and ruins the experience. Today I give this place 3 stars based on service. Lauren P was our waitress. First off, we asked for knives because our table had none for us to butter our bread but she forgot and never brought any. Second, I ordered a beer and was almost done with my first so I ordered a second beer because I didn&#39;t know when she would be back. She came back pretty quickly but refused to drop the second beer and glass even tho she already picked up my first bottle. She stated that we can&#39;t have 2 drinks at a time. I am familiar with the stacking laws in Hawaii but I didn&#39;t need another glass and I had no other beer bottle on the table with me and my bf who is well above drinking age. When she came back to the table as expected a long while later (15 mins) I told her to cancel the second beer. She said ok but proceeded to ask us if we were done with our appetizers even tho there was still some on the plate. She never checked to see if our drinks needed to be refilled. To top it all off she forgot to take the 2nd beer that she never served off of the bill!!! I&#39;m so disappointed with the service that at the moment I&#39;m thinking I want to give them 2 stars! Pppfftttt!

I don&#39;t frequent this place too often, but I always enjoy it!!<br><br>There is always a wait.. ALWAYS! But its right next to the beach, and even though they say the pagers won&#39;t reach that far, they do!! So do a little shopping or relax by the beach til its your turn. <br><br>The restaurant is nicely decorated and puts out a really good feel. I&#39;m always really comfortable in there. The menu has a modest selection, and everything I&#39;ve tried, I&#39;ve enjoyed.<br><br>And then its dessert time!!! So many delicious cheesecakes to choose from. You can&#39;t go wrong!

I would give it 5 stars but waiting 45 mins is too long. BUT! Just get there early enough so you can put your name down (they don&#39;t take reservations) &amp; go shopping! This place is great for kids (noisy so no one will mind if they&#39;re making a lot of noise), they also give kids a bread &amp; banana plate. Start off with the Mac &amp; Cheese balls, they are deep fried to perfection &amp; the accompanying marinara sauce which seems to be cheesy, makes the experience even more enjoyable. Also, try the shrimp bistro pasta, it&#39;s a must.

Came here for a blueberry white choc cheesecake lunch! Was a neat one with the original cheesecake swirled with blueberries with white chocolate mousse. Coupled this with the Tropical smoothie which had the refreshing icy blend of mango, passionfruit, pineapple and coconut- perfect for the warmth!<br><br>Didn&#39;t realise until we were sat down by a waiter how big the place was- we kept walking in towards the back, deeper and deeper and there were so many tables! And they were all packed or almost! Such a popular place- but you can see why for it&#39;s great cheesecakes- the hardest part is always picking one out of the many many they have on offer!<br><br>Definitely a must visit if you like cheesecakes- classic American!
The wait was atrocious, we literally waited two hours... The service was fast and friendly but the quality of the food was not that of what I would expect from other restaurants, overall ok.

DELICIOUS!!!!<br><br>My family and I eat at The Cheesecake Factory where we live and there is ALWAYS a wait no matter which time or location you go to, but this wait was WORTH IT! <br><br>We put our name in and had an hour and a half wait so we shopped for about an hour went back checked our name and had about a 5 minute wait from there. Our waitress was ON TOP OF IT! We never had to ask for a refill, she was friendly, she gave us bread as soon as it was running low, and our food was delicious!<br><br>I defiantly recommend going about an hour or two before you want to eat and put your name in and then do some shopping while you wait!

Happy Birthday to me!<br><br>The food was yummy and so were the drinks.  The part that got to me was definitely the wait.  I am pretty sure we waited over an hour, and we came early!  We ended up eating at the bar on the high table and it was fine.  We had a margarita and shared some apps.  I would go back but probably not if I had to wait that long again.

Very nice place , super busy , very nice food Mac cheeseburger was delicious, steak diane was delicious however they cut the steak up and it dried out a little. Chicken Parma sandwich was delicious too.

I work in Waikiki.  Next door to the Cheesecake Factory and it is constantly busy.  Always a wait and for a good reason.  Its great.<br><br>Went on a friday at 430p  Best is to get there early before the dinner crowd gets there.  They open at 11 and stay open till 10 or untill they get everyone in.  Needless to say at 430pm we went right in without a wait.  YAY!<br><br>The place is HUGE!  and our waiter (Andrew, I think) was great. Very personable.  He gave his favorites and suggestions.  Some we took others we passed on.  I do wish I took his advise and had one of those thick shakes.  it seems the put a piece of cake in a glass add ice cream and whip it up. Mmmm  Oh well, I can do it next time.<br><br>Appetizers:  Crab cake(jus ok) and Crab stuffed Won Tons(Awesome).  <br>I had the Cuban Sandwich which was great. I also reached over and stole some shrimp scampi from a friend and it was REALLY good.  <br><br>FOR DESERT......a Hershey Chocolate Cake/cheesecake. Whoa!  Im a chocolate lover and I REALLY LOVED! this.  Complete with chocolate chips and a little piece of Hershey Chocolate candy.  Damm, I had to work out twice the next day.<br><br>The overall experience was GREAT!

Arrived at the Waikiki location for lunch.  Sat at a table in the bar because it was empty.  We waited for 10 minutes for a waitress to show up.  Another 45 minutes to get water and bread.  We&#39;ve been waiting for one hour and still no food!  This is the worst lunch service since they open.

Kids macaroni and cheese had burnt char in it from either the cream sauce burning or dirty oven or pan. Failed at basics! Overweight waiter who did not want to be there and leaned on everything. Huge tourist trap if it was in town would fail.

Pretty good place to eat in waikiki !!! with dozen of menu to decide ~~~<br><br>I love the food normally we just go according to whatever the waiter or waitress say because they know most.... try to avoid Asian menu entree they are not that good... but we always order the luau salad which is amazing !! chicken bellago was good too !!!  What else most of there food is good haahahha ! I like there complimentary bread (chocolate one was gooooood)<br><br>The only let down about this place is the crazy long waiting line to get a table sometime it is right away whereas others can go 1 hour, 2 hours and even 4 hours for 10 people !!! <br><br>8 times i been there was super good but still i never get to try there cheesecake ~~~

Me and my family have been eating here every week back in 2010-2012. The food is always great. You can never go wrong with this restaurant. I love the atmosphere. We always eat at the patio to smell the ocean and feel the aloha vibe. Wait times can go to at least an hour but the area has a bunch of stores to kill time with. The wait is worth it! Sadly I had to move to California but every time I visit my family we never miss to eat at Cheesecake Factory. I will always come back here!!

I have to say, &#34;now I see why everyone is waiting forever outside&#34;. It&#39;s totally worth the wait.. Drinks and dinner was exceptional or maybe I just ordered to right things.. So full there was no room for cheesecake, perhaps next time. I highly recommend, the wait is worth it and besides there are a lot worse places to wait in the world than right on the strip in Waikiki..

I just rolled home from the Cheesecake Factory. Yes.....rolled.....because there was just SO much food in each portion! Prices are a little high, but we came home with enough leftovers for another 2 meals. Bargain if you ask me. <br><br>Parking is validated at the Royal Hawaii Hotel, 1st hour is free and $1 per hour for another 3 hours. <br><br>On a Sunday morning, 11am, we were seated relatively quick. Service was kind of slow after that. Our waiter offered bread, which we accepted but it came out after our appetizer reached our table. <br><br>The menu is extensive, and I mean longer than an OCD making a list of things to do. They have 2 pages of appetizers, just as many for their specialties, pizzas, burgers, pastas, steaks, mexican, seafood, salad and of course drinks and dessert -  you name it they probably got it. <br><br>Drink wise, I splurge and order their Peach Bellini ($9.50) Expensive, but heck, how often do I actually make it out to Cheescake Factory? Apparently only once every 1.5 years. So...<br><br>For appetizers though, I always enjoy their Avocado Eggroll. Its delightfully fatty from the avocado, yet light and with a nice plum sauce. Today we ordered their spinach and artichoke dip with tortilla chips. Heavy on the cheese and cream, lots of big chunks of artichoke in the dip.  Came with a side of sour cream and salsa. The salsa was yum, quite possibly more yum than the dip itself. <br><br>For entries, I typically get a salad. My bffs love their jambalaya. Today I ordered their lunch sized chicken piccata with angel hair pasta. Slight sour edge but creamy and yum! The bf got a mac &amp; cheese burger. The patty itself was a nice medium, pink but not bloody, tender and flavorful. <br><br>We ended with a Tuxedo Cheesecake - chocolate chocolate and then a layer of vanilla marscapone to help cut the richness of the chocolate counterparts. The whipped cream is nice and I could eat that all day instead. <br><br>Total for the Peach bellini, a cold apple cider, spinach and artichoke dip, lunch sized chicken piccata, a mac &amp; cheese burger and a tuxedo cheesecake came out to around $60. <br><br>Expensive for my tastes, but again, getting almost 2 more meals out of the deal!
Great food! They are consistent! I have only done takeout for dinner (3x in 1 week) and they are consistently great! A great go-to place when not sure about other places to eat.

service was great, restaurant food selection was great, i&#39;m a vegetarian and i find that it&#39;s hard to find a variety of options for me, but there was quite a few good options for me to get! when we got our food they were huge portions for a really good price and the food was delicious. the staff really made an effort to make sure we had everything and didn&#39;t make us feel rushed at all. they had live music and it wasn&#39;t too loud. they could have put the lights a little bit lighter but it was still a good amount of light. :-)
Take out the cheesecake we took to go and it would be 1 star. Blah service, over salty food. Better food for less in Waikiki. Go elsewhere.

It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory, there&#39;s really nothing to add in my review that you haven&#39;t already read somewhere else.  The food is great, the service is good!  What sucks is the one hour and thirty minute wait time. In San Diego, the longest I&#39;ve waited to eat at a cheesecake factory was 45 minutes.  Also theirs never a large mob of people just standing their waiting.   But I guess the tourists in Waikiki really want their cheescake.  <br><br>I ordered the shrimp scampi pasta, which is what my wife normally orders.  She isn&#39;t here with me in Hawaii so I called her and asked her what I should get.  Of course she replied with her favorite.  So in tribute to my wife I got what she would&#39;ve ordered, and it was delicious!
Fantastic food, kind hostess, fast and nice waitress. Hamburgers are charbroiled and are delicious.
Extremely long wait time. Over the service was fine but very slow. There was a lot of chaos.

Normally you have to wait in line to eat here. Today we were seated as soon as we arrived. So that is one star.<br><br>Our teenage son is notorious in our family for not liking anything. He assumed he could only eat cheesecake. Instead the menu is about 25 pages long and has almost everything. So another star from this.<br><br>We had a great set of courses, one each as the portions are huge. The waiter was very attentive and kept the kids drinks topped-up with the free refills.  <br><br>Hit the spot on News Years Eve when we had a long wait until the next meal. Thats the third star.

I am a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. They serve really tasty dishes no their menu is really extensive. Beware of the wait if you&#39;re going during dinner time. I&#39;ve waited two hours one time! Ridiculous! But the food is well worth waiting for. We had a bad experience this past visit, the bus boy was gathering our plates to clear our table when he dropped two of the plates right onto our table and in a friends plate that still had good food left on it that she was waiting to be put into a take out container. The manager came because he heard all the commotion and plates falling, etc. sodas toppled over, two people had wet attire and one meal ruined. The manager had the meal that was ruined replaced. For the inconvenience of the mess and wet attire you&#39;d think they&#39;d at least give a complimentary dessert! Nothing! This place is worthy of a five star rating but due to the unprofessional customer service and the long wait time I&#39;ve given them a 3! However the food is good!

I had miso salad and my husband had the vegan salad, delicious. The Damon was cooked to perfection. No wait to eat. This was lunch menu. Tiffany waited on us. She was fast, friendly. She was right on top of things.

Uniformity. <br><br>Chains tout their unwavering uniformity of product. I dared test Cheesecake Factory&#39;s uniformity of product by ordering their Chicken and Biscuits in Waikiki to compare it to the Chicken and Biscuits I tried many moons ago at Cheesecake Factory in Baltimore&#39;s Inner Harbor. <br><br>My official report: Both Baltimore&#39;s Inner Harbor locale and Waikiki&#39;s locale serve their Chicken and Biscuits with bite for bite exacting uniformity. Mission accomplished. <br><br>Both locales - then &amp; now - served it listless, pasty, and bland. Baltimore wasn&#39;t a fluke. This is the standard. No bang for my buck in this dish. <br><br>My Specialty Drinks were enjoyable. Strong. Tasty. Nicely garnished. Presented well. Mixed with love. Yes. I&#39;d say the new bartender&#39;s coming along swimmingly. My Spinach and Cheese Dip appetizer with it&#39;s hot, gooey goodness and crisp tortilla chips was nice. <br><br>And I compliment this Cheesecake Factory&#39;s vibrant vibe and upbeat atmosphere. <br><br>So, come on down. Do a decadent dessert. Have a Specialty Drink or four. Carouse with their namesake cheesecakes. Wallow in the wonderful open-air frontage and people watch as touristy hordes frolic to and fro on Kalakaua Av. Or ogle the tourists sitting at the table next to you. Succumb to your server&#39;s beaming bright smile &amp; pretty profile as she waits on you with aplomb. <br><br>Just don&#39;t get the Chicken and Biscuits. Your taste buds deserve better. <br><br>Uniformity. <br><br>It ain&#39;t always as good as it&#39;s touted to be.

the place smelled horrible, like throw up and sweat. i understood it was busy, and my boyfriend was not happy with our server. our server was messy and did not give us the greatest service, but when my boyfriend said something he did try his best effort to make it up. i believe he had good intentions. im a server too, so i understand rushes and the industry.<br>my meal of the black pepper shrimp with plantains, was horrible i barely ate it. my boyfriend was happy with his chx n mash potatoes. <br>we took a cheescake togo and at home we ate the delicous slice together. it was wonderful<br>honestly our house smells alot nicer and cleaner than the cheesecake factory so i wished we took the whole meal to go, well except for the shrimp.<br> 2 stars are for the cheesecake and server effort

Jen is a delightful server! From beginning to end Jen was really attentive and helpful, and she suggested all the right dishes to order!<br><br>We ordered the Thai chicken wrap for appetizer and the ono fish specials plus strawberry daiquiris!  Everything was so delicious!<br><br>Jen always made sure that our drinks were refilled and the food was to our liking! She  really made our experience at the cheesecake factory outstanding!

If I could describe this place in one word, it would be CROWDED.  I have been here on different days of the week at all different times and there is never a short line.  I even called in an order once for pick up and it was an one and a half hour wait.  I couldn&#39;t believe it.  <br><br>Don&#39;t get me wrong, the food is pretty good, and of course the CHEESECAKE is to die for.  My go to is the BANANA CREAM CHEESECAKE which has a layer of banana cream, fresh whipped cream and fresh sliced bananas.<br><br>Parking is in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center lot.  DON&#39;T park in the hotel lot... they will not validate.  <br><br>Bottom line: Opt for another location for food and just order a cheesecake to go from the little take out counter in the front.  Even with that, you will wait in a pretty long line and will be swished into the front area (where loads of people will be waiting for seats).  But at least the wait will be relatively short.
Had the smokehouse BBQ burger with sweet Potato fries. Sorry no pic of the burger. ... was too hungry to pickup the phone LoL. For dessert? Original strawberry cheesecake.

It was around 3:52 pm on a Thursday afternoon. I had placed a phone order for three items and was told that it&#39;d take around 15-20 min for pick up. The girl who took my order didn&#39;t bother reading back to me my order. And I thought it was strange. Then before I could ask her to do that she hung up on me. I thought they were busy so I gave them 25 minutes and when I showed up at the pick up counter, one item was missing. So the girl who helped me at the counter had told me she didn&#39;t take my order as she had just started her shift. I said no problem. How much longer for that one missing item? She said another 10 minutes but I ended up waiting another 20 minutes for it. Then an older guy showed up. He was apologetic and offered to talk to the girl who took my order but he didn&#39;t offer to comp a dessert or anything for causing me inconvenience. They weren&#39;t even busy at all when I showed up. Total wait time 45 minutes for a phone order. On top of that, their validation on my parking ticket still costed me $6 to park for less than one hour in the Royal Hawaiian shopping center. If their food wasn&#39;t just okay, I would not have given them even 1 star for this review. The 1 star is for the food. The customer service here DEFINITELY needs a lot of work for an establishment who has been here for a while. Staff needs lots of training and the manager needs to be more sincere about the oversight by comping the customer WITHOUT HAVING TO BE TOLD TO DO SO. They need to make sure their validation stamp WORKS! The takeaway here is ALWAYS ASK them to repeat your orders back to you BEFORE they hang up on you and ASK THE MANAGER to comp a dessert or something for your time wasted. Because they don&#39;t know what they are doing.

I admit it...I&#39;m a closet cheesecake addict and for years tend to grade restaurants on how good their cheesecake is.  But to go to a restaurant actually named after my favorite dessert???  I must&#39;ve died and gone to Heaven!  What&#39;s even better is this is a chain!  So I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory Restaurants in Seattle and LA but Hawaii&#39;s is the best!  (Not to mention the World&#39;s Busiest Cheesecake Factory.)  Okay, so what&#39;s the bad news?  First, they don&#39;t take reservations so it&#39;s first come, first serve so you could end up waiting 1- 2 hours before getting seated and it&#39;s in Waikiki where parking is a bear.  The good news is they have kick-butt cheesecake!  Oops, need to get back on track...  Situated in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, you can park in their parking structure so bad news #2 is no longer a problem.  As for the seating, try to go for an early dinner or perhaps lunch when the crowds aren&#39;t too bad.  Weekdays are better than weekends for getting tables.  The larger your party is (i.e. more than 4 people), the better an idea it is to go off-schedule.  But once you&#39;re seated, be prepared to have your brain explode!  They have an extensive menu offering food for all palates from the simple (burgers on a bun) to more sophisticated dishes (fresh catch of the day like opakapaka).  So it&#39;s not possible to not have something that someone doesn&#39;t want.  The fresh bread appetizers is a nice thing to munch on while waiting for your food.  Once it comes, I hope you&#39;re hungry because these folks provide industrial size servings.  It&#39;s a major accomplishment if you can eat all your food without having to take home the leftovers.  But you may want to do that.  Why?  Because you&#39;ll have no space for the 5 billion different cheesecake dishes they offer!  Just like their meals, they have peanut butter flavored cheesecake to chocolate cheesecake to just regular cheesecake.  They&#39;ve taken the humble cheesecake to a whole new level.  Fortunately all is not lost and if you don&#39;t have any space, you can always order the cheesecake to be packed to take home.  The servers are always excellent and food and used dishes appear and disappear like magic.  It&#39;s not easy to get to the restaurant but I promise is well worth the effort.  Bon Appetit!
The food is great but the service is horrible! The attitude is clearly that they are serving tourists they wont see again, so they are not even trying. Not coming back!

Their cheesecake is amazing! And so many kinds to choose from. Personally I think their regular food is overpriced and nothing super special. One time I had a really rude waitress but the other times the staff had been great. <br>Now when we go, we just wait in line to buy the cheesecake to go. The line is much shorter than waiting for a table, and you can eat the cheesecake in the mall or other dining area nearby.

Wait time is long as to be expected but it&#39;s pretty ridiculous when a party of two (that&#39;s told the wait is 20 minutes) watches 4-5 other parties get seated before them then the women taking names says they have no idea how we were passed up....kinda pissed since we come here everytime we visit Hawaii and it happens to be my favorite restaurant smh

The wait is horrible for dinner! Expect to wait anywhere from 45-90 minutes if you don&#39;t plan right. Go earlier so you catch the pre-dinner rush! Otherwise you can grab a buzzer, walk around Waikiki for a bit, and head back in time to get called.  On the bright side, the walk will help your appetite!<br><br>They have a huge amount of cheesecake to choose from! Wow! I like the dulce de leche even though I need to share it. <br><br>I can&#39;t do the seafood dishes because I&#39;m not a fan but the sandwiches are yummy. I like their selection of appetizers! Sometimes I just grab a couple to share and I&#39;m full! Great portions. Enough for leftovers.
I was served a Dr Pepper by the bar tables  that tasted like chicken bleach and I still had to pay for it ugh, it actually ruined my whole experience. (This was two weeks ago around 9:00)

I ate from here multiple times whilst on holidays in Hawaii. Only was able to eat inside the actual restaurant and not order takeaway once because the waiting times for a table were insanely long, 2 - 3 hours long , However the food was absolutely amazing and worth it ! I would recommend as the menu is very large and is suitable for everyone! The cheesecake here is insane and is a must have, so save room for dessert! A tad expensive but worth the price.

The food is very decent and the portions are huge. Although the line seems to be very long, actual waiting time is always very short - it&#39;s a very big restaurant with lots of tables and servers, so don&#39;t be discouraged by the people waiting outside to get in.<br>My favourite dishes were &#34;Chicken Madeira&#34;, &#34;Chicken Marsala&#34; and &#34;Seared Ahi tuna&#34; - very tasty, I couldn&#39;t stop eating when I had to, shame on me...<br>Most of the servers were great: friendly, fast, very attentive and caring: Jeffery, Theresa, Michelle, Sontamo (sp?) to name a few. I put 4 stars only because of 2 servers we had last 2 times we dined there: one didn&#39;t introduce herself and was very arrogant and inattentive (brought water with ice although we clearly asked without ice) and Sacarra M, whose face expressed annoyance with everyone and everything around her, she didn&#39;t smile even once and made us feel very unwelcome, like as if she couldn&#39;t wait to get rid of us.<br>We tried couple of cheesecakes there, but were not impressed (funny, considering their name).<br>All in all I highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner - one of a few places in Waikiki that doesn&#39;t serve exclusively Asian food.

Like most cheesecake factories, which I usually love, except for this one downfall of the location: sitting in the dark. When a healthy woman without eyesight problems can&#39;t read the menu, it&#39;s a problem. It is really dark in this joint. Maybe someone forgot to pay the electricity bills when I was in there?

The worst experience that I&#39;ve ever had!!!! I ordered the combo Steak Diane and Chicken Medeira it was burnt to a crisp like leathered beef jerky my husband ordered Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi and he got Salmon and shrimp instead that was at 9 pm we sat at 830 pm they redid both orders then my husbands steak and shrimp comes at 930 pm and my steak and chicken comes out 20 minutes later at 950 pm. We kept asking for water refills and only at 955 pm did we get it. We ordered to appetizers the guacamole that we said spicy which had zero spice or flavor we had to add salt the chips were cold and oily. The tomato mozzarella toast was ok but super sweet like they added sugar to it which was strange. I also ordered a mixed drink that tasted like diabetes in a glass. I took one sip and told the waitress to take it away. Again asked for more water which of course never came. The second time around that the food came out my steak Diane was so blue it had a pulse and was cold and my husbands was cold also. Strange yet bad experience. The waitstaff kept banging our booth and I was so upset that I just had to leave so at 958 asked for check. They comped the drink and a free slice of cheesecake. I wish we saved our money and went elsewhere

Aloha,<br>I want to start off by saying I&#39;ve never had a bad experience until tonight.<br>1- waitress not good- Ellen<br>2-manager in duty-2/03/2017 tonight horrible.<br> <br>I ordered a classic burger medium rare with cheddar cheese.<br>The order cano out wrong no cheese, I asked Ellen to have the kitchen make a fresh one. Ellen came out with the same burger and slapped some cheese on it. The manage tell me that this burger is still medium rare even after they melted the cheese. I asked him to make me a new burger, he said a medium rare burger would take 15 minutes and he suggested I just eat the burger I ordered that was wrong. FYI a medium rare burger is no more than 8 minutes at the most.<br><br>I didn&#39;t even get comped just dismissed. <br>I will never eat at Cheesecake Factory again and I will never bring my guest here from the mainland or anywhere. <br>Horrible, Horrible, Horrible, service and this manager needs to be fired. He didn&#39;t give a shit about the my satisfaction as a paying customer!!!

Very pleased with our experience at this location! Our wait was about an hour which we were totally fine with since we are on our honeymoon and we are very understanding of wait times. Our waiter was Santana (I believe) and he was WONDERFUL! Very fun and friendly! Food was of course delicious! No surprise there! This was a nice place to eat at for a change considering it&#39;s a lot more affordable compared to many of the restaurants near by. So if you need a little break on high prices for dinner, this is a nice alternative while still having yummy food!

Biggest mistake  my life. This is the worst food you can ever eat. This restaurant should be banned. Wait time is was an hour. The food is the most tasteless you will ever eat. Please stop going here. Over rated restaurant. I asked for Soucy Bang Bang Shrimp. They gave me shrimp that was sweet, as if sugar was added to it.

Dirty table, hard bread like a day or 2 old, SUPER SALTY CALAMARI, STEAK DIAMNE was just as salty. SHRIMP SCAMPI tasted old shrimp yuk!!&#39;BAD. night at least my son&#39;s American cheeseburger was good.

Food and drinks are really good. A little pricey for drinks but the atmosphere is great and it is Waikiki, so expect big places like this to overcharge. It is however,  a little dark inside. Especially at night. I&#39;m all for mood lighting, but when I can&#39;t really see my food...uuuhh maybe the setting is set too low. <br><br>Love the long island ice teas!<br>Love the pumpkin cheesecake (only seasonal) and without the extra cream on top. I find that a little greasy.<br><br>Otherwise, great place to go if you&#39;re in Waiks. They don&#39;t take reservations, so for dinner you may have to wait half an hour to an hour depending on the size of your group. I recommend putting in your names, then go shop at Forever 21! LOL! Or walk around that shopping area because there are some nice shops.

So this place rocks. <br>That is IF you can get over the fact that a.) they don&#39;t take reservations (for ANY amount of people), and b.) if the quoted 1-2 HOUR wait time doesn&#39;t completely turn you off. In any case, I present you with option c.) wait for one of the bar tables to open up (the high tops)....they are on a first-come basis. I would never (NEVER) wait that long for a restaurant. EVER. I&#39;d rather go around the corner to McDonalds than take a little beeper and wonder what to do with myself for 120 minutes. What a waste of time! Apparently, I lack patience, whereas a lot of people do not...and they choose to suffer and endure this ungodly wait time for a table. To each&#39;s own, I guess. <br>Bonus points for me that I discovered that I know an old friend that now works here. So the last time we went, I got hooked up with a table super quick! Scoreeeee! <br><br>Anyway, so once you do get a table, then be ready to browse through the most extensive menu ever. It is ridiculous. But in a very, very good way.
