There is SO MUCH to choose from....the hard part is actually narrowing down the choices!<br><br>Everything I&#39;ve had here to-date has been pretty good, too. Nothing completely mind blowing, but consistent and satisfying. I always leave full and happy. I like their veggie salad (huge bowl....good to share!), their corn cakes app, and their slider combo that comes with fries. YUMM. And of course, no matter what, I am always forced against my will to eat some cheesecake or one of their other delicious desserts at the end of my meal. <br><br>Parking is validated at the Royal Hawaiian structure. <br>Overall, a great place that will have something for everyone in your group!<br>(although if you group happens to be more than 6 people, you will likely all starve before you get seated at rush hour times)---don&#39;t say I didn&#39;t warn you! :)

been a long time since i&#39;ve been back here..still crowded as usual but we got here early about 5pm..got seated at a booth right away..ordered calamari for our appetizer..crispy n seasoned right yumm..came with 2 dippin sauces. cocktail sauce n a creamy white garlic sauce..both yummy..bf got the famous factory meatloaf..comes with grilled onions, mushroom gravy, corn succotash, mashed potatoes...i got the luau salad..it had grilled chicken breast layered with mixed salad greens, chopped pineapple, red n green peppers, carrots, green beans, onions with huge pieces of fried wonton pieces layered between salad..topped with chopped peanuts, sesame seeds, macadamia nuts n their vinaigrette...we both liked our entrees..huuuge portions! we had to doggy bag them..we lwft roon for dessert of course...we both shared the white choco raspberry truffle cheescake n chris&#39; outrageous cheesecake which has layers of coconut, choco chips, choco cake, brownie n coconut pecan frosting..damn delicious! service was great, food great.
Super long line as always but the cheesecake is always to die for we got the banana cheesecake and the peanut butter cheesecake and man I wisish I had the whole cake

The service is very good. Prepare to wait quite a while if you get here during dinner service.  As with other Cheesecake Factories, the bar area is self- seated. Wow--I witnessed some smooth moves there tonight.  We scoped out the bar area and saw that an older couple was about to leave.  They were paying their check.  Instead of waiting an hour for a table, we were advised by the hostess to hang out in the bar area and wait for a table  to open up and then claim it.  As the older couple were paying their bill, another older couple went up to their table and began making small talk.  In no time at all, they sat down with them at their table.  There were 4 chairs.  The first couple paid their bill and the second couple scored a table.  There is another bar area in the back of the restaurant and we were able to get a seat there in about 15 minutes.  The menu is huge.  The food is average.

This is just one person&#39;s opinion, but the place suuuuure didn&#39;t live up to the hype.<br><br>We went for dinner and timed it perfectly, pretty much only waited about 5 minutes then as we sat there I could see the line getting longer and longer and longer. Crazy.<br> <br>We started our meal with the ahi poke...now that was good but expensive.  It came layered with fried won ton pi and the sauce was really tasty, the perfect amount of kick to it.  It had a small tossed salad on the side which was great because the poke was maybe only a 1/4 pound serving.  Too little for the price (around $15) and waaay too little for 3 people.<br><br>I would have just ordered another poke for myself if it wasn&#39;t so expensive. Price not listed on the menu which means if you gotta ask how much you prolly can&#39;t afford it.  LOL<br><br>Anyways, I opted for the chopped salad entree which would have been perfect had it not been for pieces of corn....yuck.  I like corn but I think it should be popped, or stay on the cob, not put in a tossed green salad.  So I actually sat there and picked it out.<br><br>Others in my party had a rib eye steak which was pretty good sized and tasted ok.  The other entree that was ordered was Chicken Bellagio which was a pasta dish with a  bunch of cilantro on top.  Ok if you like it.<br><br>We also had drinks which may be why our bill was high, the cocktail menu also don&#39;t have prices on it....remember: if you gotta ask how much......<br><br>I would totally recommend the cheesecakes pricey but huge and tasty.  I would go back only for cheesecake so at least they have a side counter for that so no need to wait in that loooong ass line.

Love the food and the vibes! The only thing was the wait time. It was a Tuesday night and our wait time to be seated was an hour and a half, no lie. But our waiter took good care of us &amp; we didn&#39;t have to wait a ridiculous amount of time for our food, which was a plus because I was starved! Lol. I was so full that I did a take out on my dessert. Overall, everything was great except for the wait time to be seated.

This particular Friday night really was as good as it gets for dining out in Waikiki.  It was about 930ish and there is always a wait time, but it was only suggested to be 15min.  It was my chance to check out Forever 21 next door (which is gigantic BTW). <br><br>5 minutes into my adventure in clothes heaven, our buzzer went off.  We were surprised that it was sooner than we expected! I was actually a little disappointed that I didn&#39;t have more time to look around!  My wallet stayed happy though.<br><br>We were escorted by a very friendly greeter and led to our table on the diamond head end of the restuarant where there is live music.  Sounds obvious that a greeter should &#34;greet&#34; you, but some restaurants have the worst seater/greeters. Not so at CF. Smiles all around and small talk as they seat you.  We had a prime spot to view the entertainersat our table.  They are top notch and I&#39;m convinced I&#39;d like them to play at my wedding someday.  Very mellow classic Hawaiian and popular songs and not overpowering the conversation.<br><br>Our server came along and told us the specials and brought us our drinks (pineapple mojito and ultimate margarita) and warm bread.  My favorite is the rye bread and I could sit there noshing on it all night.  So delicious.<br><br>We ordered the ahi carppaccio which was by far the best I&#39;ve ever had.  I really appreciate all the innovation that CF puts into their dishes.  They have quite a few traditional dishes, however, the presentation and flavor is a cut above. We were oohing and ahhing over the food that was ordered by other tables.  Gorgeous! The carppaccio looked nothing like we are used to and that was a VERY good thing.  It was two thinly sliced pieces of fresh ahi the size of the whole plate.  It was drizzled with the spicy mayo and aioli, green onions, avocado and pureed jalapeno and served with a ponzu dipping sauce and namasu on the side.  It was fabulous.  (see the pic posted)<br><br>We also ordered one entree of the mac nut crusted ono with stir fried veggies.  The two generous pieces of fish were very moist and tender and served with a delicious sauce (can&#39;t remember if it was white wine or something else).  It was about $24, but worth every bite and should be shared by two if you are ordering apps.<br><br>The part that really sealed this million dollar deal was the service.  It was friendly, efficient, and professional.  I was also very impressed at the way the servers work so well together to make their work even more efficient.  Some restaurants have servers that don&#39;t look like they even know eachother, but at CF, they even help to bring out the food and clear tables for eachother.  They have got efficiency down to a science.  Everyone seems to be working toward the same goal... happy customers.<br><br>CF was a total two thumbs up experience.  I&#39;m so glad we didn&#39;t go to our usual haunts and ventured out to waikiki for late night bites.  I can&#39;t wait to go back and this time I&#39;ll save room (like not eat for a whole day) to have cheesecake.<br><br>P.S. This isn&#39;t the cheapest place to eat if you&#39;re on a budget.  It came out to just below $100 for 4 (alcoholic) drinks the fish entree, and the carppaccio appetizer.  The drinks are where they get you.  They don&#39;t have prices on the menu and it will cost you between $10-14 each.  BUT, the entrees are large and can be shared if you order a salad or apps and I&#39;m completely all for paying a bit more to get top notch service, food quality and entertainment.
When you are in the area you have to come down to cheesecake factory. You have to ask for Chris T. He is one of the best servers you will ever have. Thanks chris for awesome dinner.

We&#39;ve been here a couple times. The food is great and the portions are huge. The service is alright, nothing amazing but nothing horrible either. <br><br>Just don&#39;t come during dinner time on a weekend unless you&#39;re willing to wait 45min - 1.5 hrs  <br><br>But before 5pm they have &#34;lunch specials&#34; which is basically all their classic menu items but in smaller portions and reduced prices.

2 hour + wait on a Saturday night?!?!? No thanks. Ur food looks fabulous but it&#39;s not that fabulous and to have a line out to the street without anyone letting anyone know what the wait time is? Nope. I can go elsewhere. I&#39;m on vacation not waitcation.

We came here for an early dinner at 4pm. We got seated fairly quickly but got put right at the back of the restaurant which was completely empty. We sat there for 15 minutes and no one came near us. 2 tables were then seated near us and were immediately served. We sat there for 25 minutes in total without being acknowledged by anyone. After 25 minutes we left. We mentioned it to a host on the way out who asked if we wanted to talk to a manager. At the point we were done with the Cheesecake Factory and left.

The food at The Cheesecake Factory is ALWAYS going to be worth paying and waiting for!<br><br>My fiancé and I always eat there on special occasions (birthdays, anniversary, etc.) and sometimes just to eat when we&#39;re in the Waikiki area.  The service is always good, but it depends who you have.  The cheesecake is so top-notch, since it&#39;s homemade, and there is a variety to choose from!<br><br>Even though the drive is far and the wait is long, it is really worth it!  That&#39;s why it&#39;s always going to be my all-time favorite restaurant!!
Had a great time, loved the atmosphere but, most importantly, the food was great! Highly recommend it and don&#39;t forget your cheesecake.
Really really best food we have had in any Cheesecake Factory ! Guacamole rocked . Chicken quesadillas were too good as was veggie burger, great place for vegetarians server was very sweet too !

Not really very good at all. It&#39;s all about enormous portions and not much else. Sat in the back bar where one is forced to listen to the cacophony of whirring  blenders. Not very relaxing at all. Their signature fish dish of macadamia nut crusted ono was over cooked and fishy. They get away with it because customers are overwhelmed with the portions. Go and try any number of the other numerous restaurants in Waikiki.

I like this restaurant. Their location in Honolulu is good. The service was fast and they did a good job accommodating our group. Food as always good. Cheesecakes are amazing. My suggestion is try as many as you can. Not all at the same time but don&#39;t get stuck with the same cheesecake flavor for always.

I came here once with a party of 10.  Be sure to go in and make a reservation.  I don&#39;t think they accept reservations off the phone.  They are always packed.  Expect to wait an hour for a table.  Honestly, the whole meal took an hour so I see why the wait is so long.  <br><br>So our party was split up into 5 and 5.  Two separate tables.  For my table, we ended up ordering all of the appetizers.  That alone was enough to fill up five people, maybe more, since we were &#34;the guy&#34; table.  All of the appetizers were terrific, I would give it 4/5 stars.  <br><br>The Cheesecake was delicious! I mean, it is their specialty!  I ordered the Oreo Cheesecake, and the Godiva Cheesecake.  I recommend getting the Oreo Cheesecake.  The Godiva Cheesecake is only recommended for people who love double chocolate.  <br><br>Cheesecakes:<br>5/5 for taste<br>5/5 for presentation

Wouldn&#39;t wait or pay the prices for the food. Especially with so many other great choices in Waikiki BUT the cheesecake is on a whole other level...so so so delicious. I could probably eat two slices if I could. Haven&#39;t had one a didn&#39;t like yet although some are crazy sweet compared to others.

Enjoyed a nice birthday dinner for my 8 year old. Food came out perfectly. One of the best Cobb Salad I&#39;ve had in years. Great portions at a reasonable price. Very extensive menu with lots of choices. Of course many of them are at the $20+ per person price range. That&#39;s without even ordering a drink. Then again, You are in the heart of Waikiki.<br>If you can go before the normal dinner rush, the wait isn&#39;t bad. Otherwise, expect a 30 minute to 1 hour wait!<br>Try to make room for the desserts...

After a long (long) wait, once we got in, we had a really pleasant experience. I don&#39;t like how dark it is inside, but that&#39;s just me. Our server was great, the food comes in huge portions, and the various flavors of cheesecake make it even more fun (even though I feel like the prices were quite high for one slice of cheesecake). All in all, minus the long wait and the overly dimmed lights, it was pretty good.

I enjoy this restaurant.It&#39;s located in the heart of Waikiki.. you can get the  best foods there. Good for vegetarians and non vegetarians.If you are on diet , then this is not your restaurant.price is little expensive.But it&#39;s worth for the food you get there. Interior designed in such a way make you calm n relax.Quantity of food is more. Particularly on your vacations or holidays it&#39;s cool place to have your relaxed food.i would recommend to anyone. Even kids will enjoy the food. More dessert available.
We almost always enjoy our meal here!! Nice staff, good food and pleasant environment.

To be completely honest, sometimes I do wish The Cheesecake Factory was JUST a cheesecake factory. Their cheesecake selection? Fabulous assortment! My best friend put &#34;Trying all The Cheesecake Factory cheesecake&#34; on her bucket list. It&#39;s been over two years and she still has a looooong way to go.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here for lunches and dinners, and each time the wait is pretty long. They DO NOT take reservations. I make sure to get to Waikiki around 10:30 a.m. for lunch and around 5 p.m. for dinners. <br><br>Our servers are always very friendly and make sure our bread basket is full. I love the complimentary sweet oat bread. Their menu is huge, but the food doesn&#39;t particularly impress me. I&#39;ve been presented with undercooked pasta before that had to be sent back. The portions are large, so if you want room for cheesecake, I suggest splitting an entrée with someone.<br><br>So, moving on! Here are my recommendations:<br><br>Appetizers: Skip the appetizers unless you&#39;re with a large group. Otherwise, avocado eggrolls are the way to go.<br><br>Entrées: <br>-Four Cheese Pasta for the cheese lover (You really, really don&#39;t need that extra parmesan, honey.)<br>-Shrimp Scampi<br>-Seared Tuna Tataki Salad (My personal go-to entrée--featured on their Skinnylicious &#34;low calorie&#34; menu with 442 cal, assuming you get the tomatoes instead of the potatoes)<br><br>Cheesecake:<br>-Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake<br>-Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake<br>-Kahlua Cocoa Coffee<br><br>Extra tips:<br>-No reservations<br>-Park at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping center and get your ticket validated (2-hour complimentary validated parking)<br>-Kill some time by checking out the stores around the restaurant but don&#39;t wander too far or your buzzer won&#39;t catch the signal when they call you<br>-No room for dessert afterwards? Get it boxed! :)

We decided to spend family time in Waikiki today; and the visit would not be complete without a stop at The Cheesecake Factory. First, I&#39;m so glad that The Cheesecake Factory did not close down after the fire. The decor is beautiful; one would never know that there was a fire here. Second, the food is just okay. I ordered the shepard&#39;s pie, and it had too much garlic in it. For the rest of the day afterward, I could taste the garlic in my mouth. The noise level is loud, and the density of the noise level hits you when you enter the restaurant. However, the noise decibal level went down somewhat after we were seated off to the side. Based on food and noise, I would be inclined to give this place 3 stars. However, our server was EXCELLENT! She kept checking on us to make sure that we were okay; and she promptly showed up out of nowhere whenever we needed something (e.g., drink refills, etc.). And of course, the cheesecake for dessert is absolutely fantastic! I always choose the strawberry cheesecake; it&#39;s a classic and guaranteed pleaser.<br><br>The women&#39;s bathroom is a bit dark and feels creepy. It would be nicer if there were more lighting in there. On a side note, there was a tourist standing in front of the bathroom sink and she was openly flossing her teeth. Yuck!! I&#39;m glad that I waited until after the meal to encounter the dental hygienist in the bathroom; otherwise; I would have lost my appetite.

This place is average. The decor is nice but quite frankly, it&#39;s ridiculous when you have to wait an hour to be seated....At any given time lol<br>The food was average, but I will admit the server was excellent. Very attentive and always making sure we were ok.<br>For the service and atmosphere it gets a 5, the food is a 1. Large portions with little flavour

The wait can be long, but for my girlfriend  and I, it has always been worth it. <br><br>We have had the steak and it has always been cooked perfectly, I&#39;ve also had the fettuccine Alfredo which is always delicious, and just recently had a cheeseburger and hands down one of the best burgers I&#39;ve had. It&#39;s sooo juicy. <br><br>Sits in the heart if waikiki we usually park in the structure right before the Sheraton get our card validated at the cheesecake factory, if the wait isn&#39;t too long you won&#39;t have to pay for parking, if it is you will probably have to pay for parking. <br><br>If you haven&#39;t tried the cheesecakefactory this is a def must try.

Everything from the food to the drinks to the deserts are outstanding. There is so so much to pick from. A local favorite is the loco moco, a thick hamburger patty on top of rice topped with two eggs and bathed in rich mushroom gravy is die for. All of the portions are huge, perfect for sharing. Another favorite is the bang bang chicken and shrimp, oh so good. Service is always fast and friendly. The only bad thing is the long wait. I wish they opened earlier for breakfast and took reservations.

We called ahead for a table for 6 and was given a 45 min wait time. Misquoted by 1 hour of when we would be seated. Told us 45 mins and we had to wait 1hour and 45 mins. We were then sat all the way in the back of the patio, it&#39;s hot and stuffy and the temperature difference from walking through the restaurant to where they sat us was at least 10-15 degrees. I tried to move us to the table near an opening to outside instead of the wall and rudely was told &#34;You can&#39;t just move, there may be someone else assigned to the table!&#34; <br> When I asked if there were any other tables inside I was told it would be another 20 mins. NO WAY! So we sat in the dark stuffy corner (on our family vacation - once in a lifetime trip in HI with all 4 of my kids) <br>Turns out &#34;rude guy&#34; was our server...<br>I ordered Parmesan crusted chicken and the server said they were out of that. I was starting to think I was being filmed on WWYD? I ended up ordering appetizers since I didn&#39;t want anything else on the menu. He just gave me a disgusted look, shook his head and asked &#34;you don&#39;t want ANYTHING else?&#34; ... are you kidding me.<br>The manager came over a few mins later and said he &#34;heard&#34; we were not happy.  I explained the ridiculous long wait, the unfavorable table, the chicken that I ordered was out. He apologized for the chicken being out of stock and again offered me to order something else. When I told him &#34;no thank you&#34; he offered me complimentary cheesecake. Not for the 3 of of us that ordered cheesecake but just 1.<br>It was an anniversary trip, family vacation. We had bad services, unfriendly staff and food is mediocre. Find another place to eat if you&#39;re thinking of going here. There&#39;s a McDonald&#39;s down the street.
We love Cheesecake Factory but this place was super busy! If you are going to eat here, go early because there was a constant line outside! It was conveniently located by the mall and easy to get to.
I asked one of the waiters where the restroom is. He just completely ignored me. Such an arrogant jerk
Great Kobe beef burger. Service was friendly, food was tasty and price was reasonable. This place is one of my favourites in the area. Highly recommended.
By far my favorite place to go. The menu is huge and nothing is ever bad. Service is quick once you get a table and the Godiva brownie Sunday is always a cheat meal winner!
Good food, GREAT Cheesecake , good beer selection. Ribeye steak is excellent.<br><br>Get there early as there&#39;s qute a line after 6 PM or so

My family and I went here on a few occasions during our vacation. On Christmas Eve 2015 this place was PACKED! 2+hour wait type of packed. We ended up getter my lucky and were handed a pager from another party who had already been waiting 1.5 hours and so our 30 minute wait was a piece of cake! Once we were seated our waiter was absolutely amazing! Super friendly and outgoing. You never knew or felt like the place was crazy packed and that the servers were running around crazy. The food didn&#39;t take long at all and it all came at once with 4 people bringing it all to the table. It was all correct and delicious! We ended up ordering cheesecakes to go since we were all so stuffed. Way to go Cheesecake Factory, you made the end of our Christmas Eve perfect! We were all very impressed on how well this restaurant ran and worked together. Top notch customer service!

The best part of this restaurant is the cheesecake options. The slice is shareable and the taste is amazing. Creamy texture with a bust of flavor. I love the addition of the whip cream swirl on the side. Just a precaution, make reservations and come early. It&#39;s super crowded.

We would probably come here more often if it was not in Waikiki.  But aside from that, you get prenty of food for the price that you pay.  The service is usually pretty good.  The only thing is if you get there after 5:30 for dinner, there is usually a line and you have to wait.<br><br>There are a lot of choices, but my favorite is the Chicken Madeira.  I usually order this and don&#39;t try anything else.  But this last time, I ventured and tried their pork chop.  That was pretty good too.  The pork chop was tender and full of flavors.<br><br>We also ALWAYS order the avacado eggrolls.  The dip is superb!<br><br>Dessert...  Too many to choose from...  You just have to try them out.  I wish they had a sampler!

Great, attentive service and so much variety on the menu. No reservations are taken so prepare for a long wait. I recommend to get here when they first open. Our wait was short which was awesome. Fried Mac and cheese, carnitas, and gumbo was on our menu. Carnitas were bland as fudge but everything else was ok.
Overpriced. Over iced drinks. 1 draft beer and sangria with a ton of ice $20 plus tip. Didn&#39;t bother ordering food because both plates with bread were dirty.

My second time here and my experience was amazing. My friends and I had to wait about an hour and half to get served because we went on a Friday night but it was worth it. Tyler was our server and I can say that I have never had such a kind and courteous server like him, EVER. he made everything more enjoyable and was always trying to serve us as soon as possible with all the tables he had. He made sure our experience was as best as it could be and fast despite the crowd. Thank you Tyler T!

WT!?!? I came home and opened my take-home box to find SOMEONE ELSE&#39;S leftovers.... <br><br>Ok, so the salad I got (chopped vegtables) was not the best....tasted blah. The Adam&#39;s cheesecake was awesome....but HELLO!?!?!  I can&#39;t believe they got my take-home box WRONG!!!! That&#39;s so GROSS!!!!<br><br>CHECK YOUR BOX before you take it home!!!!!!

Well, they would&#39;ve gotten a 5, but had to wait an hour+.  I guess it&#39;s ok though-you&#39;re told that.. if they weren&#39;t great, we wouldn&#39;t have to wait :)<br><br>So, parking on the 6th floor and hiking a mile (exaggerating) to the restaurant will surely build an appetite.  Menu is freaking huge, choices are beyond abundant and the food taste is AWESOME.  Even when they&#39;re slammed, consistency is there.  <br><br>Highly recommend:<br>* Chicken Piccata<br>* BBQ Chicken Chop Salad (or Cobb salad, can&#39;t remember the actual name)<br>* Crab wontons <br>* Spicy ahi tempura rolls<br><br>If you can stand waiting an eternity for a table (and it&#39;s worth the wait), you&#39;ll be happy to have eaten there.

I had something with chicken lol the name i believe was italian so i dont quite remember but the chicken meat was white and tender and oh so delicious! I also had the tuxedo cheesecake for the first time and I loved it. I usually have the godiva one which is still my favorite but i wanted to try something new.

Yawwwwwn..  ....Over-priced and disturbing that people go here when they could have gone to Side Street Inn or The Little Village.  This place is expensive and can be had in Sacto (in other words save this place for when you are desperate in a SH$% town).  <br><br>Hawaii has far too many options get out and explore.

The wait was long but that is expected on a Saturday night at this location. Our server was Charles. Possibly the nicest waiter I&#39;ve ever had at any restaurant. 6/5 stars for him! Ask for him. Got the shrimp scampi and my wife got the chicken sandwich. Both were bomb.

This place is seriously food overload.  I always get the SAME thing here.  The MEATLOAF....come on now....how can you resist the mash potatoes, a stack of meat and gravy.  SERIOUSLY!<br><br>I love the mixed drinks there even if it is a little pricey.<br><br>Tried the nachos this past time and it was the dog&#39;s bark.  WOOF WOOF, ya hear?  Got some kalua pork on it and the peppers were great.  The salsa was fresh and so was the guacamole.  ahhhh, the goods for sure.<br><br>The wait wasn&#39;t that bad but when we left there must have been at least a 2 hour wait.  I heard them tell one group of eight &#34;1 hour and a half&#34;.  I was like WHOA.   <br><br>The wait staff was VERY helpful and VERY quick to fill water and ask if we needed anything else.<br><br>I was very impressed.....ROCK ON C. FaCtOrY !!!!!

Food was great, restaurant is loud, can barely here the person next to you. This is the second time I been here. Everything I come I pay 14.00 dollars in parking. Would have been a 4 but these guys just simply make it easy to park.

We came here from LA cheesecake over here is really good not gonna lie yesterday we came the front desk helped us and gave us a table  and the ladies were sweet and very nice and the food was good so we decided to come on Christmas night it was packed and the girls that worked on Christmas night were the most rudest people I&#39;ve met very unprofessional. They told us our wait time was an hour and 10 min so we waited an hour and 10 and later on we kept asking how many minute she rudely respond saying 20 min and after she add another 20 then we asked again she added another 10 they both kept adding time while the other people who came w us got a table, whoever they liked they would get a table come on people aren&#39;t stupid ..  very unprofessional though and over all that i asked the girl how many more minute she responded rudely saying &#34;look we r packed today it&#39;s Christmas i said yes but you keep adding time and she tells me oh no u waited an hour and 5 and i said look i have my phone and i know how to read time.. like ur telling me i waited less ? When i know and counted how long i waited at the end i asked how many she said there&#39;s 10 people Ahead of you but before she told me ur on the top first yeah right and i jus gave the timer back and said we don&#39;t want it and very rudely she responded saying Merry Christmas to you and ur family and after i didn&#39;t say anything she said some other messed up things, i didn&#39;t hear i jus walked away w my mom, she was a very big tall girl

Went here for the first time with my boyfriend this past Friday and we already were expecting a wait. Checked in and was told that there was going to be about a 40 minute wait, which was accurate. When our buzzer went off, we returned to the host stand and told the host our name. We were then asked to move to the right hand side of the host stand were we had to wait to get seated. We<br>Moved over like 2 feet and waited with several other parties to get seated. I wouldn&#39;t mind waiting to get seated if the people who were suppose to be seating customers were attempting to get people seated. My boyfriend and I stood there for another 15 minutes, waiting to hear out name but rather witnessed, two males and three females having conversation about other things that were not related to getting customers seated ( I was standing close enough to hear personal conversation and information being exchanged). Once hearing our name being called, we proceeded to the back of the Resturant, walking about 1-2 miles an hour and not sure where we were heading. Very awkward experience...Thank goodness for our server Olivia Y!!! She made this whole experience 10x better. Not only was she quick with the waters, bread and awesome and giving suggestions ( Fried Mac and Cheese and Salted Caramel Cheesecake) but she made us feel right at home. My boyfriend agreed that if it was not for our server, we would not be returning to this establishment or recommend it to others.
One of my favorite places to eat but the best part is the cheese cake. Mango key lime is the way to go!!

what do you get when you put three best friends together ( after many moons of not hanging out), good food, good waitress, and no wait for a table????!!! <br><br>A raucous of laughter and pidgin laced story telling of the current events in our lives.<br><br>Let&#39;s start with our arrival:  got to cheesecake right after work, around 4:50pm, due to anxious hunger in our tummies &amp; excitement to see each other again.   Hosts &amp; Hostesses were waiting patiently to seat people coming in, took us inside to a booth about 4:55pm. <br><br>Menu: tough tough decisions. go healthy? eat whatever your heart desires cuz hey you haven&#39;t seen your gals in eons?  i decide on the special: ginger crusted salmon with bok choy in some kind of ginger cream sauce, and BROWN RICE. The universe has finally blessed this place with brown rice on THE day we chose to eat here! chee hee!  One of my friends got the Kobe burger with mushrooms &amp; sweet potato fries, my other friend ordered the club sandwich with side french fries. <br><br>We each gave a two thumbs up to our meals.  For me the exception was the sauce, it was a bit tart for my taste buds &amp; a bit too gingery,it made me wish i ordered a good old burger, but then, I was trying to be healthy! Sweet potato fries were a WINNER! Crispy &amp; sweet and full of yummy goodness!<br><br>We just had to order dessert, cuz that&#39;s just how we do.  I ordered the Reese&#39;s cake cheesecake because they are donating 25 cents to a charity and my friend got the red velvet cheesecake, we shared amongst us.  The Reese&#39;s cheescake was really rich and whoah good.   The peanut butter made it thick &amp; the nuts at the end were a bit of a surprise.  Overall it was nice to deviate from my favorite cheesecake, the Kahlua cocoa chocolate (coffee?) cheesecake.  It was surprising richer than the red velvet concoction.   Red velvet, you can&#39;t really go wrong with that one.<br><br>Customer service:  Our waitress was on it! She knew the specials and was extremely friendly.  She was patient with us and had a great sense of humor since our dinner together brought out the sillyness in us.  Our food came out in a timely manner, and she remembered our request for straws and always smiled.  Our waitress helped make our dinner even better.<br><br>And that, my friends, is what happens when you put best friends, good food, and great service together.  A winning review and amazing memories.

Thoroughly enjoyed the company and staff were really friendly. Would appreciate more gluten-free options though. Remember to make room for cheesecake as good serves are bigger than life!!!! Take-away boxes for food leftovers are handy though. I love that cheesecake take away orders are easy to do......expect to try more slices next time I fly in from Australia.<br>The TV sitcom, Big Bang Theory does not portray how truly busy this place can get over the festive season!!!!

Awesome time in Honolulu,Hawaii!  No wait at 4:30 pm. Food arrived fast and hot. My party of five was well satisfied with this meal. Used the new cakepay app to pay for the meal and it worked perfectly.  Our waiter was polite and efficient serving us. Great job cheesecake factory!

Easily could have been 3or 4 stars, but when the bartender doesn&#39;t even say hi, how are you, and starts the conversation with what can I get you... It doesn&#39;t make you feel welcome.  The food Is the same as the all the other cheesecake factory&#39;s locations (and this location is in paradise).  The food came out so quickly I was amazed... But it&#39;s just a chain restaurant and they were slammed, so I guess they were trying to turn and burn as many tables as they could.  I will go back, but I won&#39;t sit at the bar.
I visited in this  place with my family. Overall, price&amp;taste are good for traveller but it takes a long time to wait.

If you&#39;re looking for a reasonably priced restaurant in Hawaii that will fill you up and even let you take home a doggy bag of leftovers then this is the place. Not crazy expensive and the meals are so large you really get 2 meals worth, so good value. A bit crowded and noisy as it&#39;s so big and busy and if you don&#39;t have a booth then you do sit a little too close to neighbouring tables for my liking. I had the strawberry cheesecake, it wasn&#39;t bad just ordinary but I think if you go you should choose a fancier one and make it worth the visit.
Came here for breakfast, ordered an omelette with tomato and bagel. Compared to zippy a for example great ingredients for the price.

This is one of our go-to places when we can&#39;t figure out where to go.  We sit at the bar and the ladies are always polite and provide quick service.  If you haven&#39;t tried their waffles, you must!  They are only served on Sunday during their brunch.  You really can&#39;t go wrong here.
Amazing service, huge value for money meals and the cheesecakes are to die for!! Make sure you visit on a very empty stomach!

This is my second attempt to eat dinner here, but I will not let me first try ruin it for me! <br><br>My first time was on my birthday. My mom had sent me a gift card for the factory and I was so excited to go! (Word to the wise, they do not take reservations!) We went on a Sunday at about 7:00 pm and the line was half way to the side walk, by the time we got the hostess they said it would be a 1.5 hour wait! No way I was going to do that! So try #1 was a loss.<br><br>The next weekend we went on a Saturday at 4:30 and got seated right away!! (Yay finally) I have to say the portion size of my pasta was huge!! The food came very fast and our waitress was so attentive! I had about half my dinner to take home since there was so much. We ordered one cheesecake slice apiece and then one to take home. Try #2 was a major success!<br> <br>*eat the brown bread they give you when you sit down, oh my gosh it was great!!

I really didn&#39;t think I would like TCF because it&#39;s another &#34;chain&#34; restaurant. We came here for lunch while staying in Waikiki for a couple nights recently. I was pleasantly surprised. For one thing, we got in right away. That was great. I had the fish taco platter, and it was decent and very filling; I couldn&#39;t even finish it. The kids loved their cheese pizza, and my wife liked her pasta. The waiter we had was friendly, professional, just a cool, regular guy. I would not ever try to come here at night, though. The wait to get in is unbelievable. I am too old and impatient to wait to eat food when I&#39;m plunking down money for my food. Will come back again for lunch someday though!

Getting there:  Easy to find and parking can be found cheaply with validation at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center garage.<br><br>Ambiance:  Dark but due to the hustle and bustle, it is difficult to carry intimate conversation.  Live music plays at times as well, but not featured stuff.<br><br>Service: Very courteous and helpful wait staff.  They go the extra mile in keeping water levels, food quality checks, and even parking validation for you.<br><br>Food: Typical fare for the chain restaurant.  Pasta portions are very generous but reflects the price.   If the dish isn&#39;t naturally heavy, the portions will definitely feed you for more than one meal.  If you like pasta and cheesecake, this is obviously the place to go but they also have other foods.  The menu has many choices and their specialty drinks are fruity and varied.<br><br>Who to bring: Any sized party works, but larger parties probably have a longer wait.<br><br>How much to bring: Enough to pay for a full tank of gas.<br><br>Verdict: Four stars for the food, portions, and cheesecake desserts.  I wouldn&#39;t go to this place too often given the wait and price but definitely a good place to get a satisfying variety of food.<br><br>Final notes: Weekend dinners are often an hour  wait I think.  Be prepared, this place is always busy.

Both times we ate here, the staff were wonderful, the food was great and we left feeling satisfied.  The only thing I could suggest is to up the lighting  a little, but I&#39;m not sure if that&#39;s part of their &#39;thing&#39;.  Last time we went, we had a waiter Chris R who went above and beyond to help us. Chris helped us decide what was best to eat for lunch and gave amazing advice on the selection of cheesecakes.  He also refilled my husband&#39;s drink before he could even ask (he was super impressed by this!).  We had a toddler and baby with us and Chris acknowledged them which helped them feel important too.  I watched as Chris waited people at other tables and gave every customer the same amount of effort and respect as us.  Thank you!
Brunch is yum! Big portions....so should hold you over till dinner, especially if you eat the bread
I got food poisoning from undercooked meatballs. There were disgusting pigeons all over the place as well.
Food  can either be hit or miss!!!<br>For the most part i enjoy this place, wait can be a bit long.. but again its waikiki so what can you expect..<br>Looking forward to coming back soon!

This place is outrageous.  I would personally never choose to come here because of the ridiculous wait time, but my BF&#39;s family wanted to have dinner here, so we all prepared to camp out outside the restaurant.  After an hour and a half wait, we finally got seated.  <br><br>The food is all quite good and the portions are enormous, so the value is undeniable. The  menu is so extensive that it&#39;s almost frustrating to try to pick what to eat!  We had two appetizers for the table - avocado spring rolls and crab rangoons.  Both were tasty, but the avocado spring rolls were amazingly good, packed with avocados with a cilantro sauce that really brought out the flavors.  I ordered a passion fruit mojito that was a little weak, but delicious (like minty juice). I also had the macadamia nut crusted mahi mahi, which was very tasty.  BF ordered the white chicken chili, which had white beans and a Southwestern-style, sour creamy flavor with a little kick.  Everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy their food as well.  Service was not lightning fast, but if you consider that we had 8 people, and the restaurant is enormous, it was very reasonable.<br><br>This place must be a goldmine, because it&#39;s almost like a factory the way they get people in and out.  I definitely won&#39;t be a frequent patron, because I&#39;m not into waiting over an hour to sit down, but I will return every so often.
This place is a mad house during dinner time, but the food is worth the wait and apparently so is the service. Jess P is super energetic, funny, and attentive! I love her~!

Great location. Always very busy. We had a party of 20 for a friends birthday. Upon arriving we received a buzzer and when we finally got paged we had been told that they could only seat 11 of us since the other 9 of us had not yet arrived and the other 9 of us would need to be seated elsewhere and away from us. The manager on duty, Max, was incredibly rude the entire time and not friendly to any of the children that were in our party. The waiter and waitress attending to us were more than amazing but this visit was quite horrific due to the management.

During our stay in Waikiki, we passed this Cheesecake Factory several times walking along Kalakaua and joked every time, &#34;What&#39;s Cheesecake Factory?&#34; Since we dine at this chain on the mainland, we were determined to eat only at establishments we didn&#39;t have back home.<br><br>Well, we were on Day 5 of our vacation and the DH and I just wanted something that wasn&#39;t local.  I never thought it would happen, but I was ready for a nice salad and he was ready for a burger. <br><br>Despite a crowd always waiting to be seated, our wait wasn&#39;t long - about 10 mins. But we also did just miss the lunch crowd. The service was good with a little aloha added in.  DH ordered the Factory Burger and I ordered the BBQ Chicken Salad + two Passion Iced Teas. The only reason I can&#39;t give this location five stars is the food. Almost as good but not quite. DH said his burger was a-ok and unlike the mainland, they don&#39;t serve shoe string fries. My salad was good but they were a little skimpy on the fried onion strings unlike the mainland. And my favorite CF Passion Iced Tea was lacking that same exact flavor that&#39;s consistent on the mainland. <br><br>Otherwise, a good distraction from the local fare!

$26 million Cheesecake factory most popular restaurant in Hawaii.  I will write a review if I can ever get a seat in the restaurant..... Always a line but Japanese tourist only go if there is a line.. and they take pictures of everything, hilarious to see them order pupus and main plates and no room on table for two.. eyes as big as speed racer.. taking pictures and blogging even before they eat.. but the plates so big homeless can sleep on them.  <br><br>Food is consistent and always good.. bread great.. atmosphere is not Hawaiian but they dont care.. nice live music.. good bar and the secret is that at night it is an hour wait.. but you can sit on the wall and kibitz with the tourists or go to the bar and order food.. but that gives away the only way I can eat there.. also a back bar only for local professionals after work who do not want to wait in line.  should have live music in the back and give some native Hawaiians jobs instead of just kids off the boat from LA.   <br><br>I have eaten CF in Beverly HIlls and Marina Del Rey since 1984 and only thing bad is that the restaurant is not on the beach, with the money they make.. they should buyout the Moana Surfrider and open Cheesecake Resort right on the beach and make more money than that hotel which basically wastes good beachfront restaurant space with junk food..  but they make no mistake for sure they have more money than God .. store brings life to Kalakaua street scene and Royal Hawaiian center.. if you get wait buzzer let the girls go shop Forever 21 next door.  Cheesecake makes more than Dukes about $2 million a month.. so dont forget to tip your waitress.. even though she might make more than you.  They should make a reality show and make stars out of their staff.
I know long lines &amp; Cheese Cake Factory , go together. Be it , ATL, Cleveland, Ft.Worth. The service, food &amp; lines, make this well worth the wait. You want fast-food , go to Taco Bell.

Can&#39;t beat the selection of food items at this place. So glad we have one on the island. Everything I&#39;ve eaten from this menu has tasted great. Chicken madeira, hibachi steak, kale salad, avocado egg rolls, pizza: all YUM. Cheesecake even more delicious, if that is even possible. I&#39;m especially impressed with the service. Went here recently for a friend&#39;s birthday, and our server was incredibly patient with our large party.

Always a good meal at Cheesecake Factory. We ordered buffalo bites for appetizer and were expecting 4-5 little bites but instead got 8 massive bits. We only ate 4 and boxed the rest up. Mains we both got pasta and were both amazing, large serves. We planned to have cheesecake for dessert but meals were so big we could not fit it in. Have been back since to purchase take away cheesecake. Very big meals, next time for 2 people I would order 1-2 appetizers and a main to share.

Food was consistent with the rest of the chain. We had a large party and the manager immediately introduced himself and gave us our seating options. We were sat quickly and in a beautiful area of the restaurant, near the fountain in the back with a garden view.<br><br>Service (server) was great and gave us insider tips about visiting Oahu which was nice.  What the manager didn&#39;t know was that my dad is a veteran and was meeting his military buddy that he had not seen since the 1960&#39;s. It was an important night. Like I said, service was great (our main server), they were busy...drinks (not necessarily brought by server) were quite slow, but other than that - good. <br><br>However - the manager, initially friendly, was overheard by a member of our party (as they were heading to the restroom near the host station), &#34;They&#39;ve been here for 2 hours, hopefully they&#39;ll be leaving soon.&#34; After this was said, he walked to our table and took our silverware and napkins away, stating, &#34;Just helping clean up here!&#34; Then came back a few minutes later to stand against the wall near our table (about 6-8 ft. away) and stared at us, until we basically felt pressured to leave. The funny thing was, a lot of that time was spent waiting for drinks, salads, dinner and dessert. We weren&#39;t there long after the service was complete.<br><br>Everyone in our party was trying not to rush my dad and his friend&#39;s reunion. Maybe I should have said something to the manager, I know he was just doing his job... It was a little disconcerting, it seemed that the focus was on numbers and not customer service. <br><br>Just a tip - it&#39;s loud in there, but customers can still hear what you&#39;re saying in your headset, Philadelphia!

We arrived at 630 and were told there was a 1 hour and 15 minute wait.   1 hour later we were told they were cleaning our table and it would be another 5 minutes. 15 minutes later we were told there would be another 40 minute wait.   When i went to find out what was going on. .they said that we didn&#39;t check in until 7 and were told there would be a 1 hour 45 minute wait.   They offered to seat half our party now and half later.   I was livid and refused to eat there.   I can&#39;t tell you about the food but the service sucks.  If you want to eat dinner. .go at 4 and wait 2 hours.  They are obviously understaffed and can&#39;t admit when they make mistakes with their seating.

It&#39;s always a lovely place to come with family and friend ! Big portion, great food, friendly server and awesome Long Island ice tea ! ( and that brown bread !!! ) <br><br>Being here almost every state that I visited and almost tried the entire menu ! <br><br>We love the chicken toasted salad &amp; Avocado egg roll for appetizer ! My sister always get chicken chipotle pasta   ( she ordered it at least 10 times already ) ! Bang bang chicken , chicken shrimp gumbo, white chilli chicken, Rib-eye ( 16 oz &amp; medium rare :))))))  <br><br>My favorite cheesecake is the White chocolate macadamia raspberry :D ! <br><br>The onion Ring ( big fat one ) is so gooooood ! <br><br>Tips: the portion is big ! Watch out ! And the Menu is big ! Be ready :D

Today I had lunch at the Cheesecake Factory on Oahu for the first time. I was so excited because I heard so many great things about it and I was going to be able to experience it first hand, well it wasn&#39;t what I was expecting.<br><br>I went with my nieces Sammy and Hue and my nephew Tristin. Sammy and Hua have been to the Restaurant before and just loved it. Sammy had the Chicken Madeira Hua and I we...nt with the Fettuccini Alfredo and Tristin had a plain charbroiled Hamburger.<br><br>Sammy and Tristin&#39;s food was great Hua and I not so great. The Alfredo was extremely salty we just could not eat it so we sent it back. We got two new orders a little bit better but still to salty Hua sent hers back I decide to try and eat mine and asked for more bread to help cover the saltiness. Bread, water, even bear could not cover the saltiness.<br><br>The reason I am writing this is because even though my first experience was not very good I am willing to give it one more try because of how we were treated. When we sent back the first order Wayne (sorry did not get last name) came to our table and apologized and explained what they though might have been the problem and reassured us a new order would be out shortly. Wayne was apologetic, he empathized and really showed that they care about there customers. He offered to bring out complementary drinks or food to make up for the problem. The second time he came out to talk to us again nothing but professionalism. That is the reason I will give it another try I really believe that statements made that it is the bomb is true and this was just a fluke.<br><br>One comment maybe Wayne should spend some time with the waitress Tammie she needs a little help in being more attentive to her customer even if it is an 8 year old. she was good at letting wayne know about what happened with the food we sent back, but that was about it!! she would ask a question but we never finished asking while she just walked away from us. I watched as she helped other customers and i did not see her treating them this way, she looked like she was conversating with other customers but just very vauge with us, maybe because we were &#34;locals&#34; i dont know what her problem was, but she really needs to treat customers the way she would want to be treated.

Even with the long waits and the crowded, touristy atmosphere. The food and service make up for it once you are seated. <br><br>Pros:<br>-Everything I&#39;ve had taste good and the Steak Diane will keep me coming back  when I need my red meat fix. <br>-Food comes fast<br>-Good service<br>-My father swears he had the best soup he&#39;s ever had there. <br><br>Cons:<br>-Long wait after 6<br>-No cheap parking in site<br>-Loud <br>-No intimate seating, better for groups than a date. <br><br>Tips:<br>Sometimes you can speed up the process if you find a table in the bar, I think most if not all seats are first come, first serve. Also, small bar hidden in the back, sometimes you get lucky since not many people seem to know about it(don&#39;t tell anyone ;-).

Fun place to be....<br>Great location in the middle of all the actions<br>The prices were very reasonable &amp; good portion size<br>Super busy, This place is always packed &amp; The noise <br>level is also high <br>Large alcohol menu. Limited wine list<br>The service was fantastic<br>This restaurant chain is famous for an extensive menu <br>Good live Polynesian music &amp; very enjoyable <br><br>Honestly the food in Waikiki are much better in mainland US. <br>very fresh &amp; with a little of Hawaiian twist.<br>Enjoyed &amp; love sinful deserts....great way to end the evening.

Very solid food. Long waits for dinner. <br><br>The menu is expansive, as is the wait for dinner (up to two hours sometimes). <br><br>There are two bars where you can wait - or eat - the bar in the back is under utilized, just ask for directions (it&#39;s out of the hustle and bustle).

Normally I am quite pleased with my experience at the Cheesecake Factory but today was just horrible. I ordered the Crusted Chicken Romano, my go to item on the menu, but today it completely flopped. My food was room temperature when I got it and the pasta noodles were hard and sticking together. I ordered coffee at the end of the meal and coffee was cold! Not even warm. Also, the waiter did not refill our water at all during our entire meal. NOT WORTH THE OVER AN HOUR WAIT!!

Really crowded, thanks to prime location but dinner started with really arrogant waiter.  No basic courtesy and looks like he is forced to do his job. Disgusting thats all I can say. Really pissed off and what shameful ending of an awesome day.

They are always busy but service is better than other Waikiki restaurants. <br>We had a little miss-communication with order but the manager took care of right away and he is so nice and professional!!! <br>He is a great manager!!

An hour half wait time was to be expected. But from the time we we were seated till we exited is where it counts. Katrina A was our waitress. Unreal and unbelievable how slow service was. But hey gave her the benefit of the doubt. So she took 15 minutes before she even greeted us. We sat there no menu no water. Then she got our order wrong and charged us for an extra meal which I caught by reviewing my bill.  Because the service was slow and she screwed up the order plus we were there mostly waiting during  our 2 hour sit I honestly wanted to tip her less than 10%.. however I tipped her 10% not the 15 18 or 20% she made sure to point out on the bottom of the bill.  Then as we exit she stops us after looking at the bill. She says excuse me you tipped me wrong. And that we were supposed to tip her the 20%. What a fool. Shes lucky she even got 10%. Unreal how her customer service and etiquette was... Simply rude and lacking common sense. She must&#39;ve never got the memo that small parties arent required to tip any given amount. Hey heres a tip for you Katrina... check yo self before you approach your customers and try embarrassing them... you only embarrassed yourself in front your manager and colleagues. <br><br>Atmosphere: busy and slippery floor <br>Food: delicious as always..especially the rib eye <br>Front hostess staff: very nice and friendly <br>Wait help: Booooo. Horrible
I don&#39;t like the fact that I can&#39;t make a reservation here. Waiting in line was forever and time is money

The thing to keep in mind if you decide to eat here, is that this place is constantly busy.  I came here for a late lunch one day, a Saturday, and they were packed.  <br><br>Now, I believe there are mainly two types of customers in this world: pampered, spoiled, demanding, condescending types, and those who are willing to give the help the benefit of the doubt until they actually screw up.  I think I fall into the latter category.  <br><br>So, the quality of the service here was great considering that my waitress was incredibly busy.  You may actually have to wait for a refill of water, and you may not have your meat cooked to a level perfectly suited to your palate.  Guess what?  You are still in Waikiki eating at a quality restaurant with hard working waiters and waitresses who have to deal with whiny tourists day after day after ever loving day.  If there is one thing I learned after eating here, it is that restaurant staff are an under-appreciated crowd.<br><br>Now, off my soapbox.  The food was delicious.  I had a shepherd&#39;s pie and a couple brews.  It hit the spot, and I highly recommend this dish if you decide to eat here.  Your seating choices are fantastic: you can either sit in their outdoor area on Kalakaua, or have a relaxing meal inside the restaurant.  I enjoyed the dining experience, had a terrific, hard-working waitress, and all of it was for a very reasonable price considering the location.<br><br>I didn&#39;t get to see &#34;Penny&#34; from Big Bang Theory (haha) but I still had a good time and will go back here if I&#39;m ever hungry again in Waikiki.

Awesome food, nice ambiance, friendly service....<br><br>My only complaint is the prices. Like everything else in Hawaii, this place is seriously overpriced but hey, it is the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Munch on!!

It was very fast we were seated, and the food was very good, and came out in a fast timely manner. And for the portion size, and the price for the food, it is very worth it. And the of course, you can&#39;t leave here without having the name of the restaurant, cheesecake!!!

As a local, I rather dine anywhere in Waikiki. But I had a staycation the other weekend so of course my boyfriend and I dined in Waikiki. There are so much food places to choose from in Waikiki, but we settled on this establishment because we both agreed that it&#39;s been years since either one of us ate here. As always, there&#39;s a lot of people waiting and there is almost always a wait time. But for a party of two, we waited about 15-20 minutes which isn&#39;t that bad at all. We were seated promptly and was given water. I kind of fell in love with their Shepards Pie! The first time I had one was when I visited Canada and I was searching high and low for a place that serves it. Though of course it wasn&#39;t the same, but hey, it was so good and I was very contented with that calorie-filled meal! I love how they have lunch specials of certain food items, which is just a smaller portion  Considering that this place is always packed with people, the service was alright, not the best and not the worse. As long as I get my water refilled and the check in a timely manner, then I&#39;m fine (which our server did very well). We didn&#39;t get any cheesecake for dessert (I had it once before, though it was good, I&#39;m not a fan of cheesecake-well my stomach isn&#39;t LOL). Thanks for the delicious pie, and it was so good, I&#39;ll probably come back soon (just for that though).

Of course packed as usual, not the typical menu I am accustomed to.  Service was good, decided to have the crusted chicken pasta, (why) I forget the breaded chicken gets a bit mushy after sitting on the hot pasta.<br><br>I enjoyed the buzzing atmosphere here in Waikiki, nice friendly people, but the only problem I had was my &#34;hot&#34; bread came shortly after my meal arrived which was a bummer.  The olive oil seemed the same but the balsamic vinaigrette was much different but taste very good.<br><br>Overall I had a nice dinner, should&#39;ve tried something a bit different being the menu was deserving but just chicken (lol) out and decided to be bland.

We love this place! Ok, so the food is not mind blowingly amazing but it sure is tasty and a good feed! The food servings are ginormous and even the drinks! It&#39;s certainly is great value for money. If you don&#39;t finish your food you can take it away. The menu is HUGE. There certainly is something for everyone on the menu. We have been twice in the week we were in Waikiki. The first time we had grilled fish tacos and Evelyn&#39;s Favourite Rigatoni pasta &amp; a slice of the fresh strawberry cheesecake. Both mains were great &amp; the cheesecake was nice - though I&#39;m not much of a cheesecake person but I had to try it while I was there. After seeing the next table order burgers we were excited to come back and try the burgers for ourselves. The second time we had the Americana burger with sweet potato fries and the Traditional burger with fries. Wow! The burgers there are fantastic! The meat patty is thick and juicy and cooked to your own liking. The sweet potato fries were the best I&#39;ve ever had. All meals were fresh and the service is quick. Best to go during lunch or before the dinner rush as there is ALWAYS a 30-45 minute lineup for dinner time. Were contemplating going back on our last day here!

This place is good. I&#39;ve been here a couple times and my friend and I went today to celebrate both of our birthdays. The host was really nice with seating us and the food was prepared well. We couldn&#39;t finish it all. A bit pricey, but what do you expect? It&#39;s a restaurant in Waikiki. They sang happy birthday to us and brought our cheese cakes with candles in it. It was a really good too. It&#39;s kind of dark in there and the bathrooms are big.

The Cheesecake Factory hardly needs any introduction. This one is located in the busiest part of Waikiki and is huge. Despite its capacity though, it&#39;s always packed with people especially at dinner time, and on weekends the line can extend outside with a waiting period of up to two hours.<br><br>I always took issue with their no-reservations policy, but despite this and the often lengthly waiting period, I do enjoy sitting down for a meal here. If you&#39;re the impatient type, at least you can phone in an order and pick it up within twenty minutes even when it&#39;s busy, which I imagine would be a useful factoid for tourists staying in Waikiki.<br><br>The menu is the most extensive I&#39;ve ever seen at any restaurant (I don&#39;t know how the servers manage) and is one of the reasons why this place is one of my favorite major chains. I made it my goal to try everything on their menu, but thank goodness I&#39;m over that phase. By now, I&#39;ve tried about a quarter of the food on their menu, which really is enough.<br><br>For lunch, I do enjoy their Grilled Salmon. The dinner portion is kind of pricy, but the lunch portion turned out to be more than enough to get full with. I usually order it &#34;Simply Grilled&#34; with broccoli and brown rice, but you can also get a Miso-flavored and a Crusted Filet version, neither of which are particularly that good here. I think simply grilled is the way to go if you genuinely like salmon or fish in general.<br><br>I&#39;ve also enjoyed their Shepherd&#39;s Pie on more than one occasion since it offers a generous portion of ingredients with spectacularly tasting sauce, beef mince, and mashed potato. Hardly a complicated dish, which makes it a safe bet when you&#39;re looking for quantity (the dinner portion, though I eat it by myself, can definitely be shared by two).<br><br>Most of the pasta and pizza is pretty good, too. I also enjoy their Pineapple Mojito&#39;s every now and then even though it&#39;s often mixed differently, but then The Cheesecake Factory is nothing if not for their desserts.<br><br>There are a couple sundaes and smoothies on the menu, but if you&#39;re ever here, you MUST try their cheesecake. Fresh Strawberry is the simplest and safest thing you can get, but I&#39;m a chocolate lover. I NEED my chocolate.<br><br>Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake is pretty awesome and is most appropriate around Halloween time. You can also get a good chocolate fix with their 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cake Cheesecake without compromising on your addiction to plain old cheesecake too, since this one has distinct layers of both in it, along with a hefty load of chocolate icing. But alas, the one chocolate cheesecake that satisfies me completely is the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake. It&#39;s the best, and the flavor is so rich, even I have to eat a slice in increments over the course of a week.<br><br>Decisions, decisions, decisions. . . <br><br>As it is so easy to become overwhelmed by their colossal dining and dessert menu, I truly recommend previewing their menu online or taking with you a take-out menu before sitting down for a meal. After a long wait gripping that eternal buzzer, you wouldn&#39;t want to add to your waiting time by waltzing in without a plan, after all. . .

So I order a pasta with no sausage only shrimp but instead the waitress punch in only sausage so after 20 minutes waiting for the food to arrived I was sent back and everyone is eating but me. Nice!!!

It&#39;s understandable that a restaurant reads their reviews written by guests. It&#39;s become formality to fix whatever issues arise in the reviews so that it doesn&#39;t happen again in the future. But seriously?!? To fire an employee who works hard and does her job and does it well. I&#39;ve never been to your particular restaurant but I have been to others within the chain. It&#39;s saddening that a major restaurant like yours stoops so d*mn low and throws their employees out, without taking proper procedure to learn both sides of the story. I hope by now you&#39;ve hired her back and fixed her situation. I hope by now you&#39;ve told that woman (Stephanie) with the awful review that she is no longer welcome into your restaurant to protect YOUR employees. I hope by now that you&#39;ll take the proper action when reading reviews, that the customer is NOT ALWAYS RIGHT. Apparently neither was the management of The Cheesecake Factory. What a bright shining light you&#39;ve made for yourselves on the world. I hope that others can read this review on management there and not take it out on the actual working staff that makes that place run. It&#39;s not just one man that makes your clocks tick, you&#39;re just the marks on the clock... but it&#39;s the employees that wait, clean, cook, serve, get down on their hands and knees and make people want to come back in and make the hands on the clock keep ticking. Good luck.

It may not be the finest dining experience but this place has great food and great service as well.<br><br>Their menu is huge and the choice of cheesecake is just amazing. <br><br>This restaurant is always packed and with long waiting line. If you don&#39;t mind sitting in the bar area just ask any of the staff if there are seats available so you don&#39;t have to wait for too long.<br>We went there twice and had not waited to get seats at the bar.<br><br>You can both eat and drink at the bar.

I know this place is known for their dessert, but we opt out of it.  Instead we went healthy and had chicken sandwiches and chicken salads.    <br><br>First came the bread and our waitress was nice enough to offer us evoo and vinegar instead of butter.  Then came the entrees which were nicely plated.  My chicken avocado sandwich was piled with avocado, bacon, nice thick piece of chicken breast, fresh tomatoes, lettuce and slightly grilled, humongous sizes of whole wheat  bread with oats.  <br>My meal came with a side and I had the green salad instead of the Caesar.  This place definitely serves generous portions.<br>My hubby had a huge plate of the chicken salad and that too was flavorful.  The chicken was served over a bed of rice, which I thought was interesting for a salad.  <br>For the price, the service, the ambiance way back at the bar and no lines to wait at 5p.m. in midweek deserves at least a 4 star from me =)

One hour wait to get seated. Service was great. The appetizers were delicious. A musician played and they were good. The entree.... Cashew chicken was awful. Tasted like they put the whole bottle of teriyaki sauce in the entree. Shrimp pasta with Arugula tasted like flower with tiny over cooked shrimps. Service recovery was good. Cheesecake was yummy.

Went Christmas shopping on Christmas Eve in Waikiki with the bf &amp; decided to finally eat at Cheesecake Factory for brunch. Dined in a few minutes after they opened, which is probably the best time considering that after maybe 10-20 minutes, the place got packed! It took awhile for my bf &amp; I to decide what to eat because it was hard to pick from the many different choices on their menu. But while we needed more time, our waiter offered us some bread &amp; butter. We finally made our orders, I got the combo of the Steak Diane with Shrimp Scampi with mashed potatoes, my bf got the hamburger steak dinner portion &amp; we also ordered the deep fried mac &amp; cheese &amp; fried calamari. Once our food came in soon after, we realized we got too much food. The portions here are huuuuuge! The fried calamari was yummy, which came with 2 sauces a garlic mayo &amp; a marinara sauce. The fried Mac &amp; cheese was very cheesy. My combo plate was so full of flavor but the hamburger steak wasn&#39;t anything special though. We didn&#39;t end up finishing our plates so we got take out for our left overs. <br><br>Besides the many entree choices, there are also many cheesecake choices! For dessert we ordered the white chocolate caramel macadamia cheesecake &amp; an original cheesecake with fresh strawberries. I didn&#39;t like the white chocolate caramel macadamia, I love sweets but this was just too sweet for me. So the original with strawberries was the best one. <br><br>Overall, our first dine in here was great, especially since we didn&#39;t come during peak hours of long lines &amp; long waits.
Just like the one in IL:) feeling like im home...

i have eaten at the Cheesecake Factory many times in California and never been disappointed.  I cannot say the same for the one in downtown Honolulu.<br><br>They don&#39;t take reservations or call aheads. It was first come first serve only.  When we arrived, the line was well outside the door.  After 20 minutes in line we discovered there were actually two lines.  The first was to put in your name and the second was to get a beeper.  <br><br>We were told it would be a 1 hour 7 minute  wait.  I checked in after 1 hour and 20 minutes, to find why we hadn&#39;t heard from them.  I was told they were &#34;running a little behind&#34;, and that it would be another 25 minutes.  <br><br>I checked in after another 40 minutes to ask  why we still hadn&#39;t heard from them.  I&#39;m not sure that they didn&#39;t know that it would be in excess of a 2 hour wait but just gave customers those &#34;estimates&#34; knowing that after someone had already invested more  than 1.5 hours, they would stick around for &#34;another 25 minutes&#34;.<br><br>They finally seated us  without the beeper ever going off. <br><br>We had to wait quite a while for our server.  We waited even longer for our appetizers. The salads and avocado rolls were fresh and perfectly prepared.  <br><br>We waited far far too too long for our main course.  When it arrived, two of the meals were acceptable, a third one had a steak that was hot but the salmon was barely over room temperature.  My Macadamia Ono had obviously been sitting in the window for quite a while as the fish was only slightly warm, under seasoned and a little dried out.  My brown rice had no warm to it at all.  The vegetables were perfectly cooked but near cold like the fish and rice.  I finally gave up and told them to just bag it and I&#39;d reheat and doctor it at home.  <br><br>We next ordered desert.  All they would have to do is cut it and serve right?  How wrong could that go?  When the server checked back with us, he had a distressed look on his face when he realized that after nearly 15 minutes that course not been delivered in anything close to a timely manner either.  <br><br>The Red Velvet Cheesecake was really good.  I think the reason it took so long to deliver this course to the table is that they must have run out of desert plates. The cheesecake was chilled as it should be, but the dishes were hot.  I&#39;m guessing fresh out of the dish washer.<br><br>In total our dinner adventure took 4.5 hours.  The manager knocked off the charge for the appetizer and a starter salad to help defray the cost of the parking lot overtime charges.<br><br>Will I return to the Cheesecake Factory?  In California yes, in Hawaii ... not a chance.

Unfortunately, it doesn&#39;t look like I will ever get to eat here.  Called  two times, it rang and rang and rang and both times somebody picked up the phone and hung it up   I never got to ask my question. This is not customer service.

First port of call when we go to Honolulu, without fail.<br><br>Menu has changed a few times over the past couple of years &amp; favourites taken off (Cajun 24hr marinated Rib-Eye steak being one &amp; my favourite!).<br><br>The queues.. they&#39;ve not changed in the slightest.  Still insane to get seated at peak times, but hey - thats always the case in this location for a lot of restaurants.<br><br>Meals are consistently good - not outstanding.  Don&#39;t get ambitious in your appetite either.  The portions are very HEALTHY!  We just manage one starter to share, two mains &amp; cheesecake TO GO!  Always have a cheesecake here.. It&#39;s whats the place is called after all!<br><br>I&#39;ve eaten at this chain here, San Francisco &amp; Austin, Texas.  Slight regional differences in the menu, which is good to see.  The cheesecake, remains the same though.  <br><br>You Gotta Eat Here - for sure! :-D

Avocado spring rolls were SOOOOOO good...it was a random appetizer we told the waiter to pick for us. Our main dish...the garlic noodles was BLAH...there was a really good salad a couple people got that was REALLY good too...but I totally forgot the name.<br><br>The wait was over an hour...UGH...lucky they have random shops to go to while you wait to get paged...not a big cheesecake factory fan...in Hawaii or not...kinda overrated

Food was good but service was only so so. Our drinks (iced tea and diet coke) were never refilled, so we asked for to go cups and he came back with two of the tiniest cups I&#39;ve ever seen as to go cups. Apparently tea and coke are at a premium with them, even though they charge $3.50 each!

This is a great a place to eat when you have a group or if you are just on a couples<br>date ..... the menu is loooooooong and the selection is overwhelming ... also the bread that you receive as an appetizer is one of the best on the island ... however having a drink, cheesecake and a main dish will def hurt your wallet ...

Wednesday night and waited 50 minutes for a two-top. All of that would have been ok since the food is usually good but not tonight. Bad food and a bad waitress. <br><br>We waited at the bar and got drinks and an app. The bartender was great. When we got our table, we immediately ordered. 20 min go by and the waitress says, &#34;I just checked on your food and it will be just a couple of more minutes.&#34;<br><br>20 more minutes until we finally get our food. In the mean time, a couple who sat down 30 min after us got their food. When we did get our food, the items ranged from cold to luke warm. The plates obviously sat in the window. The butter wasnt melting on my mashed potatoes because they werent hot. My hubby&#39;s plate was missing his tempura asparagus and his food was cold too. <br><br>When he notified the waitress to tell her about the missing food, she said she knew but she never mentioned anything about the missing food when she dropped our plates. Nor did she tell him the asparagus was coming. My hubby asked her to take the plate back and he didn&#39;t want a replacement. She left with a sour look on her face. <br><br>Manager Marshall came to us within 5 min and was very cordial. He attempted to make it right and comped both of our entrees. My hubby was over it and refused another plate. Marshall asked if it was ok for our server to come back to us and we agreed. <br><br>However, a different server came to finish our meal until it was time for the check.  He was nice and I started to feel better about the night although my man was still upset. Then the original server came back and she did not offer an apology. In fact, she slammed the check down with a mumbled &#34;thank you&#34; and ran away. <br><br>I deliberately left her zero tip. My man is currently a server and I was a server throughout college. Her behavior was unacceptable. The manager and second server made a good attempt at service recovery for her screw up but her sour attitude ruined it. <br><br>Total 2 hour wait for our entrees, one of which we sent back. Not worth it. I should have stayed home.

I am not a fan of chain restaurants, but you don&#39;t have much of a choice in Waikiki.  The hostess was particularly rude, however, the manager and server more than made up for her.<br><br>Wayne, the manager, and Joni, our server, were top notch.  We had 4 adults and 4 children.  We were celebrating a 3-year old birthday.  Wayne made sure we were seated in a reasonable time, and Joni was fantastic with the kids.  Wayne made sure we had a red velvet cheesecake defrosted in time for our dinner.  And, did I say how fantastic Joni was?<br><br>Although I have said I am not a fan of chain restaurants, I will definitely go back to this one.  In fact, I might even try the Denver location!<br><br>Thanks to Wayne and Joni!!!

My friends and I all went out to cheese cake as a treat to ourself.  We love Cheesecake Factory because during the wait, all the guys sit at the bar, and all the girls walk around and shop.  The service at the bar was great.  Really a 5/5.  But as soon as we got our seats our new waiter totally forgot about us.  I don&#39;t mind waiting for food, I understand it takes time to cook, but my problem is when the waiters take a half and hour just to greet you at the table. I really like when the waiters check in on you, refill your bread and water while you wait, but our waiter never did that.  The only time we saw him was when he brought us food.  We even had to get up and find him to get our check because we got tired of waiting. It&#39;s so difficult because we love the food and location at Cheesecake Factory but the service really kills it for us and I&#39;m not sure if we&#39;ll go back.

Did a phone order, picked up my dinner and headed home.  When I got home and opened the package there were no corn in the Santa Fe Salad and the Factory Nachos had no guacamole and sour cream.  This was a total disappointment.

I called the restaurant in the morning to ask if they take dinner reservations for large parties (it&#39;s normally walk in only but I figured since we had 20 people, I figured the could accommodate us with a reservation) and the women said no. I asked how long the wait would be for a party that large and she said, &#34;anywhere from 20 minutes to 3 hours, we don&#39;t take reservations.&#34; So I was a little irritated and told her that I thought it was ridiculous for a restaurant to not want to accommodate a large party like that and then said thank you, to only hear the phone slam down and see my call ended. Not sure who I spoke to, couldn&#39;t get a name because she hung up on me. Later that evening, one person from our party went down early and put our name down at 5:30pm which ended up only being 10 of us because the rest of the party could not make it. They told him that the wait would be 90 minutes to 2 hours.
