Cheesecake....My nemesis. You have a power and control over me that cannot be denied. It is because of you, my evil cheesecake that my ASS looks like 2 extra large yelp petals. I hate you, but I love you. <br><br>Its 4th of July weekend...I scrapped all my plans for fireworks for some fried mac n cheese balls and it was worth every bite :-)<br><br>Here&#39;s the low down for hostess seating times:<br><br>15 min  = 25 min<br>20-25 min = 20-25 min<br>30-45 min = 45-50 min<br>1 hour = 45-50 mins<br>1.5 hour = 1-1.75 hours<br>2 hour = 2 hours<br><br>We got a 1 hour wait, which fortunately for me in the above chart meant I only had to wait 45 minutes! Yet!<br><br>The service is great, the prices are steep, and the food is consistent, unhealthy and delicious.<br><br>My kids are always stoked to eat here and mommy loves the blueberry mojitos.<br><br>Reece&#39;s chocolate cake cheesecake is &#34;beyond out of this world, if I never had another orgasm for the rest of my life it would be ok cause I had this cheesecake&#34; kind of good.    <br><br>Most often you walk away with a yummy doggy bag.

I haven&#39;t eaten at the Cheesecake factory since I moved from Las Vegas back home here on Oahu.  But about five years later as luck would have it, as me and the fiance were walking around Waikiki pondering where we should eat for lunch, there was a sudden shift in the universe and we landed at the front door of this place.  It didn&#39;t seem crowded so we decided we&#39;d give it a try.  <br><br>I remember their menu as being quite extensive (at least over 5 pages), and as I turned from page to page I just felt more confusion phasing over me because I was stumped as to what to get.  Wanting to simplify things I decided I&#39;d choose from just their lunch specials.  Well dammit, even that was hard because there still was so many options.  WHHHYY??  Why must everything look so good???  Finally, I settled on the salad and pizza combo choosing the caesar salad ($1 extra) and the four seasons pizza (artichoke, tomato, prosciutto, wild mushrooms, and mozzarella) and the fiance got the wild mushroom burger, and we got the firecracker salmon as an appetizer.  The appetizer was awesome.  Salmon strips wrapped in spinach and a wonton wrapper, deep fried and served with a sweet hot chili sauce.  Then our meals came.  Holy moly did I accidentally order two whole meals because my salad came in a bowl (think CPK whole salad size) and a 6pc pizza (again, CPK size pizza)... all as one lunch dish??  I looked around to see if anyone was starring at me thinking if I was a baby cow, but I noticed that EVERYONE&#39;S tables looked like ours: big plates covering the whole table.  Even my fiance&#39;s burger couldn&#39;t fit in his mouth it was so big (no sexual visual intended. lol).  And everything tasted decent.  Nice!<br><br>Fast forward to Mother&#39;s Day, my mom wanted to come here because she wanted to shop at the 3-story Forever 21 next door, so we came in for their brunch (only served on Sundays).  Still not knowing what to order and craving a caesar salad (those get me every time) I ordered the salad and pizza combo again, but this time I got the margherita pizza and mom got the sunrise fiesta burrito (egg, chorizo, peppers, onions, potatoes, and cheese and topped with salsa, cilantro, and an avocado cream sauce served with a side of black beans).  I already knew what my food was going to look like, what i didn&#39;t expect was mom&#39;s footlong breakfast burrito.  This place cannot stop surprising me with the size of their food.  Her burrito was soo tasty too, the only thing we didn&#39;t like were her black beans, way too salty.<br><br>This place wins the gold medal for great quantity and good quality food at the right price.  I am definitely going to keep coming back... and next time I promise I&#39;ll order something new.

The wait is normally an hour or more but this is their busiest location in the country so expect it! Aside from that everything is great. Regular menu as the other locations, easily located in Waikiki. We normally go once each time we visit after a long day of snorkeling!

The only reason I don&#39;t give it 5 stars is because there is always a wait. I&#39;ve only been here once during a really weird between lunch and dinner time where i got seated quickly. It&#39;s not their fault, but it&#39;s still a negative. <br>I love the red velvet cheesecake. It&#39;s the whole reason I come. The food is good, but you don&#39;t come to the cheesecake factory and wait the hour to get your table for the food. you wait for the cheesecake, and it&#39;s worth it in my opinion.

food 5 stars<br>cheesecake 5 stars<br>service 4 stars<br><br>wait time? for those who complain about the wait time, well it&#39;s not their fault... it just means that they bring in good business and it&#39;s nothing personal... if you can&#39;t wait then go somewhere else:)

Honestly, I was really surprised. I expected a run of the mill American chain restaurant salad.<br><br>I was knocked off my chair when I saw and tasted my ahi tuna salad with tomato, avocado, pickled ginger, greens and about 6 oz worth of some of the best ahi tuna I&#39;ve ever had. All for $17 US.<br><br>The coffee sucked, but who cares? The salad was superb.

One of the better chain restaurants of its class. I have been to this location about four times and each time it was good. The burgers and pizza&#39;s are good. They also have huge portions which always gets my approval.<br><br>The wait is a bit of a drag but hey everyone should be on island time.

The waiters were incredibly polite and I enjoyed the bread our table was provided with. Yet, the veggie burger was underwhelming as the patty was lukewarm and crumbled apart. While I was disappointed by the meal, my family enjoyed theirs.

My gf and I had dinner at back bar recently. Bartender Chris attempted to help us but I think because he was alone at the bar, his frustration leaked into his customer service. Everything we asked for seemed to annoy him. The only thing that saved his tip was the runners bringing the food on time. 3 days later we were going to the magic show across the street with another couple. We went to back bar again hoping Chris was not there. Unfortunately Chris was there. We ordered drinks only and he was negative as ever. My friend payed for the round and commented that the bartender did not smile once. All I have to say is, we are on vacation to have a good time and meet cool food service people, being that my gf are both bartenders. Some people are not wired to be in customer service, Chris is one of those people. Will never return to bar as long as he is there.

Good freaking grief, I don&#39;t even know where to start.  We were regulars at CKF.  The service is so bad and the food isn&#39;t any better.  They screwed up my friends meal, serving his pasta raw. Raw like crunchy in the middle and stick to your teeth raw.  He always orders the same thing, when he sent it back the manager told him &#34;maybe it&#39;s time for you to try something else.&#34;  Ummmm F U dude, I go out to eat and pay you to eat what I want to eat! They treat everyone like tourists they&#39;ll never see again, so they don&#39;t really care if you like the food or service.  You suck Waikiki Cheesecake Factory.

Good service friendly staff and amazing food! Our server was a little soft spoken and was hard to hear him sometimes but he checked back quite often and kept our drinks filled.<br><br>Also we were celebrating our friends birthday and they were more than willing to get everyones attention and sing happy birthday for him.

Amazing! The service was fantastic. Their manager, I believe his name was Dan? Was fantastic. We had a conversation with him and it was like we were talking to a friend. Which was the same for their entire staff. Busboys to waiters to hosts. Fantastic. It&#39;s worth the wait.

I usually like eating here and have brought friends to try my favorite, Steak Diane.  This te was horrible!  My steak was tough and charred. My Faye&#39;s food was supposedly Kobe but not like any that she had there previously.  I cannot see throwing good<br>Money in going back......at least until the memory or taste goes away. <br>I only give it a one star so that I can post this review.  Don&#39;t waste your money!

Amazing how busy this place is EVERY single day and night.  It is a huge restaurant though so the line seems to move.  We stopped in for dinner. Wait was over an hour but bartender pointed us toward the rear bar. It&#39;s a hidden gem!  Sat right down with no wait!  Typical CF menu and consistently prepared as usual. The bartender in back was friendly and efficient. Will go back!

Let me preface this review by saying I would never wait the crazy two hour wait that is normal for dinner time at this Waikiki tourist hotspot. However, when I get off work and can get an open seat at the bar, I&#39;m very happy to be eating a late dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. (And they are open till 12, so late night eats are always an option here!)<br><br>Although I can never imagine taking the menu test to wait tables here, I think its safe to say that there is truly something on the menu for everyone! If you can&#39;t find something to order here, you probably should never leave home! Seriously, pasta, sandwiches, salads, tacos, fresh fish, you name it, they got it! And being that they are so corporate, the food is consistently good, no matter what you order. My favorite of late has been the blackened chicken sandwich with a green salad instead of fries (although they do offer sweet potato fries which are highly temping!). The sandwich is massive--as in I usually take half of it home--and costs less than $12! Can&#39;t complain about that! Their salads are yummy too, but I know from experience that the lunch size portions available in the daytime are much more managable!<br><br>So if you want to brave the crowds (normally a 50/50 mix of Japanese tourists and and mainlands tourists too scared to branch out and try a restaurant they don&#39;t have back home...) the Cheesecake factory is usually a tasty choice. Just remember, it will be less crowded if you&#39;re up for a late lunch or even later dinner. And they do validate parking in the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center parking lot, always a plus! Happy eating!

What a fabulous place! People so friendly and the Food... Parking is at the Ewa Mauka side of the structure. There are different parking areas. Be sure to park in the right area. There are signs. Aloha and have a great dining experience here!

Our youngest wanted to try this place so reluctantly we agreed to get a buzzer and wait 20 minutes for a table, which isn&#39;t too bad given how long you can wait for. They do it really well once you get in in terms of service, menu is huge as are the meals.  The food is good and given the size not bad value.  Beer expensive and no prices on the menu.

I love this place. The line may be long, but there&#39;s great entertainment wherever you turn in Waikiki. The one thing I always get is the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo. And why come to Cheesecake Factory without a slice of cheesecake right? I&#39;m old fashioned and I like to stick to the original. The white chocolate cheesecake was amazing, but it was too sweet for my tastebuds. There&#39;s so much to choose from, but I always stick to the good ol&#39; gumbo. It&#39;s really worth it since they give you a huge portion of that. There&#39;s always enough to take home and savor the next day. It sucks that there&#39;s no reservations but i guess if you really do love the food, you&#39;d wait and I did.

This Cheesecake Factory has to be one of the busiest ones I&#39;ve ever been to. That being said, when you&#39;re craving pineapple upside down cheesecake or the carrot cake cheesecake (my favorites), and you&#39;ve eaten your fill of the chocolate cream haupia cakes from the ABC Stores, lol, this is the place to go! Desserts here NEVER disappoint!<br><br>If you&#39;re not up for the wait and just want some cheesecake, there&#39;s a register on the right hand side coming in where the cheesecakes are displayed. You can get what you want to go a lot faster.  :)

Went here because hubby&#39;s craving for cheesecake. The place was crowded as always. I was surprised that we didn&#39;t have to wait too long. Staff was not friendly enough, seems like everyone&#39;s rushing to do their tasks. Menu was extensive and before I could decide on what to order, the waiter came (again) to ask what do I want. He didn&#39;t even bother explaining sizes/portions of our orders, like salads in lunch or appetizer sizes. Before you can have your order, you&#39;ll be full with their bread and butter which is btw good. And guess what, you can pass the time by counting how many staffs they have. The place is cozy and I like that they kind of putting families with young kids in one place. But I felt like their lights are too dim. Food is good, cheesecakes are good. But their service needs improvement, and more lighting would be nice.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been a &#34;very okay&#34; place to eat. Today, we thought we&#39;d try their breakfast, but I guess we&#39;ll never experience it. Can&#39;t get over these Waikiki establishments that treat locals like second rate customers.  We walked in--obviously local residents dressed appropriately, and host guy was local too.  Lo and behold, we were directed to the far back at the tiny table off to the side. There were many available large tables and booths near windows. Also, there were many parties of two sitting on these desirable tables. <br><br>Sorry, but with a ton of other places to try,  we didn&#39;t feel like trying to work it out with the host. and left.  We probably won&#39;t be back, and I WILL yelp this.  I&#39;m on a Staycation (the Sheraton Kai Suite has been phenomenal), but I will maintain that all too often, businesses like The Cheesecake Factory make me save my money for vacations out of state.
Went to Cheesecake Factory for my friend&#39;s birthday and although the restaurant was busy, there was minimal wait time.  The seating area is private with semi-circular booths available.

Kyle was our waiter he was more than amazing. So polite, always had a smile, and we never had to ask for a refill as he was on top of his serving game. So far the best waiter I&#39;ve had at this location. <br><br>Expect to wait at this location because it&#39;s in the heart of Waikiki and all the tourists are wanting to try out this spot.

The food is always good and service welcoming. I love their Luau salad (sp?) and cheesecakes. The only thing I dislike is the wait and then after hours when you get seated they put you right next to the table with other people and you feel like part of their party. NO privacy at all!! And you can never reserve a table. The best way to get dinner is to grab a seats by the bar, if you don&#39;t mind eating by the bar. So much faster and normally no or little wait, but never the same as you are waiting for the table.

yummmm!! seriously the nicest food. yes there are large portions but anytime before 5pm you can get the lunch time portions slightly smaller.<br><br>I&#39;ve had the pasta here a couple of times and it&#39;s been cooked perfectly! and so fresh you can taste the fresh basil.. <br><br>we also had cheesecake ordered to go! as we could never finish our meals here. we took a doggy bag after of our meals.<br><br>mango key like was the best!!
Food was really good service a little slow. Menu had so many choices. Wasn&#39;t the cleanest cheesecake factory that I&#39;ve been to

Our wait time was underestimated by a mile. When we finally get seated after 2 hours, our young server did not know the meaning of attention to details. We ordered 3 appetizers, as our party was pretty large. One came out, but she never put in the other two  Wow! Then, we said 2 separate checks &amp; even pointed out the division for her. Why did we get one check again? When we ordered cheesecakes to go, she put them all in one bag. We told her we needed more bags to separate the orders. She apologized &amp; said she&#39;ll get the extra bags &amp; separate the orders for us. Ummm.. She gave us the bags &amp; walked away. Really?? The only saving grace for this particular restaurant location was the delicious meal that I had &amp; the fact that it was my birthday. Otherwise, they would&#39;ve gotten a one star.

I believe everyone who visits CF only goes for the cheesecake, but only cheesecake for lunch or dinner is looked down upon (unless you&#39;re me) so people order food as well. <br><br>I&#39;m not a fan of their food. I&#39;m a fan of their cheesecake. I&#39;ve never had one I didn&#39;t like. I&#39;m obsessed with their lemon raspberry ladyfinger cheesecake. It&#39;s super tasty, but still light and won&#39;t weigh you down. <br><br>The ONLY food  I like here is their fried mac &amp; cheese balls. I come there about once every few months &amp; commit &#34;carbicide&#34; when I order them. But oh so worth it. <br><br>My advice is to order an appetizer &amp; cheesecake. Their food isn&#39;t worth the price. Or simply get a cheesecake slice from their to go counter &amp; go eat it in the peace of your hotel room or on the beach where you can be gluttonous in private.

&#34;Hey Grant let&#39;s go have dinner in Waikiki&#34;<br>&#34;ok&#34;<br><br>Little did I know that my little sister set me up... big time.  We had dinner at Koa Ave but then I got blindsided by a visit to Forever 21.  The strip of Waikiki was bangin&#39; for it being a Tuesday night with tourists checking out pretty much anything that was open (which was everything).<br><br>Upon arriving at Forever21 I had a choice, either go with her into the store and undoubtedly be the straightest guy in the place, or check how much money was left on a Cheesecake Factory Gift Card.  Guess what I did.  I won&#39;t lie, I stepped foot into Forever21, but not far.<br><br>What surprised me was the ridiculous amount of people milling around outside and in front of the Cheesecake Factory.  It was difficult getting inside not to mention I had to stand in this loooooong line at the cheesecake counter.<br><br>Turns out a $50 gift card from like 5 years ago retains its full value.  Good deal.  The staff was quite competent and friendly despite getting slammed harder than your pinky in your car door.  Props to them for not being moody soul eaters like some other places I know.  Despite having to shout my order to the person taking my order 18 inches from me, they got everything right, so I tipped them the balance on the card after getting $40 worth of cheesecake.  <br><br>I really appreciate all the workers keeping their composure at such a busy hour on such a strange day.  Keep up the good work.

Living in Vegas for 5 years, I ate at Cheesecake Factory in Caesers over a hundred times. Don&#39;t ask why. I have no answer. I am serious too, 100 times. and there goes Love&#39;s street cred on yelp, instantly gone.<br><br>Since opening in Honolulu 5 years ago, I have eaten at CF, 3 times. <br>Don&#39;t ask why. I have no answer.<br><br>Nothing on the menu really impresses me, except I like the Ranch and I dip everything in it. I always complain that the chicken lettuce wraps don&#39;t come with enough chicken, the scampi is too oily, I don&#39;t like the chicken marsala, the salad&#39;s aren&#39;t healthy, I dig the fried mac n cheese balls but after a couple bites I tank 2 glasses of water, it&#39;s rich. Cheesecake is like any other cheesecake but with crazy swirls and toppings.<br><br>Yet, when I visit Vegas in January, I will probably eat at CF in Caesers.<br>again don&#39;t friggin ask.<br><br>Eat at CF in Honolulu and save the rest of the cool spots for me.

I just gave Cheesecake Factory 5 stars. I hardly ever give anything 5 stars. I can&#39;t believe I&#39;m doing this. I&#39;m giving a national chain a 5 star rating. This is a place I don&#39;t even come to voluntarily (please see my below rating for reference to BF dragging me here: ) But their customer service and attention to detail should give them an extra star. <br><br>OK, here goes:<br><br>We went back last night. We ordered Buffalo Blasts. They were delicious. This place has THE BEST BLUE CHEESE DRESSING. Hands down. Great dressing base and then tons of fresh blue cheese. Anyway, we also had the Steak Diane/Madeira combo and a BBQ Chicken Salad. All were, as always, really really tasty. <br><br>This is why I&#39;m bumping the Factory up a star:  My salad was a little late getting to the table. Ok, not a good reason to give them an extra star, but the manager came out with my salad. He told me they had to make another salad because mine had been sitting there. They messed up on the original order. No biggie. It wasn&#39;t even that bad of a wait. The manager apologized. I accepted and continued on happily with my food. At the end of the meal, we ordered a cheesecake to go. The bill arrived and the server said the cheesecake was COMPED because of my wait for the salad. Wow! Thanks! You just voluntarily gave me a slice of cake. On our way out, the manager ran into us and double checked that we were happy when leaving. He apologized again and hoped we were content with the free dessert. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is always on their game. Mistakes are going to happen though and when the do, they really step up to the plate and muthafuckn deliver. Obviously this place has the means to give me a free slice of cheesecake, but it&#39;s the thought that counts. And I didn&#39;t even complain about the wait for my food.  I didn&#39;t even have to beg mercilessly for something free because I had been &#34;inconvenienced&#34;. It&#39;s not too often there&#39;s customer service like that anymore.<br><br>Big up to the manager for following through. This place rocks.

This location is world-class outdoor seating exciting fun loud great food what can I say it&#39;s awesome! I&#39;m giving four stars instead of five only because there&#39;s a two hour wait on a daily basis to get in and that just sucks

We had a class act experience tonight at TCF.  I ordered a Steak Diane and my man ordered the pork chop.  While his meal came in a timely fashion, a mix-up in the always busy kitchen caused my dish to come out after he finished his meal, so bartender, Nick, and floor manager, Marshall, partnered together to give us a fair reconciliation of the bill.  We even walked away with a complimentary slice of cheesecake.  We appreciate the accountability and the generousity of spirit.  Our meals were delicious too!  We&#39;ll be back.

Overpriced food, ridiculously long lines especially for dinner (2 hours, are you kidding me!!). Soup arrived cold, burrito was edible but thats it, much much better food and service at PF Changs just around the corner.

Avoid it like the plague on Friday/Saturday nights unless you eat dinner at 4PM--the long wait can reach ridiculousness (i.e. 2 hours). I come for lunch because my fuse is too short for the line and the lunch specials are perfect in portion and price.<br><br>The Avocado Eggrolls and the Spicy Ahi Tempura Rolls (make sure to tell the server you don&#39;t like your fish overcooked) are just deelish. It&#39;s bizarre for me to rave about Asian-inspired food at chain restaurants, but these are rare cases. And I don&#39;t care if this place is a chain, I can&#39;t afford to eat at Alan Wong&#39;s all the time.<br><br>The dish I order on every visit is the Pasta Da Vinci (sauteed chicken, shittake mushrooms, caramelized onions, Madeira wine, penne pasta). It&#39;s FAMAZING! I try to bypass the cheesecake. Like Prince William they&#39;re rich and delicious, but they&#39;re around 1,000 calories per SLICE! I don&#39;t know about you, but I rather have 4 Subway sandwiches.<br><br>Who needs dessert when the waiters are so sweet-looking anyway? I swear, Abercrombie models moonlight as Cheesecake Factory servers or something.
Management here in Waikiki needs to cater to who spends the most money here and ensure Japanese, Hong Kong translation is available at every shift seriously.

So when I was talking to a friend from college that lives in Honolulu, she says, &#34;Yo, you HAVE to try out the poke at Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s the bomb!&#34; I&#39;m like, really?<br><br>Well, it is.<br><br>Came here with my family the other night and finally gave the poke a try. Served sandwiched between two thin triangles of seasoned flatbread, covered in fresh shredded green onions, I thought the poke was, in fact, pretty awesome. I was a little less thrilled about the grilled macadamia nut crusted hawaiian fish, mahi mahi, in this case. The macadamia nut crust was a nice touch, delicate and not overwhelming, with an almost panko crunch to it. But the fish was slightly overcooked and lacking in flavor.<br><br>I also had a thankfully strong mai tai here. I wouldn&#39;t have minded having three. My suggestion, avoid the crowd, hit the bar, and have some kick-ass poke while sipping on mai tais. Definitely worth the visit.
Sunday brunch today was unusually not busy so we got a seat right away. Portions were humongous and service was friendly. Crab hash is definitely something to get.

I came into the cheesecake factory for lunch. I had the best experience with the bartender Sheri. She was awesome! Very personable,attentive, and obviously cared alot about her job. As a bartender myself I really appreciate to see that. She is an amazing example of a great employee. She even gave me advice about a nail salon to try. I have never written a review before, but her exceptional service deserved to be recognized. Thank you Sheri! The cheesecake factory is very lucky to have you!

YUMMMY!! First time I ever had a cheese cake was from here and it was delicious. I got bacio flavour and I wanted more (even though they give you a great big serving)! <br>Was amazing!! Food for dinner was nice too I stuck with a pasta which was nice enough! Sizes meals, drinks and deserts were enormous and cheap in price so it was well worth our 2hour long wait!

BUSY, BUSY, BUSY location. My secret to getting a table here is to come about 15-30 minutes before they open at 11AM. Then, you are guaranteed seating. I don&#39;t like waiting, so I have never come at dinner time. I heard that they get craaaaazzzzzyyyyyy busy...<br><br>My favorite items:<br>+Hawaiian luau salad - salad made w/ a Hawaiian twist! Besides lettuce, the salad is a three layer wonton chip salad (generous portion, easy fills two to four people) and kalua pork! yummmm! The salad dressing is a little on the strong side, but pretty yummy!<br>+Energy breakfast - comes with egg whites, grilled chicken and some spinach and grilled tomatoes.<br>+Snickers cheesecake - I&#39;m weak for nuts...

Who cut the CHEESECAKE???<br><br>1st of all ... they need to open another location in Hawaii! The wait is so not the business! Another location would reduce the long wait &amp; crowd by half .. that would make the dinning experience a lot more enjoyable.<br><br>You not only have to wait for your table .. you have to wait for your food too! &#34;sorry the kitchen/bakery is backed up&#34; .. &#34;Cheesus-Christ&#34; .. the food is good &amp; the cheesecake is delish (nowhere near OTTO CAKES .. see previous review) =( <br><br>Here&#39;s why I only gave 2 star&#39;s .. so not like me, I&#39;m normally generous scorer &amp; I often consider ALL aspects .. I&#39;ve had my share of working in the industry so I have credibility: We had a party of 10 &amp; we checked in at 7pm ... our table wasn&#39;t ready until 8:45! Our food wasn&#39;t ready till 9:45! Dessert (GRRRR) .. Was a disaster! We were celebrating my Aunties birthday &amp; she ordered a &#34;special&#34; dessert, they &#34;86&#39;D&#34; the dessert &amp; failed to inform inform us. The waiter brings out another dessert &amp; tells us that they ran out of the &#34;birthday girls choice&#34; .. NO BUENO!  The Manager came by &amp; apologized, he comped another &#34;special dessert&#34; &amp; sent out a whole choir of employees to sing happy birthday! I SAY .. &#34;GOOD SAVE&#34;!

I love it here. One of my favorites!<br><br>The mojitos are so good and they&#39;re not stingy either! My favorite is the Passion Fruit one. But I recommend any of them.<br><br>The sampler appetizer is delicious. If you&#39;re going with more than 2 people, order this.<br><br>The lemon-herb roasted chicken is AMAZING. Comes with mashed potatoes and steamed carrots covered in the amazing sauce.<br><br>Tried the Dulce de Leche cheesecake, that was good.<br><br>BUT...<br><br>the best one I recommend to anyone is the Caramel White Chocolate Macademian Nut Cheesecake.<br><br>I actually CLOSE MY EYES while I&#39;m eating this cheesecake. Sad part is, I can only eat a few bites of it because I think if diabetes was an actual food item, this cheesecake would be it.

If the name alone doesn&#39;t make you go there then I don&#39;t think anything else will. Just came back from &#34;dinner&#34; to celebrate all the september birthdays! They do not take reservations even if its a group more than 10, We got there at 715pm and they told us our wait time would be 45 minutes, which we accepted and waited for. However they did not mention that we had to wait another hour! YES it was almost two hours before we got buzzed... It was really annoying when we kept asking after an hour how long the wait is and they kept replying with the mandatory sayings, &#34;20 more minutes, setting the table now...&#34; I think NOT! I would have really appreciated if they just told us up front how long the wait would be instead of sugar coating it, then we would have choose another place to satisfy our hungriness! <br><br>So we get buzzed then we have to wait again to get seated! seriously I guess there are different levels of waiting.. <br>Level 1- Waiting outside, making sure that your stomach is really empty!<br>Level 2- Wait for Host, now you really need to eat be cause you already waited 2 hours and you can smell the aroma of the food and see all the food passing from the kitchen to the customers. <br>Leve 3- Waiter, I am already going to automatically get 18% so I can do a shitty job, its required anyway! <br><br>Really???<br>We get to our table and we there aren&#39;t enough chairs, so we politely ask for an open table next to us so we can combine it, the manager for the night says that we can use the table all the way on the other side of the room, which is the same exact amount of chairs a few feet away from us. The manager wasn&#39;t very sympathetic and was not willing to meet our needs. <br><br>I am already sick to my stomach just thinking about it. The food was bleh, I ordered the fish tacos, my thinking mentality (quick and easy to eat) I was a starving marvin!!! Didn&#39;t get to the cheesecake yet because it is siting in my fridge, did not want to wait another hour to get my dessert although it is only feet away from my table.

I&#39;ve been to The Cheesecake Factory several times at different locations and look forward my starter of a Well-Mannered Dirty Martini, it&#39;s one of the best dirty martinis I&#39;ve had, made with Ketel One Vodka and Blue Cheese Stuffed Olives (those stuffed olives are ono and should be a pupu unto themselves!) and I like the end of the meal by enjoying a slice of Godiva cheesecake with coffee.<br><br>The service is always good, but it&#39;s the meal itself I find not very satisfying. It&#39;s like every appetizer, soup, salad and entree is pushed through a Cheesecake Factory filter and what ends up on the plate is unsatisfyingly formulaic - there is a sameness to all the dishes.  Yes, the menu is vast and portions are large, but I just can&#39;t find the soul in the food, and that&#39;s a key ingredient for me.

It&#39;s the most wonderful time of the year at the cheesecake factory..now is the time when they have RED VELVET CHEESECAKE. Oh yes, it&#39;s true...Now get yourself down to the cheesecake factory for this slice of heaven! <br><br>(Just make sure to save me a piece ;) )

Met with old classmates for lunch today. I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake Factory in FL, and once at the Waikiki location as well, but it&#39;s been a long while. I remembered the cheesecake being good (well, duh!), but not much else.<br><br>Ordered the Chicken and Avocado club, which was chicken breast with avocado slices, bacon, swiss cheese, shredded lettuce, tomato slices, and a herb sauce on crisp toasted bread. It smelled fabulous, but the first bite was an omen. The chicken was so tough that I couldn&#39;t bite through it. The combo of the bread and cheese and herb sauce was nice, but the chicken itself was tasteless and dry. Downer.<br><br>Strawberry lemonade was nice, and free refills were a bonus. Ordered a &#34;Wild Blueberry&#34; cheesecake which was good. <br><br>Service was great. Very helpful server who answered questions well and dealt patiently with us. :)<br><br>ETA: 4 HOUR free validation when you park at the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center structure! Sweet!
Great atmosphere and really good food. Works well for large party. The location could not be better!

Always HUGE line-ups at this place, so we spent at least an hour waiting for a table.  This restaurant is massive and can seat hundreds.  Service was prompt, but the food was OK.  I guess I expected more.  Overall it was good and I would come again.

This place does too many things right to ignore.  The dishes are consistent, many items are downright delicious, and lots of the dishes have large portions.  Sometimes I get tired of the many &#39;hole in the wall&#39; joints in Hawai`i so this place makes for a nice change of scene.<br><br>I recently had the Grilled Shrimp and Bacon Club Sandwich.  It&#39;s so much more than a regular club!  I think the dressing they use puts it over the top, plus it big!  It&#39;s enough for two people who don&#39;t want a full meal, the club makes a great late night snack.<br><br>This is another great LATE NIGHT place that stays open later than most.  Plus they fully validate you for 4 hours, good for those who need the validation.<br><br>The floors at Cheesecake are always very slippery, weird.<br><br>Last seating is 11 during the week 11:30 on Fr&amp;Sat, 10:30 on Sunday.<br>The extensive menu means everyone in your party can eat something they like.

Since there are hundred of reviews, I don&#39;t need to reiterate what has been said:  Cheesecake good, Food so-so.<br><br>I&#39;ve been here a bunch of times and I must say that their service has gotten better over the years.  I walked in and told the guy hostess (I&#39;m not sure what you call guy hostesses)  that I would like a table for 13 people.  He was extremely helpful and told me to stand on the side to talk to the manager about how long a wait would be.  The manager quickly came to talk to me and said that the wait would be an hour to an hour and a half.  What ended up happening was the wait was over 2 hours.  Considering that I expected to wait 3+ hours,  I had a pleasant evening.<br><br>To celebrate the cheesecake factory occasion, I rocked my favorite cheesecake factory shirt:  <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fshirt.woot.com%2Ffriends.aspx%3Fk%3D4113&amp;s=b680f901219d8b0abfbba1ba170245fae5c9add6bc59d1d21549dd5d0ae177ff" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">shirt.woot.com/friends.a…</a><br><br>Woo Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel CheeseCake!

My favorite: Steak Diane and herb crusted salmon combo! SO GOOD.<br><br>The wait time to get seated can get REALLY long if you go on a weekend or anytime after 5:00pm. On the weekends, I&#39;ve experienced a little over an hour wait time to get a table, someone I know has waited for 2 hours on the weekends.<br><br>However, if you can catch an early dinner, around 5ish, on a weekday, the wait time is about 20 minutes. At 5:30, the wait time had already built to 40 minutes.<br><br>Since this location is in Waikiki on the strip, and it can accommodate a very large number of people, it&#39;s ALWAYS bustling with people and tourists.<br><br>The place is nice, the lighting is dim, and I feel like the food and help is really hit or miss when it comes to what you get. I&#39;ve had good dishes, and bad dishes as well as good and bad waiters/waitresses. The portion sizes are very good though and I usually have a little bit leftover to take home.<br><br>HOWEVER, the desserts are ALWAYS good. They have EVERY cheesecake imaginable, as well as a few other desserts that are good. This past time, I shared a brownie-ice cream dessert with my boyfriend and sister. Everything is very rich, and you should probably set aside some stomach space for dessert if you plan on having any!

They always have a wait....it&#39;s a popular place so! Don&#39;t go to this place for Sunday brunch. Every time I&#39;ve went with my boyfriend they ran out of french toast before noon. I brought it to the manager&#39;s attention and all I got was a I&#39;m sorry, we do have to soak the bread 24 hours, so we just didn&#39;t prepare enough the night before. I must say the manager&#39;s suck and they need better training.

I am not one of those people that believe they are &#34;above&#34; chain restaurants, and coming here for the first time in a while reaffirmed why that is so.<br><br>The food my group ordered (combination pizza, pasta, some drinks) were all surprisingly good and came out within 10 minutes. I think the bill came out to about $15 bucks a person, which seemed pretty average. Service was good, and the atmosphere seemed comfortable. <br><br>On another note, this place has probably the best location on the Waikiki shopping strip. Highly visible, and easily accessible to foot traffic. Consequently, it is always retardedly busy. Would come here again if too lazy to find hole-in-the-wall places in Hawaii again!

Honestly, I think I am so over large corporate American chain restaurants.  I mean I love to eat and I like things that are reasonable for the price.  But the portions at Cheesecake Factory are just so big!  My coworkers and I ordered the appetizer sampler plus an entree each.  The appetizer sampler was enough to be a meal for three people!  And we were hungry too!  The sampler came on four plates!  It was just so much food.  I took one bite of my actual entree and was full!  Plus to me everything was too greasy or too cheesey.  While I am no health nut, I could feel my heartache sneaking up on me!  <br><br>While we were waiting for our food to be boxed up, we were looking around and all the entrees were huge!  I saw the burger and it looked at like 8 inches tall I swear and the salads were huge also.  Although when I was in high school I liked this place I think I am starting to pick quality over quantity.  (Although I still like the cheesecakes if there are four people to share it with!)

This place always has a ridiculously long line if you&#39;re waiting for a table.  But I like eating at the bar as much as I like eating at a table, so I always skip the pager and go straight to the bar!  Never have had to wait for the bar there :] I like their entrees (the salmon with herbs is delicious and tender) but I really just go for the dessert.. Irish Coffee with Baileys and a banana cream cheesecake please!  My absolute favorite combination!  The bartenders are super cool, so skip the two hour wait and jump to the bar! 5 stars is for the cheesecake alone ;]

Food - 4<br>Price - About right<br>Service - 4<br>Cleanliness - 4<br><br>I&#39;ve been to numerous CF&#39;s through the years but have avoided this one as it&#39;s always swarming with tourists and what appears to be ridiculously long lines.  So the review is commensurate with expectations.  We expected the long wait, attentive service, great food, and desert.  That&#39;s exactly what we got.<br><br>So... we parked at our secret spot (sorry) and checked in at the restaurant, got our pager, was told it would take an hour.  We walked around a bit, got back to the area in 50 minutes, waited about 12 or so minutes and our pager buzzed.<br><br>Our table was kinda tucked away but it was just fine.  Candace was our waitress and she was excellent.  <br><br>We ordered -<br>- Pina Colada - Tasted awesome but only a tiny hint of alcohol<br>- Blueberry Mojito - That was nice and strong<br>- Steak Diane and Herb Crusted Salmon - Steak was damn good as if the steak melted in your mouth, Salmon was good but the Salmon tasted <br>- Coulette Steak - Good overall steak.  Skipped the fries.<br>- Tiramisu Cheesecake - Great balance of traditional cheesecake and tiramus<br>- Dulce de Leche Cheesecake - As advertised, not too rich which was perfect<br>- Coffee - just right<br><br>Overall, not much to complain about except the wait and the inability to make reservations.

Visited there yestersay lunch time, Good food but the African-American who came in and brought us the food look like he doesnt wanna be there.  He was very rude and unfriendly.  The waiter was very nice though.   2 star for the food and waiter other than that the guy killed the service.

A bit of a wait but probably the busiest and most popular restaurant in Hawaii service was fantastic and the food unbelievable  had a burger the first time and was so full we couldnt get to the cheese cake. They were happy to bag it up to take home. Second time had cheese cake and smoothie was to die for.

As always Cheesecake is a delight no matter which one i am at. Food was fantastic here as other locations ive been to.<br><br>Menu is huge and has very complex/flavorful selections.<br><br>Drink menu is great also, i love the Peach Bellini (frozen peach drink) and my aunt had a mai tai (didnt taste it, she said it was good, but she has never had one before, so...). I ordered the Herb Cursted Salmon and Steak Diane. Very good. And we had a pizza, burger and burrito at our table everyone seemed pleased.<br><br>Service was not over the top outstanding, but the best that we have gotten since being in Oahu! It was very loud with the combination of music, crowd out side walking past, full restaurant and quite spoken server.<br><br>They serve a bread basket with a great brown bread. mmm...<br><br>And of course a page and a half of cheesecakes! Mmm. My favorite is always Chocolate Mousse. But we also had Godiva Choc and a White Chocolate/Carmel/Macadamia which was great...<br><br>Prices range from $8-$21 on average for entrees.<br>Cheescake from $6-$8<br>and my bellini was $9 and mai tai $10<br><br>I always like to stop by TCF even for a drink or appetizer when in a town that has one. Enjoy!<br><br>Oh, they also serve an extensive breakfast menu all day long!!!

I&#39;ve been here maybe 3 times..every time its been really busy! except this time...i went early so i beat the dinner crowd. I never really had anything bad here..today, i had the fish tacos and my other half had the crispy spicy beef. Both dishes were pretty good! For appetizers, we had avocado spring rolls...which were absolutely awesome! I highly recommend these as a starter..the decor inside this place is really well done..very nice inside! The only thing i recommend is try to avoid going during the traditional dinner time...its crazy busy and you&#39;ll be waiting awhile to eat.<br><br>Overall a good place to eat in my book!

I have no idea why tourists travel thousands of miles and want to eat at the Cheesecake Factory??? Something I am sure they could get in their hometown!!! <br><br>Anyway, I absolutely refuse to wait in line or in this case, out on the sidewalk and curb. If I do come here, I am either by myself or with one friend. I head straight to the bar area and have a seat either at the bar or one of the tables near by. It is just more convenient and I don&#39;t want to make my eating and drinking an event! <br><br>If the bar near the entrance is full, walk toward the back of the restaurant and you will find another bar back there. It is a bit smaller but just as good. The food is the same and you still get the same &#34;phone book&#34; size menu! <br><br>I like the Cheesecake Factory, but I prefer to eat from the local or one of a kind restaurants when I travel. Not something I could easily find at home!!!

Went here a week ago, great place to bring the family because it is already loud. The food is good in my children&#39;s mind so that&#39;s all I really cared about. Overall it was a pretty cheap bill.

Portions are enough when you&#39;re really hungry. Service was awesome! Fried Mac and Cheese was thumbs up!! Steak Diane and Salmon was great. Save room for Craig&#39;s Crazy Cheesecake (carrot cake and cheesecake swirled together).

The wait is horrendous, but the cheesecake is worth it.<br><br>Instead of waiting to sit down, occasionally I just eat somewhere else for dinner and get dropped off (then picked up again of course ) so I can get my cheesecake to go.<br><br>My favorites include:<br>-Vanilla bean<br>-Red velvet<br>-Pumpkin (seasonal)

Went last weekend for my boyfriend&#39;s 27th B-day. I could say it was pretty good! I ordered Fried Shrimp Platter that includes coleslaw and french fries. Dang!! I was loving my plate! While my bf ordered Steak Diane which I could say it was pretty good too. We went there around 4 pm and we had a seat right away.

Rating: 3.5/5<br>Date(s) Visited: 9/15/10<br><br>Food: 4/5<br>Service: 4/5<br>Atmosphere: 3/5<br>Price: 3/5<br><br>Located in the heart of Waikiki, it&#39;s only natural that Cheesecake Factory would be eternally busy. But is it worth the hour long - or more! - wait? That depends. If you&#39;re in Waikiki to do a little shopping and are looking for a place to eat afterwards, then yes, but if you&#39;re just looking for dinner, then probably not.<br><br>Food:<br>Their food quality is, by and large, good. Their menu items are vast and mostly original. Their menu is so large, in fact, that you&#39;ll be certain to overlook a lot of things that might spark your interest. I know I did.<br><br>We ordered their &#34;Thai Lettuce Wraps&#34; which came with assorted vegetables, strips of chicken satay and coconut curry noodles along with peanut, sweet red chili and tamarind-cashew dipping sauce. This was my favorite dish out of everything we ordered since it was absolutely monstrous and rather flavorful (as long as you used the dipping sauces). I can say that I didn&#39;t much taste the coconut curry noodles and the only sauce that was worth my time was the peanut sauce, but other than that this dish was remarkable.<br><br>Next came the &#34;Fried Macaroni and Cheese&#34; which was surprisingly good. It&#39;s coated in a thin, slightly crispy bread coating and sprinkled with cheese. Breaking into the sphere of goodness, the cheese pulls apart from the edges like it does in those pizza commercials. The flavor was incredible; having a sharpness that tells you it&#39;s homemade, though the marinara sauce seemed to be the parsley of the dish.<br><br>My friend ordered a side of garlic mashed potatoes, claiming it was the best he ever had. Meh. I&#39;ve definitely had better and their potatoes I found to be lacking proper seasoning (a bit of salt and pepper fixed that). I&#39;d give this dish a pass unless you&#39;re really craving starches.<br><br>The final thing we ordered (besides dessert and drinks, but that&#39;s later) was their &#34;Firecracker Salmon&#34;. Now, I&#39;ve made &#34;Firecracker Salmon&#34; as fillets for dinner, and I can say that I&#39;m rather disappointed at the absolutely tiny portions we received and the stunning lack of flavor. It&#39;s more fizzle than firework. We got four pieces of salmon wrapped in fried wonton skins. The whole thing was about as thick as my thumb and not much longer (see: <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NXAt_BOrUSCHuCR6pvY_Iw?select=NncYLS0A8Uz5OYe0zuylyg">yelp.com/biz_photos/NXAt…</a>). It was served on a mountain of shredded purple cabbage. I felt like we were paying $13 to get $10 in cabbage and $3 in salmon. The sauce it was served with initially has no flavor, but then the heat arrives and soon departs. It&#39;s delicious for the few seconds where you can taste anything, but other than that the dish is a total flop. For the price, I wouldn&#39;t recommend it.<br><br>For dessert we ordered we ordered the key lime cheesecake which tasted almost exactly like a key lime pie. Their whipped cream was made with real cream (because they whipped it too much and it had the faint taste of butter) and topped with a thin slice of lime. They had two giant scoops of vanilla ice cream on the side and I can only imagine how amazing it would have tasted with chocolate sauce. I suggest you get it with coffee, because having the bitterness of the coffee right after the tartness of the cheesecake is divine (although my friend said it sounded gross).<br><br>My friend got their &#34;Pomegranate Mojito&#34;, which looked delicious. Just as a warning, he said it was super strong and was later intoxicated for the rest of the evening. Then again, he&#39;s a lightweight so...<br><br>Service:<br>Aside from the absolutely ridiculous wait, the service here is good. The waiters are patient and professional. They don&#39;t hover and they&#39;re not constantly interrupting your meal. They see that you need a refill of something and get it.<br><br>Atmosphere:<br>I had the misfortune of sitting right next to their live performers, which made conversation next to possible. I guess that no matter where you sit in the restaurant, it&#39;ll be loud. The lighting is rather dim and very orange, which makes photographing food very difficult and next to impossible to color correct, but that&#39;s a photographer&#39;s complaint. Other than that, it&#39;s reasonably enjoyable.<br><br>Price:<br>The prices here are definitely a bit spendy. Although you can get some good values (e.g. Thai Lettuce Wraps), I feel like you&#39;ll miss more than hit with a lot of the things you&#39;ll find on the menu. When I looked at the bill and saw that my friend&#39;s drink had cost $11, I gasped and nearly had a heart attack. Then again, it&#39;s Waikiki and everything&#39;s expensive.

Okay, I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory many times in Honolulu, and I&#39;ve been there in San Francisco also. I&#39;ve gotta say, San Francisco trumps ANY Honolulu experience I&#39;ve ever had. The food is the same, but the service in Honolulu is SOOOOO BAD that I won&#39;t eat in the restaurant in Honolulu anymore. We do takeout. For example, I ordered a Jambalaya on my last visit, and it came with undercooked chicken. It took the waitress 25 minutes to check back with our table. By then I just didn&#39;t want it anymore. On another visit, I had a waitress that barely made eye contact with our table, took forever to bring us our drinks, and then became animated only at the time when she brought our check. <br>That being said, I&#39;ve had decent servers, and even good servers, but generally, service is poor. Not at all like other locations.

This has got to the busiest Cheesecake I&#39;ve seen so far and they do a great job of cranking out tables as soon as possible. We came in on an early Saturday night and were told 15 minutes. Our buzzer flashed a little after 15 minutes and we turned it on only to stand around aimlessly for the next 10. I&#39;m familiar with there being a little time in between for staging but 10 minutes was kind of ridiculous, but they were busy up at the desk so I let it go.<br><br>Our server Heather was fantastic and very thorough with her descriptions of dishes and answering our questions. I felt her enthusiasm to be quite genuine and rare to find in a Cheesecake Factory server. I wish I could have taken her back to San Francisco with me and had her teach the servers there a thing or two about hospitality. <br><br>Our only issue during dinner was the fact that one of our pasta dishes was undercooked. The pasta was suppose to be overcooked and soft and it came out hard in the center of the bowtie noodle and a little harder than al dente. We asked for it to be remade and some joker of a man came by the table just to say, &#34;you guys okay? Your food will be out in a little bit.&#34; He didn&#39;t stop at the table but rather did a walk by and with a hurried demeanor. We later found out the  guy was a manager. He didn&#39;t help the situation but rather irritated the hell out of me.<br><br>However, our server was so apologetic and was great about everything I couldn&#39;t hold it against the restaurant. My moco loco was a little salty but it was nice to have something different on the menu besides the usual crispy spicy beef or buffalo chicken sandwich. We also didn&#39;t stay for dessert because the portions of meals were so big and the weather outside didn&#39;t allow safe temperatures for cheesecake slices. I might get takeout if there was nothing else open on the strip by the beach but I wouldn&#39;t dine there again.

I work in a restaurant and we have a phrase we use called &#34;turn and burn&#34;.  It&#39;s when we&#39;re busy and we try to turn as many tables as possible in order to make more money.  Fast, impersonal service in an effort to seat more people.  If you&#39;re a good waiter you can do it without your guest noticing.  If not, well......<br><br>The service sucked.  No offense Barry, but we want to chill out and eat, not rush.  We got a coveted outdoor seat, which I did love, but like I said, bad service in an effort to get us out as soon as possible.  <br><br>And the food...The food sucked.  I love CF.  I&#39;ve been to 3 different locations here in the Bay Area, and it&#39;s definitely one of my favorite places to eat.  But for some reason something tasted off here.  My pasta tasted like it had been sitting for a good 20 minutes.  The Roadside Sliders we got for my daughter ($9.95 btw) tasted like Wendy&#39;s hamburgers.  My fiancee&#39;s Chicken Madeira was disappointed, and my Mom&#39;s fish was overcooked ($24.95).<br><br>Overall, for the money spent, this was a huge let down considering how crowded the place is.  I guess tourists flock here because there&#39;s only one or two in their state.  We have like 4 here in the Bay Area and I was reluctant to go because of that, but the outdoor seating and the fact that it was Cheesecake Factory Waikiki drew me in.  <br><br>With all the great restaurants on the island I would definitely avoid this one.

We love this place. Mostly because of the cheesecakes! Yummy! But the main dishes are tasty as well. We went here three times during our vacation and had good service and good food all times. Try the strawberry cheesecake. It is so delicious!

OK to be honest, I&#39;ll give it 3.75 Stars, but rounds up to 4! :)<br><br>What intrigues me is that people from all over the world come and flock to the Cheesecake Factory like it&#39;s some kind of Hawaiian tourist attraction... Wait, don&#39;t they have them everywhere?! With the crowd building up outside, we decided to walk on in to check in. Thankfully my friend was smart... skip the line and sit at the bar! <br><br>I chose the restaurant, Cheesecake Factory is her spot. I simply knew I was going to enjoy my meal. <br><br>The service here is fairly quick. Even with the vast amount of people that were there... our glasses of water were filled, we were checked up on, all with a warm smile. <br><br>On the menu: Pasta da Vinci (I think that&#39;s what it was called) with Broccoli &amp; Hibachi Steak (mine). I freaked out at the sight of bean sprouts on which the Hibachi Steak sat on (I dislike bean sprouts) but it wasn&#39;t that bad. I&#39;d like to say the steak was memorable, but it was just good. I did think the wasabi was an interesting twist as a topping on mashed potatoes.<br><br>Dessert: Wild Blueberry with White Chocolate.  The cheesecake was nice and fluffy, not uberly thick like plain old cheesecake. It was decent, what disappointed me was that it wasn&#39;t fresh blueberries! But I guess I&#39;m just a bit picky. Haha. <br><br>All in all, great atmosphere... Lively, Upbeat but just a bit dark in some parts. Here&#39;s a tip: bring out the cell phone to illuminate your journey through the menu when it&#39;s especially dark-there&#39;s simply a LOT to decide on.

I had a great meal, dessert, and drinks at the bar.  The staff was very personable and attentive.<br><br>The quesadilla with Kahlua pork was fantastic and came with ample sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.  The Tiramisu was light and delicious.  The drinks were mixed well.  After a few nights of disappointing meals at other places with better ratings, I was pleasantly surprised!

Love the food! Price may seem expensive but it really is the right bang for your buck! The drinks are mixed really well; compared to other restaurants I say the bartender really knows his drinks and has the skills to back it up. If you are coming for dinner (like around 7 or later) SERIOUSLY go and put your name in at least 1.5 hours ahead of your anticipated dinner time, maybe even earlier if you have a big group otherwise the wait is ridiculously long its not even funny. Otherwise the food is really good
Great food &amp; excellent customer service. The wait is long (over 1 hour on a Friday night), but well worth it!

Our hostess started things out on the wrong note as she did not seem happy to see us and seemed irritated when we asked for a booth. She said we could have a booth, but would need to wait for it to be cleaned. She did not make any small talk as we were waiting for it to be cleaned and then she got snippy with my husband when he had the nerve to try and sit before the places were set. <br><br>The waitress was very nice, friendly, and attentive. The food was delicious as it always is at the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>We could do with less negative attitude and gloomy expressions from the hostess. Maybe she could attend a customer service training since she&#39;s in the service industry and coming into contact with a lot of tourists ready to spend at the establishment where she works.

If you don&#39;t like waiting then be prepared because the wait is looong. I mean, obviously it&#39;s going to be busy especially after 6. But my boyfriend and I finally got seated after almost a hour. The waiter wasn&#39;t special. When he took our orders he seemed nice to me, but to my boyfriend he was kind of lackluster and rude. Wait for the food was long as well. Had the Calamari and it was very delicious. For entree, i had the Shrimp Scampi (YUM) and my boyfriend had the Steak Diane which he enjoyed. Asked for the check took about 5 minutes for it to get to us then almost 20 minutes for them to bring it back. Not sure what is up with the place and making you wait, but it was an OK experience.
This place has good food and incredible desserts although the dinner wait time is a little ridiculous at times, eat early or late! Sometimes I call ahead and get dinner to go...

Place gets really busy during peak hours. Expect a 40 minutes to an hour wait. People of all kinds visit this establishment and they do have a menu in Japanese as I observed a patron to request one. Food was okay. Nothing to cheer about. I don&#39;t remember ordering alcohol so cannot vouch for the alcohol ratio in the drinks. The cheesecake will never do you wrong. It is always yummy and delicious. This is one of those establishments that you are excited to see in Hawaii as they serve many different varieties of food. One of the places I knew I could order food that I could eat.

Best thing about Cheesecake factory is hands down the cheesecake. Food is ok to good. Waikiki Cheesecake factory can get very busy and cost more than mainland cheesecake factory&#39;s. Service was OK. Had to wait for refills a few times.

Really nice one!!!! Love the atmosphere and service here. They are almost always busy in the evening. If you don&#39;t have the patience to wait long then this place isn&#39;t for you. I def. think it&#39;s worth waiting. Mahalo :)

Have been here a few times. Last them was a Saturday night. The line to put your name in for a table was super long and there were tons of people waiting outside. We were told it would be an hour wait and it was only about 45 minutes which was great. They have a lot of seating on the inside, much bigger than any other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s. The food was amazing, as always.
The food is great! BUT make sure to check your utensils before using them. Ours were dirty with bits of food left on them and we had to ask for new ones.  That&#39;s about it (:

Huge portions, giant menu, and amazing cheesecake.<br><br>Those are the three easier ways to describe the cheesecake factory.  The cheesecake factory is an American eatery that offers many different types of items on their enormous menu.  Each time i visit it takes me quite a time to decide on what to order.  But not matter what I order the food is good.  I especially love the deep fried macaroni and cheese which are macaroni and cheese balls breaded and then deep fried and served with marinara.  Every time I come here even if I tell myself &#34;you will not order the mac and cheese balls this time&#34;  I always end up ordering them.  My favorite cheesecake here as well is the white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake and it is delicious.  While you cannot go wrong with almost anything on the menu there are other things you must watch out for.<br><br>This location is a great location for the restaurant but leads to many problems for the customer.  It seems as if the restaurant is in a weird shape and they do not have enough seating for people waiting for a table (and people wait hours for tables literally hours.)  If you plan on coming during dinner time on a weekend plan on waiting for at least an hour.  While this place is good it is not wait around for an hour good.  Your best bet to avoid these lines is to arrive from about 2-5pm and you will not have more than a 15 minute wait.  At 5pm they open up the entire restaurant for dinner service so a good time to show up is right around 5pm.  Showed up at 5pm with a group of 8 and was seated within 5 minutes.  Oh yea forgot to mention this place also doesn&#39;t take reservations so either show up early or be prepared to wait.<br><br>In the end great cheesecake (it is called the cheesecake factory for a reason), good service, but a long line that is not worth waiting an hour for.

We have been to a Cheesecake Factory before, just not in Hawaii. We arrived about noon on Tuesday and seated right away. Out waiter was very nice and the decor is really nice inside. My husband ordered a well done bacon cheeseburger and it arrived with pink in it. Seems we keep stricking out on the well done request. Anyway the manager sincerely apologized and took care of the mistake. We will try here again sometime....but maybe for that yummy Cheesecake. 09/2012

We always say that we will not take visiting family members to any chain restaurants however after two weeks of vacation days, Cheescake Factory always seems to slide into the dining experience.<br><br>Yeah there are long lines but you can&#39;t beat the tropical setting here: tiki torches and live Hawaiian music.  This is probably the best Cheescake location I have dined in and many of our family and friends confirm this theory.  I swear the food tastes better here.<br><br>I love their Spicy Ahi Tempura Rolls.  And I usually order their Lettuce Thai wraps as my entree.  Their portions are HUGE.  But I always seem to have room for cheescake:)

The Cheesecake Factory in the Waiks is an experience like no other.  By day - you are surrounded by good weather, beautiful beach-combers, tourists from around the world, and locals evoking the Aloha Spirit - all enjoying te famous Waikiki Strip, Kalakaua St. At night, the Strip turns into a vibrant  spectacle where your dining experience is yet again, raised to another level.<br><br>We have been here so many times, I don&#39;t even know where to begin with the food. Tasty appetizers. Good entrees with hearty portions. All I can say is order what you are in the mood for!<br><br>But as for the dessert, ah, let me tell you. And that is, you have got to try the Cheesecake exclusive to the Waiks. The Pineapple Cheesecake. If no can eat Pineapple, fo&#39; shame. But if can, go eat!  Its delectable!!!<br><br>Overall, Cheesecake offers good food at good prices, and always delivers good service. And as for the long wait in lines, RELAX! You are in Hawaii! Isn&#39;t the cool vibes supposed to mellow you out?? Don&#39;t worry, the food ain&#39;t goin&#39; nowhere! <br><br>When to go: Dinner time, after sunset. Kalakaua is at its best at night!<br>Where to sit: Patio for people watching. But anywhere is good really<br>Be prepared: To wait in line...Yup...Uh huh...Waiting...Uhm, ya...<br>Why come here: For the people-watching, music, food, and cheesecake, of course!
I absolutely love this place.  Service is always good and the food is delicious. .

I was totally impressed with the Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ll admit, I was really apprehensive about going there.  I thought that the food was so so, but one night my wife and I decided to venture out of our usual and Wow! <br><br>I had the Spicy Crispy Chicken sandwich, and it was so juicy and moist.  I kept fantasizing about it.  We order a pizza for our appetizers thinking it was the usually tiny pizza that a person wouldn&#39;t remember, and that sucker was pretty nice!<br><br>Good quality food, reasonable price, and nice portion size!

Man, this is by far the best Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. Everything about this place says, &#34;Come here, I am worth it, I will treat you so good!&#34;<br><br>Went here with the fam bam, around ~8ish, and waited about twenty minutes, which was more than a pleasant surprise for a bunch of tired, sunburnt, hungry tourists. <br><br>We got seating outside on the lanai area, and it was gorgeous, not just because of the weather, but the entire atmosphere and the torches- everything just adds another star, and more thumbs up.<br><br>We had a great waiter, and crew; we were attended to constantly and never forgotten, it was such a great feeling to have such great service, almost feels like being royalty! The food was great, it seems to me that this CF gave us much, much more food than others I&#39;ve been to. Also, although we were in the heart of Honolulu, the prices weren&#39;t any more than the others I&#39;ve been to.<br><br>Five stars for this CF!

Ok, this was the only place my wife and I will visit that is not a hole in the wall place to eat.  The reason....we love the options and food overall.  The only reason it does not get 5 stars is the wait which is caused by everyone wanting to go here.  The service was impeccable at our visit.  When we checked in we were told the wait was 90 minutes.  Ok, we wait.  30 minutes in we decide to hit a hole in the wall restaurant instead, but wait.  When turning in our buzzer the guy tells us that he has a second bar and to check their if we do not mind sitting at the bar.  We go look and two seats open.  Thanks for the tip.<br>Great service again from our bartender waiter named Robbie.  Very attentive, pleasant and greeted everyone at the bar with a smile.  Now the whole time we were seated he was getting hammered by incoming bar orders, but he kept my water full, he checked on our order and even noticed when my food came out missing something and immediately informed someone that the item was missing and sent them for it.  We gave Robbie a 40% tip.  As for the food my burger was cooked to perfection and was moist as well as my wife&#39;s sliders.  <br>Nice job Cheesecake factory.  No matter if its San Diego, San Jose, Las Vegas or Waikiki we will always stop in.

WAIT WAS RIDICULOUS. When I got there I was told an hour and twenty minute wait. After an hour and forty minutes we were told another twenty minutes. Ruined my family&#39;s night since we planned around eating here. We were told since we were an odd sized group (only 5 btw) that it was harder to give us a table. Awful service. Do not recommend.

This Cheesecake Factory is what you&#39;d expect from any Cheesecake Factory... delicious!  Our waitress was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The food was awesome and the cheesecake was the best around! The Cheesecake Factory is always a safe bet for good food and this location did not disappoint!  The only downside was the 1 hour wait to be seated but that should be expected at any restaurant in Waikiki around 7! The wait was worth it and we will be returning on our next visit!

I&#39;d avoided going to this chain for months assuming it had nothing to offer--especially because its in the heart of tourist-land--but its actually good food at reasonable prices. Fish &amp; chips are awesome, the giant burrito is Ok, salads have been tasty, and the fries, too. Anyway, the basics are done well enough, and if you can remember to split the giant portions, the bill won&#39;t give you a heart attack (uh....but the food might). Haven&#39;t ordered any cheesecake yet, but only because I am avoiding the feeling of fat-cow-dom.<br><br>Anyway, Cheesecake is also great for running like a machine: they see you, sit you, take your order, get it to you, and check on you every now and then to see how you are doing, and everything is so fast and efficient, yet not rushed. In that part of Waikiki, it is a good first choice spot.

We ate here on a Sunday night at about 5:30.. Our wait for 2 was about 5 minutes! <br><br>I live nearby and we were walking around and decided...hey lets eat at cheesecake, it&#39;s been awhile. It looked like there was a long line, but it was just people waiting to be taken to their table, people leaving, or people staring at the cheesecake display.<br><br>I&#39;m sure if it had been 6:30 or 7, there would have been a 45-2hour wait. <br><br>Anyhow, we were seated in an uncomfortable section (not a booth...about a foot away from 2 other couples, including a japanese couple that stared the entire time....ugh please stop). We should have requested to move to a booth, next time. The table smelled like dirty rag water a bit (you know when someone is too lazy to change the water in the bucket and they still wipe the table down...yup, that.<br><br>We ordered quickly...no appetizers because we knew the food was monstrous-ly sized. I got the grande burrito thing, and my eating partner got a chicken bang bang thing (some type of thai chicken and shrimp meal).<br><br>The burrito was huge, but good...who can mess a wet burrito up? It came with some black beans, cilatro/guac + sour cream. yum. I ate about 1/3 of the burrito and packed it up to go. The burrito cost about 15 dollars, so It&#39;s a pretty economical deal. 2 people can eat it at dinner and there&#39;s still leftovers for 2 for a late night snack...so it makes it about a 4 dollar meal, 4 times...you get what I&#39;m saying?<br><br>The chicken +shrimp bang thai meal was just okay. But as leftovers, it was pretty tasty. I hate how they put that gigantic lump of white rice on the plate. It&#39;s so unappetizing. <br><br>We ended the day with a slice of something raspberry cheesecake. Pretty yum, although I think all the cheesecake flavors are probably decent.<br><br>so if you want to have a good time at cheesecake in waikiki: eat at 5:30 so you only have to wait 5-15 minutes. Ask for a booth. Dont get an appetizer cuz the portions are huge. Eat cheesecake.<br><br>The service is really good here. From the host/hostesses, to the servers, to the food-clearers. Everything was so fast and attentive. If you keep getting bad service EVERYwhere...check yourself...are you being a snotty brat? People in the service industry enjoy helping nice people, make it easy for them to be nice to you...

First off to the tourist, You deserve to be separated from your money!!! <br>Why did you spend so much money to fly here and eat at the Cheese cake factory?????? Get with your hotel Concierge and find some local food. Besides Hawaiian, with all our ethnic groups here you can find some fantastic Japanese, Filipino, Chinese hole in the walls to restaurants that the flavors of the food, the ambiance, even looking around at the customers makes you feel like you are somewhere else besides Kansas. Please drift away from Waikiki and move out to other areas of Oahu. <br><br>The score seems to be <br>28 votes 4 and 5 stars totaled; <br>16 votes 3 stars; <br>11 votes 2 and 1 stars; <br>Looks like my 2 star vote will now tie the 4 and 5 stars with the average and below average grade. <br><br>I really don&#39;t get the high 4 and 5 star votes unless they were voting for the Cheesecake. <br><br>I will admit the cheese cake is good, really good. They are called the cheese cake factory so their specialty should be the cheese cake not the main meal. Kinda like going to a steak house the steak should be really good. (reason I fail Buzz&#39;s steak house, their steak sucks but fish is really good, yet they call themselves a steak house). <br><br>Anyways, back to on track with CF. I try to stay away from anything Waikiki but sometimes you got to go for visitors or someones bright (dim) idea. <br><br>Here is the low down on Cheesecake Factory (CF). <br><br>Cheesecake really good, expensive but Waikiki is a expensive place so <br>no mater where you go on Waikiki you have to expect to pay more. <br><br>Everything else like steaks, salads, ect... really are poor. I suggest go for the cheese cake but not the main meal you will be disappointed by their main meals. <br><br>I have had their Cesar salad both times, not good at all. a 1 star. <br><br>My wife has had a couple of their appetizers put together to make her meal and share with me. I just grade them as okay, a 2 star okay. <br><br>There are long lines to get in, very long lines. <br><br>Parking and the traffic to drive there is difficult. The parking garage is generally full and parking spots all seem to be compact car, extra small. <br><br>I would say not good for kids only because of the long wait to get in and the crowded seating once you get in. <br><br>Not good for groups, no design for big tables, long waits to sit 4. <br><br>I would go at lunch shorter lines to get in. Night time is incredibly long. It&#39;s nothing to wait 45+min. at night. <br><br>I do not consider them affordable in their price.

Whenever I come to Cheesecake I try to come at off hours so I don&#39;t have to wait in a long line. I love that there is free validated parking. Where else can you find that in Waikiki?<br><br>The drinks are good although a bit expensive and the food is always okay. I usually take a Cheesecake home and my fave is the oreo. I think over the years the slices have gotten a little small while the price has either remained the same or gotten higher... I&#39;m onto you!!

I love this place with all my heart! Maybe not the wait time so much, but definitely the food in its titanic proportions. There is always something for everyone to find in their booklet sized menu. We love their spicy ahi tempura rolls. The tuna is flash-fried in tempura, drizzled with a sweet/spicy and what tastes like mayo sauce, topped with scallions and served with a dipping sauce which has nice &#39;kick&#39; to it. Their kids size pepperoni pizza is a full serving for one adult! And their red velvet cheesecake is to die for! <br><br>The only thing I was disappointed in was our waiter. He seemed to be very attentive to the other two tables next to us (5 ladies of which 1 of the 5 sent her entree back because it was prepared incorrectly and the other table who were tourists and who asked for separate checks). I guess this put our waiter behind because he would repeatedly check on them while passing by our table and not checking to see if were ok as well. We have a toddler. Aren&#39;t waiters suppose to more sensitive to families with children?<br><br>However, one lousy waiter won&#39;t stop me from coming back here again and again!
Love the Crab Won Ton appetizer &amp; the desserts.<br>Other than that... The entrees are ok.<br>Too crowded!  Even when I arrive during &#34;Senior citizen&#34; dinnertime. <br>Validated parking

The only time I go is when friends from overseas are visiting and they insist on eating here.  I just don&#39;t get what is so wonderful about the place.  Ok, some of the dishes are well made, but even they are not worth the long wait.  I guess if you enjoy eating portions that are 2-3x larger than necessary this is the place for you.  I read that the Pasta Carbonara with chicken has 2500 calories! That is disgusting and we wonder why 60% of the population is obese.   I guess it is fine if you split 2 or 3 ways.  Service is also sometimes a problem because they are so busy.  On the plus side, they do validate parking in the garage next door.

from 4/1/16<br>we can always count of cheesecake factory on vacation (waikiki, palm springs)<br>you pretty much will get what you had before<br><br>bit of a wait, kinda dark at your table, but food satisfies<br>calamari, vietnamese shrimp summer rolls, sheila&#39;s chicken and avocado salad (share family style because it&#39;s huge)
Sit at the bar and get the Ahi Tataki Salad, you won&#39;t be disappointed. The menu is still to big to read through, the restaurant is enormous, and the service is quick!

Been to lots of cheesecake factories in the mainland, but first one in hawaii.  HORRIBLE!  The waitress took forever to take my order.  The appetizer came out first.  Wheres my bread??  I asked her for bread and she brought it out 5 min later.  I would have gotten no bread if I didnt ask.  The bread was hard and had a hair it it!  The waitress had this fake smile, and a bit of an attitude.  My wife and I wanted to leave so I talked to the manager, and told him what happened.  I told him I wanted to pay for the appetizer and leave.  He said he was sorry, and told me not to worry about paying for the appetizer.

Day 029/365<br>Yelp Challenge 2011<br><br>I wasn&#39;t very hungry last night and wanted their cheapest salad:  the $7.50 green salad.  I figured it would be a small green side salad.  I was very wrong.  It was huge, big enough to share.  I think the tomato that was cut into wedges was actually one entire red tomato.  Along with their complimentary bread basket, it was a giant meal.<br><br>This restaurant is disappointing where they do not allow reservations or buy outs.  I spoke to one of their waiters many months ago, looking for a new venue for our gr. 6 end of the year banquet.  He suggested to me that we just drop off all of our attending students, 100-200 sixth graders, at their restaurant&#39;s opening time, and they would seat them all!  I could just imagine a huge mess, hungry students, nothing would be plated or pre-ordered.  I&#39;ll just keep looking for another venue for next year&#39;s end of the school year banquet.

I&#39;ll make this one short but sweet..... the main reason why I go to The Cheesecake Factory is for the dessert of course, the Red Velvet Cheesecake is THE BOMB!! it&#39;s the best i&#39;ve tasted so far &amp; red velvet is my favorite type of cake, cheeesecake etc.<br><br>The food is actually pretty good and they are very generous with the portions which is why I don&#39;t mind paying the price. The service is okay considering it&#39;s always busy and noisy.<br><br>I would give it another star but I can&#39;t because the wait is too long (avg. 30 min. on a good day) and the parking is a bit inconvenient. Other than that I&#39;d say that it is a little above average restaurant and would visit again if I&#39;m ever in town or waikiki
